reviews: We had a great stay! The location was convenient to everything! We found a great place for breakfast nearby (Yolk). The corner king room had a great view. Staff was excellent- Michelle was great and so helpful. When we come back, we will stay here again.

My parents came to this hotel in August because I was having a family reunion at home and it was too small to accommodate them, I would like to thank the staff for their kindness and for having met the expectations of my parents, they loved their stay with you, beautiful room with all the comfort they needed, excellent breakfast, thank you

The staff was amazing and offered such great advice on tours and food options.  The hotel is perfectly located for a lot of walking options.  A ton of wonderful restaurants within a block or two.  Shopping was close by as well.  The only drawback and it‚Äôs minor, which comes from my builder husband, was they should fix the poor job of wallpapering in the bathroom.  Too late to fix, but may we suggest doing it over with a better company.  They did not do your hotel justice.  It‚Äôs evident in other areas the upgrades were spared no expense.  Just a suggestion.  By no means would this keep us from coming back!

We stayed at the kinzie this past weekend and we were greeted by Arturo Garza. He was one the the most genuine and nicest person I‚Äôve yet encounter at a hotel. He was extremely helpful with local restaurants, things to do, and even suggested a few of his favorite spots to visit. This experience made my stay more enjoyable and I was more welcomed into the city. Thank you for everything Arturo!  Highly recommend

The staff was very welcoming from walking through the doors. The suite, omg, the pictures are nothing compared. It was beautiful and we will definitely be back. Thank you for the hospitality and the breakfast

It was the first time my friends and I stayed at the Kinzie Hotel and we were so happy Arturo took such good care of us. Arturo made our check-in process very easy and was cheerful through out the whole process. He also explained to us about the Happy Hour the hotel offers, and he brought us some cute little wine bottles we had picked from the variety he offered from. Arturo made us feel delighted when we were around him, very nice hotel and excellent service!  Definitely coming back soon!

I had the pleasure of staying at the Kinzie hotel while waiting on my apartment to be ready. I would like to say the front desk guy Nico was soo pleasant and amazing. He accommodated next with everything i needed, everytime i entered he gave me a warm welcome and a sense of feeling wanted.. Also there was a very nice young lady with curly hair who assisted me when i needed to extent my trip an extra day. Overall everything was perfect, clean, and neat. Will visit again one day and you can thank Nico and the nice lady with curly hair(sorry forgot your name) at the desk.

We were very pleased with our stay at the Hotel. Theas very cozy, clean and comfortable. We truly enjoyed the large tube, only wishing the shower had an attachment because of my height üòä. The staff Arturo Garza was very, professional, friendly, engaging and patient, he really made feel welcome. I would definitely recommend this Hotel to all my friends and family.

Great Hotel in the middle of Everything, Great Rooms, ( I had a suite), it was one of the best views of the city , I have ever had, Great , Great , Great.Walking Distance to Great Restaurants and Shopping. Evening Reception with Free , yes I said Free Wine was Great.

This would be a nice hotel if it were 3 stars, but rating it as a four star hotel is unrealistic.  Our room was had mold on growing on ceiling.  The walls were banged up.  It‚Äôs definitely in need of some repairs.  The location is fabulous.  The staff were kind and courteous.  However there wasn‚Äôt enough staff.  With only one staff member, there was a long wait to check in on a Monday afternoon.  The wait to get my car was even longer the next day, at least 20 minutes.  Over $70 a day to park and with such a long wait, we should have just parked it ourselves.  The city view should be called a street view, as the building is so much lower than the others you don‚Äôt see much except for the street below and 1-2 buildings.  It‚Äôs not a bad place, just not a great place either.

Everything was perfect, nice staff, great view, great location, TV had Netflix. Great restaurants we‚Äôre in walking distance, close walk to a great mall, navy pier was close as well. Really peaceful stay and me and the wife definitely will be back soon

Great place to stay in downtown Chicago. Across from an iconic restaurant and near lake shore drive. The staff was excellent especially Michelle. She went over and above to make sure we were welcome and appreciated. Room was cool and clean. Thank you so much we will be back

The Hotel has an AWFUL customer service, I did my checkout and on my way to the airport I notice I forgot my Apple Watch and reported to a staff member Andrew who the only thing he did was send me link to report the item, which I did and attached a picture of the Find my iPhone show where it was and was easy to find because it receives calls, they refused to check the room while the Apple Watch still had battery, they notify me the next day that they did not find my watch. Let me tell you I‚Äôve stay in not good looking room but staff more customer service related.  The watch disappear even with pictures of location during several hours and it can not be found. Shame. Besides that they only clean your room if you‚Äôre out before 8am, forget the experience of vacation waking up later

Wasn't sure what to expect during this unusual summer, but this place was better than expected. We had a suite, with amazing windows floor to ceiling.  We checked in early a couple of hours without any hassle. Did not try the "to go"breakfast, but did enjoy the "happy hour" wine. Great location on a semi-quiet street. Easy walk to the Riverwalk, Michigan Ave, and Millenium Park. Also, the price for a suite was lower than a standard room at most of the other nice hotels in the area. Also, lady at front desk told us about "spot hero" app that saved us $50 on parking. Great deal!

Its really clean, modern and upscale. Its smaller so it feels like a nice boutique hotel, yet it feels like it has the standard of an amazing high end large hotel chain. I was also surprised that we had a view overlooking a really cool outdoor patio. Its right next to amazing upscale restaurants with outdoor patios. This is a good hotel for tourism, business or anything! They gave us big bottles of wine at check in so that was cool, too!

My friends and I took a quick trip to Chicago to celebrate my birthday! The Kinzie Hotel was the perfect hotel for all of our needs. The staff was very hospitable, helped my friends surprise me by hiding cake and Party needs. Our accommodations were perfect for our weekend away. We felt very safe and secure given the COVID19 life we all live now. The Kinzie Hotel provides services at your leisure while also reducing risk. Andrew the manager provided a great guide on how to enhance your stay while also feeling like your healthy and safety are priority! Oh & best of all the location is perfect for sight seeing, dining and outdoor experiences ! You won‚Äôt be disappointed! The rooms are clean , modern, and provide great Chicago views! Oh and they have a cool photo booth in the lobby

Amazing. The place was clean, the staff was prompt, the location was in the middle of everything that we needed to get to. I was very grateful for the working crew and positive energy that we were treated with.

I used to stay at another hotel in the area but it was full. I was getting tired of that place anyway because they were overcharging for what should be affordable rooms. I guess I had an Idea of what affordable looked like for near the Loop and expected the same sort of space from Kinzie because the price was close. The room at Kinzie exceeded these expectations; windows, amenities, coffee pods and robust WiFI, but also the desk staff treated me like I was some sort of VIP. The staff immediately read my situation when I arrived (tired, hungry, barely social or communicative) there was some sort of glitch with my reservation because I used an app that was being weird. They were bright and cheerful and made me feel comfortable as they quickly accommodated. I opted to pay for

We really enjoyed our stay in Chicago, even though it was for a short time. The Kinzie Hotel was very clean, had beautiful views, and great light cancelling shades. Michelle at the front desk was so helpful and welcoming! She is a gem of an employee!

My 35th bday. Amazing Staff Very Professional and Kind. Breakfast section is awesome and healthy choice. Will definitely repeat business here. Thanks Kinzie Hotel. Love the theme lobby as well. Great security after hours too.

My room was small but nice. The bathroom could have been a little cleaner but I'll chalk that up to COVID-19 and social distancing.  I had a view of Kinzie Street as well as the Trump Hotel after I requested a high floor with a view. The staff was very friendly and informative, all except the valet which seem to take at least 30 mins and cost $73 a night which was almost the price of my room! That being said, I had a decent stay in downtown Chicago for a fairly low price!!

This hotel accepted to cancel our reservation without fee due to the current sanitary situation while we had not booked with a cancellation facility. THANK YOU VERY MUCH Kinzie Hotel !! Next time in Chicago we visit you !

My friend booked a room at the Kinzie Hotel for business and decided to have me over for dinner. I went to the front desk to ask if there was water to purchase. Raul Villarreal was very helpful and even gave some recommendations for some things to visit in the area. All in all, his hospitality and warm smile made the stay even that much better. Thanks Raul!

I just want to take a minute and shout out Raul Villarreal! He was very accommodating and helpful at the front desk, when I had some specific questions about the area. Because of his hospitality alone, I‚Äôll definitely consider rebooking at the Kinzie Hotel.

We have been trying out different boutique hotels in Chicago over the past year or so, and this was one of the nicest we‚Äôve stayed at. We had a corner suite, and it was well laid out, furnished very nicely, floor to ceiling windows with electronic drapes, and very intimate and luxurious. The front desk staff here are stellar at their jobs, especially Lexy and Lupe!! They truly are two of the most friendly and welcoming desk staff I‚Äôve encountered in many years of staying in hotels. Andrew, the GM, also was very welcoming and genuinely wanted our anniversary there to be special. The Kinzie Hotel truly is a ‚Äúdiamond in the rough‚Äù, and I highly recommend it for anyone looking for an intimate, well appointed boutique hotel, in a great location, in Chicago. Looking forward to

Family business required that my wife and I travel to Chicago for the weekend. In spite of the fact that the city is largely shut down, and the hotels that are open are very limited in terms of the amenities they can offer, the Kinzie was such a nice positive experience. Extremely friendly and accommodating staff, great rooms ‚Äì wonderful floor to ceiling windows with a nice chaise lounge to sit and watch the city rest ‚Äì great location, great vibe. We will definitely return!

Our stay at the Kinzie Hotel was absolutely perfect! From the moment we checked in, everything and everyone was incredible. A great location, an exceptionally clean room and friendly, helpful staff make this an obvious choice for anyone traveling to Chicago. Highly recommended!!!

We have stayed here a number of times when we come to town for Blackhawk games, the theater, or just to get away. The cost, the location, and the friendliness of the staff are exceptional (Mona and Derrick). If you are a walker, it is very easy to  walk to attractions both north and south. The continental breakfast is more than enough to send one out for the day, and the wine/beer in the evening is a plus. Then, too, the discount at the Public House next door is great for a drink or light meal. Parking fees are steep, but they can be reduced by using Spot Hero for nearby parking garages if you don't want to go in and out.

We loved our stay st the Kinzie Hotel. Perfect location. Close walk to so much. Rooms are clean and spacious. Fun complimentary hour hour and breakfast. Especially great bellman Derrick in the morning and Alex in the evening. Highly recommend and we've found where we'll stay from now on!

We stayed at the Kinzie hotel from March 2 through March 7. Martin, the hotel manager, went out of his way to accommodate us with our requested room. Service was outstanding from every employee; doorman, housekeeping, front desk, bartender, and even the maintenance person. Location couldn‚Äôt be better. I loved the layout of the room with a long desk bar in the bedroom and a full countertop in the bathroom (no lousy non-functional decorative pedestal sinks in this hotel). An empty refrigerator was available in the room, perfect for in room beverages. We‚Äôve stayed here multiple times and look forward to returning.

Cozy and stylish room! Appreciated the extra things offered in the room, especially for getting ready. LOVED the complimentary happy hour! The only thing I wasn‚Äôt a fan of was our view. üòï Great location to restaurants, bars, music venues, and shopping!

I've traveled all over the world and stayed at some of the best hotels. I didn't know what to expect when I booked a room at Kinzie Hotel. Not only was my greeting upon arrival and check-in pleasant and easy, the room was modern, clean and pretty cool! Bathroom and fixtures were well done. Strong shower. Ordered room service and had one of the best salads of my life! I admired the pens in the room and upon checkout asked if I could have a couple...the fellow ran out and secured me a few to take with me. Great location and a great stay. I was pleasantly surprised and will recommend Kinzie Hotel to friends and family visiting me in Chicago.

I very much enjoyed my stay at the Kinzie Hotel. From the "informal" lobby full of friendly staff to the generous rooms with lots of natural light, this hotel offers a great atmosphere. The continental breakfast and cocktail hour were much better than what is offered in more standard "chain" hotels. The location was convenient to meetings I had in the Loop, even walkable in some cases. I highly recommend this option and will definitely return!

Spent two nights here over the weekend. Excellent location and easy to find. Lovely, friendly staff and a quirky design. Rooms are clean and fresh and the bed was super comfy. Loved the complimentary breakfast and happy hour. Looking forward to returning in April, June, July and September!

I was greeted by friendly staff, stayed in a very modern and comfortable room, and enjoyed a tasty breakfast the next morning. Other perks were easy check out, text communication with the concierge, and a happy hour for all guests.  Would recommend this hotel to others and will absolutely stay here again.

Great hotel, excellent location. Staff consistently friendly and helpful. Bed comfy. Love the happy hour and free breakfast. Only suggestion would be more choice on room service, with some more healthy options. Will be back in April. Thank you to the wonderful staff.

We stayed at the Kinzie for two days for a quick trip. The staff was friendly and very accommodating. Thank you to staff Mona and Derrick for going the extra mile to make our stay great! We will definitely be back.

This hotel was awesome. It‚Äôs located in River north close to various bars,clubs,lounge and restaurants. The hotel has great staff. The room was luxurious with all the amenities. I will definitely stay here again.

I had a FANTASTIC experience with the front desk attendant Mona and Victor were completely FANTASTIC. The bartender Matt was amazing as well. Great room & Amazing amenities and Beautiful property. Amazing!! I booked the room close to a testing center I had exams at the following day and had a great night rest and was able to walk 5-7 mins to my exams. Thank you to the AWESOME Kinzie Staff for making my night stay WONDERFUL!

I went to Chicago for a short girls' trip with my two daughters and cousin.  I can't say enough about how we enjoyed our stay at Hotel Kinzie! We loved how it was so personal. The rooms were wonderful and we felt like the staff was really watching out for us. We felt very safe!  The location couldn't have been better. Located right in the middle of everything on the river downtown. So many things in walking distance. We walked to dinner and a super cool tiki bar the first night. Hit a ping-pong club the second. We would definitely stay there again and recommend to anyone!

Cozy and stylish room! Appreciated the extra things offered in the room, especially for getting ready. LOVED the complimentary happy hour! The only thing I wasn‚Äôt a fan of was our view. üòï Great location to restaurants, bars, music venues, and shopping!

I've traveled all over the world and stayed at some of the best hotels. I didn't know what to expect when I booked a room at Kinzie Hotel. Not only was my greeting upon arrival and check-in pleasant and easy, the room was modern, clean and pretty cool! Bathroom and fixtures were well done. Strong shower. Ordered room service and had one of the best salads of my life! I admired the pens in the room and upon checkout asked if I could have a couple...the fellow ran out and secured me a few to take with me. Great location and a great stay. I was pleasantly surprised and will recommend Kinzie Hotel to friends and family visiting me in Chicago.

I very much enjoyed my stay at the Kinzie Hotel. From the "informal" lobby full of friendly staff to the generous rooms with lots of natural light, this hotel offers a great atmosphere. The continental breakfast and cocktail hour were much better than what is offered in more standard "chain" hotels. The location was convenient to meetings I had in the Loop, even walkable in some cases. I highly recommend this option and will definitely return!

Spent two nights here over the weekend. Excellent location and easy to find. Lovely, friendly staff and a quirky design. Rooms are clean and fresh and the bed was super comfy. Loved the complimentary breakfast and happy hour. Looking forward to returning in April, June, July and September!

I was greeted by friendly staff, stayed in a very modern and comfortable room, and enjoyed a tasty breakfast the next morning. Other perks were easy check out, text communication with the concierge, and a happy hour for all guests.  Would recommend this hotel to others and will absolutely stay here again.

So it's been a while since my visit and am just now getting around to reviewing, as I just came across my room photos on my phone. Anyhooo, it's a really lovely hotel. Nicely decorated. Very comfortable room. Nice lounge/cocktail hour upstairs. Had an off the street room so no noise issues, but not much in the way of a view. It really was just a great hotel.

Had the best corner room on the 4th floor! So many windows and the view was really nice! The best past was Spencer at concierge, he was very friendly and personable  and gave us such positive experience I love how they offer a text message service for places to eat and places to go within walking distance which is helpful for people from out of town. Also Derrick at Valet was very friendly and helpful. Thank you for such a great Customer service and we have already told our friends to stay here next time! We hope to be back soon!  -Kristal & Tom H.

Room was perfect and very relaxing.  We were sad to miss the managers reception this time but have gone to it several times before.  Greeted warmly by the bell captain and then by the front desk.  The hotel was spotless

We LOVED staying at the Kinzie. The Staff was Exceptional and made the experience so wonderful. We brought our two large dogs. They loved all the attention, the dog beds and houses, the treats, and the toys. They are still wearing their Kinzie bananas a week later. We used the valet for our car and had to trouble the staff with putting away and bringing out our car multiple times so we could drive it to our locations. The Staff always had a smile and never complained. I have been recommending the Kinzie to everyone I meet, telling them to stay there regardless of if they have dogs or not. We will 100% be back to stay next time we visit Chicago. THANK YOU.

Only good things to say about our stay! Great location near great bars, jazz clubs, short walk to Michigan Ave. Loved the nightly happy hour. Room and amenities were awesome and staff were always friendly, greeting us everytime we returned. And on top of all that...great price!!

Will definitely be back to stay in the Kinzie hotel, from the spacious bedroom to the happy hour we enjoyed all the Kinzie had to offer. It's in an ideal location, with pubs, restaurants and shopping all in walking distance, as is access to all forms of public transport. The staff were friendly and helpful, the text service with reception was useful and included recommendations on things to see and do.

Visited this hotel on Boxing Day for 5 days with my sister to see Chicago and shop. The hotel was very central to everything and we had a great time. The room was lovely, very spacious and clean. Great lounge time each night for 2 hours with wine, beer and snacks. Also continental breakfast good too. The hotel staff were the most friendly amazing people and we will definitely be returning here in the future. This was my first visit but my sisters third, we loved Chicago.  Special thank you to Lexi who was an amazing help when our flight got cancelled, she was so patient and helped us deal with airline, rebook into hotel and also sorted our transfer back to airport. We are so grateful and hope to thank you in person some day.  All the staff were great, brilliant hotel, would

My 15-year-old daughter and I headed to Chicago the day after Christmas to enjoy the lights on Michigan Avenue and do some shopping. The Kinzie Hotel was perfect for us! So close to Michigan Avenue for walking, and the staff could not be any nicer! This hotel was clean and the staff were so helpful when I had a problem with my reservation. My reservation problem was not the hotel‚Äôs fault, it was Booking.com‚Äôs error, but the Kinzie staff corrected it for me. I will stay here again!!

The bride picked this as her base for the wedding so all the bridesmaids and family stayed here and we were treated like royalty.   From check in to check out we were pampered, taken care of and generally loved to death.   The happy hour and breakfast buffets were fun and appreciated. And the rooms were soundproof and large.   We will definitely stay here again - even without the bride!!  Well done, Kinzie! And special thanks to Victor who helped me  get through a couple of rough patches!!

Booked this hotel for fun romantic getaway and birthday celebration.  Unfortunately our child fell ill at home and we were unable to complete our stay.  The manager would not work with us whatsoever.  Have stayed here several times before but will find somewhere else to patronize in the future.  Love staying in River North, but fortunately there are numerous other options.

So it's been a while since my visit and am just now getting around to reviewing, as I just came across my room photos on my phone. Anyhooo, it's a really lovely hotel. Nicely decorated. Very comfortable room. Nice lounge/cocktail hour upstairs. Had an off the street room so no noise issues, but not much in the way of a view. It really was just a great hotel.

Had the best corner room on the 4th floor! So many windows and the view was really nice! The best past was Spencer at concierge, he was very friendly and personable  and gave us such positive experience I love how they offer a text message service for places to eat and places to go within walking distance which is helpful for people from out of town. Also Derrick at Valet was very friendly and helpful. Thank you for such a great Customer service and we have already told our friends to stay here next time! We hope to be back soon!  -Kristal & Tom H.

Room was perfect and very relaxing.  We were sad to miss the managers reception this time but have gone to it several times before.  Greeted warmly by the bell captain and then by the front desk.  The hotel was spotless

We LOVED staying at the Kinzie. The Staff was Exceptional and made the experience so wonderful. We brought our two large dogs. They loved all the attention, the dog beds and houses, the treats, and the toys. They are still wearing their Kinzie bananas a week later. We used the valet for our car and had to trouble the staff with putting away and bringing out our car multiple times so we could drive it to our locations. The Staff always had a smile and never complained. I have been recommending the Kinzie to everyone I meet, telling them to stay there regardless of if they have dogs or not. We will 100% be back to stay next time we visit Chicago. THANK YOU.

Only good things to say about our stay! Great location near great bars, jazz clubs, short walk to Michigan Ave. Loved the nightly happy hour. Room and amenities were awesome and staff were always friendly, greeting us everytime we returned. And on top of all that...great price!!

We stayed here last year at around Thanksgiving time.  Even though there is a huge choice of hotels in Chicago, we decided to go back here as we loved it so much last year.  Just as good.  A great breakfast included in the room rate - cereals, porridge, muesli, yoghurts etc. And pastries, doughnuts, rolls, hard boiled eggs.  Coffee, tea etc. They still have the 2 hour happy hour period when you can have complimentary wines and beers in the lounge area - great!  The rooms are a fair size for city rooms - noticed a few scuffs on the walls this year.  Lovely comfortable big bed and complimentary toiletries.  Snacks for sale in the room.  And a fridge to store bits if you wish.  A very good experience once again.

We had a great stay at the Kinzie Hotel this past weekend. Spencer checked us in, and he has a really warm and welcoming way about him. We loved the location, easy walking to so many restaurants! Was really nice to have a little continental breakfast, and evening wine reception. Would stay here again! Thanks to all at the Kenzie!

Kinzie Hotel is a boutiqe hotel. The lobby is small and efficient.  There is an included breakfast room for continental breakfast coffee and tea.  The locaton is convenient.  I walked to the theater district in abourt 10 -15 minutes and then headed the other direction for 1--15 minutes to the Magnificent Mile for shopping. The room was large and clean

The Kinzie hotel staff were welcoming and friendly from the beginning to the end of our 4 night stay. The hotel is close to lots of restaurants (and the Kinzie has lots of deals and coupons for many of them). The hotel is also pretty close to the river walk, some hop on bus locations, and Michigan Avenue!

Across from Harry Carey‚Äôs, AMA building and a Trump Tower/Hotel. Easy walk to magnificent mile and Clark/Lake train depot. Room clean. Nice staff. Resort fee added to nightly rate to cover breakfast/ free evening reception. TF

Just recently got back from Chicago!  Celebrating our 30th anniversary  and stayed at the kinzie hotel!  Just wanted to thank Spencer and his team for making our stay amazing and for welcoming us with champagne!! Loved this hotel very clean comfortable and the staff are very pleasant!  Thank you for making us feel right at home!  Love the wine between 5 and 7 nice touch before dinner!  Breakfast buffet was included and definitely will return one day!

Check in was quick and easy, and we really appreciated the perks of the hotel - it was conveniently located to pretty much everything we wanted to do, complimentary beer/wine/snacks at happy hour, continental breakfast, friendly staff, a bunch of Chicago information in the room, etc.  We were here on a Saturday and Sunday night and even though we were only on the 2nd floor facing the street, it was very quiet and peaceful each time we came back to our room to rest.  Everything was clean and modern, and our regular King room/bathroom was spacious.  Checkout was also easy, no need to stop by the front desk since a receipt was slipped under our door and you can checkout using the TV. We‚Äôll definitely be back soon!

We were lucky to find this hotel for a 4 day stay for a family occasion!! They have a complimentary breakfast as well as a free Happy Hour every day! Staff are friendly & helpful. Hotel is within walking distance of main avenues, wonderful restaurants & attractions. The concierge found us an awesome Uber driver who took us everywhere during our stay. Rooms were clean & spacious. We would definitely stay there again!!

We arrived at the hotel late (9 PM) and had an excellent, quick check-in process upon arrival.  We were advised of the "complimentary" breakfast in the morning and wine/beer reception at night.  Our room was on the 5th floor, and I panicked when we passed a men's room in the hallway.  I thought I had mistakenly booked us at a communal hotel where we had to share bathrooms.  We entered our room and I immediately felt relief when I saw the bathroom.  Our room was very clean and decently spacious for our brief stay in Chicago.  We slept great, too.    We took advantage of the breakfast one morning and the wine, beer, and snacks one evening.  I'm glad we did, because I got a bill after checkout that charged me a $25/day amenity fee for such things as these "complimentary" food and

One of the best Hotels for the value my wife and I have stayed in. Clean and tastefully decorated rooms,happy hour with all the wine/beer and snacks free of charge from 5-7,breakfast and without a doube one of the better located Hotels in Chicago. We were able to walk to any number of restaurants and shopping areas with ease and safety. The staff : Spencer, George,Victor and a number of others could not be more friendly,helpful and professional. What a great find.

I am very sorry to say that this hotel and its staff does not care at all about the global trash problems. All plates, glasses or tableware they use is all plastic to throw immediately away. All the breakfast servings, EVERYTHING, is plastic to throw away. When asked about it, they just say they are not equipped otherwise and it is perfectly fine to create tons of new waste everyday. It is amazing that a hotel still thinks this way in 2019 - i will never stay here again till they have solved this issue for good. The only way to ask them to change is to show them that people do care about the environment and I will stay at hotels who do work accordingly

Everything you want in a hotel- clean rooms, helpful staff, free WiFi, free happy hour beers, great breakfast buffet. Super impressed and will definitely be back to stay. Oh yeah, they let you bring dogs too which is awesome

Lovely quiet room. Spotless cleaning. Central location and Great restaurants nearby. Especially Joe‚Äôs Seafood prime steak and Crab. All the staff were very helpful and friendly. Will definitely stay at Kinzies hotel next time I visit Chicago.

The staff, especially Matt and Spencer, were so helpful. The whole experience was wonderful!  I stayed 5 nights this week so was able to try several restaurants  which were an easy walk. Snacks at happy hour were a plus. My traveling companion had a nut allergy but Matt always found her a nonpeanut treat.  Breakfast was nice but pastries seemed dry. I loved the granola and yogurt. I hope to return soon.

I arrived real early at 9 am for the check in. I was so surprised that they were able to let me check in right away without storing the luggage and came back at later time. I was super hungry at that time from catching the 6 am flight from NY (remember the one hour different) When the front desk gentleman Spencer told me that they have the breakfast ready for me on 6th Floor, it simply melt my heart. The next day, since it was the marathon weekend, they specifically prepared a 5 am breakfast for all the runners with bananas, protein bars, Gatorade etc, but not donuts or pastry. After the marathon, in addition to the late check out they provided, they also let me to use their restroom to change and clean up myself. Their service is superb. Front desk is super friendly and

The rooms are very nice.  Well decorated, and very comfortable bed.   Just a block from the river.   Free continental breakfast and even afternoon snacks.   Like this hotel a lot.   Wifi is fast and good and the staff is very attentive.

The Kinzie was amazing. We stayed 3 days, our concierge Spencer was very friendly and quite knowledgeable about the happenings in Chicago. He had some hook ups to assist us in food lines and gave us updates on where the best places for jazz and food. He even surprised us with a complimentary champagne with a handwritten letter of congratulations. He made the Chicago experience seamless and better. The room was on the 5th floor, we had a corner room that enabled us to see city views and the night lights. I will definitely return to the Kinzie.

The room was clean and comfortable. They offer a Continental Breakfast and a Happy Hour on the 6th floor. Great to grab a bite and coffee in the morning. The Happy Hour was a little too loud for me, but the fact that they offer it, is nice. I was doing work at The Mart, so the location was convenient. Loads of restaurants around within walking distance. Staff was very friendly. Would stay here again.

I have stayed at this hotel a few times over the last 2 years.  It is always a great landing spot; with great service, clean rooms, quiet during evening hours.  The complimentary happy hour is a plus.  Nice sized work out room

I stayed here because of the convenient location. I only spent one night but my room (facing the street) was quiet and comfortable with a vew of Harry Carrays. The price was reasonable for a downtown hotel.

The hotel has its benefits. The biggest ones are the location, polite staff and clean rooms. The pricing is reasonable and it was cheaper than most nearby hotels. I am not giving it 5 stars only because breakfast could be a bit more varied.

Pros:  Great location, big room - clean.  Friendly staff - breakfast bar was small but good and the staff there were mostly friendly.  Cons:  Not soundproof at all - you can see light coming in through the door to the hallway - means it was very loud when there were people in the hall.   They charged our credit card TEN TIMES for the $80 authorization charge.  TEN!  The charges eventually came off the card - but at one point we had $800 US  (and we're canadan) tied up on our card.  That was ridiculous and made me wonder about the security of our card in general.

This hotel has a fantastic location and it was very nice. It appears to be a renovated apartment. It was a loft style room. We would stay here again.  Our only complaint was the high priced parking.  Our car was also filthy when it was returned to us. We parked it and left it for 2 full days.

Excellent location for theatre trips, shopping, and dining. A short cab ride to the hotel from Union Station or an easy walk on a nice day. Nice room but was surprised when we entered that the lobby was actually several floors up. No big deal, just unusual. Would definitely consider staying again.

We loved it here! My husband and I  originally stayed at the Cambria Hotel Loop, the experience wasn‚Äôt as great as it was here in Magnificent Mile.  The room here is fantastic,  the size was of the room was huge, organized,  clean, the view is beautiful, overall the hotel is great, made us have a easy experience of seeing Chicago. Our stay was great because of one person here most. We need more people like Ms. Elizabeth  Massey, she works as a receptionist here,  she is so sweet, friendly and extremely nice, she is the one that made sure we had the best time, and was comfortable, she helped us with everything, very hard worker. Having good staff like her that goes above and beyond  is the reason that makes this hotel special compared to other hotels. We will definitely return to

Unprofessional staff. So many things to name that went wrong & that were handled incorrectly. They charged the wrong credit card. The dresser in our room was missing drawers, we did not have a remote to the tv, only one elevator working in the hotel, people were picketing outside of the hotel the entire weekend, they charged me $62 a day for parking when I was supposed to have the $25 per day parking package, I called the hotel on 4 different occasions before the arrival and not one note was put on my reservation!!! That is what Hector said anyway!! I have names and dates of every time I called & person I spoke to. NOT ONE NOTE ADDED!! Was charged $9.95 a day for a service fee. WHAT SERVICE FEE??? This hotel did nothing to service my family. It was a mess from the start. I even

Had to Cancel a trip due to my Mother becoming extremely sick and dying !! Asked hotel for a refund Hotel said tuff luck !! Don‚Äôt want to stay at a hotel that is only interested in profit and not accommodating guest when they have an issue !!

Excellent location, staff was amazing would do anything to make your stay enjoyable!  We Would highly recommend!  The bloody Mary‚Äôs were awesome. Our room  was very clean!  Yes picketers outside did not affect our stay 1 bit

Our experience with the hotel was in generally nice. We stayed 3 nights in a king room.  Will brief as follows :  üå∑Room was spacious and clean. üå∑Bathroom was clean with a bathtub. No separate shower space. üå∑Bed was a few steps below the entrance so make sure to pick a correct room set up for your needs as they have many options. üå∑Coffee machine available.  üå∑Safe available üå∑Free wifi üå∑Closet space was a bit small or am I an over packer ü§îü§î  Over the stay was great and relaxing.  üå∑Elevators were only 2 for the higher level but it was OK.  üå∑Strike is still ongoing in small numbers and is not bothering anyone

My husband and I stayed here during our recent visit to Chicago.  The property is located on the Magnificent Mile and is VERY conveniently located near upscale shopping and numerous quality restaurants.  If you are up to a longer walk, you can walk to the train as well.  Check-in was fairly easy and the staff were very friendly.  When we checked out, the front desk people were not as friendly.  This might've been because hotel employees were picketing the front of the hotel.  The picketers were apparently in a wage dispute with this hotel; had we known the hotel was being picketed, we would not have stayed there.  When we arrived, there was no picket line; the next morning, they were there.  The picketers made no attempt to enter the hotel and didn't try to keep us from coming

We stayed here for two nights mid November 2019.  We requested an early check in along with a late checkout and the staff was more than accommodating!  We received a voucher for the hotel bar which was an added plus.  The room was nice, big and clean.  Would stay at again

The hotel is in a very convenient location to all the Mag Mile shops. Lobby was small but updated and clean. Rooms large and also clean. Shower had little to no hot water the entire weekend which was disappointing and we were charged a $20 resort fee which I found odd since there were no extra perks and we didn‚Äôt use WiFi.

I stayed 2 nights in a King Suite for a girls' trip. Check in was easy and pleasant, and I appreciated the offer the Cambria has to go green. If you opt not to have housekeeping come every day, you're offered a credit to use at the bar/coffee shop in the hotel. My room was very clean, comfortable and spacious. The showers are quite narrow, so if that's an issue for you a room with a tub might be better. The location is very convenient to shopping along the Magnificent Mile. Parking at the hotel is pricey, however. I recommend reserving a spot in the Olympia Centre garage one block over. You still get in and out privileges, but it's $25 cheaper. I would definitely stay in this hotel again on a future visit to Chicago.

Our Family has booked two nights, two rooms @ The Cambria Hotel (Chicago).  My Dad , who is battling Cancer had some appointments @ Northwestern .  So we chose The Cambria for the location being close to the Hospital.  We had about a 3 hour drive to Chicago, which was hard on my Dad.  So when we pulled up, I explained this to the Bellman and he was beyond helpful letting me park out front, while I checked in.  The Girl @ the front desk was also beyond helpful and sped up checking in , so I could get my Dad in a room.  Then I realized we booked rooms without a bathtub, so I called the front desk and they moved us to rooms with a Bathtub, no questions asked (thank you, Dana).  I mentioned to the Bellman , it was our Daughter's 10th birthday and they brought up a small treat with a

The hotel is at the city of Chicago. Very convenient location. The decor is dated, but clean.The rooms are very big and clean. Service is good.  The rooftop is really nice. The bar area is well equipped.

This hotel is just a block off the magnificent mile and in a great location!  Very close to the water tower, close to shopping.   Front desk staff was very helpful and prior to arrival I had made a phone call with questions and each time everyone was helpful.  You may check your bags if you arrive before your room is ready. Great decor, the lobby had nice seating plus a bar/snack/coffee area which was very handy.  We were on the 22nd floor and had a decent view.  We looked over a parking lot but weren‚Äôt looking at another building so that was good.  We had a king suite which had a seating area and it was very roomy.  The bathroom was small but we had a handicapped accessible room so that might be why it was more compact.  There were 3 steps down into the main space.  Decor was

Great location just of the Magnificent Mile with short distance from shopping and attractions. Spacious and clean rooms, but the staff certainly could offer more smiles. Some staff were on strike, maybe thats why they were not happy?

Stayed here as my base for the marathon, excellent location to get to start and finish. Food on side very limited, especially as a coeliac so didnt eat here. Rooms were very well equipped and clean. I did try and order a taxi for one day, and was told it had been booked but it never turned up ...... so if you need a taxi perhaps do it yourself. Hotel did supply all runners a breakfast bag which was very nice of them. Also some of the staff were on strike so not great crossing a picket line.  Overall a good hotel but a few issues did let them down.

Stayed for six nights in a suite with king size bed and double fold which was in a partially separated area for our adult son who was there to run the marathon. The room was comfortable with efficient aircon for heating or cooling and very quiet. The main bed was too soft for our liking but that might just be us. The fold out sofa bed was not fit for purpose- just exposed springs so our son slept on the sofa in its non fold out state which he found to be fine and the room layout waorked perfectly for us. Although our room was on the 18th floor the lifts were fast and there was never a long wait for them. The offerings at the cafe in the foyer were okay but not as good as any of half a dozen places nearby- e.g Corner Bakery, Sunny Side Up.   All in all a very good stay in a great

The hotel service was horrible!  The maid came to the room at 5pm to do the cleaning - the exact time we were trying to get ready for a big event. The maid coming to the room in the evening was very inconvenient!  I had to chose between getting ready in an uncleaned room or wait for the room to be cleaned and then rush to my event!  Very horrible room cleaning timing!  There were only 2 elevators for upper floors so there was almost always a wait - there was an elevator scare too where the elevator wasn't working right.  There is an over-priced bar/coffee shop on the lower floor.  The doorman couldn't call or get a taxi or do his job at all!  There were constant protestors outside due to a labor dispute.  The parking was $65 per night!!   The location was good & price cheap for

The hotel was very conveniently located a half block off of Michigan Ave in the Magnificent Mile area.  The staff were very accommodating and the rooms had an interesting layout.  The rooms were also clean and comfortable.  Another attractive feature is that the hotel was relatively compact with only about 10 to 12 rooms per floor so it was much quieter than most large downtown hotels.  For the location, the cost was a great value..

Our 1st hotel on a Travelsphere tour. Modern easy to check in friendly helpful reception staff. Nice big clean room, had a safe, fridge, tea/coffee, hairdryer, etc. Very handy for walking into the city, about a 15min walk, we felt very safe in the area. The buffet breakfast was very good and the bar had a good choice of drinks. As for sleep, not too good in room 309, we had to turn our aircon off as it was too noisy, but we could hear the noisy aircon from surrounding rooms. Room 309 was at the side of the hotel where the dustbin wagons arrived early each morning to noisily pick up the rubbish. Before we got to the USA I looked up the hotel and other people had mentioned the on going workers strike. Each morning the Strikers peacefully walked around the front of the hotel, one

The location was the best!  We were within walking distance (up to a mile) of pretty much every site we wanted to see.  We had no problem being without a car for a long weekend.  Room was designed well and bed was comfortable. The restaurant bar was a nice amenity, though we only stopped for a beer one of the nights.

Where to start...Picketers out front that confront people as they enter the hotel.  Front desk staff that wasn't familiar with the details of my group reservation (12 rooms).  Inconsistent WiFi.  Terrible customer service after the stay.  There are so many hotels in Chicago, and this hotel just isn't worth the hassle.  We should have stayed at the AC Hotel by Marriott.  It's a much nicer and professional hotel.

This was my first trip to Chicago. I was only there for 2 days and one night, so limited time to sight see.  The Cambria Hotel was nice and very centrally located in the Magnificent Mile area. I was able to walk the area, do some shopping and see the river walk area.  So many things to do and see in Chicago, you really need a couple of days to take it all in.

I plan on staying at another hotel for my for night stay in Chicago, however I found the Cambria and the prices were almost $100 Les. so happy that I change. This hotel is in a perfect location. It is just east of The magnificent Mile on Superior in Michigan. At the corner of the hotel is Saks fifth avenue, Tiffany's, and Neiman Marcus. Very centrally located and within walking distance to everything! I was able to walk to Navy Pier within 30 minutes. The rooms are very large and queen. I stayed in a king suite which has a bedroom and a separate living room with a pull out couch. The furniture was kind of dated. Actually The only furniture in the room was two nightstands in the bedroom. In the living room was the pull-out couch and a chair. Bathroom is kind of on the small side

As of 9-23-19 workers were striking. There are other affordable options around this area that doesn't require crossing the picket line. Be wary of booking through a nonrefundable website, I wish I knew ahead of time.

Reserved a block of rooms for our friends and we were told each room could be paid for individually, only to be hit with over $2000 on our debit card. We were offered absolutely nothing for our troubles.

We had a group of 10 staying at this hotel to attend the Rolling Stones concert.  The rooms were very nice and spacious.  The location was perfect for walking to shopping and dining.  The lobby was so casual and welcoming and was a great place to hang out in the evenings.  The staff was very friendly and welcoming.  The housekeeping staff was on strike outside the hotel during our stay but it was only a little distracting.  It was peaceful at least.  Would definitely recommend this property and consider staying here in the future.

The best part of this hotel is the location. Right next to Gino‚Äôs East and one block from Michigan Avenue, you are truly in the heart of Chicago. We walked to Navy Pier with no problem.  My room on the fifth floor was nice sized and the bathroom was huge. No tub but had a very large shower.  Staff was friendly. There was picketing out front which I think was for all of the hotels in Chicago. It was a little uncomfortable coming from a bargaining unit background.  Between the fabulous location, and the nice rooms, I‚Äôd gladly stay there next time. Please just settle the union dispute so it does not impact your guests.

This Cambria hotel was a great stay- in an ideal location right in the heart of the city, 10 mins to the ‚ÄòL‚Äô metro & within walking of the Millennium park, good restaurants & many museums.   Good staff, gym facilities & breakfast buffet & barista area, but the best thing was the size of the King Size double room we had.  Much roomier than many other hotels I‚Äôve stayed in- this one was particularly generous with a huge comfortable bed & large hi def tv. If there wasn‚Äôt so much to see in this great city we could easily have spent all our time in the room!   Definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Chicago.

Pros... The staff is amazing. Raleigh was incredibly accommodating.  The location is amazing. Room are sizable and can accommodate your entire family.   Only con....The pull out sofa‚Äôs mattresses definitely need to be changed out. You can feel the coils.   Thank you!

This hotel is located in a perfect location.  Within walking distance of shopping, great restaurants and many attractions.  The lobby is lovely, the coffee shop and bar are great. The rooms are small, yet nicely decorated. That said there are a few things that need improvement and would prevent us from choosing this hotel again. 1.  The check in--Arrived at 2:30 p.m fully prepare not to be able to check in immediately as the check in time is 3:00 p.m.--Waited patiently enjoyed coffee, drinks and relaxing in the lobby.  Checked back several times rooms still not ready!  Finally at 4:45 p.m. with the patience of 8 people (4 adults& 4 children) wearing thin and a less than pleasant chat with the young man at the check in desk we were finally able to check in.  Reason for delay we

We had a king room with a sofa.  The room was huge,  clean,  and comfy.  The bathroom was small,  but clean and did the job.  The staff was friendly and efficient.  The bell hop Dante and the evening bartender were the best,!!! The location is amazing!!!  Right off Michigan Avenue in the middle of everything.  The only negative was as checking out we saw the price of parking. $62 a day for parking!!!!! What!!!! It isn't  even that costly in NYC.  We would stay again,  but try and find our own parking.  I think there was a garage that was $30 /day near by.

Reached quite early due to flight timings, and reception (sorry don't recall the name) was kind enough to give the room. Spacious well designed rooms. Great location with near to plenty of shopping and eating options. Will surely stay again next time in Chicago.

My husband and I with our two kids, 8 & 5, stayed here while on our first ever trip to Chicago. We went to a Cubs and White Sox game, Navy Pier, Lincoln Zoo, Millennial Park, and Field Museum. This hotel is a wonderful location with an authentic pizza joint next door. It is only a few blocks from bus stops and train station. We stayed on the fifth floor facing the front, and didn't even really hear or notice the strike picket line at night at all! The service was impeccable and the room was HUGE and bathroom was HUGE! Very Clean, Kid-Friendly, etc! We would definitely stay here again!

Had the best time here at this hotel. Staff is great, room was nice, and location is prime. The front desk was very friendly and welcoming. The front lobby is very nice and lively. The bar at the hotel lobby is just as nice! My first time in Chicago and they made it that much better! ELIZABETH from the front desk was fantastic. So polite and had some great recommendations. Would come back and ask for her help again. Overall this hotel is a great spot to stay.

Booked the hotel for two nights...had confirmed reservartion, they even blocked the charge on the credit card. arrived around mid-night due to delayed flight. they told us to take our bags and go to another hotel as they are over booked!!! I mean who does this? this is not an airline where you overbook. even there they offer you an upgrade. additionally the two people at the reception were extremely rude and aggressive. they didn't facilitate us and told us clearly that the hotel only cares about the revenue. we had to go to another hotel and didn't come back as it was extremely inconvenient to check out and check-in again due to our short trip. in short we had pay much more and the hotel didn't do anything to compensate us. the next morning the hotel manager came to apologize

The location of the Cambria, Magnificent Mile, is highly convenient.  It is located close to everything, yet the street location is quiet.  The room was delightful and clean, with a great view.  Also, the breakfast buffet was excellent.

Was just there this past weekend & would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone especially for the amount of money they charge for a room. First, no mirrors in our room except for the dinky one in the bathroom. Second, every time u call room service for something it literally takes hours if they decide to bring it.  Food there sucks & front desk is rude!  They have complimentary small water bottles so I ask for a couple to brew coffee.  After about an hour I get housekeeping to bring coffee & no water. When I ask I‚Äôm told hold on let me ask front desk. And didn‚Äôt get any. I had to go buy my own.   Here‚Äôs the best part....morning of check-out, our alarm clock kept going if every 15 mins starting at 6am. No one set it & we tried to unplug it but the cords were literally locked up in

Checked in today in a room with a King bed and a "sofa bed". The room is advertised as sleeping 3-4 - but the mattress on the sofa "bed" is like sleeping directly on metal springs! No support, no padding whatsoever. The floor would be more comfortable. I've slept on poor sofa beds before, but this is by far the worst I have ever experienced. They should be embarrassed to have hotel guests sleep on something like this. When I complained to the front desk, they offered no help whatsoever. I asked if they had any cots instead, and they said it would be an additional charge. REALLY?? When your sofa "bed" is like a bed of nails?? They should be paying US to sleep in this room. Terrible!

What the front desk won't tell you, but once you check in and get to your room you will find a hotel management letter letting you know about Cambria's Union Negotiations that were agreed upon.  However, housekeeping is still striking.  We were awakened by loud voices between at 11:00 p.m. and continued until 3:00 a.m. Our room was located at the front of the hotel.  We were on the 7th floor directly above the entrance. The letter will tell you what you need to do if the noise bothers you.  My Advice, book another hotel in the area, there are plenty. Or, Ask before you book. Otherwise the Hotel is in an excellent location, room and hotel is very clean.  Steps to shopping, Northwestern Campus, Resturants.

Lobby is beautiful and newly renovated. Elevators are efficient and rarely require a wait of more than 1 min.  Rooms are dated, with an odd mix of new and old furnishings that don't quite work together. We were in a king suite that had a large couch and a mini fridge. The TV was large and could be swiveled to be seen by the couch or the bed, but didn't allow any external connections so we were unable to watch netflix or youtube on it.  The bathroom is extremely small vs the rest of the room. Even with two people, it was crowded. You can also very clearly hear others in adjacent rooms and in the hall.  Breakfast is available on site but even with the Expedia VIP $10 off coupon, it wasn't worth it. Selection was limited - toast, scrambled eggs, bacon/sausage, pancakes were

This location is excellent if you are a family looking to see the sights or for anyone looking to shop the Mag Mile. It was priced $50 lower than the other hotels I was looking at and the room was spacious with a seating area separate from the bed - a nice layout for a family of 4. It lost a star for not having a bathtub, which reminds me that I really wish trip advisor would let you do 1/2 stars. I used Spot Hero for a very reasonable overnight garage parking spot in the Northwestern Hospital garage which is right across the street from the hotel. No in and out, but you can get to your car if you need to. Saved $25 compared to overnight parking through the hotel.

Came in earlier than expected. Hector was able to help us with a room that was top notch. My fianc√© and I will definitely book again soon. Looking forward to our next stay. If we end up stay two nights. Hopefully we can get a good deal.

This well located Cambria hotel building used to be an apartment building.  So the rooms are larger than one would typically expect and include a pull out sofa The hotel has a nice workout room.  This seems ideal for the business traveler and families as well  Late check out is limited to 12:30 without a fee

This hotel was horrible. Not clean, over priced, no parking of their own and the hospitality staff and cleaning staff have been on strike for 10 months now. Literally picketing in front of the lobby on the sidewalk.

The hotel room was clean when we checked in.  After staying 2 nights we had to request clean towels.  No one ever emptied the trash, made the bed or brought fresh towels again.  I noticed the first morning the hotel workers were on strike, it definitely effected the service.  I won‚Äôt stay there again as long as the workers are striking.

The hotel was very clean and classy. The room was spacious and the bed was the best I‚Äôve ever slept on. My wife and I wanted to inquire as to where we could purchase it. The kids really enjoyed the room and have asked repeatedly when we can return. When we return this hotel will be in our top 3.

Located centrally in Chi town's chic neighborhood, the Cambria Hotel offers top quality rooms with excellent amenities. There are plenty of Chicago attractions and shopping in walking distance from this hotel.

I found a letter from the housekeeper's union waiting for me on the desk in my room when I checked in. The topic discussed the in-fighting between the hotel and the union. Highly inappropriate. I turned it into the front desk the first night I checked in.  There are active protesters outside the front door during business hours. The hotel shouldn't be advertising for conferences if the space can't be noise-free.   The roof-top bar shouldn't be advertised if it's for "special events only." You can't even go up to look at the view. Also, have the lobby bar menu is flat-out discontinued.

This hotel was perfect for us. Not expensive; not too fancy; clean; just a block off Michigan Avenue at Nieman Marcus and Tiffany's. We walked almost everywhere and the places that were outside of walking distance were available with reasonable cab fare.  There is a hotel worker strike still going on, but it was a peaceful demonstration that was no bother to us.

The hotel was perfect for what we were looking for. It had restaurants near by and was easy to get to the train. We stayed in Chicago to go to a Cubs game but also to see the city. This hotel was perfect for our trip and had a nice bar inside the hotel. Just wish the rooftop bar/lounge was available for all guests. You have to have a party reservation to experience it.

Hotel is in a great location, I toured on foot the majority of the tourist destinations from the hotel.  Surrounded by the main attractions and the Lake is 3,486 steps away confirm by my fitbit.  Great gym.

The location of this hotel allows you to put up with a little more just because it's wonderful!  The room was clean, but nothing to brag about.  A deep cleaning needs to be done.  We used the in room coffee maker to make hot water and the water was brown without any use of coffee.  We reported it and asked for a coupon to buy something downstairs and were given a microwave.  The front desk staff and coffee bar staff did act like they could careless, the valet was nice and the baggage staff was wonderful.  The picket line was out front (but just for a few hours each day) the people were super friendly and couldn't hear them past the front lobby.  This is not a luxury hotel, this is a mid-level hotel.

It is very difficult to get to the hotel in a car.  To pull up to Valet you must enter from Michigan Ave otherwise you have to pull past the hotel and back-up your car.  Also when we were there Protestors greeted us and were a constant.  Last, our room was HOT.  We called down to have someone come and fix it and when we got back from the Cubs game it was still hot and never looked at.  Last, the room design was off - choppy no flow and hard to carry a conversation.  The valet were the nicest to us - everyone else had an attitude like they didn't want to be working there - not worth the money and will never stay at a Choice Hotel again!

The location to shopping areas and local eateries was wonderful. The staff was friendly, but acted disinterested until Jessica who was both professional and courteous really made the difference in my experience at the front desk. The house keeper was also very pleasant and accommodating during my entire stay.

Front desk staff in the evening were extremely rude and unhelpful with simple requests. I felt like they were bothered by me asking questions about the area and about needing extra water for my room. Location is good, but I paid a lot to stay here and I would not recommend. I will never stay in Cambria again. Also, they have a massive labor dispute with Chicago hotel workers. Apparently, Cambria is the only hotel not to settle the dispute - every other Chicago hotel has.

Stayed for a business conference that was being held at a nearby Hotel.  Cost was signifcantly lower than conference Hotel and Room was just as nice if not nicer.  Hotel was much smaller and that was nice, because less crowds.

We stayed here at the start of our road trip down to New Orleans at the end of May. The hotel has got the best location. Right off the Magnificent Mile and within very manageable walking distance to all that you could wish to see in Chicago. The rooms are great. Very spacious, clean and tidy. We had a great view of the 360 tower from our room on the 25th floor. This is an ideal hotel for anyone visiting Chicago. The only downside I would add to this and it is minor was that the breakfast offering was a bit stingy for the price. Ours was included as part of our trip so we didn‚Äôt pay but certainly wouldn‚Äôt have paid for it. The only seating area in which to have your breakfast is in the main hotel lobby as well so that didn‚Äôt really sell it to us either. We did have our breakfast

Although I was not a guest at the Cambria Hotel Chicago Magnificent Mile, I was helped by Dayna (at the reception desk) to get accommodation at another hotel. She walked the extra mile calling multiple times to the reception desk of the other hotel and patiently waited on hold until got somebody to answer. She offered emergency accommodation at the Cambria Hotel in case the other option had not worked. Interestingly, the next day I overheard colleagues of mine sharing their excellent opinion about this hotel. Apparently, my experience was not accidental and Dayna and her colleagues are taking customer care at heart.

Some employees of this hotel have been on strike since September 2018, they have been continuously picketing out front of the hotel, the chant, block the front door, and bang a drum starting early in the morning. I unfortunately need to have a package delivered to me during my stay, even more unfortunately it was time sensitive, due to the strike UPS would not deliver my package, and I would only be able to retrieve it from UPS after my deadline had passed, you would have thought this is A: something they should have mentioned to me when I called the hotel to let them know that I‚Äôd have a UPS package arriving, and B: you‚Äôd think UPS would know that they won‚Äôt deliver to this address. Beyond that the hotel was only okay, the staff wasn‚Äôt very friendly or helpful, the rooms

We had no clue in advance that this is the lone hold out from an apparent hotel workers strike last year. They are still protesting DAILY in front of this location starting at SEVEN AM every day with DRUMS that wake you up no matter what. We were on the top floor 28 and still could not sleep. And there are megaphones. And they yell at  you as you come in. The roof top club above 28 was also a noise issue. Stomping, partying and phone calls to mgmt did not stop the intrusion. So sleep was difficult despite a nice bed and pillows. The room was OK, but especially for the price we would never choose this hotel again with the protesters out there month after month and day after day from 700am until after check in time. Really bad.

Im in Seattle, made reservations for a few days after great reviews. Then I saw online that there is an ongoing active strike.  This would have been important information to know, I confirmed it with the front desk, they were nonchalant about it and didnt give any information, so I canceled my reservation.

So I just checked out of this hotel. The good parts: great location, big rooms. The bad: everything is so old and out of style. Ugly rugs and tiles, sink area is tiny, no control on water pressure, for some strange reason there are stairs in the rooms - which makes it unsafe at night if you need the bathroom, and the worst: the AC units are in the rooms, which makes them noisy. Plus, there is a house keepers strike for 11 months. The strikers stand outside with a big drum and make noise all day. It makes it impossible to sit in the nice lobby. And last, add some vegetables to the breakfast. It's 2019 guys, people want to eat healthy. So, with a nice renovation of the rooms and an agreement with the employees this could turn into a great hotel. Right now it does not deserve 4

This was a terrible stay! We were told that there was a pool at the hotel when I booked, and there was not! We also received terribly service from the front desk. They were so rude! When we got to the room the phone didn‚Äôt work and the beds were not made properly! I would not recommend this hotel at all!

Let's start with the positive: Great location near hospital Negatives: Extremely loud DRUM banging, chanting and protesting hotel workers. Prior to checking in we were told protests last until 4pm. We proactively asked to switch room to the back of the hotel. Eight hours later there was still loud drumming and chanting. It was after midnight!!! Front desk was "annoyed" by "noisemakers". I got the feeling I was the noisemaker now.  When I complained I was given ear plugs and sent back to my room. In the morning,management was no help either. We were told our experience at their  establishment wasn't their fault and there wasn't anything they could do. After all we were given ear plugs.  I knew a migraine was inevitable.  We endured that nightmare one night. The Cambria hotel was

staying more than one night? good luck finding a place to put your clothes. also, watch out for a protest every morning at 7am outside the hotel. they have loud drums. no one told us about that. oh, and the persistent noise the air conditioner makes all night long. good times.

The king suite is very comfortable but the bathroom is smaller than you would expect.  They were under a union strike while I was there and I did not know before hand.  Be prepared for no room service while you are there so no way to eat from the hotel after returning from your day of fun in Chicago unless you bring your own food in.

This hotel bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in.  Room was dark and quiet and I slept great.  We were in a junior suite on an upper level floor facing the back.  No view, but very quiet.  Room had an odd feature - it looks like it was recently renovated and they removed a sink outside the bathroom but left the cutout and towel hooks on the wall.  Location is great - next to Northwestern and two blocks off Michigan Ave.  Protesters were there during our stay, but they did not bother us.

The hotel workers are on strike.  They begin their protests every morning at 7 and they continue all day.  Hotel will not inform you when booking.  It soured what should have been a really fun weekend away.

My husband and I stayed here for eleven nights during a family holiday/reunion trip before Easter. We decided to ignore the negative reviews about the industrial action because of the great location and the otherwise good comments about the rooms and amenities. The hotel is situated just off the Magnificent Mile, a short walk from the department stores, restaurants, bus stops, etc. At check-in the reception staff were friendly and candid about the noise from the strikers outside the lobby every day and asked if we would like to stay in a quiet room on the other side of the hotel ''with no view''. We accepted the offer and were delighted to be allocated a mini suite with two large windows looking up at the John Hancock Tower. We also had a large leisure area with sofa and coffee

Great place to come back to after a long day of Chicago fun and food! We had a suite with king bed and sleeper sofa. Each of these 'rooms' had their own TV which worked out great for us. Was also thankful for the clean, nice bath room. Advice: Ignore the protesters...the hotel with its location, service, price and cleanliness is worth it.

Labor strike started at 7:00 in the morning. Employees screaming, banging drums and shouting abuse at anyone walking into or out of the hotel. Don‚Äôt waste your money. It‚Äôs a total joke. Completely ridiculous. Go literally anywhere else.

This is a beautiful hotel right off of Michigan Ave and Superior next door to Gino's East Pizza.  The room was beaitifully decorated and had a nice Sasmsung TV ans a awesome bathroom.  The lobby personel were veery friendly and efficient.  The lobby has a bar and a food and coffee concession.  I highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again.

The location of this hotel was excellent for what we were doing.  We were able to walk everywhere in the city, and the train (L) station was close for the times we needed it.  There was a strike going on that we were unaware of until we checked in.  It didn't seem to effect the service we received.  I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Great staff, (thank you Jessica and company), ideally located in the heart of the city, helpful and friendly staff.  The hotel was clean (not a speck of dust),easily walkable for tourists. The bed was comfortable, I had a great view of the city (room 502) and the price for  the location was more than reasonable.  I will return to Chicago soon and Cambria Hotel Magnificent Mile will be my go to hotel when I am there!  I highly recommend it.

My two friends and I recently stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and shared a room. My two friends were in a double bed and I was in a sofa bed. The room was comfortable and clean - however, I was cold in the sofa bed and twice requested another blanket from reception staff - I was told this would be brought to our room - this never materialised. I then requested a blanket from the chamber staff and was advised this could be obtained from the reception staff - I advised I had already tried this and the chamber maid said she would get a blanket - again this never materialised. We also on several occasions requested enough tea, coffee, water, etc. for 3 people as only 2 had been catered for in our room. We were told by reception staff 'it is complimentary you know' - well of course

Our room was larger than expected upon arrival. Very clean room, and spacious bathrooms. However, the protests for higher wages disrupted our morning. Restaurants nearby. Overall a modern design with friendly and efficient staff.

Hotel was fine but housekeepers were on strike. Even though I asked for a quiet room and had to stay up late, they put me at the front. Was awoken by strikers with drums and bullhorns at 7:15 AM, making it impossible to sleep. They moved me to a room in the back the second night, which was fine, but it is absolutely ridiculous to put guests in rooms where you know they will not be subjected to drums and bullhorns early in the morning.

Hotel- Kimpton Allegro (Chicago, IL) Date- 11/6 ‚Äì 11/8 (2 nights) Overall: 3/5. Good/Average. Overall, this was a fair experience, for a stay during the pandemic. The staff members we interacted with were pleasant, and the room we ultimately received met all expectations for the brand.  Rewards Club Recognition- 4/5. Above average. Although we were not verbally thanked for our loyalty, we were given a branded bag containing a chocolate bar, a bag of bbq chips, some skittles, and two waters. We were not given welcome amenity points, and we had to ask to get the usual $10 Raid-the-Bar credit. Our room was upgraded initially to a ‚ÄòKing Premier‚Äô room. Please note that this property is leaving the Kimpton chain, and the usual amenity offerings are not being provided.  Staff- 4/5.

We stayed there because our son was getting married in the city. We had a group who stayed and I have to say that the employees went above and beyond to make sure we enjoyed our stay! Our group kind of took over the lobby of the hotel throughout the weekend and never felt like so comfortable! They allowed us to continue the celebration, without any comments or concerns. With this whole pandemic putting a damper on the wedding, it was wonderful that they were so accommodating! Thanks again!

We had our wedding block for our guests and families during covid19 at hotel allegro. The staff is beyond extraordinary. They went out of there way to help with everything we needed. From allowing dogs to arranging photo shoots for our wedding party. I cannot recommend this place enough! Fantasy is probably the best most patient person on the planet. She made this step of our wedding stress free.  Also, the hotel is just gorgeous! Take a moment to look at all the detail in this fabulous building!

room I had was smaller than I expect but didnt bother me as much. The customer service was phenomenal Micheal and Ben were great the hotel time. They really brought a welcoming vibe which was awesome. Definitely will be staying here again!

Had a great stay for 4 nights - comfy beds, Renovated suite with wonderful bathroom, Very accommodating staff. Really enjoyed the use of free bikes provided by the hotel, along with bike lock and helmet too! Best perk!

We enjoyed this hotel but a few things we did not like. There is no WiFi at all, room was very small, bathroom was extremely small, great water pressure and shower temp was hot, sink water pressure hot, facet too close to sink to wash hands, need better shower curtain to not wet floor, need to renovate the wallpaper, and upholstery on bed, need to clean/wash carpet. Walls were thin. Could hear the people next door. Due to COVID restrictions, we were able to text the front desk and get fresh towels. Also they had a really NICE Prosecco Hour. Lobby was depicted as pictured as well as the entrance. Starbucks is located next door for a quick coffee pick up. Overall stay was good.

The room was very small. None of the amenities were available during our visit. No breakfast was offered, not even continental. To add insult to injury we were charged a $100 smoking fee, neither my husband nor I smoke.

Stayed here with my family during the holidays. The weather was beautiful and the hotels location made it perfect for us to walk to christkindlmart and millennium park. The hotel had some nice touches and we enjoyed room service and their cocktail hour.   Staff was great and the room was well appointed. We stayed in a suite to give our family of 3 some room to spread out. It was a great vacation!

I decided to take a last minute trip to Chicago and needed a hotel. I found Hotel Allegro at a great price. The hotel was beautifully decorated in the art deco style. The room was on the smaller side but it was perfect for me since I was traveling solo. There is also a happy hour from 5-6 daily, where you can get you Prosecco fix. It is centrally located near plenty of great restaurants and shopping. Leah R. at the front desk was AMAZING and was always happy to answer my questions and drop recommendations for some of her favorite nearby spots. If i am ever in Chicago again, I would definitely stay at this hotel.

I will be honest and say I had been avoiding IHG properties for a little while due to an experience at a property in Cherry Hill, NJ.  So needless to say, my company booked this property and I was pleasantly surprised.  It is well located.  Many restaurants and transportation are just steps away (with a restaurant in the lobby).  You can actually come straight here from O‚ÄôHare as the Blue line stops a block away.  This by no means is a ultra-luxury hotel.  However, for a renovated prewar building, it is nice enough.  They make up for it in the service.  The customer service is wonderful.  I arrived super early and was granted early check-in with a kind smile.  The elevator was clean, albeit not as secure as I would have wanted for a city hotel (meaning, you don‚Äôt need key card

My friends and I stayed here for a short reunion trip. It was fun and swanky. We really enjoyed returning from a long day in the city to free champagne (5pm-6pm everyday). The staff was very friendly and the beds are super comfortable. I would definitely stay here again!!

Rooms were nice, common spaces are beautiful, and the staff is incredibly friendly. Find Leah and tell her hi, she's one of the best!  Check out the champagne happy hour from 5 to 6 also. Free unlimited champagne and great company!

Our room was on the small side with furnishings that are either weird or artsy depending on your point of view. In addition to the very comfortable bed our room had a credenza containing the refrigerator/minibar and safe, a desk and a couple of small pouffes for seating. A small table and comfy chair would have been a nice touch but there wasn't space.  As others have noted, the walls are rather thin, so keep it down!  Like the bedroom, the bathroom was also compact.
