Disappointingly in this day and age, it still had a tub rather than a walk-in shower.  Everything was clean and worked, so no complaints there. I was a little surprised by the lack of USB outlets. I also didn't care for the main room light which was as charmless as an old fluorescent tube.  Kimptons pride themselves

I used points to stay here in December. I had minibar credit but noticed a random unidentified charge of almost $60 on my credit card from this property. I called to inquire about the bill (which I never received at checkout), and when it was sent the charge was magically removed. Note, I hadn't asked them to do this, I just wanted to see what I was being charged for. Seems they knew it was bogus without even having to ask... Hmm, why would that be? Check your bill.

Not a luxury hotel but a great price value. My rate was 130/night for a downtown Chicago hotel. Adjacent to the EL so convenient transportation links. Close to Art instiitute and Millenium Park. Attractive decor in lobbies. Rooms are small and only chair was a desk chair. No on room coffee service. But otherwise a nice comfortable room. Lots of walkable restaurants.

Hotel is located amazingly in the middle of The Loop area. One can easily walk to visit any sights in the area. Lobby and bar area have a very impressive art-deco design and seem to have been recently renovated. The rooms, unfortunately, are a bit outdated and small - the style isn't really in the line with that of the rest of the hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Porters, however, were not very helpful with luggage and ordering a taxi. Didn't have the chance to check-out the restaurant, but it seemed busy at all times.

Location is good, no complains at all They have no room service and when I asked they told me that Uber Eat was available or take out from the Hotel Restaurant. Not the answer you want to hear after a long day. No coffee maker in the room 30% of the fitness center working machines weren‚Äôt working. For sure I am not going back to this hotel

It was our second time at this hotel. We stayed one night. Loved the decor and the social hour (they had rose for Valentine‚Äôs weekend and hot cider), the lobby has cozy places to sit and chat with friends. We arrived in the morning, but they had a room available and checked us in right away, which was really nice. The room was comfortable. We would definitely stay there again.

I stay here frequently for business. Arrived at the hotel quite late at night. Was greeted warmly at check in by Leah. Recognizing I was dead on my feet, she managed to locate late night caffeine for me and I was in my room within minutes.   Grabbed my complimentary coffee while checking out the next morning and was on my way to meetings. Lovely property, friendly staff. Easy stay. They also have a great restaurant.

Terrible service from the front desk when there is a problem. Stayed here multiple times for work and now they are using my email and phone number for other guests. First they blamed it on the system and said any McCarthy that stays there will get assigned my personal info. Next, night manager said the guest had to have provided my personal information even though they couldn‚Äôt possibly know it unless they stole my identity and then the manager assured me the guest did not provide the information when I asked if I should call the police. Was told twice (a month apart) that my personal info was deleted from this strangers‚Äò reservation. Now being told to call back for a third time and talk to a manager. Worried that personal data is not safe when staying here. The rooms are small

After a long day and struggle to get downtown Leah and Nick made my day when I checked in !! Wonderful smiles and warm welcome. The complimentary champagne was a bonus !!  Room is decent size for Chicago and everything was clean.

Staying at Kimpton Hotel Allegro has been such a wonderful experience! The customer service here is exceptional and the employees are especially nice to talk to. Shout out to Paige for making our stay worthwhile!

Had a blast at this hotel, lobby is beautiful and staff has been extra friendly to us. Would definitely come again, especially for the happy hour from 5-6. Thank you to Leah for treating us extra well during our stay.

Was here on business, their Prosecco hour makes this the best hotel ever! Leah was the best out of everyone, and nick as well, we were here with a group and they treated us better than any other hotel! Thanks!

All around great stay. Be sure to see the concierge, David. He is dedicated to service and thoughtful care during your stay. All staff is kind, friendly and the hotel has a great vibe. Close to so many sites!

This hotel is incredible!  It has a historic feel but is super clean and gorgeous.  We had our wedding here and can't recommend Paige enough to help book and plan your event.  The staff is amazing and highly recommend this hotel.  Great location and food too!

I was bummed I was going to be in Chicago for work on my birthday and not have anything special to do. Lucy at the bar made me feel so at home and sang me ‚Äúhappy birthday.‚Äù The next day when I got back from work, there was a piece of cake with a note that a ‚Äúlittle bird‚Äù told them it was my birthday. Shoutout to Lucy, David,Leah, Paige and everyone at Hotel Allegro for making my stay so incredible. This is not a birthday I will be forgetting.

The room was great and the service was excellent.   The bar was fun with awesome happy your deals and interesting cocktails.  Bathroom in the room was very large and comfortable.  Location downtown is superb and easily walkable to many attractions.  Will stay again.

The night manager Artuto made my visit so wonderful. He took extra time to make sure I had a great room and then sent me additional amenities! I will be returning tp the Kimpton everytime I am in Chicago. The coffee bar every morning was great. Cant wait to come back and experience the cocktail hour.

My wife and I stayed at Hotel Allegro for a few nights and were very pleased with our experience there. Very clean and comfortable room, friendly staff, nice fitness center and within walking distance to most of everything touristy. The free coffee and hot chocolate bar in the lobby was a nice touch too. Only negative was the thin walls, but that's really only a minor detail that did not bother us much.

We decided to go to Chicago for our anniversary and didn't really want to spend a lot of money.  The hotel room was nice, clean, and the people were very friendly. Parking was expensive and we did have some issues with parking but got everything figured out (hard to find the car on Sunday because the parking garage wasn't actually open on Sundays so we had to go to a  different entrance).

The Allegro proved a pleasant surprise during my last visit to Chicago. I brought my team of 5 up for business meetings and we experienced a beautiful boutique hotel with a tremendous staff. They were quick to serve us and took time to answer any questions we might have regarding all Chicago has to offer. One employee, Rubie, stood out as she went out of her way to ensure my staff and I were satisfied. Her food suggestions turned out to be just what we wanted during our stay. Thanks Allegro and Thanks Rubie!

This was a trip for a group of 8 people. Busy time of year and the hotel staff was spot on perfect. The set up was easy and well organized. We all had a good time and I will be going back to this location in the future.

I surprised my wife with a night in  Chicago and a theater show. We were very amazed how beautifully decorated the room was. The entire hotel was amazing! Some have stated the rooms are small, we found it comfortable and just fine. Front desk service was absolutely phenomenal.  East check in and helpful explaining things. Very convenient to the Cadillac Palace Theater and short  walk to State St. and Michigan Ave.

We have stayed here multiple times and have always had a great stay. The staff is great and usually very accommodating.  The hotel is very modern and has a great vibe.  The best part is that they do a Prosecco happy hour every day for hotel guest.  You just have to show them your room key.  They also have kids games and kids goody bags at the front desk.  The only downside is there is no pool and rooms are tight.  Other than that it is a great hotel!

Beautiful Hotel-Front Desk personnel were fantastic and professional! I needed an upgraded room because my mom and niece came for a surprise visit!!!  Morning coffee and evening cocktails were spot on! We absolutely loved the decor!

I stayed at the Kimpton Hotel Allegro this past weekend for my friend's 30th birthday! The staff was incredible! Upon checking in, Leah and David were SO helpful and informative. Their pleasantness made me forget all about our delayed flights and traveling discomfort. Our room was clean and beautiful as was the hotel lobby. Definitely a lot of beautiful backdrops for great pictures! Leah, David, and Paige were so helpful, bringing us whatever we needed during our stay and checking in on us to make sure we were having a great time. They also provided us with recommendations for dinner and fun things to do in the city! The hotel has a free prosecco happy hour every night, which allows you to mingle with other guests as well as the staff. I enjoyed staying at the Kimpton Allegro,

We hosted about 25 rooms for our NYE wedding this past week and working with the whole Allegro team was SO easy. Zero complaints.  Leading up to the event they were always accommodating, helpful, and responsive. We needed a few things while we were staying there at the last minute and everyone was so easy to work with and helped make our experience great. The amenities are amazing, the area is great, and that lobby cannot be beat.  It's always clean, comfortable, and affordable.  My absolute favorite.  Who doesn't love a free prosecco happy hour!?

Every time I am at Hotel Allegro, David and Paige are the warmest people that always greet me first. Whenever I am visiting or passing through to do work in the beautiful lobby, I have another good experience. Highly recommend for anyone staying in the Downtown Loop area.

In the Loop, close to Clarke and Lake El, this hotel is central. Theatres nearby, a short walk to the art Institute and north towards the Magnificent Mile. I chose it for the convenience of the Ogilvie Transport Centre and the blue line for getting ot the airport at the end of the stay and of course being in the centre of Chicago.  It has a good spacious lobby, where free hot drinks are served in the morning and Prosecco or mulled cider fo an hour early evening, sufficient (and beautiful art deco lifts) and reasonably sized rooms.  There were some inconveniences: the room with two people, suitcases and warm weather clothing quickly became a little cramped. Very little hanging space and not enough room for suitcases meant we had to work round each other.  There were not coffee

We were staying at the Allegro for a night in the city to celebrate my friends birthday. We were greeted at the front desk by Deja Tate. She was incredibly helpful and gave us suggestions of places to go in the city as we are not from the area. We ended up going to one of her suggestions and had such a fun night. She also gave us a late check out because we got back to the hotel late. She made our experience amazing and we definitely will be back!

Stayed for a night to catch a show at the theater next door. Cozy and fun rooms had a great 1920s vibe going on with ultra comfy beds and the old wooden window frames on the other side of the modern glass. Had great staff, fast checkin/out, can‚Äôt wait to go back!

I‚Äôve stayed at Kimpton Hotel Allegro couple of times during my business trip to Chicago, I strongly recommend. The hotel  kept the old architectural style, very clean and located close to theaters and restaurants, with a Starbucks next to the hotel. They don‚Äôt provide free internet

Phantom was in town and it couldn't have been more convenient being right next door. Beds and pillows were uber comfy. No negatives at all here. Highly recommended and cannot wait for another visit. Also this was our first stay here.

Such a beautiful hotel inside and out. Finely decorated yet welcoming. Staff was great, bed was Amazingly comfortable! Location perfect with nearby public parking less expensive than hotel parking. Price unbelievable for Chicago. Will definitely stay here again!!

First time we stayed here. I liked the location and atmosphere.  People were excellent to work with. Very close to the Cadillac Palace theater, 312 restaurant and Kindle Mart. Many pluses to stay here. Did find bathroom to be smaller than would like and the bathroom vent did not clear humidity very well

Our stay at this hotel was wonderful.  Just next to the Theater District, this hotel is well situated for guests who attend operas or like to take in a good show.  The lobby is grand, both in size and in styling. Our check in experience was very good. The line to check in was small, and the front desk staff did a great job making each guest feel valued while working efficiently to serve everybody. (Darius was the representative with whom we both checked in and out). I was especially impressed with Leah and Page, both of whom are truly model employees. I couldn't help but notice during the morning coffee just how kind and engaging these two ladies were in particular. Kudos to each of these three representatives; they are true assets to the hotel! The room we were assigned was a

The hotel and staff were great I loved the text msg they do it‚Äôs very convenient the room could probably be a little more sound proof but glad it‚Äôs a dog friendly hotel!! Didn‚Äôt like the fact I booked with a reservationists and the hotel didn‚Äôt see the same thing I booked so I got doubled charged for valet hotel is located in a great place to walk everywhere

I was going to Chicago to see Phantom of the Opera at the Cadillac Palace Theater, and wanted a hotel close by. The Kimpton Hotel Allegro is right next door. It's a beautiful hotel, clean, the woman I spoke to at the desk when I checked in was friendly and even checked in on us after we had got to our room to make sure we were happy and had everything we needed. The price for our room was more than generous for such a nice hotel and a perfect location. I would happily stay there again.

Hotel was very nicely decorated for the holidays and we showed up just in time for their Saturday happy hour which was nice . Lots of people gathered and felt very festive . Our room had no view but were told we would have one so it was disappointing.  The room was small and so was the bathroom . They do send you a text to see how everything is going and I shared my concern but nobody responded . Other than this the hotel is close to a lot of main attractions Chicago has to offer . I love kimpton properties but this one was just ok .

I booked this hotel for my birthday getaway with my sister and I'm very pleased with my choice. We came early to the hotel to see if we could check in early, they said our room wasn't available yet, but they checked our bags so we didn't have to carry them around while we walked. Pleasantly surprised by that. We got a room on the 19 floor, good view, nice people at check in. My favorite part of my stay was the bartenders at the hotel bar. They knew how to make every drink that was being ordered, big plus they were super friendly and gave me a free drink because it was my birthday!!  I will definitely be staying at this hotel the next time I'm in Chicago. Good price for the room, lots of accommodations and great location. Walking distance to everything downtown.

The hotel is chic and fun. The food is good. The meeting rooms are flexible. Some are on different levels and not the easiest flow. Sleeping rooms could use a coffee maker. But the staff is remarkable.

Had a good stay here. Within 2-3 blocks of the Goodman, next door to the Palace and close to many good restaurants. Macy‚Äôs just down the street. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. It‚Äôs a beautiful hotel- historic and full of style. The room had all the amenities that we needed. It was a little small but very comfortable and a great price! We will definitely keep this hotel in mind especially when we come for a theater performance !

Stayed one night for our annual trip to see A Christmas Carol at the Goodman. Within walking distance to all the theaters. Hotel is very clean and a beautiful lobby area. Enjoyed the happy hour with hot bourbon spiced cider! Room was small but bed was super comfy and bathroom had all updated fixtures. Shower pressure was awesome! Will definitely be recommending this hotel to family and friends. Thanks again Kimpton for another fantastic stay!

We are pretty faithful to the Hotel Monaco .  This time, however, I thought "Why not try the Allegro?"  The Allegro is always a bit cheaper than the other two Kimptons, so we decided to try it.   The short story is that I thought it was great. I still like the Monaco better, but I think the Allegro is a great option.  I actually prefer the location, it's much closer to the Fulton Market restaurants and a quick trip on public transport to the United Center.  The rooms are quite a bit smaller and the noise from the hallway is pretty poor.  I know, they will say "it's an old building".  But honestly, I don't know if the problem is the doors or the walls, or both.  When in the hallways, you can hear convos in the room.  When in the room you can hear convos in the hallways.  It's

Amazing meal served at wedding and guests still rave about it.  Paige is wonderful to work with.  Valet guys--the best!  We experienced a rainy day wedding and Marvin D--went above and beyond helping us!  Thank you.

This hotel is a very nice clean place to rest your tired body. But the staff is what makes the stay memorable. The front desk people: Paige, Leah and Deva were very helpful and very friendly. I also want to mention the two concierges (sorry guys I didn‚Äôt get your names) were very knowledgeable and helpful. These are the people that make your stay memorable and to have the desire to want to return to this hotel.

I stayed in the hotel for a wonderful weekend in Chicago. It was an absolutely beautiful hotel, nice staff and comfortable bed. The rooms are a bit small and there is no room service or pool but other than that a nearly perfect experience.

Our room was beautiful and the staff was extremely helpful! Very clean and well stocked room with all we needed and more. We used the valet services and would do so again! The view and location was perfect for all the activities we had planned! Within walking distance of many of the theaters as well as shopping and ChriskindlMarket!

I loved almost everything about this hotel.   Its modern interpretation of the Art Deco motif is masterfully realized. My room featured beautiful art, the bedding was extremely comfortable, and the bathroom, although a tad on the small side, featured high quality Atelier Bloem products and soft, plush towels.   The front desk staff, including Leah, went out of their way to ensure that I was comfortable. And I greatly appreciated the coffee in the lobby each morning. What‚Äôs more, I never had to wait long for an elevator.   There‚Äôs a wonderful electric, festive, big-city vibe about this place.    I arrived at the hotel a bit before check-in time, and was told that my room was available, but there‚Äôd be a $30 early check-in fee if I didn‚Äôt want to wait. I was exhausted from my

I know this review is pretty late but I wanted to let you guys know I had a great time at this hotel beautiful room. I love the social hour and most important Leah at the front desk, she has a contagious personality. Definitely will be booking again.

I was here for business but it was a short sweet and simple. Leah at front desk checked me in with smiles and giggles had me blushing the whole time we were talking. I love the vibes n the entry keep it up!

My sister and I came in to town for a quick girls trip and had a fabulous stay at the Allegro!  We were able to get an early check-in, Todd was very helpful!  Our room was super trendy and clean!  We enjoyed their complimentary champagne social before we headed out for dinner and a concert.  We enjoyed a great conversation with Daja and Bryant who shared great information about the hotel's history!  Definitely will book again for another trip to Chicago!

During my stay at the Allegro, I have asked the front desk 3 times, to remove a dead bird outside my window.  The bird is still there. This is just not acceptable.  The dead bird is on the fire escape and should be easy to get to so I am not sure this situation has not been addressed.

We needed an overnight stay with an affordable price. I use Travelzoo to find clearance travel stuff. Travelzoo had this hotel for $99. Parking with that price was $45. A steal in Chicago! Also the location of this hotel cannot be beat. It is a really good location. We walked to everything that we wanted to do.  First if you arrive with a car, there is no driveway at all for this hotel. I managed to find curb space in front of the hotel. But I have a small car so this can be challenging. The valet took our car away and that was no problem. Check in was easy and the agent was professional.   Our room was nice. Kimptons have unusual room decor. The room was very clean.  But the bathroom was too small. The vanity is only 16 inches wide. Very difficult to use the sink with the

We stayed here on our first trip to Chicago. It is in a very good location and made it easy to get wherever we wanted to go. The staff was very helpful and attentive. They had all the amenities we needed and an awesome evening Prosecco and cider hour each evening. We would definitely recommend the allegro to others!

Stayed at this hotel in early November to visit my brother . The hotel itself is lovely but the staff where very rude. Not very helpful. If you want to stay at a hotel that looks great but treats you badly this is the place for you.

This is a very old hotel with a number of art deco touches and that may appeal to some, but, for me, it wasn't enough to offset the many things that were lacking in a typical business hotel.  I stayed here with colleagues, one of whom was enthusiastic about staying here and recommended it.  As a result, I didn't bother doing any research about the place before booking my room.  I know that management will probably respond with "well, it's a very old hotel," but it's advertised as "vintage meets modern" so I don't think that will serve.  I'll start with the negatives and then cover the positives.  First off, my room not only didn't have a closet, it didn't have a wardrobe or even a coat hook! Had to throw my winter jacket over the desk chair and keep my shirts folded in the

This is a little belated, but after a visit to the Kimpton Allegro the end of October for the Society for Neuroscience meeting, I would NOT recommend this hotel. My co-worker, SC, had her wallet stolen out of her purse, in the lobby, during the complimentary proseco happy hour. The manager, Todd, was incredibly rude, demeaning and dismissive about the incident. He really couldn't have cared less that SC was stuck, 600 miles away from home, without any money or identification. SC had a very clear timeline because of Uber receipts and credit card activity, making it only possible that the wallet was stolen in the lobby, in clear view of at least 3 security cameras. At first she was told the table where we were sitting was out of view of the cameras. Then she was told they could

Fabulous staff, lovely rooms with the best beds in town, perfect location. . . . What's not to love? Oh, and reasonable prices. I don't stay anywhere else in Chicago. Very easy access to public transportation. If you don't have a coffee pot in your room, ask and they'll bring you one. Thanks, David!

As a former SPG platinum, I have yet to experience service that has wowed me like SPG used to do - but I have now found my place.  The Kimpton is a beautiful space with friendly staff.  Leah was a delight at the front desk and the room was modern and clean. I love the yoga mats in the room and sipping the complimentary bubbles in the cozy lobby at the happy hour.  Definitely recommend this spot.

One of my favorite hotels in the Chicago area, the design is gorgeous and the rooms are quiet and comfortable. The fitness center has a wide variety of options including a Peloton bike which was fun to try. Also any hotel with a Prosecco hour every night is a winner in my book. Highly recommend this hotel to those coming to Chicago for work or pleasure.

Decent hotel but how you don‚Äôt have bottled water for purchase in your lobby is extremely annoying and inconvenient. This is my 2nd visit (only hotel in Chicago my company allows us to stay at) and I come back to the hotel late at night every evening and nothing is open in the vicinity. I can either: bring a glass or two of water up to my room from the lobby which is difficult with bags, squeeze my way into the bar and purchase one for $4 or purchase one in room for $6 for which our company audits us. Please offer water bottled water in your lobby to grab and go.

This hotel was gorgeous. Yes the valet is a little overpriced, but the staff was on point and so friendly. We absolute loved the fact that they allowed our furry companions without a fee! They even had a doggy bag waiting!  As for the room, there are a few extras that I wish were available such as an empty fridge, a microwave and some better pillows. The bed wasn‚Äôt the most comfortable compared to other hotels.  Overall it was great, just a few things that we could have used.

He had a great stay at Hotel Alegro. The entire staff was fabulous and attentive. Fun Prosecco reception at 5 pm in upbeat bar/lounge area. Great location in the loop and close to lots of attractions and great restaurants. Rooms were classy with all the amenities. We love all Kimpton properties.

Can‚Äôt recommend highly enough. Great room, wonderful amenities. Fitness room well-equipped and clean. Restaurant was terrific. Fantastic location. Particularly appreciate Leah who checked me in and paid a lot of attention toward making sure my stay was incredible. Friendly staff, gorgeous property and d√©cor.

I stay at Kimpton properties a lot when I travel for work and my experience with the Allegro was very much in line with other Kimptons - service is great, location is usually good, and, under the guise of ‚Äúboutique,‚Äù there are usually strange things about the rooms that can just make them difficult or uncomfortable. At the Allegro, it was the lighting. The room was very small, which is not unusual for city hotels, and my first room looked straight out to a brick wall only a few feet away. The walls were covered in dark blue wall paper and the only lights were a glare-y ceiling fixture and two very dim wall sconces on either side of the bed. I asked for another room, and was put in almost the same room but on a higher floor so I at least had some daylight in the morning. The

The stay was short sweet and great. The room was great had a delightful smell as well. The check in was smooth and quick, Leah greeted us with a friendly smile and a warm welcome very friendly. The concierge Josh was great gave great directions.

Great location, beautiful property. Two things for a business traveler... After a long narrowing travel day, coming to a place where businesses surrounding are mostly closed + the restaurant not having room service is a minus. Second, the room had a dirty bath towel that either had make-up stains that was kind of gross to deal with it and made me question the hygienic conditions!

From the moment I walked in the door I was greeted with smiles - Rubie at the desk made me Feel comfortable and eddies I was truly impressed, I checked in around 515 doing wine hour, there was a bellman standing and he was extremely friendly I forget his name but he surprised me with a bottle of champagne to my room because I had such a crazy day trying to get their awesome awesome service.‚Ä¶ I got a follow up call later on from Deja, just checking on me and making sure that all was OK, she seemed genuine and sincere.  the hotel Decour was very relaxing. 515 during wine hour, there was a bellman standing and he was extremely friendly I forget his name but he surprised me with a bottle of champagne to my room because I had such a crazy day trying to get there awesome awesome

GSA Kay was very helpful in helping us get a room. Bellman Ishmael was very helpful and pleasant. The room was a nice size and that there was a refrigerator in the room. We were happy with the room and would love to visit again.

It's a bit dizzying how many hands through which the Ambassador has passed since it's PUBLIC CHICAGO rebranding nearly ten years ago.  The turnover rate of the hotel employees was high and the service was varied, though always well intended.    Hopefully, with the Hyatt brand inheriting the property, there will be consistency and believe me when I say that this is the consistency the property has always deserved.  The property itself is gorgeous with a stunning chandelier in the lobby and modern decor.  My favorite room layout is the one bedroom, which feels more like an apartment than the loft. The decor is the only thing that's been changed and it feels like a downgrade from a sexy hotel to a suburban mom decorated hotel.  Ambassador used to be a great place to have a date,

Good for what we needed which was a night out in the Old town bar area. Easy walk to and from lots of great bars. The building and room were a bit older but still clean enough. Might not do an extended stay but it was a clean room in a great location

We were heading to a concert at the Aragon ballroom and decided to try this hotel out. Fantastic, great service, clean rooms and very modern. Low beds but overall very comfortable. Located greatly near 3 arts cafe. Nice bar downstairs and breakfast was semi self service. All in all a great experience.

I received excellent service from Kay she was very professional when I needed assistants and very nice and caring.she has an outstanding personalty and very fun to talk to I most definitely will be visiting again

The hotel was beautiful with very great staff to go with it. The only problem i had at this lovely place was with paying for a room i did not intend on staying in. I was charged more money not aware of the price told to me after already i booked.

Checked in to this hotel last week from out of town and the clerk Kenya have a awesome attitude and very helpful. Any questions I asked she was able to answer instead of telling me she don't know. Thanks again

Stayed in this hotel for NBA ALL STAR WEEKEND. Overall my stay was great. The hotel has warm cozy feeling vibe the minute you step in. I had a superior queen room which I found a little too small for my liking. The location is great! 3 mins walk from the Clark/Division subway station. Walking distance from the Michigan Ave (Magnificient Mile)   The only cons during my stay was the noisy hotel guests! There was one couple who fought during the night of Valentines Day and the following Saturday night. I had to go shut them out on both nights. Also on Sunday night, another guest was playing loud music. Lets say that I didnt get much sleep during my stay! Also the heating fan was very loud! It would stop and go back on randomly :/   PROS: Friendly staff and very comfortable bed!

This is probably the best hotel in North America, not just because of the location and the facility, it's also because of the culture the staff itself offers and promotes, the hotel front desk has super stars like Ms Kay, who go an extra mile in making up your day even though they don't have to do it. The night supervisor Mr. Kenny is kind and understanding and the bar tender Mr. Timmon is a Rockstar mix master, the lobby and the elevator have lively classic blues playing and its truly a miracle how the staff keeps the place sparkling clean and warm and never gives you a feeling of being away from home. This hotel has everything right, the bedding, the food, the bar and the music but most of all, the people. Ehind all this are the embodiment of perfection, kindness, compassion,

This was our first trip to Chicago! We stayed at the Ambassador and enjoyed our stay! Beautiful hotel with a very cozy feel. Great breakfast in the hotel and excellent service. There is also a cozy bar. Close to shopping and restaurants ,the Valet service is also excellent there!  Any request is handled with a smile. I highly recommend The Ambassador!

While checking in, my husband and I witness and interaction between a front desk clerk and a disgruntled guest. He was being a complete jerk, slamming things down on the desk and calling the clerk out of her name. I think her name is Kay stayed calm and very respectful, offering to help the guest solve his issue. Not once did she raise her voice or sound angry( I was angry for her). She remained professional and friendly. My husband said he was going to offer her a job. We work in the public sector and we have never seen anyone handle that situation with such finesse.

I would like to send this review out to the Front Desk staff especially Miss Kenya. Everyone was friendly and professional but her attentiveness to any detail was outstanding. Not only to myself but to my work colleagues. And I wanted to bring her work ethic to your attention.   I definitely will return and recommend staying there to my other colleagues.

I picked this hotel as a weekend getaway for my girlfriend and I, and it was wonderful!  The front desk lady Kay (nice on the eyes by the way) was very professional. The service was top notch, from check in to check out, I cannot express what this weekend meant to us. We felt like royalty! The hotel was beautiful, the room was gorgeous and clean and the service was excellent.  We were just amazed at how wonderful Kay was, and the rest of the staff, but Kay stood out the braids-maid that's looking better than the bride!  Statuesque.  I have absolutely fallen in love with this hotel and yes, yes, yes, yes, we will be back!

Kay and the rest of the staff were friendly and extremely helpful from the moment we checked in through departure. The location is great, walking distance to the best the city has to offer. Will definitely return on a future visit!

Every aspect of this hotel was wonderful during our stay. We chose this hotel for our wedding so we could have a central location for our rehearsal dinner and wedding in the city. From the very beginning Maya Dykema was very warm and accommodating. She made sure everything we needed was provided and the hotel employees were kind and prompt with their service. She was absolutely terrific to work with. Our family stayed here as well and they were impressed with how much the hotel went out of their way to make us feel at home. The service was perfect. That coupled with how beautiful this hotel is makes this place the perfect hotel in the city, regardless of what you're looking for.

I live in the neighborhood and had to stay overnight at a hotel and picked the Ambassador Chicago, since I walk past it almost every day.  It's such a beautiful boutique hotel in the Gold Coast of Chicago with so much history, that I thought it would be great to stay there.  The entire staff, especially Vidal Moran, the Director in the front office, were so wonderful.  They even had a special welcome bag for my little doggy Juliette including treats and a foldable bowl.  So adorable! The guest room I stayed in with a King bed (that was so comfortable) was huge!  If you haven't seen the hotel take a walk through it.  It's fabulous! I loved it and I highly recommend this to anyone traveling or just wants to stop in for a drink or dinner!

I was there for my anniversary with my husband and miss Kay ü§ë she was very patient and hospitable she even showed us how to catch the bus and the train how to download Uber  app on her phone but while waiting in line she had a very very nasty guest in front of her and what got me the most was she continue to smile and be professional and polite to the guest even though they were jerks Miss Kay is the greatest of all time.   Mr&Mrs Happy Guest

My daughter and I stayed at this hotel (which we‚Äôve stayed at before and love!) in December. She‚Äôs a college student in Chicago so we left a bag with the hotel and spent her break in Colorado with the rest of our family. When she came back on her own to pick up the bag (the rest of us live overseas so we were gone by then), she forgot her bag ticket. But Wayne and Kay were incredibly helpful and gracious, and remembered my daughter! They stored her bag for the entire time and made sure nothing happened to it even though she was a few days late on picking it up.  Great hotel with great staff.

This hotel is amazing to spend time in Chicago. The one bedroom suite is very spacious and beautiful like photos. Especially Kay and Wayne were so helpful and made my day :) Me and my family truly had amazing time here and will definitely come back :)

A few weeks ago, my (now) fiance and I returned to stay at the hotel where we first met--and he proposed! I was immediately struck by the kindness and high level of customer service provided by everyone, from the hilarious bellhop and attentive bartender, to the welcoming front desk staff and managers. The hotel is so elegant and unique--it's completely modern yet has so many restored vintage touches. Even the toiletries are luxurious! We loved our room--the views were stunning and the bed and couches were super comfortable. The bar is also fantastic, and there are a few really cool lounge areas near the lobby where you can hang out.   The staff went WAY BEYOND "above and beyond" to put together a romantic and wonderful night's stay for us. Their employees bent over backwards to

Found hotel through TripAdvisor. Great location . Walking distance to many restaurants and Lake Michigan .  Room was very nice . Receptionist Natalie was extremely  pleasant and helpful . Good experience. Will stay again

Kay was fantastic! Kay is an employee at Gold Coast (Chicago) Ambassador and she made the experience at her property an outstanding one. I recommend this brand of hotel and this particular property for those traveling to Chicago (downtown) whether locally or internationally. The property is very clean, the staff is very professional (Kay), and the bar area, including fireplace, really sets the tone and ambiance for a cozy and memorable stay. Kay made it a great stay! I hope she continues to receive opportunities to grow within the Ambassador brand, and even if she decides to change companies... I know she will be an outstanding asset and leader. Thank you, Ambassador Chicago. Thank you, Kay!

My husband and I came to this hotel on a weekend trip for a wedding.  Check in was easy and the concierge had a lot of information/fun facts about Chicago which made out short stay fun. He recommended pizza which was spot on! (Thank you for that)  The room was clean and cozy. My husband and i particularly liked the toiletry. I know that‚Äôs something many people don‚Äôt really comment on that but the quality of it was worth mentioning.

I surprised my wife with an impromptu Chicago getaway for our 15th wedding anniversary. Our stay at the Ambassador Chicago was beyond my expectations. The class, the service, the amenities were on point. A special thanks to Kay at the front desk. Her knowledge and expertise provided that extra plus that made this getaway unforgettable.

My family and I recently stayed at The Ambassador Chicago on a Thanksgiving family holiday trip....... from the front door welcoming staff to the attentive and prompt housekeeping personnel ... we were treated so graciously... lovely staff all the way around I would highly recommend this hotel and have stayed here many times and received consistent superb customer service... and our family dog also loved the stay!üòòüòçüòòüòòüòçüòò

The Ambassador Hotel is a tucked-away gem. It is perfect. The staff is profecient, cordial, professional and kind. The rooms are lovely and comfortable. The pillows are incredible (hint to management: buy more than you need and offer to sell them to guests). It is now my go-to hotel in Chicago.

Myself and my husband essentially lived in The Ambassador in the lead up to our destination Chicago wedding -- therefore I believe our lengthy stay warrants a very much deserved review. The aesthetic of the hotel is breathtaking, the ambience in each public space feels fitting, the guest rooms are modern, comfortable, clean and calming. Ishmael, Kay, Natalie, among all others on staff, are spectacular -- they went above and beyond helping us and most of our wedding guests with endless luggage, questions, issues. The hotel manager kindly sent us a bottle of bubbly and strawberries upon our arrival, and when our guests began to arrive, Ishamel and the others had more bubbly and goodies sent to our room. We have and will happily return.

The ambassador hotel is a beautiful and elegant hotel in Chicago. We were wowed by the service. Ms. Kay checked us in, it was seamless and professional. We let her know we just got married and she was so excited for us. In her power she was able to send us a charcuterie plate with a congratulations card, wishing us a beautiful marriage. Overall would recommend 10/10 thank you Kay, Ishmael the doorman and Jose the Secuirty man, for your help throughout our stay!

Just stayed a couple of weeks ago on October 4th-9th and I loved it. Kay at check in was awesome, she was very helpful and friendly. Mrs. Teresa Quito who cleaned my room every day was more than outstanding, she is been working there for 14 years and she talk about her job like if it was her first day. Another employee who is proud to work there is Kenny at front desk, I Chek out and he assisted me at 4 am and told me the History of the hotel. Next time I visit Chicago I will definetily stay at this great Hotel. Thanks for made me feel at home!!!  Me gusta  Compartir

My husband and I decided to visit for a  weekend getaway and chose the Ambassador. It was a great decision. We loved the location, convenient to restaurants and shopping in the Gold Coast. It's also right near the North end of Michigan Avenue's Magnificent Mile.   The staff were exceptionally warm, welcoming and knowledgeable. Everyone we met from the Bell Staff and Front Desk, to the bar and Housekeeping, they were all kind and hospitable.  The room was nice and the hotel has the charm of years past combined with modern amenities. We especially enjoyed the Keurig in the room and the bathroom toiletries.   We had drinks at the bar and grab and go breakfast in the Library, both were great. The drinks were delicious and the grab and go breakfast was ideal for a quick, tasty bite.

I LOVE the Ambassador. It's my home away from home. The beds are extremely comfortable and the rooms are super clean. I love the ambiance of the hotel, they have an amazing entrance lobby, library room and bar on the first floor.   The staff is exceptional- Kay always makes me feel welcome with her big smile and warm personality. Everyone is very attentive with their service. I cannot say enough good things about the staff.   I stay in Chicago often and would only stay here. I highly recommend this as your go to for a business or vacation travel.

My experience is a unique one. Not everyone‚Äôs Dad worked at the Ambassador in the 60‚Äôs. I grew up hearing the Sinatra, Kennedys, Garland, and even Lassie stories of staying at the Ambassador. I felt like I knew every inch of the property, but yet as an adult, had never stayed there. Decades (I mean, decades) later, I stayed there for the first time. I couldn‚Äôt help my emotions and told Kay at the front desk my story. She seemed as excited as I was, and I felt so welcomed by her reaction, almost as if I was coming home. My husband and I settled into our room when room service knocked on the door. I told my husband that they probably made a mistake so I would let them know. The young man said that ‚ÄúThis was for Ingrid‚Äù, and I said that there must be a mistake and he insisted that

Hotel interior is gorgeous! You guys did an amazing job with the renovations- Restaurant happy hour is perfect! And Kay at the front desk welcomes me with a smile and makes me laugh after a long day of traveling every time! She is fantastic.

I've been to Chicago over a dozen times and rarely decide to stay in a luxury hotel, but two weeks ago I decided to try something new. I am glad I did! The room was spectacular and so comfortable yet luxurious, and I really felt like I made the right decision. Aside from the amenities, I also really appreciated the kind staff. While everyone was wonderful, I particularly enjoyed a bellman who helped me out named Ismaeel! This young man so warm, friendly and funny I instantly felt like I already knew him. On top of that, he did an excellent job with my bags. Just a great example of the quality staff at The Ambassador!

The Ambassador is a lovely, charming hotel with hints of glamour the moment you walk into the front doors. It's located on the Gold Coast and is tucked away on a residential street in a neighborhood that's excellent for walking.   The hotel lobby, library, and bar are lovely. There was a fire in the library when we arrived, which was quite welcoming. Our rooms (we had a celebrity suite + attached room, as well as another room down the hall) were clean, airy, bright, and well-appointed. We loved the toiletries. The beds were super comfortable, the rooms spacious. The views were terrific - all city!   The Ambassador is in a great location for a lot of walking - you can easily walk to a variety of shops, bars, restaurants, and the Magnificent Mile.   Finally, the staff was

This was my first stay and from the moment my cab arrived the staff were delightful. Every single individual I interacted with was friendly, courteous and paused to interact with me. It has been a long time since I‚Äôve experienced such warm service.  The room was clean and functional. Secure elevator service. Bath tub. Efficient room service that exceeded my expectations.  I will stay again for sure.

Kay checked us in quickly and was friendly and very helpful.  Kay was very upbeat and helpful.   The location can not be best. The Gold Coast has it all. Shopping and food. Quick walk or Uber to Michigan Avenue.

Let‚Äôs start with the positive aspects: Location - Gold Coast far enough away from loud city street noise in a residential area Historic building with great architecture  Friendly housekeeping and bellman staff Clean room with comfortable bed & temperature control though small  Well stocked mini bar   Negative aspects: Paper thin walls so you can hear everything in the next room at all hours  Spotty front desk staff in terms of friendliness and competence- examples: Upon checking in we were told the driver room was not ready. We were asked to leave my cell phone so that the front desk a call when the room was ready. They never called. First morning, after calling at 6 AM when our next room neighbors were in ordinately loud, I was told that they could call to ask them to turn down

It was quiet and in a wonderful neighborhood, the Gold Coast but we could walk to downtown. Our room was lovely and spacious. Hotel staff was very helpful in all respects. It wasn't too expensive. All told, a great place to stay when in Chicago. Only drawback was the lack of a restaurant but we heard they are going to restore the restaurant in the future.

I stayed at the Ambassador last month for a long weekend while in Chicago for a wedding.  The hotel is on a quiet street in a nice neighborhood, and a short walk away from restaurants and entertainment. Our room was spacious, clean and made when we arrived. We were greeted our first evening by Kay at the front desk. She stuck out as a highlight of our trip- welcome us back every time we saw her, giving great local tips and cracking jokes. Thank you, Kay for making our weekend! We will be back!

I traveled to Chicago to attend a friend's bday party. This was the closest major hotel to the venue. Decent room with a king bed, large closet. The bed was interestingly lower to the ground. The fitness room in the lower lobby is small, only has 2 treadmills, one elliptical, two weight machines and dumbbells. The neighborhood is residential, so don't expect to walk out into city life with stores, restaurants, etc...

I usually don't write reviews,I travel a lot, meet a lot of people. After hotel after hotel, services and fake smiles are the same, util I stayed at Ambassador Chicago! The level of service that I received from Kay was beyond exceptional. Kay really made my stay pleasant, she has given me a new hope with staying at different hotels. I will now, expect anything less. This was the BEST experience I have ever had while traveling for work. Not only was Kay attentive to all of her guest needs, she made me feel as if I was her only guest in the 200 + room hotel. Ambassador Chicago is my new home, when traveling to Chicago. My room was nice, nice decor. However; it was the service I received from Ms. Kay, that made my stay worth the travel. I didn't even mind the colder weather in

This hotel, in the near North Side, is within easy walking distance of the miracle mile. They do have on-site parking available, but it‚Äôs expensive as it is everywhere in Chicago. We‚Äôve now stayed there three times and each time the experience was wonderful.  The staff has always been very friendly and courteous, housekeeping has been exceptional. The rooms are very well appointed and spotless from a housekeeping standpoint.  We have not eaten there but for their standard breakfast sandwich and coffee fare. What is unusual is the reasonable price of the breakfast sandwich. It was very good too. In downtown Chicago you almost expect to pay more than average.  In addition, they have a nice bar wHich  is quite popular. Again, this was a family visit so we didn‚Äôt partake.  For

I loved this hotel. Quiet area and rooms, the room itself is quaint. The selection of in room amenities is very impressive. Is also appreciate their commitment to eco friendly processes. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone.

The rooms are clean and have lots of space, the hotel has a charming fireplace, good options to buy breakfast inside the hotel and a very nice bar. The staff was extremely nice. Location is good for dining but a bit far from downtown.

My boyfriend and I were greeted by Ms.K front desk receptionist. She was extremely friendly and very  in tune to my mood and needs. After one delay after another while traveling to the hotel, I was exhausted. Finding out that our room was not ready only made matters worse. I expressed my frustration but Ms.K remained calm and sympathized with me and upgraded our room.which was magnificent. Just talking to that young lady put me ino  a better mood. I wish more people who deal with the public could posses her attitude and willingness to help others

Nothing per se wrong with the establishment, but I wouldn't say it truly excels in any area either. Room was clean, but quite boring and lifeless. Hangers in the bathroom weren't tightly screwed and they were dangling from the wall as if the lightest load will be too much for them. Shower head was funny and hard to operate. Breakfast was quite terrible (if you are staying there, go to the 3rd Coast which is just 100m away). Staff is indeed helpful. Nevertheless, an average hotel with an average experience.

My husband and I celebrated our 2 year anniversary and we decided to stay here overnight as a mini getaway. This was the best choice we could have made. Our first encounter was with the front desk staff member named Kay who presented us with stellar services from the moment we arrived. She was friendly, helpful and over accommodating. She made immediately feel welcomed. The hotel decor is beautiful, the staff was excellent, the food is delish and the rooms are next Level clean, even the housekeeping staff was excellent. We loved the view and we will definitely be returning for another stay in the future. As a lifelong Chicagoan, this is definitely a gem.

Easy and enjoyable walk to Michigan Avenue, excellent staff, delicious food.  Lots of lovely homes, restaurants, shopping in this district.  There is a view of Lake Michigan from street in front of the hotel entrance.

hotel was crowded (peak time July I suppose). the service was excellent, from the front counter staff being so helpful and friendly to the cleaning staff. Location is awesome- just 2 blocks from the beach.

A colleague booked rooms here thru a third-party (hotwire I think). Other than the usurious $67 valet-only parking fee (NYC is less expensive), everything about the hotel was a pleasant surprise. The lobby is intensely attractive, as is the library, which has a fireplace (real, I think) and overpriced-but-drinkable coffee in the a.m. The restaurant is undergoing a big makeover, so we only had the room service menu in the bar area, but I have to say, the food was top drawer. The rooms are an intriguing mix of modern--lighting, super-low beds, gorgeous bathroom--with old-schools touches. There were some oddities (the closet, sans door, was the size of a small apartment), but I find this character appealing. The wifi worked. I was too lazy for the gym, but there is one. All in all,

Wayne Wayne Wayne!! This man deserves a trophy for best customer service!! Our stay at the ambassador was amazing thanks to the great service and polite staff. Rooms were excellent and very clean. We will definitely be staying here on our future visits to the windy city.

Rooms were very clean! Like the overall atmosphere of the hotel. Rooms are pretty modern. Great location for a reasonable price. Thank you to Teresa Quito and the rest of the housekeeping team for a great job!

All main attractions are in walking distance or easy metro access. Rooms are nice and big, beds are comfortable, breakfast offer is sufficient. Staff is friendly and helpful. Pet friendly hotel next to the lake.

The Ambassador Hotel is located in a truly beautiful neighborhood (Gold Coast), yet it‚Äôs only minutes from the hustle-bustle of downtown. It‚Äôs also very easily walkable from the Ambassador to Lake Michigan (jogging trail along the lake, sunbathing, etc.). The hotel itself is very clean and the service is excellent. The first time we were there we got bumped up to the Penthouse. It was exquisite and the whole place holds a lot of history. This is our go-to place whenever we are in town.

Location is great, walking distance to the lake and to many other places rooms and bathrooms are very good But what really matters is the great staff they have, all of them really helpful, specially Kay, she was the best!! I need extra help and she was on top of it and did a wonderful job, she is one of a kind They should work on the breakfast, which is terrible, very simple things can improve it totally, again the staff helps to go through a bad breakfast will be back

Nice clean room . We would have liked coffee/tea making facilities in the room . The was very little information about Chicago which  we had to get elsewhere. Other than checking in and out we had no contact with any staff. We didn't use the bar or restaurants

Great location, super friendly helpful staff, clean room, toiletries provided were really nice.  Only disappointments parking is a challenge and no pool/spa.  Do recommend and definitely would stay again.

I am a bit late in writing this review but better late than never.  I stayed here on business from August 11th, 2019 to August 15th, 2019.  The hotel is simply fantastic.  The rooms are absolutely spacious and comfortable.  The location was perfect for my needs.  Safe area to go out and walk in.  Many eateries/restaurants near by that you can walk to.  Everyone at the front desk was friendly.  I may forget some names but Danella, Kenya, and Batista, were all wonderful.  But if I had to choose one favorite thing about this entire trip then I would have to say it was definitely Natalie at the front desk.  This girl is absolutely amazing and extremely aesthetically pleasing to my eyes.....yes, that is a compliment to you Natalie.  She is simply, the most beautiful girl I've ever

Ambassador East is a charming, soothingly comfortable hotel in beautiful, Gold Coast Chicago. The staff are stellar, and totally responsive, going Beyond the call of duty,to every need and request. My wonderful stay is truly, 'Home Away From Home'.

Stayed here for two nights which was great lovely hotel as far as the room was concerned, food another thing, quite rubbish and expensive and served in very dark lounge or restaurant. The hotel has bags of history as it was, we understand, frequently used in the 40s 50s and 60s by many of the entertainment stars who were travelling from New York to Los Angeles somebody took the trouble of obtaining photographs of theses artists which must have numbered in 100s all very interesting as we understood that the photographs were origionaly displayed in a bar but now, unfortunately, they are mostly displayed in a basement area by the toilets. It is a shame nobody ever thought of adding names to the photographs it was fine for the well know artists but for the lesser known ones they

I wanted to make last minute plans for my wife's birthday weekend.  Natalie at the front desk and Ishmael at the front door came to my rescue.  They went above and beyond to make our night a memorial one at the Ambassador Chicago.  Natalie came up with the great idea and Ishmael hustled to the store to get the necessities and returned in timely fashion.  Upon my departure, they personally made an effort to wish me well and to make sure if we were pleased with our stay.  The Ambassador Chicago is now on top of my list when looking for a weekend getaway.  I consider it to be my hotel and will definitely recommend it to all of my associates.

The Ambassador Chicago Hotel was probably sleek whenever it opened, but the hotel is extremely tired with a low standard of services.  1) Scratched furniture. 2) Stained furniture -- doesn't help that all the furniture is covered in white slip-over covers. 3) Almost electrical outlets where you would want them, though a small outlet docking station or whatever you call it was at the desk. But nothing by the bed or nightstand. 4) Japanese-style beds that are super low to the floor. 5) Walls that desperately need a fresh paint coat. In some places they have done patch jobs but not painted the full wall. 6) Bathroom tile flooring that needs new grouting. 7) Old door knobs and fixtures that are dilapidated. I'm sure someone thinks these are nice "historic" fixtures but they look

We stayed at the Ambassador while attending a wedding in Chicago.  The location is fantastic,  near all sorts of restaurants and among the most beautiful houses in the city.  We did not have a car, but all our travel was easily accomplished via shirt Lyft or Uber rides.  There is also much to see and do within walking distance.   The room was clean and quiet.  The bed was very comfortable.  We slept well.   This is an old and storied hotel that is well maintained and staffed by well trained professionals.   We felt that the Ambassador delivered good value for our money.

This establishment needs to seriously get it together. We booked two rooms. My group came at different check in times. First party checked in at 3:00 and they did not have the room ready until 4:00! Second party checked in at 4:00 and they did not have it ready until 4:30. Check in time is 3:00! For a boutique hotel that has been around for awhile, you need to step your game up significantly considering there are so many other hotels in Chicago. And to be quite frank, I've actually always gotten lucky and been able to check in and get a room BEFORE check in time at majority of hotels I travel to. Also the beds were listed as King beds which we selected and they appear to be queen beds instead. Very disappointed and do not recommend.

Had only one night in Second City for business. Found this gem which I remembered from my early days in Chicago, when there was an Ambassador East and West across the street from each other. Pleasantly surprised by the modern upgrades - comfortable room, nice lobby, friendly staff, reasonable price. The location can‚Äôt be beat. Away from the noise, but within a short walk to lakeshore, Michigan Ave, subway, and old town.   My only issue was no coffee in the room. Had to go to the lobby in the morning to buy it from the barista.

The legendary but tired Ambassador East got the Ian Schrager treatment in 2010 and was rebranded the Public.  It followed the classic Schrager formula of renovating old dowager hotels, creating dazzling public spaces and turning small outdated sleeping rooms into funky-but-chic, design-forward places to lay one's head after the party.  Even the epochal Pump Room, Frank Sinatra's go-to gin mill when he visited Chicago, got Schragerized.   Apparently the new concept was only modestly successful, because Schrager sold out in 2016.  New owners restored the Ambassador name, but maintained the Schrager boutique hotel vibe.  And they shuttered the Pump Room, rebranding it "Booth One" (in reference to ... the Pump Room?!), which has subsequently closed.  Are you still with me?  The

I was here visiting a family member and came to the desk to ask the Agent to call for them and Kay went out of her way to help me. As I waited for my Auntie, Kay (Kenya)bring me a cup of coffee and I believe she may have pay for it of if her own pocket. Just thought it was great to meet and have nice people still around we never tell the good story‚Äôs always the bad just want to let the company know that Kay (Kenya) is Awesome and she really care about the Guests

I stayed at the Ambassador Chicago for 6 nights in March 2019 and, overall, I was quite impressed with this hotel especially considering what I paid for my room The hotel is a good 4 star standard with very nice public areas and fairly recently refurbished bedrooms. The owners have tried to retain as much of the old style charm as they possibly could while still  providing the amenities of a modern hotel My room was very big and quite comfortable. As other reviewers have stated some of the furniture in the room is a bit "IKEAeske" , not that there is anything wrong with IKEA furniture I had 2 minor issues with the hotel; - The room is a bit like a shop so there is just so much stuff such as hats etc. left out in the bedroom for you to buy, the management could probably do with

Great hotel. Very nostalgic! Great service. Friendly staff!! It was my birthday and they delivered champagne and chocolate to my room! I would stay there again and also recommend to anyone going to Chicago.

My stay at the ambassador Chicago it is a historical hotel located in the best ever part of Chicago which is the Gold Coast the staff is  fabulous .... Thank you Maria. Maldonado Supervisor.   I made reservation for my next visit thank you üòä namaste

I have stayed at the Ambassador many times when it was The Public and always loved the cool chic modern vibe of this historic hotel. So I was curious to see if things have changed. I had a one night stay at the Ambassador in mid July and I was greeted by Maria at the front desk. She was extremely knowledgeable about the hotel and even told me a great story about a Taylor that used to stay there;) Needless to say Maria went above and beyond to exceed my expectations accommodating my requests and arranging a fantastic room with a great view. Overall I think the hotel is even better now that it is Ambassador again. I look forward to my next trip back to Chicago and plan to stay at the Ambassador again.

This hotel is in a gorgeous location. It's surrounded by beautiful and stately Chicago style "brownstones" and homes. It's location is extremely walkable to many major city attractions (Mag Mile, Hancock Building, etc) and the Redline train is just a 5 minute walk. The beach path and LSD are literally down the street. From the beach path it's a super easy walk or bike ride to Lincoln Park.   The hotel bar was very relaxing and full of history. I stuck to wine but their cocktails looked super yummy.  The only issue I had with this hotel was that my room didn't have a closet. I found it super odd because I never not had a closet in my hotel room before. I didn't have anything to hang, but my travel companion did. She had to drap her dress on an arm chair. They should at least have

Lovely boutique hotel in a magnificent neighborhood, the Gold Coast. Rooms were partially modernized, a bit on the small size, but comfortable with a very comfortable bed, which was a bit low. Large walk in closet and modernized bathroom. The service is pretty good, the ambience in the lobby and lounge was quite chic. Great location for walking in north Chicago, Lincoln park, and quick ride to other areas.

A beautiful hotel in a great area.  The hotel is a couple of blocks from the magnificent mile in the most beautiful neighborhood. It is wonderful that you can walk a couple of blocks and be out of the hectic area of the city. There are still so many restaurants within a block of the hotel. The hotel has such a great bar. We stayed in a one bedroom suite which was huge and very comfortable. There is no microwave but you can request one. There is a bar refrigerator which we emptied and used to store our own snacks. And this is the crazy part and downside of the room - there are two large walk in closets in the room which are lovely, right next to the tiniest bathroom. Why couldn‚Äôt, there be just one closet, you are only there on holiday and make the bathroom bigger. The space

The hotel is descent located in a nice neighborhood with plenty of food choices within walking distance. The rooms are kind of small but the bathroom is what kind led me to the review. Not only is it very small it has a toilet you would find at a truck stop. One you have to flush with your foot. Total turn off since I didn‚Äôt want to use my house shoe each time to flush. The staff was very nice the rooms could use a little updating not a bad stay the beds where on a platform that sat low to the floor didn‚Äôt sleep that well. I probably wouldn‚Äôt stay again especially because of the bathroom and the platform beds

The Ambassador has been the best hotels I‚Äôve stayed in by far, the staff is super helpful, very educated on the night life and best restaurants around. The bell hop Ishmaeel was outstanding. Will return soon.

The location was great.  It‚Äôs close to the lake and close to great restaurants and shopping.  On the downside, the valet was $67/day or you can self park half a block away for $45.  The hotel looks great for an old building.  We booked 2 rooms and they gave us adjoining rooms which worked out pretty well for us.  The bathrooms were small but decent and the rooms were a good size.  The beds were comfy.  In our room, the side table lamp keeps going on & off late at night without anyone turning it on.  I say ghosts but hubby thinks it‚Äôs an electrical short.  Either way would be scary lol ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

We just stayed at the Ambassador and had a great experience with this hotel. We were traveling with our 2 young kids and had a 1 bedroom suite. This was a great choice and affordable for anyone traveling with kids because the bedroom had a separate door from the living room and a huge walk in closet. This is an awesome location to the water and restaurants and access to the train. Thanks for a really nice time and we will for sure be back.

Overrated. Outdated. Poor WiFi connection. Air conditioning barely worked. Only a duvet on bed. No separate sheet. Website said you get breakfast if you book directly with them but had to argue to get them to honour that - which they barely did. The breakfast itself wasn't worth it - sandwiches or limited continental. No complimentary water. Safe was small and placed about 6 feet up on a shelf. Nowhere to put suitcases. Only positive thing was cleanliness.   This place relies on its reputation and looking pretty but doesn't deliver of 4*.   Would not recommend

The Conrad is always my first choice when I'm in Chicago and they've never let me down in my 15+ stays.  Rooms are beautiful and well appointed, but the service is what matters most and whether it's one of the restaurants (which are both great), front desk or valet, it's always A+.  They also have one of the best gyms I've ever seen in a hotel.

Beautiful room was nicely appointed and had a large TV.  Very quiet.  Bathroom was lovely with double sinks.  The bed was very comfortable.  Enough closet space.  Refrigerator is in a "drawer" which is neat, but it didn't keep anything very cold.  Staff was friendly.  Problem checking in with credit card machine which didn't work.  Have eaten at the restaurant before (not this visit) and it's "ok" but overpriced for what you get.  If you get a good rate here, this is an outstanding hotel choice.  Hotel parking is a rip-off... we parked a block away for half the price.

The staff were exceptionally friendly and efficient for a basic hotel chain. A couple of hours before arrival I received a personal text asking me what my ETA would be, and we engaged in a few more texts with a couple of questions that I had. The valet dudes were great as well, and the front desk staff ppl were some funny folks. I even sang along to the PA that was playing I Got You Babe by Sonny and Cher, to their amusement but to my buddy's chagrin.

Before you stay with ANY Hilton brand hotel, you might want to read about my experience and make your own decision.  I'll cut straight to chase;  * Checked into the Conrad Hilton in Dec '19 for a few nights.   * I was given keys to someone else room. I walked in, they were in the shower, underwear and personal items on the bed. If it were someone else other than me, they could have stolen the persons valuables and/or attacked the person in the shower.  * I returned the keys to reception, reported that and was given new keys.  * When I got to MY room, the safe wasn't working, I reported it and was told it would be fixed. With that in mind, I went out for dinner and drinks. Next morning my passport and a significant amount of cash is missing.  * I complained to the hotel manager,

Wonderful location, beautiful hotel, professional staff, luxurious rooms, bathroom & bedding. The in-room coffee is a nespresso machine with a wonderful array of options a accoutrements. So nice to wake up to excellent coffee in the room. Can‚Äôt wait to visit again!

This hotel was amazing, right on the magnificent mile.  Within walking distance of all the great shops and restaurants.  This place has great views, great staff, wonderful amenties.  Room service was great and they had anything available you may have forgotten.  They also offer free water your whole stay.

Perfect Location. Luxury to the nines. Rooms are very spacious and clean.  Staff is very friendly. Greeted at the door every time I go in and out of the hotel.  Continental breakfast with hot eggs and bacon was great for the one day they did it.  (Hope they continue with it) David S. In the restaurant went above and beyond with his hospitality.  Thank you for great stay Conrad Staff.  Highly recommend.

Loved the Conrad, it was right in downtown Chicago. The staff was incredibly helpful and nice. The room was very big and had plenty of space. It also had a nespresso machine with everything you would need to make coffee in the morning. The fridge was also stocked with bottles water. If you needed anything, you could send a text and it would be delivered. The views from the room and the lobby are amazing! We loved our stay here.

I booked the hotel through Travelzoo and was nicely surprised at the great location and value. The hotel was beautiful and clean and surrounded by many attractions such as shopping, restaurants and to our surprise Starbucks Reserve.

I stayed at the Conrad on a snowy trip to Chicago recently. The room was amazing. Tons of unique things that differentiate the Conrad brand from other Hilton properties. Housekeeping is phenomenal and goes the extra mile. The lobby isn‚Äôt in the main floor so it is nice that you can simply get in the elevator and head to your room without a lot of fuss. The food at the restaurant was also delicious at dinner time. One of the best burgers I have ever eaten. Breakfast was not nearly as good. One item to note is that the room was incredibly quiet for a downtown hotel. Almost silent. I will be back.

My husband and I stayed here for just a couples weekend filled with shopping and dining...this hotel is extremely nice and is in a phenomenal location right off the Magnificent Mile. You won‚Äôt be disappointed if you stay here!

I had an very pleasant time at the Conrad. The hotel has an amazing location right downtown on River North. The staff is excellent and very helpful. On the third night I wanted to switch rooms as I was having a friend join me. They were able to accommodate me. From check in to checkout everything was seemless.

I stay in the Conrad on a Regular basis for work. Love the rooms üòç The bathroom is the highlight of the room the shower is amazing üòç great amenity Kits in the room also. Electric blinds both blackout and sheer which is pretty cool.  The have a lovely restaurant on the 20th floor and a rooftop bar. Both are lovely to chill in and great views, but quiet expensive. Great for a night cap if you wore out in Chicago before hand.  The location is amazing also.   Enjoy your stay.

1st time here! Loved it, great view of Mich ave. Right behind the new Starbucks Reserve & close to everything. Room was nice, everyone was courteous & friendly. All the hotels in the area are pricey so we felt this was great for the price!

This is our go to! We have stayed at many different places in downtown and we love this place! Clean, trendy, and staff is amazing. We got an upgrade this time and it was spectacular. Great corner view room.

The whole experience was great the people at the front door were amazing and they always opened the door for me the valet always got my car immediately I never had to wait free water at the hotel and the fitness center was great

The hotel is located on a quiet street but is very close to the local attractions, stores and restaurants.  The service from entering the hotel through room service time is excellent. Very clean rooms as well. The gym has everything you would find in a traditional gym and more than a typical hotel.

This is one of my favorite places to stay in the city for short periods of time. The location is great, with plenty to walk to in the evenings after work. The rooms are spacious and very well cared for. The staff is respectful and attentive; and the whiskey selection at the bar is one of the best in the city. I come frequently and enjoy my stay every time.

We stayed at the Conrad for 2 nights.  It was an exceptional room and the service from the door staff and check-in staff was superb.  The valet parking lot is a couple of blocks away, so it takes 10-15min to retrieve a car minimum.  If someone is ahead of you it can be 20-30, so just plan ahead when you call for your car.  Breakfast items are overpriced, but I guess that is Chicago.  If you don't need to eat multiple plates of food, I would go to the Starbucks Roastery on the corner instead.

We enjoyed our stay at this hotel! Love the interior and plush beds, bathrobes and slippers. The shades opened and closed with the push of a button on either side of the bed, and the view was lovely from the 18th floor. I enjoyed coffee from the in-room Nespresso machine while getting ready in the morning. Cannot say enough good things about the Conrad Chicago.

NEVER going to stay in any Conrad franchise ever again. Called the hotel regarding some urgent issue and have to modify the reservation. The operator could not solve my issue but the manager was not willing to have the flexibility to help.

Right in the heart of Chicago.  The staff was excellent at check in and whatever we needed.   Sunday morning Brunch was a little understaffed, but still enjoyable.   I would plan on staying at the Conrad sometime soon.

Great stay at this well located Chicago hotel.  Service was excellent and the staff were all very courteous . The rooms were clean and quiet (which made for a good night of sleep).  Overall, a well maintained facility.

We stayed here for a last minute one night trip to Chicago in January, 2020.  We got a Travelzoo deal that included parking and breakfast, so it was very reasonably priced.  The rooms were a bit on the small side, but very comfortable.  The rooms were recently updated and modern.  The location is perfect if you want to enjoy Michigan Ave, however we soon realized that Michigan Ave is suffering from the death of retail like most malls.  There just is not much to do.  The Starbucks Reserve Roastery is very close to this hotel, but we weren't that impressed with it.  One downside of this hotel is the street noise.  I've stayed in downtown hotels before and never had street noise this bad.  Multiple times during the night we woke up to sirens, revving engines, and squealing tires.

This is my second stay at the Conrad and I loved it just as much as the first. The rooms are beautiful and sleek with tons of space and controls all over the place for various lighting options. the closets are huge and so are the bathrooms. Truly feels like minimalist luxury. And can't beat the location. I also got texts from the hotel staff checking in and asking if I needed anything.

The staff exceeded our expectations and was one of the best hotel experiences we ever had.  They made our daughter feel like she was royalty and made us feel very welcome and accommodating.  Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

I booked this with a Travelzoo "Top 20" deal for a short weekend trip to Chicago.  With free valet parking and breakfast, the hotel was a steal.  The hotel itself was well worth the price without the "freebies".  The location was fantastic.  The King room with Mag Mile view was spacious, clean, modern and comfortable.  Bathroom had double sinks and great stall shower.  Great technology to control lighting and drapes. Loved it!!

The room was lovely and most of the amenities were great. The exception was the pillows; Hilton properties continue to provide pillows that go flat within a few seconds of lying on them. The service was uneven: Check-in was good. On Day 2, our room was not cleaned when we returned after being out all day; we had to sit in the lobby for 45 minutes that evening while the room was made up. The person at "customer service" had the audacity to suggest that they just give clean towels instead. And we weren't even offered a bottled water in the lobby for our troubles. In the restaurant for the included continental breakfast, on the first day the service was almost non-existent. There was no one available at the host's stand for nearly 10 minutes. When we were finally seated, no servers
