The location of the hotel is wonderful, and right next to one of the largest Starbucks.  It is easily accessible to many Chicago features.  The hotel staff was very accommodating.  Sedalia was a great help with our luggage and making us get settled in.

I like to stay at Conrad properties whenever I can so was looking forward to the Chicago Conrad. The location is great! You‚Äôre a few steps from Michigan Ave and it‚Äôs easy to walk to the Gold Coast area or Lincoln Park, not to mention, downtown, Millenium Park etc.   The lobby is on an upper floor (20th), but guest rooms start on lower floors (8th floor, I think). I thought this was a huge inconvenience since it‚Äôs not practical to go to the lobby floor when your room is on a lower floor. I‚Äôve been to other Conrad hotels where the lobby is not on the ground floor, but in those instances, rooms are all located above the lobby so it‚Äôs easy to stop in at the concierge or at the front desk if you need something on your way down and you're headed out for the day, or on your way up to

The property itself is decently maintained and well situated. The room was fairly large and comfortable, however several improvements could be made.   1) the breakfast for diamond members is horrendous - think worse than a roadside motel 6. It‚Äôs basically a bred item or two and yogurt. It‚Äôs a way for the property to steer people into ordering from their pricey ala carte menu.   2) room wasn‚Äôt cleaned well. We had our dnd sign on in the morning, but no one came around to clean in the afternoon. No turndown service.   3) they couldn‚Äôt figure out how to make the electronic key on the Hilton app worked, despite several trips to the from desk.   4) still trying to figure out how to get the Hilton points for my paid stay from the property.  It‚Äôs unlikely that I‚Äôd stay at this property

Firstly, this is a Conrad which only opened a few years ago - like most Conrad hotels, it is stylish, refined and has generally great service.¬† However, while I wanted to love this hotel, unfortunately a few small things impacted my opinion - namely,  1) the decor in the room seemed too minimalist to the point of being unfinished; I aesthetic is a bit early 90s and not to my liking.¬† It was also quite loud on the 9th floor with noise coming from neighboring room and another floor 2) Diamond status was not acknowledged and no upgrade offered; I do not have an issue of not being offered an upgrade (as the regular room was large and I understand there are limited amount of suites, although a higher floor would have been appreciated) but would be much better if they were proactive

For being my first time at this property, the staff provided an OUTSTANDING experience / stay. Complete attention to detail & making my stay Fantastic by adding a personal touch to their services & displaying professionalism.

The check in was bad. That creates a rough start. They stated that they had given my suite away, later after complaining they found my suite.  The Good: Like other Conrad‚Äôs, the Property is beautiful. The rooms, everything you‚Äôd expect from a 5 star hotel in appearance. Stylish, upscale, tasteful and spacious.  Front Desk representatives Emma, Yasmin and Christina. Emma almost singlehandedly held up the service commitment that I would expect as a Hilton Diamond member. She cares about her work and that says more than the gentlemen who checked me in.  Yasmin and Christina offered solid advice about the hotels offerings.   The Bad:  Housekeeping was completely unacceptable.  Unwashed coffee cups were put back in the clean service bar. They‚Äôd been rinsed but still had coffee/tea

We stayed here for a weekend getaway, using Travelzoo promotion that included parking and breakfast. We had stayed with same promo last year. Hotel has great location, very comfortable rooms, very nice restaurant bar and good, efficient service. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a weekend in the city. Conrad delivered on all counts-

This boutique Hilton hotel is located steps from Michigan Avenue and the new ultimate Starbucks. We walked to the Chicago Theater and dives at Trattoria 10 on North Dearborn. We also visited the Art Institute for the Andy Warhol exhibit. It was a great weekend experience.

Concierge, Valet & Front Desk are all great! Impression based on lobby is outstanding! First impression upon walking into our room is impressive! However, the room had a section with dead light bulbs, dust on ledges and the black out curtains did close all the way. All of these are small things, but for The Conrad? Details they shouldn't be missing.  Our trip included the breakfast buffet at Baptiste & Bourbon. Cute concept, classy decor, wait staff are helpful & kind. However, their breakfast buffet was absolutely nothing special. It consisted of the same options you would find at a 3-3.5 star hotel; small assortment of bagels & muffins, dry cereal, oatmeal, yogurt and fruit. For the price of this "buffet", we expected to see more. Waffles, sausage/bacon....something more than

Very clean hotel and hospitable staff.Good size room , though beds were  smaller then average queen. Over all continental breakfast was good and wholesome. Enjoyed our time.  Location wise,we could not ask for a  better place with the rate we paid.

Proximity to the Starbucks Roastery prompted this choice and I am very happy with the Conrad! The room was lovely, and  the staff were very attentive and welcoming. I would happily stay here again. For some reason they insist on 200 characters, so I will pad it out a little. Haha

If you can get past the hotel bar hostess who is far too busy and important to be bothered with you and the generally poorly trained or slightly combative staff, you will meet a desk manager who seems to genuinely care and will exercise tact in working through problems.

Most of the hotels where I stay for business look the same, so I was surprised by the very modern look and feel of my Conrad Chicago room. A narrow mirror lined most of the room, the cabinets lights turned on when doors were opened, and there was a Nespresso machine. The bathroom had within it a separate room and door for the toilet, which is convenient if more than one person is staying in the room. It was unusual, beautiful, and comfortable.

Though it is a business hotel, our Diamond Member family enjoyed our stay here. They can seem to nickle and dime you for meals but the kids' meals were amazing - scrambled eggs and tons for crispy bacon and french toast was off the hook. GREAT quality food so for $6, whatevs! Rooms were clean and comfy and the location was so prime, we couldn't have asked for better. Definitely would recommend!

Had a wonderful experience at the Chicago Conrad, The staff exceeded expectations and the location is always a great one for shopping and entertainment. Hats off to Ana at the front desk and the Bell Staff made us feel like royalty.

One of my favorite hotels. I love the Conrad and the rooftop. The staff is friendly from the time you walk in until you leave. Very professional and accommodating. I always enjoy myself at The Conrad.

We had a wonderful stay at the Conrad. The staff was nice and the room extremely clean which is always appreciated.  The only issue is parking. There‚Äôs literally only 3 parking spots to get your car into valet so if those are full you need to double park angering the people behind you or circle the block which takes 15‚Äô. My only other suggestion is to increase your late night menu.

Wonderful stay! Rooms are perfect! Staff is wonderful!!  Ask for Tiesha (T) at breakfast, she is amazing and provided wonderful service!   Tom was our waiter in the evening and he provided wonderful service and very friendly!   The staff who took care of our rooms went an extra step for us and provided us with cables ties to keep our phone, iPad chargers nice and organized!  Things like that and the staff make me always come back!

Expensive restaurant and poor service in the resatuarant. Better options to eat or have a drink around the hotel than inside it. Miss labeled menu did not show what food was in season or not. Lack lack of a microwave in the room was just a let down.

Bad entrance, difficult for uber with luggage, check in floor 20, difficult check in 2 rooms. Rooms are awful, best in area , big modern, large tv . All the amenities . For the price great. Close to Eataly, new starksbuck, theaters AMC , the price for Christmas was very nice

Here are the pluses for the Conrad Chicago: location, superb valet parking at a reasonable rate for Chicago, capable and welcoming staff, beautiful lobby, bar and p.a. views, spacious and TRULY CLEAN and fresh rooms and linens, spacious bathroom facilities including a wonderful shower AND tub, large flatscreen TV, modern refrigerator, wonderful view of the city from our room...  Now the minuses: well, I can‚Äôt think of one.  This is an excellent hotel. One of the great pluses of this hotel is not only the congeniality of the staff, but also it‚Äôs location just off the Magnificent Mike.  And the beds are so comfortable, that after a day of shopping, or sightseeing, or visiting with friends, or walking, walking, walking in a city that is pedestrian-friendly, it is a refuge after a

This is not The Waldorf, but it definitely competes with the other higher tier Chicago hotels. Price is much better than those other higher tier hotels. Rooms are nicely appointed. Soft linens, robes and slippers provided are incredibly comfy. Water, Nespresso machine and hot water kettle are always nice amenities and much appreciated. Bathroom has a beautiful and large double vanity with an enclosed toilet and shower on the opposite end. Overall, nice place and will absolutely stay here again.

As a Hilton diamond member, anytime I can get a good corporate rate at a Conrad I‚Äôm going to grab it. I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It‚Äôs close to my office and offers me luxury and service that other Hilton brands can‚Äôt provide. The room was spacious and full of amenities. I enjoyed the espresso machine. The gym is also very large and full of modern, clean equipment. I will be sure to book early to stay here often. I had a very pleasant stay

Everyone greeted us with a smile and was very helpful. Wonderful view of the city. Our room was available early and they brought up our luggage before we returned. Excellent service without having to ask for it.

This hotel should be at the top of your list for Chicago. It is *lovely.* From the impeccable friendly service when you walk in to the rooms which are updated, with high ceilings, lovely amenities, lush beds. It is really luxurious - a five star experience. Also the price of the rooms is very reasonable for the quality of the hotel. I stay here whenever I can. I also dined in the restaurant - the service there can vary.

Clean nice rooms.  Friendly service.  Near everything!  We had a small issue w our room not being ready and they were beyond accommodating.  Probably third time we have stayed here and won‚Äôt be the last.  Parking is a little tough w the new Starbucks next door!!

We stayed only for one night but it was in a great location, had valet parking, and was easy to check in. The room was large with a great view and a huge bathroom and lots of nice amenities like black out blinds, Nespresso machine, and great products in the bathroom.

Great location. Uncomfortable bed. Bathroom could be cleaner. Guest room smelled of cigarettes. Wouldn't recommend unless these things are resolved. Wanted to love this place as it was quite affordable.

Exceptional hotel steps from Michigan Avenue. Well designed luxurious room was spacious, well appointed, spotless and comfortable.  When arriving the doormen were there to greet us and directed us to the elevator to the lobby at the top of the hotel. Check in and all service/ staff were friendly and efficient.  We had room service breakfast which was very good.  This is a fantastic choice for visiting the Magnificent Mile.  We will stay again.

Room service was as TERRIBLE as you might expect given the other reviews.  Wish we had heeded them..  My daughter ended up getting sick after eating the food.  We had our grandchildren with us and had to wait more than an hour and a half to get food -- and then the order wasn't even close to what we asked for.    Decided to get up and see if it would be better to go to breakfast in the morning.  After we were finally shown our table, we waited more than fifteen minutes and still no one came to see if we would like coffee or to take an order.  And we were the only ones in the whole place.    The concierge wasn't much better.  Lackluster and disinterested.    Very disappointing.

Right in the middle of the North Michigan shopping area this hotel is very luxurious, a reasonable value for the dollar given the amenities and staffed by great employees. Our suite had an amazing view. We stay every year in December since its' opening. We will be back.

The Conrad is a wonderful hotel. The room and bathroom are very clean and nice quality. The food and bar is great too. Great location right on magnificent mile and right next to the new starbucks. Overall great experience.

I've stayed here a few times for business travel. I always arrive late. The entrance on the ground floor always seems disconnected to the front desk. The bellman asks my name and, then, when I get to the front desk, they seem shocked that I've arrived. Weird. The crazy plants and wild art behind the front desk, oddly disguise the front desk workers who seem to blend in. Then, their personality is a bit off-putting - they seem annoyed. One night, I asked for help with two small things and they had no help or suggestions. Restaurant.. same behavior. Long waits to get seated for dinner, drinks or breakfast. Food is mediocre, seems microwaved, which is outrageous considering the prices and that many of the dishes are at any other Hilton. Rooms, however, are large and very nicely

From the time we arrived until we left, every aspect of our visit was excellent. The location is perfect right off Michigan Avenue allowing easy access to anything you might want. My wife and I stayed in a regular room with two double beds. The rooms are exceptional, very clean, with plenty of room. There is plenty of storage and plenty off room to move around. The bathrooms are very spacious, well laid out and very clean.  This will be our go to hotel moving forward when we come into the city.

I can only hope my experience was due to having appointments in the early am and came back for my complimentary breakfast. I have stayed here many times and since no lounge credit, but that has now changed to Continental Breakfast in restaurant. I was bunk big mistake as I always spend more then the credit.  My biggest disappointment was only one option for hot, and little cereal and few pastries. Fruit was decent but the oatmeal was not good and I know only oatmeal would have given me no options had I not been off my dietary restrictions. They need more options and oatmeal was awfu! Beware of this if you consider what is otherwise a great property.

Booked this hotel for several reasons.  It is part of the Hilton Hotel family (a trusted staple for me), they offered a great price (which was a pleasant surprise for Thanksgiving week), the location just off of Michigan Ave was perfect for walking everywhere (and next door to the world's largest Starbucks if that's your thing).  But, the Conrad Chicago is so much more than a typical Hilton hotel.  It felt very much like a boutique hotel.  The rooms (we had 2) were spacious and comfortable; the bathrooms and toiletry items were luxurious.  Valet parking was $70/day so I would recommend self-parking at a nearby public parking garage or skip the car all together unless you really need one.   The restaurant, Baptiste & Bottle, offered a continental breakfast buffet and/or menu

We wanted a great location (which happens to be right next to the new Starbucks Roastery) where we could walk to shops and the Museum of Contemporary Art. Our room was quite spacious (500+SF) with large windows overlooking the city. This new hotel has a boutique feel with very friendly and accommodating staff. We're coming back next year!

Very impressive hotel. Rooms are top notch--clean, spacious. Bathroom has a nice supply of towels and separate tub and shower. You would be hard pressed to find anything wrong with the Conrad. Location is excellent--near Rush St and Michigan Ave.

I will second many of the poor reviews regarding this hotel. While the room was very nice and clean, the food service was beyond HORRIBLE. We went to the restaurant the day we checked in for drinks, and the waitress didn't smile and was very short with us. We ordered four drinks, iced tea, beer, and two Shirley Temples. This took over 20 minutes, and there were maybe three other parties in the entire restaurant. The next morning, we  waited over 45 minutes for a table to have breakfast. As we walked back to our table, there were many other tables open, so I was confused why it took so long. As others have mentioned, the continental breakfast for Diamond members was pathetic. Most of the items were picked over, and there we no bowls, plates, or spoons. My son got the French

This is the third time that I stayed in this hotel. The food and beverage service of the hotel  worsened dramatically compared to previous years and you are not at all getting 5 star hotel service. Despite of many calls we could not reach anybody for ordering room service. Every morning we had to wait 20 minutes for getting into breakfast room and another 30 minutes for just getting bagels !!! We wanted to talk to food and beverage manager and the answer was he or she was very busy ??? No proper answer or call back to our complaint letter. They just send a phone number and asked to call them after 1 day we check out from the hotel.  To sum up  the hotel is not any more the Hilton Conrad it used to be and I would not recommend to anybody expecting 5 star hotel service.

Let's make this crisp and easy to absorb:  1. The rooms are supposed to have bathrobes. It's on the housekeeping inventory. If they're not there when I check in, I will mention it so that I am not charged for pilfering. If on subsequent days they're still not in the rooms, I will determine that there is a communications issue between housekeeping and the front desk. Or a systemic issue of Not Giving a Fig.  2. Why is the a/c not cooling between midnight and 3AM? Every night.  3. Why isn't anyone responding to multiple requests to see why the a/c is not cooling between midnight and 3AM?  4. In room dining: Forgetting utensils. Forgetting catsup despite requesting it. Twice. Old, cold french fries. Wrong burger sent. Salmon barely cooked-slimy and slick inside and I value my

This is absolutely a fantastic hotel, but it's not a true five star hotel. The bell staff at the door is helpful, but not as helpful as they could be. The reception staff are helpful, but not too helpful.  The reception is on the 20th floor, but the rooms are below the reception. The lobby has a beautiful view, but it was not terribly inviting. The restaurant on the 20th floor had breakfast for Hilton elite members, but I was made to feel like a second class citizen for partaking in it, and it was a relatively poor continental breakfast. I would much rather receive a credit for the restaurant than a continental breakfast that the waitstaff judge you for ordering.  I received an "upgrade" to a Michigan Avenue facing room on the 16th floor. The room was very well appointed, the

Overall this is a very nice looking hotel but the service is definitely subpar. I recently stayed with my wife and I am a Hilton Honors Diamond member but this property does not give any value to tier status.   At the time of checkin, they were unable to offer a same day upgrade or even a high floor room. The server at the bar was extremely rude to myself as well as our friends we brought to the hotel for drinks. They offer free breakfast for Diamond members however this is a TERRIBLE breakfast. The breakfast only includes mini pastries, milk, cereal, etc. We asked if we could upgrade and pay a difference, however, that was not an allowed option so we purchased the alternate hot breakfast at full menu price. We also asked for late check out on the day of our checkout and were

Came to celebrate my husband‚Äôs birthday and thanksgiving  We have spent 30 minutes to discover the valet weren‚Äôt in their spot with no room to leave our car. They have double booked us And the room is nelly and full of dust Not a proper happy birthday welcome  Certainly not a 5 star hotel service

We were so pleased with the treatment by the hotel staff.  We felt like valued customers.  From the moment we went to the 20th floor we felt welcomed.  Never had to open to door to come in the building or leave for the day.

This is a newly Conrad Hotel in Chicago for several years now.  It's a very nice hotel and good for work-related functions - Save place to rest, good shower, warm room, comfortable bed.  I had stayed here several times whenever I traveled to Chicago for work. I enjoyed the breakfast restaurant but it could be improved.  The room was small for the amount of money paid.  I don't think it was value-added given my status with Hilton hotel.  I don't recommend this hotel unless you are desperate to find a luxurious hotel to stay at in high season.  The staffs here should be educated to learn more about what it is like to work at a high-end hotel.  The staffs sometime could be clueless, unimaginative, and entitled.

Pros:  Modern hotel, Great bar; especially bartender Zak, another Conrad bear to add to the ever-growing collection.  Cons:  Where to start?  Overall, hotel is not worthy of the ‚ÄúConrad‚Äù name.  terrible service, front desk staff rude and accuses guests of lying, no sincere Diamond benefits, hotel nickels and dimes guests.  Detailed:  We arrived at the Conrad Chicago late Friday evening for a two-night stay.  We visit Chicago several times a year and typically stay the Palmer House which is another Hilton property.  We decided to try the Conrad as we have had wonderful experiences at all the other Conrad‚Äôs we have previously stayed at.   The door staff were polite and let the front desk staff know of our impending arrival.  Front desk staff was pleasant at check in; however,

Good experience other than hearing some noise from a room next door. Staff took care of it. Nice toiletries, plenty of storage space, nice views, good location, friendly staff, classy decor. I would return and recommend this place to others.

Excellence Is the best word I can use to describe Conrad! I‚Äôve stayed at several hotels in Chicago and this one stands out!! I look forward to my next visit! Now the new giant Starbucks Reserve is right next door!

My first experience with the Conrad Chicago. Very nice room at a fair price in a great location. Friendly and welcoming staff. Only stayed one night this time. Will definitely stay there again next time I‚Äôm in Chicago.

You can never go wrong with a Conrad. And the staff here are really on top of things. Had a standard king room this time but standard here is quite satisfactory. I‚Äôm picky about bathrooms and I love their bathrooms. I‚Äôve stayed in a skyline suite here, and if you get the chance, you should. It‚Äôs a great view, a beautiful room(s) and nicer than my apartment.

The arrival process went so smooth...and we didn‚Äôt get in until 1 am! The room service was excellent and we used it at least once a day for convenience and it‚Äôs quick delivery. I loved our view, the room was fantastic and the key pad used to put our room on private, call for tray pick up, have our room made up, etc. was so nice. They even texted us two different days to see if we needed anything for our room since we had our room on private/do not disturb. We will MOST DEFINITELY be back again.

Luckily I only stayed one night.   Front desk attention and service was great, but the overall style of the hotel is outdated and old. The carpets in the rooms need to be changed ASAP, the shower/bathroom area was quite small, it felt almost European. The bed was comfortable, as were the pillows.   Had breakfast at the restaurant downstairs and it was rather disappointing, the food wasn‚Äôt good.   On the other hand the location is pretty great.

Celebrated my birthday in Chicago and decided to stay at this hotel. Had a wonderful experience from Check in to check out. Received a room upgrade that had stunning views of Millenium Park! The door man, Barry was awesome! He helped answer any question about where to go and how to get there. Always had a smile on.

We always have great luck at Fairmont‚Äôs but not this time. The furniture in the rooms and the bathrooms felt very dated. No coffee maker, no house keeping unless you ask for it, no parking on site and only two pillows on a king bed (so 1 pillow each). I get it, covid precautions but this just seems excessive. I couldn‚Äôt get out of there fast enough. We left and checked in to Trump International the very next morning. They had all the amenities I expect when traveling.

This hotel will not disappoint you. I had my room upgraded to the gold room.  Which I had met the 4 amazing people in my life.  They did not make you feel like a guest. So much more like family. Alexander Mcandrews, Mandana Kaydi, and Tiphani. They had the best hospitality in the world. They make you never want to leave the Fairmont chicago. Also huge shout out to Cody an amazing sweet person also. Make sure you say hi to them and for sure you will feel the same way I do as soon as you meet them.

I stayed 4 nights in June 2018 while attending SHRM18 Chicago. The hotel was beautiful! My room had an amazing view that faced the pier/lake as well as far north downtown. It was in walking distance to many neat attarctions and dining. The marble spa styled bathroom included was amazing! There is not a pool on site, and parking is undergound, but i would definitely return. I had the best time, and did not want to leave!

My suite overlooked Millenium Park, which was a short walk out the main door. Every inch of the hotel was clean and modern. Friendly, efficient staff at every interaction. Delicious food spanning many kinds of cuisine across the length of my conference. Thoughtful amenities like a light-up makeup mirror and shoe cleaning station really enhanced the room experience. The public lounge areas were also spacious and comfortable to grab a few minutes of laptop or phone work or just to gaze at the city views. A hotel that manages to maintain both a sense of vintage history and gilded modernity that makes for a perfect stay.

Wonderful stay.  Luxurious hotel without being pretentious.  Combination of comfort and style.  The staff was courteous and available without being noticeable.  Location can't be beat.  Amenities are second to none.  Can't wait to come back!

Excellent staff - very friendly and helpful - and great accommodations. I was surprised at how well laid out the room was, and it didn't feel cramped like most city hotels. Also, the food was excellent at the restaurant, the room service, and the events held at the hotel. What more can you ask for?

My stay was seamless from start to finish.  The hotel was in great shape, staff was kind, and operations ran smoothly and without a hitch.  Fairmont has once again proven that they are the best of the best!

Hotel lobby and restaurant are nice and swanky.  The overall quality of guest rooms, hallways, bathrooms have room for improvement.  The concierge, Gail Walker, is on top of her game, always remembered us and gave very helpful recommendations!

Had a 2 night stay here with my sister, and loved it! The room was gorgeous, we had a corner suite, and everything was extremely clean, modern, and elegant looking. Turndown service was provided, even though we didn't request it, and it was lovely! The staff were very pleasant and helpful, and I loved the feel of the lobby. The location of the hotel is also absolutely ideal - it's central to everything, and I felt very safe the whole time.  On our first night, we had an issue with the room next door who decided it was a good idea to throw a loud room party late into the evening/morning. Having just got off an 8-hour flight, we were very tired, and so called reception to see what was happening. 5 minutes later, staff immediately came to see to the room next door and resolve the

Our room was lovely and large. We had a suite that included 2 beds and a separate room with a pullout couch and table. The view was great. A little bit of the city to the right and straight ahead was the lake. All staff was very friendly and helpful.  Awesome stay. I will return.

I loved being within walking distance to Millenium Park and the Art Institute of Chicago. Alexander at the front desk was especially helpful with local coffee shop and nearby shopping recommendations.

Great hotel with nice accommodation. Staff very accommodating and pleasant. Nicer than normal gym. Great location in the heart of Chicago. Very clean and spacious rooms.Bathrooms, slippers and umbrellas supplied!

Stayed at this hotel for a conference.   The guest rooms were much nicer than I expected for the group rate that I paid.   Bedding was very comfortable and the bathrooms were a nice size for a downtown hotel.  Staff was friendly throughout my stay.

amazing locations, great views -  we stayed at 38th floor and it was amazing, the booking through Booking.com was a bit messy but it may be caused by booking .com  staff were helpfull and all very great experience, overall

Could not check in at 5PM. When I checked in at 7PM could not get my luggage. An other 20 minutes of waiting and more frustration. To top it all off no lounge access for Diamond accor member. They really do everything possible to not make you feel welcome. Maybe its because Im not from USA so they look down on me. My conclusion please avoid this hotel by any means!!!

We recently got an invite to the black tie opening for the Chicago auto show. After enjoying endless food and drink and many beautiful cars that you could actually sit in.  We chose to stay at the nearby Fairmont Hotel.  We stayed on the gold level 15th floor. Which has a delicious hot breakfast and a light dinner included with the room at an affordable price.   The view was fantastic and the bed was even better.   We live in the greatest city in the world.

Farimont Gold staff and lounge experience was outstanding, hotel well located, clean and welcoming, if a bit dated in some of the decor. Very much appreciated the quick check-in and check-out and really very friendly staff.

Very nice hotel in a great location.  We walked everywhere and it was located right in the heart of the action.  Easy check-in and lovely room.  Upon leaving, we left our bag with bell captain and it was again very easy.

The hotel was very accommodating to the conference I attended.  The housekeeping staff did a great job of keeping my room fully supplied and clean.  Appreciate them.  The rooms and beds were comfortable.  I enjoyed having 24 hour access to the fitness center as well.  I would stay here on a return trip either professional or personal.

Loved the rooms, friendly helpful staff, concierge was really great. definitely recommend!!! The rooms are really large and love the stone tile in the bathroom. Such a great value for the money in January.

I‚Äôve stayed here 10 or so times now since I visit Chicago a lot. There is nothing horrible about the hotel, it has just become very run down. The elevator today had the call box door broken and hanging open. The carpets in the rooms are worn, and there are scuffed walls everywhere. You can see the photo of my room. It looks like a roadside inn.   The people are lovely and friendly, and it is in a great location. Just don‚Äôt kid yourself that this is a luxury hotel. It is far from it.

Had a brief stay here on business. Check in was a breeze despite late arrival. Room was pleasant, feels like an old school Ritz (separate shower bath and a door that closes for toilet). Room was reasonably spacious as well. Location can‚Äôt be beat. Didn‚Äôt do much to test the customer service or housekeeping since it was a one day stay, but would come again.

The hotel is located in Chicago Downtown, very close to Millenium Park where the Bean (Cloud Gate) is located. A couple minutes walking you will reach the reach the Chicago riverwalk and the Michigan Avenue (the Magnificent Mile). The people are friendly, the service is good, and also it was safe walking around the area at night. All in all it was a good experience. If you need breakfast, there's a Deli called Bockwinkel's just behind the hotel open from 7AM. The sandwiches are good.  Warning: for people from South East Asia region, who are used to the 5-star experiences in hotels throughout SEA, you will find yourself comparing the services and the amenities. My suggestion is, DON'T. Different customs, just enjoy the location and the friendliness of the staff,

This was the second year our group was at the hotel and it was another fantastic experience.  The banquets and events team are top notch and the food was yet again another hit with everyone who attended.  I am sure we'll be back next year.

I‚Äôm always on the hunt for good skin services. Living in the city, my skin gets rough and clogged from all the environmental factors. Couple being someone someone with sensitive skin, I struggle to find someone whose able to give me an effective facial without leaving my skin red and irritated. Alexis is a skincare angel sent from above! She was incredibly educated on all the products used and easily swapped out products that she suspected would irritate my skin. Not only was my skin irritation free at the end of my visit, but I kept getting compliments on how clear, glowy, and glass-like my skin looked afterwards. I immediately booked another appointment with Alexis!!

My wife and I enjoyed a three day‚Äôs stay at the Fairmont Millennium Park in Chicago. We upgraded to the Gold level, and it was more than worth it! All staff members and management were outstanding. And access to Millenium Park as well as the rest of downtown Chicago makes this a great place to stay when exploring the Windy City. Thanks to all of you, and we are looking forward to our next visit!

Everything was amazing about the stay - I received an unexpected upgrade to a suite. The space was luxurious and the bed was so comfortable. I also enjoyed the Le Labo toiletries and the tea selection. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful - they made me feel welcomed and valued during my stay.

Another great stay at the Fairmont Chicago.  Special thanks to Mugi and the Reception Staff as well as Patrick and. Gold Lounge Staff for attending to all the details !  Knowing my preferences for my stays is big factor in why I return and will continue to do so.

I have stayed at this hotel the last 3 times I have visited Chicago and have never been disappointed.  This trip we had an issue shortly after checking in, which was no fault of the hotel or their staff.  The people in the neighbouring room decided to smoke marijuana in their room shortly after arriving, which created a strong odour in our room.  A smell our daughter could not tolerate. We went down to the front desk on our way out for the evening and although we didn‚Äôt want to make a fuss, Hyon at the front desk handled our concerns perfectly.  Not only was she extremely sympathetic to our concerns she provide us with several acceptable options to address our concerns.    On top of the excellent customer service provided by Hyon and all other staff we have encountered on our

Traveling on a road trip we stopped in Chicago and stayed a night at the Fairmont.  Great rates and the gold rooms are worth the extra charge. The gold lounge was great and had wonderful views of the city.

We stayed at the Fairmont Millennium Park for three nights around the Christmas Holiday.  The location was very convenient to a number of attractions in Downtown Chicago, including the ice skating ribbon at Maggie Daley Park, Christkindl, the River Walk, The Art Institute as well as shopping on State Street and Michigan Avenue.  One minor issue is that while the area is busy during the day, there is pretty limited foot traffic around the hotel at night so we typically took Uber back at night rather than walking.  Our Gold Room was clean and spacious and the Gold Lounge had a wonderful breakfast and other snacks throughout the day.  I particularly appreciated the service by Hyon at the front desk, who made check in a breeze and went above and beyond to ensure that we enjoyed our

I've spent one night on a business trip. I arrived late at night, and the reception personnel was accommodating and friendly. The room was upgraded to a beautiful room. I will return, a great location and view.

We stayed here for an event at Millennium Park. The location is perfect since it's right across from the park on the north side.  The room is larger than normal. The bathroom has a big tub and decent sized shower. The bed is very comfy. We felt like we were sleeping on clouds.  Would definitely come back and stay here again.

a great place to come home to- the gold floor lounge spoiled my 4 year old granddaughter rotten; the conciere in the lounge was extremely helpful and knowledgeable with reservations and best times to go to the different venues - nice!

Our family stayed on the Gold Floor for the week of Christmas and had a wonderful time! The hospitality that Mandana shared each day made our week special! Mandana is a true representative of the Fairmont culture!

From the moment we were greeted by Nino at Fairmont hotel in Chicago, to our room, to the champagne and chocolate covered strawberries...everything has been amazing. Special thanks to Gail the concierge who helped us with different recommendations on food and entertainment in Chicago. Everything and everyone was wonderful!

What happened to this once beautiful and lovely hotel?!?! We stayed for a night and the hotel was decked out for the holidays. But, there was no holiday spirit. The front desk personnel were void of personality and only wanted to work the computer system. Escalators were turned off.  There was no welcoming atmosphere that you would expect from such a ‚Äúluxury‚Äù hotel.   We went to the hotel restaurant and were promptly seated. We waited 20 minutes and were only acknowledged once we got up to leave for the hotel restaurant (Filini) across the street. And, the restaurant personnel looked right at us after we were seated. Our room had (what we guessed) was the hotel cleaning crew's hair on our toilet seat and in the bathroom sink. AND...we were charged a "amenity" fee of $20. When I

Fantastic amenities.  The spa is a truly wonderful thing. The staff was exceptional.  Vitaly and Melissa were fabulous.   I enjoyed my seaweed wrap with Vitaly and waxing with Melissa. Check in and check out was great too. Just a wonderful end to a long business trip.

From the moment we arrive the staff was friendly and outgoing. The hotel is in a great location and the room was perfect for our stay. If possible, I will always stay at a Fairmont! The Gold Lounge is a real treat.

The Fairmont is primarily a business hotel during the week so it was nice and quiet for our Saturday night stay.   We checked in early which we really appreciated.  The person who checked us in was very nice.  The room was very nice, clean and a good size.   We were upgraded to a room with a better view, also a nice touch.  The only negative was no mini fridge so there was no place to store our leftovers.   Also, the restaurant  service was not the greatest.   Personnel was inexperienced and it took a long time to get our food.   Also, they advertised a brunch but it was not being served that day.   The management needs to do a better job for the guests using the restaurant.

From the arrival hello by the doorman , Harry,  till his final goodbye, staying at the millennium was purely magical. Very attentive staff, beautifully appointed rooms, quiet and peaceful and yet right in the very energetic heart of downtown Chicago. How much more connected can one be?

Great view of city and lake, close to millennium park, attentive and well trained staff, easy walk to mag mile shopping and restaurants, a few minor details like towels and linens could be updated, good fitness center

Classy hotel on an excellent location. Spaceous rooms and hallways, excellent service. Service and quality according to room rate. Columbus tap is a nice bar, but lobbu bar shouls also be opened most of the time.

My husband decided to pay for gold lounge upgrade for our anniversary stay this past weekend. While it was a nice perk, there ended up being several glaring negatives.   First, we had asked for a quiet room far from the elevators- which was true, for the guest elevators, but unknown to us we were placed almost directly across from the service room and we were woken up at ~6am with tremendous clamor/noise/plate clanking. We went out into the hallway to find it was the staff setting up breakfast! Not exactly the restful sleep you want for a celebratory weekend, and this just set the tone for the rest of the morning.  Next, the gold lounge has a "write down your room number for alcoholic beverages" as an honor policy system.. .both my husband and I did not drink alcohol at the

The Fairmont in Chicago is all you would expect from a Fairmont.  Service is great, rooms are excellent and location is perfect.  Great place to stay if you need a downtown hotel.  Millenium Park across the street and water views are a real plus.

Very convenient to Aon Center. Rooms are modern, well kept and comfortable. Concierge lounge on 15th floor had an excellent array of food and beverages throughout the day. Hotel staff was personable, attentive and helpful for all requests. Thank you Fairmont Chicago for an excellent stay.

I adored this hotel.  Everyone was the perfect combination of professional but welcoming.  I was here for a conference and the conference services were outstanding as well.  I'd come back in a minute.  Perfect location to walk everywhere too.

Location can't be beat. Being so close to the best attractions in the Loop such as Grant Park, Magnificent Mile, and the river gives you access to countless things to do. I thought the room was very clean and comfortable and I would stay again.

Very comfortable home away from home, but a little pricey with the food and in room refreshments.  Normally would book at a different hotel, but overall experience was good.  The staff was very welcoming and room was clean.

Stayed for three nights; very big hotel but friendly staff at check-in and my room was of a good size with a big bathroom, good shower and comfy bed. All very clean and well presented. Disappointed that no swimming pool in a hotel of this size and the fitness area is underwhelming.  More Holiday Inn than what I'd expect from a Fairmont. Good bar/pub in the lobby.  Nice beers, friendly staff.  Colleague ate and said it was good.  Would stay again.

I really like Fairmonts. When my wife and I travel, if the city has a Fairmont, its typically where we stay. With that, we've been to some beautiful properties (Lake Louise, Banff, San Francisco). Now with that being said, this is a lovely hotel. It may not have the grandiose as some of the other properties, but the staff is incredible, the rooms immaculate, and you can walk or train anywhere in the city. Next time in Chicago, I know where I am staying.

Great View of the Park, even as just a basic room booking.  Nice to have a separate shower and bath and coffee and TV with Streaming access.  Everything you‚Äôd expect of a Fairmont and enjoyed the Beer place downstairs as well.  Not overly grand and giant feeling, but quite cozy.  Location is a short 5 min stroll to things, not directly on top of them, but that‚Äôs actually pleasant. Altogether highly recommend.

Stayed here a couple of nights for a conference.  This is a large, somewhat older hotel in a convenient location near Millennium Park and Michigan Avenue shops.  It‚Äôs not glitzy or modern, but they‚Äôve kept it up. My first room was too cold, and they cheerfully moved me to another room.  Rooms are spacious, with nice bathrooms and large flat screen TVs. WiFi is free, worked well.  Minibar fridge is electronic so they‚Äôll charge you if you take anything out.  Nice fitness center.  Staff are very helpful and friendly.  I arrived late for what I thought was a buffet lunch at my conference, and they made me a fresh new meal.  Conference food was excellent. CVS is across the street, and a well-stocked market is around the corner (Bockwinkels).    Overall, this is not at the level of

I stayed on a business trip last week and the Fairmont was perfect. A great workspace for me to answer my emails, prompt room service with excellent food, and all of the staff were so friendly. I'll be staying here when I return.

My husband and I came to Chicago for a wedding and decided to stay for the weekend at the Fairmont. We booked a room on the 37th floor in one of their suites and we were both blown away by the views, suite, and service. The valet was wonderful taking care of our bags and car, the check in staff were great and our room was ready 4 hours earlier than expected. We also had access to the gold members lounge and the staff and food there were excellent! We were only there for 2 nights and 3 days for a wedding but we both felt like we were on vacation. This was our first time staying in Chicago as well as our first time staying in a Fairmont hotel. We definitely want to make a trip back to the Fairmont Chicago and plan on visiting other Fairmont locations in the future.

At check in, we met Cody at the reception desk and he was extremely accommodating.  In addition to making the check-in experience seamless, he made out dinner reservations for that night and even checked in with us later to ensure we had an enjoyable evening.  Well done!

Spent a few days there while running the Chicago Marathon. Staff is professional, pleasant and the rooms are well appointed and clean. The in-hotel restaurant is a little pricey but the food and service are excellent. Only disappointment is I believe they raised their normal rates due to the marathon being in town.

Room very small, no fridge. Very tired room. Horrendous customer service with staff with disgruntled attitude. This is not a 4star hotel. Location was excellent, close to magnificent mile. Good vibe on entrance but that quickly diminishes. Me and my friend booked twin room and ended up with double.

The view was nice. The room was clean. The service was good. The staff was nice and helpful. Lots of great restaurants close by and within walking distance. Lots of great stores to go shopping too. Enjoyed my stay.

A pick from the internet turned out great. Get a GOLDEN room, breakfast, afternnon snacks and after dinner sweets are includet. You can walk to many interestng locations. Use a taxi to get arround ( Car rental is about $ 60.- per day and hotel parking $ 50.-) You have $ 110.- to spend on cabs. No worry about parking or how to get where you want to go. The hotel is mid range but better located then some of the more luxury places.

Came for a conference, booked a Gold suite. Arrived quite early on a Sat, had already emailed in advance to try and take advantage of platinum early check-in. Asked the door man if we should check in at main reception or Gold Lounge, he advised us to go on up. Unfortunately the lady working there at the time said she had no registration privileges, she was normally at concierge desk. But she took our info and offered to go downstairs and check us in while we waited in the lounge. Came back 5 mins later and said our room wasn't ready. I asked if she had an idea when it may be, she wasn't sure, but then said something that made it sound like maybe she never even talked with anyone downstairs. I think that it was really busy and she couldn't get to the people working at reception.

I stayed at Fairmont for work but just to get the invoice for my stay I had to go through hell. When I called the person answering the phone and even the hotel manager was extremely rude, put me on hold for more than 10 minutes. I had to get the invoice for the expenses to be approved. Horrible staff would never stay there.

The Fairmont is in such a great location it‚Äôs a short walk to a lot of the places you must see when you visit this great city!   The hotel is truly a 5 Star property clean, beautiful and everyone here couldn‚Äôt be nicer or more helpful in making our first time in Chicago the best.  I highly recommend the Fairmont if you are planning a trip to Chicago.

We stayed one night for a concert in downtown Chicago.  We are Disney Vacation Club members and used our points to book the room using their Concierge Collection.  We had a Gold King room which offered not only a great room but access to the Gold Lounge.  Tiffany and Jesus in the lounge took good care of us at both the afternoon tea time and the early evening canape time.  Both times there was plenty of food to satisfy us and a great selection of teas to choose from.  Our room was very clean, comfortable and offered a great view of the lake.  Before checking out in the morning we took advantage of the lounge once again for breakfast.  Highly recommend this hotel.

Our suite was spectacular with views of the water and millennium Park thanks to Bradley Russell , Alexander checked us in efficiently and with an upbeat manner.  The concierge √Ålex made arrangements for a boat tour and answered all our questions.   Fabulous Hotel we highly recommend

It was my first time staying at a Fairmont Hotel, and this experience did not disappoint! When I arrived, I was immediately assisted with my bags and the staff was very friendly when I checked in. I enjoyed staying at the 31st floor since it had amazing window views of the city! Also, if you have the opportunity to, I would suggest indulging for the king size bed if you're solo traveling at Fairmont Chicago (the mattresses were so comfy). As far as my trip itinerary goes, the staff was very helpful in suggesting to me great sightseeing and food spots! Also, SO many sightseeing spots in Chicago (such as The Bean/Cloud Gate and Buckingham Fountain) were a 10 minute walk from the hotel! If you get the chance to, I would also suggest trying out Columbus Tap, which is also located

This Fairmont (just like all Fairmont hotels we have stayed in), is excellent. The rooms are spacious, well decorated and clean. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful.  Special mention to Mugi, Abraham and Mandana in the lounge on the 13th floor for going beyond what we could expect.  We asked the concierge for a fridge in our room and a guy appeared at the door 10 minutes later with a fridge. We also requested a kettle (we are English and prefer tea to coffee) and that was also delivered quickly - and no extra charge for either of these items. If you are going to Chicago, stay at the Fairmont. It's a bit pricey, but well worth it. We stayed in 8 hotels on our trip to the USA in June/July and the 2 Fairmonts (Seattle and Chicago) were by far the best of them.

For the most part this is a wonderful hotel in a great location. Pros and cons:  PROS -Nice view of the city -Good location, easy to find and get to. There is a CVS across the street for all your last-minute needs -Close to Millennium Park -Friendly staff -My room had a sound machine, which I did not use but is a nice touch for those city stays -Great, fast free wifi! -I was also given a free drink card coupon upon check-in -Room came equipped with hair dryer, robe, soaps, iron and ironing board, etc.  CONS -Room did not include a mini fridge. I called the front desk to ask if I was missing it and they told me there was a $30/night upcharge to have a fridge in my room. There was a fridge stocked with a mini bar, but not for personal use -Hotel does not offer continental

This property is in a clean, safe and modern neighborhood....feet from the Aon building and 2 blocks from the river. Check-in was unpleasant. The agent did take the time carefully read that we reserved a Gold 1BR suite. He attempted to charge us for 2 upgrades. One for lounge access and another for a higher floor. This could have been either gross incompetence on his part or a money grab hotel directive. Either one is bad. Once that was sorted out, we enjoyed our stay. The suite was large. The view of the park was impressive. The club lounge was pleasant and nicely furnished. Breakfast was more than adequate. Evening appetizers were varied but not enough to provide a meal. This sparsity seems to be the trend of chain executive lounges these days. The staff in the lounge was

Brian Culberson concert at the Fairmont Chicago Millennium. Love the Hotel. very clean and modern. The Bar area was very accessible. Bartenders were very efficient. Just had a wonderful time. the Hotel Staff was so friendly. I Love to have stayed at the Hotel. everyone I came in contact at the Hotel was courteous.

Lovely hotel with fab views of Grant Park. If you can upgrade to a Signature 1 bedroom suite, it is very spacious. Very clean hotel and centrally located for most of the major attractions. Super comfortable beds and the bathrooms are nice.

The Fairmont chain must have replaced their pillows - now very uncomfortable and hard to sleep on.  Had the same problem at the Seattle Fairmont.  Must be an Accor hotel change.  May have to avoid this chain!

We spent 5 nights at this hotel and thoroughly enjoyed the stay.  The staff were very friendly and attentive to any requests (we asked for a mini-frig).  I went running in the mornings and when I came bak to the hotel the bellman hands me a hand towel and bottle of water.  Close to everything. Millenium Park right across the street. The Miracle Mile shopping/restaurant two blocks away and Chicago River a block away.  If it's a nice day, try walking to the museum section. It's a little ovwer a mile and about a 30 minute walk.  Highly recommend.

The carpet on the stairs in the event area has worn through. The phone in my room didn't work. Room service came to my room twice with the same order - I had to turn the second guy away. The hotel isn't quite what I remember it. Has lost some of its charm.

Room was fantastic with a great view. The location of the Fairmont is perfect and plenty of shopping and sightseeing all around. 5 minute walk to "The Bean". Immaculate amenities with a great gym and spa area. Overall hotel is very large with restaurants in and near by. Would recommend a quick weekend getaway here.

We had a very special wedding to attend in Chicago and 7 of us from out of town were attending. I booked a queen suite with an attached king. The accommodation was very nice and it all went off without a hitch (once I hooked up the kids with WiFi). I would not call the rooms luxurious by any means, but only because places like The Canyons in Park City, UT and The Mayflower in D.C. have probably spoiled me.  Easy access to The bean (AKA Cloudgate), Buckingham Fountain, Michigan Ave and Navy Pier.  The room was very quiet and the bedding was wonderful.

The Fairmont is a nice hotel, but it is expensive. If you are attending an event in one of the connecting properties it's convenient.  It's a bit of a walk to get to public transportation. The bed was comfortable and they provide robes for your stay.

I recently stayed here for four nights with a family group of ten.We were all happy with our rooms,mine in particular was spacious with a comfortable king size bed and large bathroom.There‚Äôs a pleasant bar in the lobby,ideal for a quiet cocktail but our main meeting place was the Columbus Tap with its large range of craft beers and very professional bar staff.We also had breakfast there on a couple of occasions as well as whole range of bar snacks while watching football.The hotel is in an ideal location,very close to the Loop business district but equally convenient for Michigan Avenue with its shops to the north and The Field Musem,Art Institute and Shedd Aquarium to the south.Whether you‚Äôre here for business or as we were,pleasure,the location is hard to beat.We would all be

Stayed here twice, in 2016 and 2019. Very pretty hotel full of history. Value for money. It's further than expected from the 'central' area though, I misjudged the scale on the map, and it was a 45 mins walk to where I had to be for the week at Aon Center. But it was a nice walk, wouldn't do it in winter.

Cannot say enough good things about our recent 5 night stay at the Chicago Hilton.  Great location, great service, great price.  From my first contact with Candace (front desk mgr), I felt like a valued customer.  Our daughter was graduating from Med School - and I wanted everything to be perfect.  Alicia (diamond desk) was super helpful, friendly and was able to answer my every question.  Bellmen Rufus and Stephen kept us going in the right directions and always had a helpful tip or suggestion.  Our rooms were delightful and we adored the view of the lake (not many big lakes in our home town of Las Vegas). As obvious ‚Äúout-of-towners‚Äù,  we felt like our home base in Chicago was there to take care of us.  Highly recommend.  Will absolutely choose this hotel again on our next trip

We loved the hotel. We went right before christmas 2019 and the hotel was beautiful. It was interesting to explore the hotel and the decorations. The hotel is very large and interesting to see. It was far enough to not be in the crowded downtown but still close enough to walk everywhere we wanted to go. Room was excellent, much larger than we expected and plenty space for all christmas shopping and to relax.

We visited Chicago Illinois for the 1st time and we were nervous, our 1st experience with our children and we wanted it to be great worrying about our hotel experience was one problem we hoped would not be an issue and it wasn't. Thanks Simeon and Allen for taking very good care of us making sure our room had a refrigerator making sure our bill was accurate. We were very pleased with this hotel the location was great the view was amazing of the city and we plan to stay here again. Thank You guys for helping us feel relaxed and welcome.

Room was huge and well appointed.  The concierge service was really good, and when it snowed hard one day we could while away time exploring the massive facility. The indoor, heated pool also came in handy on this day. A short walk from Yolk (which we love) and right across the road from the Park and Fountain. Easy walk to the Museums and the Aquarium too. A great spot for a good walking, family holiday.

First time staying at this Hilton and our stay was fantastic. Superb service, especially from the restaurant staff. The chef prepared for us a huge dessert the moment he saw us with our White Sox fear and immediately greeted us. We felt right at home. Special thanks to Mario, Thomas, and Jay for always taking such good care of us during breakfast. The food was amazing. The only hassle during the stay was having to wait so long to check in and also to see someone from front desk whenever we needed to get our key reprogrammed (15-20mins waiting time).

One of the amazing hotel must takes stay in this hotel when you visit Chicago staff is very good over your the food is very good. the hospitalityis we nice  I'll give a big Thumbs Up this hotel. I'll highly recommend this hotel

I had a very comfortable stay at this hotel and I will definitely recommend it to all the tourist visit in Chicago this hotel is simply amazing and the hotel is right at the centre and the heart of the city. A big thumbs up

Even though the weather was chilly, the room was cozy and warm with a fantastic view of Lake Michigan and Navy Pier!  Would definitely recommend this hotel.  Had dinner at Kitty O‚ÄôSheas and the service and the food were both excellent!  A very fun atmosphere!

I was impressed by the whole staff and would highly recommend Chicago Hilton as they were simply excellent. In particular, there was an employee named Julius Doxy who recognized that I was frustrated and took the appropriate action right away. It is the little things that count that make the difference in the end. Great stuff, Julius.

We stayed 3 nights at the Hilton Chicago on S. Michigan for a mother/daughter trip. Hotel location is ideal across from a park. The marble entrance is so beautiful. By far the best part was the staff especially Carsarra H. at the front desk. She found us a room earlier than regular check-in and was so kind to find us an upgrade as well as get us a room closer to the elevator since my mom uses a cane. Thank you for taking such good care of us, we will definitely be back! üôÇ

Fun trip and good hotel experience overall except I had issues 1 day with housekeeping getting my room cleaned. I enjoyed the locations close proximity to the parks and great quick service food spots.

Excellent property, clean, friendly, great location and  will defiantly  come back to this location in the future. Food in hotel was great and service was friendly. Great view of the lakefront. Bus service right outside front door.

We had the most wonderful, and relaxing stay at the Hilton Chicago. Everyone on the staff were always willing to go the little extra out of their way to ensure we had a fabulous stay. For example, Jessica the tour guide for the historic hotel walking tour was amazing and knowledgeable about the hotel‚Äôs rich Chicago history. She went completely out of her way and took us up to the executive suites at the very top of the hotel with the amazing views over the park and lake! Quite the highlight! Highly recommend staying here to all, you wont be disappointed.

Julius was extremely personable and made us feel very welcome. He gave us ideas of the best places to go in Chicago. The entire staff was delightful. Service like this, is what keeps bringing us back.

I had an excellent stay at the Hilton Chicago this weekend, especially because of service I received from Ms Darnella Harper (in the fitness center), Tiffany (at the front desk), and Doy Edward Gildart (at the front desk). I will be back!

I love the Hilton Chicago, Mr.Doy was amazing he shared soo much information with me his customers service was amazing. He was able to answer all my questions , he kept a smile on my sister and i faces and i felt very welcomed to Chicago .

The hotel‚Äôs renovation is gorgeous, they‚Äôve done a fantastic job of bringing modern and classic touches. I stayed here for work and the staff was professional and polite. There are two areas that need improvement 1. The room was missing some key items that such as towels. 2. This is the first hotel I‚Äôve ever stayed at where a guest has to pay to use the gym, that is ridiculous. The gym is nothing extraordinary and making guests pay $15 per use is ridiculous.

I was excited to book a weekend in Chicago with my husband. When we arrived, the first room we were assigned had long, black hair all over the bathroom sink, floor, and shower. It was evident that the bathroom had not been sanitized or clean. As someone with a background in hospitality, I understand these things happen. We went back downstairs and asked if we could change rooms. We went to our second room only to find that it was located in the elevator lobby (literally) and was a handicapped room with the cabinets thrown open and the furniture beginning to brake. We went down a THIRD time. We spoke with a different guest agent each time, and the third agent was absolutely horrible. She was rude and aggressive without listening to our concerns. We were finally reassigned to a

Had a great visit to Chicago staying a the Hilton. Carsarra H at the Front Desk was very friendly and accommodating for my stay. Had a very nice room with a lake view. Several restaurants on site for business travelers. Would definitely come back!

Was here for a trade show checking in was a bit of a challenge as there were tons of us there trying to get in and registered. Carsarra was able to roll with the punches and get is taken care of and settled. Folks take for granted what people in the hospitality industry do.The staff here were able to manage our large group and still maintain everything else. It was well done and I appreciate the efforts.

We are having an excellent stay here! Each employee we have met has gone above and beyond for us. In particular Jay the ma√Ætre d at 720 breakfast was lovely. He put us first and took great care of our family while we enjoyed our morning meal. While staying at the Hilton Chicago be sure to also have breakfast here. The food is amazing and the service is even more so.

Around the hotel there was good security and those guys were polite, friendly and efficient. The same cannot be said for the Reception staff. I needed $3 for the left luggage and as I was on route back to the UK I did not want to get more currency. It ended up costing me ¬£26 at their ATM for the $3 charge (cash only). I had to use it as check out was 11am, not the standard 12:00. I asked Reception to charge $3 to the room to give me the cash for the service. They said the left luggage was noting to do with them so use a ATM, even after I explained I did not want to pay for more US currency - most unhelpful.

I enjoyed my stay at this hotel! I was clean, comfortable, and virtually everything that you could ever need was located within the building itself. I stayed in a double room with a friend that, to our great surprise, only had one bed (not great), but everything else--the mattress, the bathroom, the fridge--were all good.   One thing to note: virtually everything other than the room itself costs money. If you are not a Hilton Honors member, you must pay for Wifi. You also must pay $15 per day to use the gym, unless you just want to run the track or swim in the pool. There were no water fountains in the building that I could find, so it's either free sink water or expensive bottled water.

I have been to a number of Hilton properties around the US and this is by far the best. I received exceptional service from two people specifically, Julius Doxy and Marvin Carbajal. I travel all the time and I received great hospitality here which was really nice and hard to come by.

Absolutely the best gym in all of Chicagoland hotels. Indoor pool, sauna, track (yes, a track) and every dumbbell/ anaerobic piece of equipment you could possibly want.   Oscar, who greats you at the sign in area is absolutely fantastic. His professionalism is only bested by his memory (remembered my name in-between three week stay).   Equipment is well maintained, cleaned daily and new (love the pelotons!).   I choose Hilton Chicago for the gym over my next favorite the Wit.   Great work Oscar!

I recently stayed at the Hilton Chicago while taking my son on a tour of one of the colleges nearby.  This was my second time staying in the hotel.  It's location near several colleges as well as the beautiful park was a plus.  The room was updated and clean.  It had 2 bathrooms which was a great perk with our 2 teens in the room. Check in was hassle free and we were offered the option of an upgrade to our room for a nominal fee which we declined but it was nice to have the option.  When we did have an issue with our room (the mini fridge wasn't working) maintenance came within a reasonable amount of time to address and fix the issue.  Staff was professional and friendly. Parking is available but we did not use it this time.  My biggest complaint was that there were Hilton

Very beautiful ball room. This hotel would make for a great place to have a wedding or an event. The staff was great and very friendly. I thought the rooms were very typical for most Hilton locations. Also a great place to get your shoes shined!

I stayed here for a week (02-08 Feb) for business. The location is excellent, across from a beautiful park and within walking distance to good shops and restaurants. Additionally, the Irish pub inside of the hotel was great for late night drinks. The staff was very kind. My only complaint is that the fitness center was not included in the stay - seems very odd and penny pinching to me. For that reason, I will not be booking future business stays here.

I've stayed hear a number of times, for business. The location is near to my business and the staff has always been friendly. But, this last trip was a nightmare. There was some type of guest kerfuffle that started around 1:00 am and went on for hours. That didn't leave me feeling like security had things under control. When I called reception, they sounded in a panic. (Ultimately, police were called and the guest was escorted out. But, this lasted WAY tooo long for comfort!!) Dishes - breakfast and dinner - were stacked in the hallways for days. Carpet had pieces of garbage on it for the duration - three days. Restaurants were closed - without warning, not even at check in. Room service, the same thing - closed. The temperature in the room was freezing. The elevator from the

The stay was very comfortable, with great facilities.  It was within good walking distance of the museums, and easy transportation distance of everything else.  The staff was phenomenal and the historic setting was unique and beautiful.

I‚Äôve been a Hilton Honors Member for over a decade. My experience at this hotel has me speechless. My team visited Chicago for NBA Allstar Weekend. We had 3 Suites. I don‚Äôt like to complain, so I won‚Äôt get into details but Hilton failed miserably on this experience for my team. I will never stay at this hotel again and for the amount of money we spent on rooms, there is absolutely no excuse for the service we received. I highly recommend you save your money and stay somewhere else in the City. We ended up leaving the Hilton Chicago and checking into LondonHouse.  To finish on a positive: Dean & Sandra in Hilton Grand Vacations are phenomenal. Carsarra at the front desk was an angel and needs to be moved up into a Management Role. She gets it!   I would highly recommend Hilton

It was a great location for us and the room was clean and quiet.  The food from the grille was good.  Very easy to get a cab. Concierge was helpful.  We only stayed one night but it was very comfortable.

I stayed here as part of a conference. I found the staff at breakfast and reception to be friendly, but this property lacks many amenities that you might find at other 3-4 star hotels. Housekeeping was not great. They left trash and used towels in the room. They also did not refill empty kleenex boxes. Moreover, the lighting in the room was terrible. There were 2 lamps that made the room dark most of the day. Lastly, the food options were not good. The grab and go place did not have many options for vegeterians beyond over-priced yogurt. I also found the continental breakfast to be lacking. The pasteries tasted stale, I saw orange juice come out of paper cartons, and the fruit didn't taste fresh. I think this hotel has potential to be nicer. I am assuming that Hilton is more

I just stayed for five nights at the Hilton Chicago for a conference and had several problems while there. The housekeeping was poor - papers under desks and the bathroom vanity, an old sock left in the closet. One day, housekeeping never showed up at all. I had a significant problem with temperature control. If i had the heat on, it was too hot and uncontrollable. If I turned it off, the room became too cold.   The breakfast is decent, but overpriced. One morning, the server tried to charge me for a full breakfast when all I had was a continental one. Another morning, a female colleague was treating me to breakfast. The male server, assuming I was paying, gave the check to me. When my colleague took it, he commented that as the man, I should be paying. Not only was this

Executive suite is adequate;  but not amazing in size.  The beds were very comfortable. There are 2 bathrooms; which helps out.  There seems to be a staffing problem.  We are Hilton Honors members and they always only had one person at checkout.  Room for 5 to 9 personnel.

This is a conference hotel that can't keep up with the number of people that stay here. I stayed for 5 days this past week and the carpet outside my room was never vacuumed during my stay. There was litter and dirt that I began to recognize as I came and left my room. On one night my room was not refreshed when I returned at 6pm. The heat in the room was also a problem. It was 77 - 81 degrees even when set to 68. I was told to open the window which wasn't easy. And one last issue, because the hotel is near Grant Park, there aren't a lot of places to eat nearby. This past week it was quite cold so I looked at the offerings in the hotel. The breakfast buffet was $35+ per person. I know hotel food is sold at a premium but this is simply too high. The other options are a faux

Disappointing experience. Room was clean. But overall hotel was lacking. Quite dated, felt shabby. Checking in felt like being in a train station, with a long line cordoned off by ropes. Color scheme and decor muted and dated. Just didn‚Äôt feel like a 4 star hotel at all.

We spent one night at the Hilton Chicago in conjunction with an office holiday party that was being held in one of the ballrooms.  Overall, our stay was highly satisfactory, although we had limited exposure to the hotel's amenities.  Check in was crazy mobbed because there were multiple holiday parties at the hotel that night (Saturday about 10 days before Christmas), with many attendees staying over.  As a Hilton Honors member,  however, we were able to avoid the long line by using the electronic check-in feature.  We were upgraded to a one-bedroom King Suite on one of the upper floors, facing Grant Park and the Lakefront.  Amazing views and a spacious room.  You could hold easily have a party for 20 people in the living room. The furnishings were rather dated, however,

Beautiful...fast check in...fast checkout. Comfortable beds. Super clean. Easy to locate.  Con:Expensive parking charges...we did UBER...LOL 10 minutes parking @ doorman post. Historical property. Bellman...Consciere Service...Doorman...come dressed to impress.

I have been a HHonors member for almost a decade and never have I been treated as if I am so unwelcome and unwanted by anyone the way I was from the moment I arrived. I planned a getaway to Chicago for my birthday on 2/11 because I wanted to have a calm and relaxed moment. I thought this hotel would be the perfect place. I could not have been more wrong. It started from the moment I went to check in and the young lady that I dealt with was rude and didn‚Äôt even greet me with so much as a hello. I had wanted to check in online so that I could choose a high floor room but was having issues with the app so I asked her if I could change the room from the 8th floor to something higher so I could maximize the Lake view that I had purchased. She looked at me and rolled her eyes and

It was a very nice hotel excellently remodeled with a modern style.The room was spacious clean and very comfortable. They have a fully equipped gym and a full sized lap pool that are of the best quality I've seen in a hotel in many years. The staff are excellent and super friendly. The only thing missing is free internet and smart TVs.

This was my first time staying at this property and I really enjoyed myself.  The view, the food and the service were all  amazing!!  My room was exceptional.  This place is a whole city within itself.  Downtown Chicago is great.

Each staff member treated us all with respect and kindness. The follow up texts to make sure all was well was most welcome! Very grateful for this staff. The hotel itself is GORGEOUS!!! I cannot wait for our conference here again next year.

I love being a Hilton Honors member because they always make me feel like royalty. We only stayed one night, but had the best time. Since we were able to extend our check out to 2pm, it felt longer. Also, after checkout we used the indoor pool, whirlpool, and sauna! Special thanks to the Customer Service Coordinator, Robert Almaraz who had a bottle of wine waiting for us in our room. The turn down service is a great service to offer as well. I also want to give a shout out to Amanda at the front desk as well as Tiffany and Alicia who texted me just to make sure I had everything I needed. I plan on coming back  soon! Thank you all!

Checking in took about 10 minutes . Process was a little longer with employee than normal . Nice facility, great location for walking to shopping, restaurants, and parks.  Security in hotel was available. Grab and go restaurant was convenient with good choices .

This hotel is a Chicago icon. It lives up to its badge. We were given a large room with a lounge (upgraded at no cost on 4 July). The hotel has large halls and lobbies, despite its size lifts worked well and promptly. The rooms were very comfy. Wifi had a good speed. The toilettes were adequate. It was great to have a small kitchen. Location was perfect to explore Chicago, you could walk almost anywhere and if not a short Uber ride away would get you anywhere in no time.  The check in was smooth, and the service was impersonal but efficient. It was my 2nd stay in this property (the first one had been 20 years ago) and I can say the hotel retained its charm and lives up to expectations.  I would highly recommend it.

We had a great time at the Swedish Covenant Gala in October of 2019. Everything was great from the reception through the end of our stay. We enjoyed the food, the ballroom,  our hotel room was great and so was Kitty O"Sheas. I also appreciated the fact that the hotel checked for our room key when we headed to our room by the elevators.  I like the extra security for guests. We will definitely stay here again.  Great time.

Top location at the city, an typical USA big city hotel a lot of tradition long corridors nice rooms and somewhat unmotivated staff, but I can recommend everyone for a weekend trip. Location, location and location!!!

Feb 2 to 4, I was at this hotel. not my choice, my employer booked me at this hotel. Everything was fine until I showered , when I noticed dark black stains on the bathtub near the corner on both sides. At first I thought it was just a stain. But then I started sneezing, and later after the shower , I realized it was molds, only because I have experienced such in my rented apartment. I also noticed fresh caulking between the bathtub and the wall. It sure covered most of what was mold because only a small portion of the mold area was showing. I then was smelling a moldy odor. I then called the operator to report the problem. I was passed on another person, who just said, ' ok , we will look into it. after about an hour or so, some maintenance guy, inspected the molds, a said' oh

Frankly, at some point it feels like a "tourist trap" you expect from shady hotels that only disclose true benefits of your stay once you are already booked. For this hotel type some things should not even be an issue as they are easentially "a given". For example, you dont have an access to the gym as a customer and have to pay extra. You also get water in your room only on the 1st day. Breakfast is not included.
