Yes, it is clean, great location, and staff is frindly, but isn't this what you expect from this type of hotel anyways, especially for the price. That being said, we stayed only half of the planned stay and moved to Hyat as all those amenities above are included in the price, and yes, it is clean and staff is also friendly.

Lots of History here. It's in a great location overall. Been here before. I like it...I only get high floor rooms, so I don't really no what the other ones look like. Great full breakfast buffet......

I love older hotels and the Hilton Chicago is one of the best. Lots of dark wood and marble with high ceilings and ornate trim. The public areas of the hotel are beautiful. Guest rooms are very nice and well done as well. I have been to this hotel several times for business meetings which included use of the Grand Ballrooom. If you stay here try to see the Grand Ballroom and also walk around the other public areas. Well worth the time. In a city noted for great architecture this hotel fits in very well. Great location on Michigan Avenue across from the park and Lake Michigan waterfront.

Patthamon greeted me and made me Feel right at home from the time I arrived. I appreciated that she checked on me each day and took care of my late check out. She represented my favorite hotel very well. Thank you Patthamon

I can't say there was anything wrong about the hotel.  It is a old hotel but nothing was great either.  The restaurant was just ok.  I had an issue with something flashing in the middle of the night in the room and had to change rooms.  Could not figure out what it was.  The staff wasn't rude but wasn't pleasant either.   Nothing horrible.  The hotel is just ok.

Overall I love the Hilton chain. I always stay at this particular Hilton every time I am in Chicago.My room was perfectly located. I had an awesome view of the water and overall downtown. Doy Gildart was a great help! I never buy these vacation packages and he old it to me without being overwhelming! Easy to talk to and got the job done fast. I cannot wait until my  trip to Vegas.

I received a free room upgrade to the 16th floor which had an amazing view. Thank you to the staff for making my stay most pleasurable! This is where I will choose to stay whenever I'm in the Chicago area. Thank you Hilton!!

Absolutely the worst Hilton we have been to. The Executive rooms are a joke, as is the breakfast add-on.  This executive room literally faced another building, had nothing extra in the room, and was dark with an odor. Front desk employees are unfriendly and have a racist demeanor. You are better off at Embassy Suites.

After driving all night, I SPENT MY TIME CALLING TO ASK ABOUT AVAILABILITY AND FEES ASSOCIATED WITH CHECK IN so we could be aware in our choice of where to stay. We were told we could not make reservations over the phone which began my frustration, as I had a credit card ready and wanted to be able to check in and go to sleep. That not being an option, the lazy man answering the phones late at night ensured me to just come in and it wouldn't take long. It did. Unfortunately, we wasted the Chicago leg of our family vacation on this suspiciously inexpensive Hilton. I should have known if its too good to be true it probably is. We only stayed as a "day guest". Meaning we arrived exhausted at 5am and planned to leave within 6 hours. We paid $50+ tax for TWELVE HOURS IN THIS HOTEL.

Rooms were very good. Staff was friendly. Easy check in/out. Location was amazing and it was easy to get from place to place and see landmarks. Meeting rooms were very large and able to accommodate a very large group.

Doy made sure I was taken care of and was great with offering recommendations for other Hilton hotels.Thank you for your hospitality. You are awesome! I also enjoyed my stay here at the hotel. Very clean and the gym is amazing.

Upon traveling for business to Chicago from Ohio I met two lovely Hilton employees. Doyle and Sandra we're so pleasant and welcoming. I've been a diamond member for over eight years and this is a large reason why I only travel Hilton!!  I was offered a package through Grand Vacations buy both of them and I'm so excited for my next travel experience with Hilton!

Room was immaculate. Park on site was handy. Options for food were good. The little cafe/shop had Starbucks and many other breakfast items to eat there or to go. Staff everywhere to help get you where you needed to go. Love the adult hot tub plus family hot tub.

The check-in process was pretty smooth and they even upgraded my room! The view from my room was fantastic, the bed was comfortable, and they had a good selection of restaurants in the hotel! I would definitely return to this hotel again if in the area!

This is an absolutely beautiful hotel. We much enjoyed the large pool, sauna and gigantic fitness center with indoor running track. Yaasmeen at the front desk was in particular helpful and truly made our stay very much enjoyable, she went above and beyond on several requests. Good beds, historic halls and ballroom and good food make this hotel a gem. Of note: it is close to the Field museum and Shedd Aquarium and a (roughly) 20-30 min walk will get you to the loop.

Gorgeous views, big rooms, and quiet (away from the sirens that plague many downtown Chicago hotels). My top recommendation for a reasonably priced, elegant stay in Chicago (and I've stayed all over downtown). Plus it was super cold out and the room was nice and warm.

Stayed at this hotel over Thanksgiving.  The lobby is amazing!  We booked a room with two bathrooms.  It was a nice touched but they were very small with little room for storage.  Rooms look very dated and could use some updating.  Our rate included breakfast and parking. Parking was very easy.  The breakfast was very good.  Housekeeping left a lot to be desired.  There were literally towels and garbage cans left out in the hallway throughout our stay.

This hotel is just average. Don‚Äôt be fooled by the history and impressive lobby. This is not a five star hotel. The rooms are old and a bit shabby. There is a shower with a shower curtain, no mini bar, no complimentary water, no in room safe. The room service starts from 5:30 so if you are travelling from abroad and wake up early because of jet lag prepare to starve and be thirsty.   Also check that your room is clean. Mine wasn‚Äôt and I had to call to get someone clean it. The service works: I did get  the room cleaned and some water from the front desk. But it is very average. They don‚Äôt help you with your luggage. They also take a fee from taking care of your bags if you want to leave them after you‚Äôve checked out. I have never experienced that before even in a two star hotel!

This Hotel holds great history and you can sense it as soon as you walk through the front door.  The Hotel is in great shape and has been updated to current accommodations that you expect in a new Hotel.  Other than the Restaurant being closed during my stay, it was Wonderful.  Kitty O'Sheas is great and they have a first class Gym/Fitness Center.  I highly recommend this Hotel.

This is a busy property located within a 15-20 minute walk to the museum campus (Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum, and Adler Planetarium) and a short walk to Millennium Park.  The rooms were well appointed.  Our party of 7 stayed in 2 different 2 Queen Bed, 2 bathroom room.  This type of room is a major advantage of this hotel.  The Diamond member benefit was a $20 voucher per night per room for breakfast at the coffee shop.  I was under the impression it was a credit at this restaurant, but there are apparently restrictions on how the credit can be used.  No upgrade was offered for the room and we were put on a normal floor.  A bit of a disappointment for the Diamond status.  Overall, it was a comfortable stay.

Stacy and Marvin helped us keep our 3 Giordano's pizza's frozen we had promised to bring home for our family.  They were so helpful and accommodating to us.  We will be sure to stay here on our next visit to Chicago.

Jessica our tour guide was absolutely wonderful. She kept the tour interesting, personal-able, and super informative. My husband was the one who wanted to see the tour and I thought it might be a bit dry but since it‚Äôs only 30 min. I figured I‚Äôd why not.  I was very pleasantly surprised. So much wonderful history that I‚Äôm ashamed to admit that I am just now learning it after staying here many times over the past tens years. Thank you Jessica and I think we were with her even longer because we had questions, hence the 30 mins flew by. Jessica‚Äôs enthusiasm, adoration, pride and respect for the hotel and its past and present guests made me want to not only stay here again and again but work here too! The tour is  beautifully presented and I will be recommending this to friends and

So while this hotel had lots of interesting history, beautiful brass details throughout the hotel including the doors & elevators, it‚Äôs historical value and beauty did not meet up to its image. First of all I‚Äôd like to say what I felt was positive about my stay here, which is the only reason I‚Äôm giving it two stars. The people at  front desk staff, Herb cafe & Kitty Oshea‚Äôs had a group of wonderful friendly & helpful staff. The room was clean. This was by far the only positive experiences I had here.   The rooms were nothing special.Average size with  peeling paint in the ceiling , it had an odd layout with the desk being in a narrow area behind the bed & was difficult to walk through. The central heat would not shut off no matter how far you turned down the thermostat.

Doy was excellent today!! He immediately came over and asked us what our needs were and if there was any way that he could help. He was very kind and patient with us and was able to book us an amazing deal. Thanks Doy, keep up the great work!!!

I was traveling alone with my three kids in Chicago. I arrived at the Hilton and everyone was so helpful. The guy holding the door, the lady who checked me in was patient with me with the kids, and one guy in particular, named Doy, was super helpful. Not only did he answer my questions about the surrounding area, but he was very polite while selling me a vacation package. Normally people selling vacation packages are annoying, but he was so good, I decided to buy it. Also, I want to add the cookie decorating made my kids travel so much better. Thanks Hilton!

Family staycation at the Hilton during winter break is always a blast!! We love swimming at the pool. Relax in the hot tub. We can have dinner on the premises if we really want to relax or the kids love Bub City so if we feel like venturing out that‚Äôs our go to spot!!

We stayed for a family weekend.  The rate drew us in.  Our room was plain, bathroom old, pool had literally wall to wall kids and parents - we turned and left to avoid the insanity.  Wait for elevators was forever...  Might have been the weekend... Still fans of Hilton, just not this one.

My husband and I stayed here when attending a seminar.    The staff providing us with outstanding customer service from the moment I made my reservation through my entire stay.    It's a beautiful hotel with a comfortable sitting area downstairs.  The room we had was outstanding, with an amazing beautiful view of the lake.     We were very happy with everything.

We took my grandson on a train trip to Chicago and stayed at the Chicago Hilton, we had a wonderful time and love the Hilton hotel. It was very reasonable and central located. The staff were very friendly and the hotel very clean, I would highly recommend staying here if you are in the Chicago area for any reason

This is my 3rd year in a row staying here and this hotel never disappoints.  I upgraded to a lake view and it was well worth it!  I would recommend checking the NFL schedule before arriving as there could be a lot of fans there on home weekends (Soldier's Field is a short walk).  However, even with the fans, everything was great.  One small gripe - I didn't get any water bottles on my stay. But I obviously lived to tell about it.

We've had really good luck with this hotel and have been back a few times when visiting downtown Chicago.   This hotel is nice for couples or families. We love the extra room, clean accommodations, nice pool, and hot breakfast. The room is spacious with a separate living room and kitchenette. Beds are comfy. Bathrooms are clean. The pool area is nice with a gorgeous view of downtown.   We definitely recommend a stay here if you want to be close to everything downtown.

Plus:  super location, 2 short blocks from red line metro, easy access to mag mile and downtown.  Corner suite with second window wall really opened up the room.  They will hold bags for your last day.  Pleasant staff.  Late check out no problem.  Kitchen.  Comfortable bed.  Minus:  there are no extras at this time - not even the breakfast sandwich you got in early covid - nothing.  Kitchen has neither d/w soap nor even paper towels (!)  You get plates and glasses.  But at least a f/s fridge (with one (!) ice tray).  No housekeeping.  Yes, there will be disruptive people in the street lobby who don't belong there.  Horribly uncomfortable sofa.  Place is mainly a value for convenient location - plan on using super easy CTA, parking is like $60 a night.

Zero attention paid the shady people that hang right at the front door of the hotel. Was there for 7 nights and had at least 3 instances where homeless people were actually inside the hotel panhandling people at the 1st floor elevator. Zero security presence, a desk that could be used as either secuirty or a valet sits unmanned 24 hrs a day at the 1st floor elevator approach. Meanwhile the lobby is on the 6th floor. Once inside the hotel is great! l just really think its poor service and unsafe to maintain no control over the front entrance and elevator approach. The neighborhood degenerates are all very familiar with the easy pickings and lack of security in this front entrance area. We actually saw a security guard from the business right on the corner shoo a few homeless

My job booked a room for me here due to the protests to ensure I could make it to work, and when they told me which hotel, I was like " meh, whatever, it's free", but BOY WAS I WRONG about my expectations! The front office manager on duty (Asian gentleman, didn't get his name) was very welcoming and me, working in hospitality as well ( my hotel is closed temporarily due to corona)I can appreciate and recognize great, GENUINE service. When I got to the room, it was so nice, and SPACIOUS! MUCH nicer than some rooms I've stayed in at "4 star boutique hotels", I loved the kitchenette, the bathroom was big, everything was beyond what I thought I'd get. And the bed.. That bed. Wow. I slept like A BABY! Can't wait to stay here again really soon! You guys rock!

We did not get to experience the full hotel since the lobby and restaurants were closed due to the pandemic. The layout of the one bedroom suite was excellent and the sofa bed was useful. Great location, loved having Starbucks across the street. The room was quieter than I expected it to be based on previous reviews. The only thing keeping me from a 5 bubble/5 star review is that the room seemed somewhat dingy and the bedding didn't fit the bed great, but it was fine. The most positive part of the stay was the pleasant staff who handled everything very nicely during the pandemic. All of the staff should be commended for their efforts, thank you and stay safe!

Came into the city to celebrate granddaughter birthday. Decided to spend night. Location was great. Room was very clean and comfortable. Staff was very friendly. Jeremy was very helpful and pleasant! Pool area was clean and had nice view on 19th floor. Breakfast was standard and ok. Evening social was a little disappointing compare to other hotel we have stayed, but was still ok. We drove in and used the valet parking, attendant was not very helpful or friendly. Would definitely stay here again, if back in the city.

Have stayed here couple of times before - last trip 2018.  Room was clean with everything you want supplied - great view of the Wrigley Building (see pic).  Breakfast buffet supplied all you needed.  Evening food provided (I was there Wednesday & Thursday nights) was great with everything being replenished as it was running low. I didnt have to wait for elevators at all (receiption in on 6th floor with rooms starting above which give great views over the city).  Good wifi and hot water in shower/bath had good pressure.  Bed was comfortable and AC works will in the room. Will happily stay again when am back in Chicago.

This was our second time staying at this hotel. The stay itself was not bad, room was relatively cleaner as compared to the last time. They charged my card separately for parking even though I had paid for park and stay package when I made online reservation. After four or five phone calls to the hotel and an email to Hilton corporate office I was able to get the refund. They gave me the reason that there was some glitch in their system.

Great option for a solo traveler. The pool on the 19th floor made for a great  morning swim with a wonderful view. Breakfast was always good but the waffles were not offered on Saturday morning. I enjoyed my stay and the kitchen staff were always very welcoming.

I feel that I may be somewhat biased in this review since I booked this hotel during the low season on a Wednesday night, therefore got an amazing deal online.  I didn't even realize this was going to be a suite with a full kitchen until I opened the door - so just in that regards this room surpassed my expectations.  Regardless of the price, even if I had to spend quite a bit more, I think this place would have been worth it.  It really does feel like a home away from home, with the room giving a small apartment vibe.  I was able to get groceries and cook myself a small dinner - pots/pans/utensils and various kitchen utensils were all provided.  I was pleasantly surprised to find a decent free breakfast in the morning (which I didn't even realize was included as well).    Most

Nice clean place to stay. The view of Chicago from upper levels and pool was beautiful. The suites were very nice. Kitchen clean and cute. The beds were nice and comfortable. And it was close to alot of eatery's and markets.

I stayed here for 2 nights on a work related trip.  The first floor concierge area was great for the Uber pickups.  The lobby itself is on the 6th floor which is also where the free breakfast is located.  There is a free happy hour with dinner each night. Breakfast was ok. I don't eat eggs but a friend said they were kind of rubbery.  Also she got what she thought was decaf coffee one morning and then had the jitters all day so - maybe control your own coffee destiny LOL.  The room wasn't huge but was very nice.  There was no fan in the bathroom so if you have to have that door shut when you shower, expect it to be steamy in there.  The water pressure was on the weak side but not enough to bother me.  The bed was firm enough and there were both foam and feather pillows on it

Booked two nights here in a king one-bedroom suite. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful to me. The valet person on the ground floor was always pleasant and it was nice to know that there was a staff member at the entrance for safety.  The room was fairly spacious for two people and the kitchen was very nice to have. Some of the glasses were dirty with food stuck to them, but it was good that I checked before using them. There was also several scraps of paper on the bathroom floor behind the door that were still there when I checked out, which means housekeeping did not sweep the bathroom floor after our first night, although they did replace our towels for us as we expected them to.  The evening social was very nice to have available. I went to it my first night

We got a very good deal during the 7 Feb weekend. This is very nice hotel (3/4 star). It is not a hotel room but a 1BHK apartment with full kitchen inside. View from the room was perfect (trump tower and downtown).Service was good. Room and linen were clean. We enjoyed our stay. Breakfast had so many options from hashbrown to eggs to walnut etc.

We live in Michigan and have been making trips into Chicago for the weekend for decades. We‚Äôve stayed in a lot of different hotels, but none of them have been as convenient a location as this Homewood Suites. You can, quite honestly, easily walk to just about any major attraction or restaurant in the city. It‚Äôs ridiculously close to the Magnificent Mile and all it has to offer. Depending how fast you walk, about a 15 minute walk to the lakeshore. And tons of restaurants abound in the area, from dressy and expensive to mid-range and business casual to casual family-oriented places (Rainforest Cafe, Hard Rock, etc.).  The breakfast buffet was great compared to other breakfast offerings I‚Äôve seen at other mid-range hotels. There was always a scrambled egg and cheese option, a

Large suite rooms. Full kitchens, lots of electrical outlets, strong wifi signal, evening social with real food. Beds are comfortable. Located near a city mall with lots of restaurants and food options nearby.

Great location with a comfortable room and the evening social was a nice addition. The room was clean with nice spaces. The space for the breakfast and social was terrific. The quality of the food was not superb for all parts..maybe a bit better quality coffee or wine available would be nice. It was very convenient in it's location and the staff were polite, friendly and professional.

This hotel is located within easy walking distance of shops and restaurants. The rooms are so spacious we were able to hold committee meetings in them. The staff is very friendly and the breakfast and evening food offerings are good.

Comfortable living from home with welcoming, attentative, and helpful staff.  Nicely sized rooms, breakfast, workout space and pool. Only two elevators -- so if you're visiting at a busy time there's a bit of wait.I find the kitchen table a great place to work before or after meetings.

Location is great for Michigan Ave and is near the river so you could also walk to Millennium Park.  Every staff member was incredibly helpful and sweet -- from doorman to front desk to breakfast attendant.  The city views from this hotel are amazing -- from breakfast/reception area to the pool to the rooms.  We stayed on the 19th floor which was down the hall from the pool and we loved the peaceful vibe of the pool and again -- that view!  The breakfast bar is a cut above others and the Monday-Thursday manager's reception includes free wine and basically dinner.  When you consider all this free food, the hotel is an amazing bargain!  Also, checking your bags for early arrival or late departure is very easy.  The set-up with kitchen and bedroom is great.  Love everything about

Great place.  Very well located in Chicago spacious room  and good breakfast.    I would definitely stay at this hotel next time in Chicago.     Service was very good   Two blocks away from Michigan av  The gym is not as good as I expected.   Could be better

Everything was good, I  would definitely recommend it. Good room quality, nice staff, great pool with really warm water. Breakfast and evening social were great, the food was tasty. The only annoying thing  is the mandatory 200 characters review obligation.

I've stayed at this hotel at least twice on my routine trips to Chicago, and I can't say enough great things about it! On our recent stay, we had a very early flight arrival. I called to inquire about leaving our bags with the valet so we could enjoy the city until our room was ready. We arrived at the hotel around 9am, and they actually let me check into my room! No extra charge, no hassle. The guest services agent was extremely friendly and accommodating. (If management is reading this, the associate was working 7-3 / AM shift on Friday, 1/24). There were 2 agents at the desk, but unfortunately, I cannot remember the name of the person that checked us in. The other agent was also allowing a guest to check in early due to the same situation, so both get 5 stars! Please be sure

This hotel is a a GREAT location. Very centrally located. The rooms are comfy and of good size. Mattress was a bit hard for our liking, but might be good for others. There were a few parties we could hear but considering the room stayed pretty quite.

The location was excellent, right next to Eataly. Lots of great restaurants and shopping in walking distance. Staff were friendly. Complete hot breakfast and an evening meal with beer and wine are provided. Full kitchen and large room.

We checked in to the 17th floor for a 6 night stay.  The hotel and room was very clean.  Check- in was friendly and fast.  The front doors off the street need some lubrication and service. On occasion a doorman would open.   The room was nice. Beds were comfortable.   Simple and minimally furnished.  The kitchen was a very nice feature but could have used some more cookware and utensils. Housekeeping cleaned everyday including the dishes.  The bathroom needed a little repair as the ceiling Sheetrocker/ spackle was damaged. Also the towel rack kept falling off the wall each time a towel was placed on.   The gym is small but functional. Free weights up to 50‚Äôs.  The pool was warm and well maintained. The view from the pool level (19th floor) is great.   Breakfast was good and

We checked in around 4pm, got ready and left for dinner. It wasn‚Äôt t until we returned from dinner and started fixing the sofa bed into a bed for the kids when we noticed large dried blood on the side of the sofa, we then looked over the sofa linens we just put on the sofa bed and realized theres dried blood on the sofa blanket. How disgusting!!!! I immediately contacted the front desk and someone came up and offered to move us to another room. All the kids wanted to do was go swim. However, we repacked and move to another room. I asked the hotel worker what will be done to compensate for the inconvenience and disgusting bodily fluids left in the contact of my 2 young children. She said some snacks, I explained we just ate and have snacks. She then said she will see what could

I can‚Äôt say enough about this hotel. Clean, comfortable rooms, in the heart of downtown Chicago (close to Michigan Ave, Eataly, great restaurants) for a very reasonable price. My family also appreciated the free happy hour (beer, wine and light dinner) and breakfast. The staff was exceptional and extremely accommodating.

Excellent location, staff is over the top friendly.  I will book my next stay in Chicago at the Hilton Homewood Suites.  The rooms are great, very clean.  They do allow pets, which is great.  I am looking forward to my next trip to Chicago (next time leisure trip).

I would definitely book this hotel again. I love the social from 5-7pm and the complimentary breakfast. I had a room with a city view and I loved it. My bed was very comfortable and I love that the kitchen in my room had all the utensils I needed if I wanted to cook.

Family gathering in Downtown Chicago with our family from Spain.  We enjoyed the location and its proximity to a market, Michigan Ave. Shopping, and even Navy Pier.  It is a well kept property with great service, including a meal or two on the weekdays.

I will start with the good, the breakfast and evening social during the week were fantastic and the breakfast/evening social staff were extremely friendly and helpful.   The bad was both rooms we had contained multiple issues with the bathroom and windows. The tubs in both rooms were cracking badly. The second room we had the shower drain was so slow it covered your feet. Our toilet sounded like the little engine that could every time you flushed. Our window would not close for two days.  We encountered attitude when we tried to get a new room and still had problems with the second room. They did address the issues when we checked out but room issues caused the stay to not be as enjoyable as it could have been.

Overall location and cleanliness of the room was good. We have stayed at many different hotels in the are. We like this one the best as the proximity to shopping, eating and night life was the best. We would definately stay at this hotel again

Very close to many tourist sites, restaurants and shops. Also was very convenient to my work as well as train stops making it easy to get around. Parking is expensive, so being near the train makes traveling to and from the airport was cheap and easy.

I would recommend this hotel for its location, price, and overall quality.  The location is fantastic, just off Michigan Avenue.  The breakfast was good, the staff was excellent, and the rooms were spacious.  On the downside, the elevators were always crowded, the rooms are a little dated, and the hotel was a bit cramped.

Was a great experience and friendly staff. Clean rooms. Will recommend and be back for the future. Cleanliness was great. Great location for walking distance and very convenient for everything  Rate a excellent  trip

Only 2 elevators, slow and packed.  Rooms were hot, thermo didn‚Äôt work. Beds were uncomfortable. Sheets felt they were made of plastic and fitted sheet kept popping off.  More attention to detail while cleaning needed, in rooms and hallways, pool etc. happy hours were great!   Variety each night and beer/wine.  Breakfast was mostly the same each day and not very impressive.  I would stay again just bc of location, happy hour and price.  Just be ready to take stairs.

We picked this location based on its location and the size of the room which was actually a suite. The suite was larger than our first apartment! The kitchen area had a big refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher and cooktop. There is plenty of room to store luggage and shopping bags. We used valet parking which was fast and attentive. We found it strange that when we walked in the only thing in the lobby was the valet attendant, you have to go up to the 6th floor to check in. This hotel is within easy walking distance of shopping and dining. The pool area has a great view.

Our kids want to move out of our house and into the suite. Homewood Suites has spoiled us. We can't stay in a normal room now. And we can't book a suite with any other chain because they are too expensive. So you really have no other options, just Homewood Suites.

This is the second year in a row that I¬¥ve stayed there. The attention of bellboy and reception is just ok. Although the servers and kitchen people, very good. Mostly what I like is how close it is from everything, easy to walk to a lot of places and the rooms are very comfortable.

I surprised my 6-year-old daughter with an overnight stay in downtown Chicago. She loved the city views, cracking the window open and hearing the city sounds and most of all, the indoor rooftop pool. The breakfast was far better than most hotel continental breakfasts and the staff was fantastic. The pool was a bit crowded and chilly, but we still enjoyed it. The location was amazing. The red line train is very close, it was fun to walk to the nearby shops and I saved a great deal of money on parking by using the SpotHero app instead of using the hotel's valet service. It's walking distance to Rainforest Cafe, which was a hit with my daughter. The room was very clean and the price I paid was a great value for the area. I highly recommend this hotel and will keep it in mind for my

This hotel is relaxing and has great amenities! Staff is very nice and helpful. The free dinner socials and breakfasts are some of the best complimentary meals we have had!! Definitely worth the stay!

Spent 2 nights here for business (Monday and Tuesday nights) and was very happy with the stay. Check-in a breeze, lobby beautiful and just sorry I had to leave too early for breakfast and did not get to experience the snacks from 5-7pm. Room clean, comfortable, great view, quiet, good temperature. Nice to have a big fridge, and the table was good for using my laptop, plus there were many outlets for charging all my devices. I will definitely be back.

We had 3 reservations for 3 rooms. We travel with grandkids and when they get up they come in our room so they don't wake up the others. Must have rooms together. Called 3 times and still were not together when we checked in. Said there wasn't anything they could do. Never again.

Great hotel at an amazing location in downtown. Rooms come in studio apartment-style and offer a nice value for money. The room came with free breakfast which was good. It will definitely be my first choice to stay in Chicago.

A very nice choice if you want to be as close to the Magnificent Mile as to the best restaurants, department stores and the Red Line that will take you to any sport stadium in town. Nice suites with full kitchen, king size bed, gym and pool available on the top floor and excellent breakfast and managers reception at the end of the work day. Friendly and helpful staff adds to the nice experience. Highly recommended!

We had pleasant stay. Location was good, loved the complementary breakfast. Especially this location loved it more. Their Thanksgiving dinner was AWESOME.  it was very homely and Serving staff were amazing. We had a bit of problem on the black Friday in suite service. Otherwise overall very nice experience for me and my family

Lots of fun in Chicago!  The staff was great. We arrived before check in from the train, we dropped off our bags and checked in.  We were happy to find that a room was available. Unfortunately it looked as though it hadn‚Äôt been thoroughly cleaned. Housekeeping eventually took care of it, and the rest of the stay was great. Great location, great breakfast and evening social was a pleasant surprise. Also, Having kitchen to use helped so much!

The staff was amazing and the view was incredible. However the room was furnished with cheap furniture that went way below the standards of the Hilton Hotels. Bed was hard and uncomfortable, the couch was a pull out and the cushions were so thin you could feel the springs and the temperature you couldn‚Äôt control no matter what you did..up or down with the temp and nothing happens either it was too cold or too hot.

Our family was lodging at Homewood Suites Chicago Grand Ave last weekend and found this facility a great find. For the price of the stay, we found the breakfasts provided to be over our expectations. Jeremy, the breakfast porter made our stay very pleasant and treated us like family. The location on Grand Avenue was great as it was centrally located to the shopping on Michigan Ave as well as convenient access to the Chicago mass transit system.  One thing we value is the way the staff treats their guests. Concierge Sammy was particularly friendly and helpful for what we needed. An added perk to this facility was the small kitchen facilities that we used to make sure our grandchildren had their snacks and eats. If I could give this a 6-star rating, I definitely would.

The hotel was amazingly located, the room were very clean and spacious, the staff was friendly and always willing to help.  the only recommendation would be to offer soft boiled eggs, or freshly fried eggs.

Rooms have plenty of room to spread out, and full kitchen accommodations add to the allure.  The staff was exceptional friendly and made sure all needs were met. Breakfast and night social hour included.  Highly recommend this location.

As an annual visitor to Chicago to watch the Bears (who by the way are just so bad!!), could be off visiting the awesome city of Chicago. This is my 3rd visit to Homewood suites within the last year, they have never disappointed. On this particular visit i had the studio suite, it was perfect. Complimentary breakfast is really good, the staff on front desk are always so helpful. Better yet its next door to my favourite steak restaurant Joe‚Äôs. Not the even the visit of Trump on his first visit to Chicago since he took office when I was there, would put me off returning to East Grand Hilton.

Close to many fun restaurants and things to do. Rooms clean and nice but bedsheets are stiff and rough to sleep on. Complimentary breakfast was ok, not great options for anyone with food allergies though.

Had a quick one night stay over in Chicago. This is my third trip that I have stayed at this location and always enjoy myself. Only downfall is the elevators are a bit slow, but the staff more than make up for it. Staff in the Evening Social and Breakfast area are amazing, always look forward to speaking with them. The food selection is always great as well.

This was the first time we visited Chicago and we know and trust Hilton suites when we are new to a place.  The hotel ticked all the boxes, had spacious rooms with a decent size kitchen/utilities so we did a fair bit of shopping at the local Jewel Osco (my daughter loved the little shopper trolleys, why doesnt everyone do them).  Rooms were fitted out to a high standard and i suspect the carpets were brand new due to the amount of static shocks we were getting everytime we touched each other or door handles - zap.  Breakfast was one of the best ive had in a long time, the choice and quality superb.  As others have mentioned location was great and we managed to fit in a visit to Billy Goat Tavern which was just up the road!

I highly recommend Homewood Suites, it's just north of the Loop, a block from Michigan Avenue and perfectly located for easy access to shopping, dining, and all of Chicago's great attractions. The rooms are very quiet and comfortable, with plenty of space. The views are great as well!

Excellent location.  A short walk to Michigan Avenue,  Millennium Park,  Navy Pier.  Great restaurant's all around.  Friendly and helpful staff. If you're looking to stay in downtown Chicago, give Homewood Suites a call.

Excelent hotel for the price and centrally located in Chicago. very close to public transportation if you did not want to rent a car.  Hotel staff was very freindly and accomodating and rooms were very  clean and comfortable.

We had a very nice experience at this hotel. We have 6 in our family, and we fit comfortably in the suite. There is a nice kitchenette if you want to eat in. The staff was very friendly, even the bell guys at the front door. They offer a free hot breakfast in the morning, which was nice, so we didn't have to worry about eating out for breakfast. Location is great, and right in the middle of everything.  About a 15 minute walk to Navy Pier. We would definitely stay here again!

The hotel location is great but I was told due to their online pricing policy, the hotel sells out and they WALK customers to another hotel.  When I got there they said oops we sold out and have to put you in a room next to a family (noisy kids) and zero upgrades and the breakfast area was PACKED with people (had to go eat outside the hotel) and the food was really cheap and reheated from a packet, bag or box.  Not a good hotel, just a good location.  Sad :-(

I recently stayed 5 nights at this property while attending a convention in Chicago.  The downtown location is near many restaurants, the river, and the Magnificent Mile.  It offers the standard Homewood rooms, which appear to have been recently renovated.  Mine was very clean and well maintained.  Be prepared for quite a bit of noise from the street....sirens through most of the night.  The inside of the hotel is quiet.  The included breakfast was pretty good, probably better than average for Homewood.  My only complaint was that the bananas were over-ripe to the point of being mush.  There's a small gym on the 19th floor.  The equipment is OK but the TV on the elliptical didn't work (a common problem).  Regardless of a couple of small problems, I'd certainly go back.

Very pleased with the cleanliness and the location of this hotel! Will definitely stay again! Also, it is right around the corner from Eataly, one of the best places to eat and grab an excellent cup of coffee!

I recently stayed at the Homewood Suites by Hilton in Downtown Chicago and really enjoyed my stay.  The entrance could be a bit tough to find as it is only marked my a street level double door and and awning. You actually take the elevator up to the 6th floor to check in.    Every member of the staff was very friendly, from the valets, to the front desk to the people who served breakfast.  The hot breakfast was very good and varied everyday. There is even an evening cocktail hour with free wine, beer and tea or coffee. The offer a light meal as well that was unexpected and tasty.   The only reason not to give this hotel a 5 star rating is the room is rather plain. I liked it, and it met my needs, but nothing lavish. But it was clean which i prefer. I also had a great view of the

Spent another birthday at this location based on my pleasant and previous satisfactory stay.  Reserved a Two Queen Beds One Bedroom Suite which was spacious.  However, the living area sofa pillows were flat and uncomfortable and it was difficult to stand after sitting because the sofa is so low.  The furniture could use a serious update (Room 1108) because it is so beaten down.   Betcha carpeting would be brighter and fresher if shampooed.  Bathroom area is very large and  blah with a too low toilet seat.   Location is great and Happy Hour is "Happy", due to the gentleman named "Jeremy".  Food was also good, plentiful and filling.   Beds are comfortable and a door separates bedroom and living area.  Full sized refrigerator was a plus, worked well to chill our snacks, drinks.

Stayed for five nights while husband attended conference. Close to restaurants, stores and riverside. Arrived late and after check in the assigned room had a view of the parking garage.  Called to front desk and spoke with Mel who had checked us in and was super friendly and welcoming. After explaining I would be spending time in room she was able to reassign to upper floor room with a great view of the city and even came up to room and escorted us to our new home away from home. Made the overall experience exceptional.  Only drawback was included breakfast was not friendly for diet.

My stay was very pleasant, the staff was helpful and polite, my room was clean and comfortable. The hotel is located close to fabulous restaurants that are within walking distance. I recommend this hotel for anyone visiting this area of Chicago.

This hotel is very convenient to the Red Line L Train stop Grand/State. Very friendly staff, great breakfast and a 24 hour coffee station with  good coffee creamer. You can take the Orange line L train from Midway and switch to the Red Line at Roosevelt to Grand/ State for $3.00.

The Homewood Suites is conveniently located in the River North area, across from Nordstrom and the attached shopping complex. The service is excellent, from sales, to front desk, to valet, to housekeeping, to the attendants at breakfast and happy hour.

Location: perfect Service: perfect Beds: king size too soft and sofa bed not comfortable (sorry but it was awful) Breakfast: wow!!!! Super good Staff: super friendly Rooms: great views, complete and equiped kitchen, king size bed, black-out windows, dining table, modern, great!! Pool: warm and with a 19th floor view!  Would definitely stay there again!!!

Other than the location, I would not recommend staying here.  The A/C is our room was noisy (but rarely produced cool air) and the beds were very uncomfortable.  Broken doors, broken toilet, incredibly slow elevators - the list goes on.

We stayed here for 8 nights. The room had a large bed with dressing area, wardrobe, bathroom, lounge, kitchen and dining table. Very well placed hotel. Hotel is very clean and all the staff we met were very pleasant.  Breakfast is excellent and Monday to Thursday evenings they have an evening meal with wine or draught beer which you help yourself to. Food was great. We enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this hotel.

We arrived to a warm welcome from Erin at reception.  She was really helpful.  Our suite was very clean and spacious.  Breakfast was very nice.  The evening social between 17.00 and 19.00 was a very nice addition.  Nice snack food , wine and beer. Really recommend this hotel. It's also a great location,  u can walk to Bavy pier and river walk fairly close by

Really enjoyed our stay. We arrived to a very warm welcome from Erin, who was amazing.  Our suite was fab and really spacious.  The view from our window was fab,  trump tower and wriggle buildings. Beautiful at nite. The breakfast was very tasty and the social nights Monday to Thursday were at great addition and surprise, tasty snacks , wine and beer, free from 17.00 to 19.00

This is our 4th trip to Chicago and first one not in the loop. I like the location of this hotel. Lots of restaurants and a short walk to Michigan Ave and 1 block to the red line. Room is clean and reasonably fresh. For a suite, it‚Äôs small, but plenty for two. A family of 4 would be tight. Main drawback for me was no safe in the room. In a large city that would seem to be a basic requirement. Wound up having to carry my backpack with laptops all weekend. Wouldn‚Äôt stay here again due to that. Breakfast area was bright and well maintained. Food was ok. There was a young man there who provided excellent service with a great attitude. Should have gotten his name.

We checked in to the 17th floor for a 6 night stay.  The hotel and room was very clean.  Check- in was friendly and fast.  The front doors off the street need some lubrication and service. On occasion a doorman would open.   The room was nice. Beds were comfortable.   Simple and minimally furnished.  The kitchen was a very nice feature but could have used some more cookware and utensils. Housekeeping cleaned everyday including the dishes.  The bathroom needed a little repair as the ceiling Sheetrocker/ spackle was damaged. Also the towel rack kept falling off the wall each time a towel was placed on.   The gym is small but functional. Free weights up to 50‚Äôs.  The pool was warm and well maintained. The view from the pool level (19th floor) is great.   Breakfast was good and

We checked in around 4pm, got ready and left for dinner. It wasn‚Äôt t until we returned from dinner and started fixing the sofa bed into a bed for the kids when we noticed large dried blood on the side of the sofa, we then looked over the sofa linens we just put on the sofa bed and realized theres dried blood on the sofa blanket. How disgusting!!!! I immediately contacted the front desk and someone came up and offered to move us to another room. All the kids wanted to do was go swim. However, we repacked and move to another room. I asked the hotel worker what will be done to compensate for the inconvenience and disgusting bodily fluids left in the contact of my 2 young children. She said some snacks, I explained we just ate and have snacks. She then said she will see what could

I can‚Äôt say enough about this hotel. Clean, comfortable rooms, in the heart of downtown Chicago (close to Michigan Ave, Eataly, great restaurants) for a very reasonable price. My family also appreciated the free happy hour (beer, wine and light dinner) and breakfast. The staff was exceptional and extremely accommodating.

Excellent location, staff is over the top friendly.  I will book my next stay in Chicago at the Hilton Homewood Suites.  The rooms are great, very clean.  They do allow pets, which is great.  I am looking forward to my next trip to Chicago (next time leisure trip).

I would definitely book this hotel again. I love the social from 5-7pm and the complimentary breakfast. I had a room with a city view and I loved it. My bed was very comfortable and I love that the kitchen in my room had all the utensils I needed if I wanted to cook.

We booked a night here following our wedding reception and everything was lovely. I did not realize it at the time of check in but when I had mentioned that we were getting married, the person at the check in desk upgraded us to a suite! Absolutely did not expect that, and it made preparing for the wedding much easier.

The staff, hotel and rooms are BY FAR superior to any we‚Äôve stated at in the area! The Executive King Suite made it possible to put our 2 year old to sleep in the bedroom easily with the sound machine and doors that shut. My husband was able to get up early to work without waking our son. The suite is HUGE with special features like motion lights under the nightstands that light up at night when you get up to use the restroom. The staff has been extremely caring and remembered our family from our visit last month and ensured we had a quiet room because they knew my son had a hospital stay. If I had a suggestion it would be to put in a bigger fridge and add a microwave to the room. The room is huge and could easily accommodate some other appliances that would help with extended

Hotel location is very good , animations and overall service was great , room was clean , but the hotel was kind of not occupied because of Pandamic For COVID 19 , but the hotel precautions was really good

The check in staff were friendly, the room comfortable. We did have issues with breakfast service (so slow) but the food selection was very good. The location is right in the middle of everything so would recommend.

Very nice hotel and in great location with friendly and helpful staffs and amazing service!!  Upgraded to a suite with gorgeous views and enjoyed bottles of wine and ros√© sent up to our suite. Enjoyed going to the jacuzzi - relax our bodies from walking miles and miles.  Ate only once at Level Two Restaurant and it was great! - tasty and delicious food. Came a couple times for drinks though, everytime we go out to do sightseeing and coming back- bartender‚Äôs so friendly and makes really good cocktails.  We‚Äôre definitely going to stay here again if we ever go back to Chicago.

City view room on 16th floor was beautiful. We enjoyed the room and location. Hotel traffic was low due to Covid and it gave us a chance to experience the peace and beauty of the hotel. The staff was helpful and pleasant. The Starbucks is also right there in the lobby. The only thing missing (a small miss) is a microwave.

Spent three nights (family trip -- taking son back to college).  While the hotel feels fairly dead (restaurant/bar shut, which is different from when we were here at the start of COVID procedures when they were doing "pick up bagged meals"), things worked really well.  The hot tub and pool were open for single-group-at-a-time usage (reservations on the hour for a 50-minute block followed by sanitizing) -- we enjoyed that every day (not hard to find an open time).  No maid service in-stay, but easy to get towels, toiletries, or whatever from the front desk.  Staff friendly, COVID taken seriously, and a very good location.

I arrived in for the first in  Chicago and It was then I was informed that my reservation at THE TALBOTT HOTEL was cancelled by mistake my them, the told me  could not accommodate me because they were already book and had no intention of honoring the reservation. This was my first time in Chicago and can you imagine not knowing where you are going to stay at 9:30 pm at night?   I contacted the HYATT reservations and they were able to get us,  a last minute reservation at HYATT Centric Magnificent Mile. From the moment I was put in contact with the Manager Adam, it was an exceptional service during my entire stay. Though understandably limited on staff due to COVID-19 restrictions, they did not miss a beat on any request or assisting with any questions or concerns. They were

We were here the night before a procedure at Northwestern. We had a corner king room and it was lovely. Great bed, nice bathroom, good A/C. We were very comfortable and enjoyed our stay! Thank you for making an unpleasant trip better :) We will definitely be back as this hotel is a great location for a staycation  trip too!

We had a great trip, liked this hotel a lot. All of the employees were great except out first encounter with the front desk. We booked 2 queens and when we showed up at 10 pm they did not have the room type we reserved they could give us a king with a roll away or we could leave. The clerk was very rude about it. Finally a nice lady came over and was very apologetic, bought us breakfast and guaranteed the correct room for the rest of our stay. When we got our roll away housekeeping delivered it to the hall and left.

The Hyatt Centric is a really nice hotel and the location is so convenient to Northwestern Hospital.  I had an extended stay here while a family member was hospitalized.  The staff at the Centric were very helpful and always kind.  The Centric is also a short walk to Magnificent Mile.  So may shops and great restaurants nearby.  I will definitely stay here again...hopefully for fun next time!

We spent four nights here to celebrate my birthday.   The hotel is very nice, the room was comfortable and quiet, and the restaurant was great.   All the employees were very friendly and helpful.   I highly recommend reserving a room with breakfast for two included--it is a great bargain.   The hotel is within walking distance of many places you might want to use--a Walgreeens is right across the street in the Northwestern University Hosptial Building,  a Starbucks is located in the same building as the hotel, and there are several excellent restaurants close by.

I have stayed at the Hyatt on St. Claire in Chicago a couple of times now and have enjoyed my stay very much.  The staff is wonderful, the hotel is in a prime location in the city tucked a block off Michigan Ave. so pretty quiet and still centrally located to shopping and dining, etc... The rooms are comfortable and equal in value to the price.  Will stay again and again when I visit Chicago.

Really enjoyed the hotel. We spent only one night, but the hotel was over my expectations. Everything was high end and conforfotable. The hotel.is very well located, central Magnificent Mile with a lot of restaurants, stores around. It was a great experience.

Bed and pillows were very uncomfortable. Ear plugs in the room since you‚Äôre next to a hospital. Hotel food wayyyy over priced. The only plus is the Starbucks downstairs. I would not stay here again!!!!

The hubby and I stayed here from 12/31/19 to 1/2/2020. We booked this hotel very early on, knowing that ourselves and friends would be attending the Resolution Gala at Navy Pier for New Year's Eve. We all managed to get hotels in walking distance from one another, but our friends and family were very jealous of our room. Our room was the meet up point, before heading it. We stayed in a very nice suite, and our room, plus the hotel itself  was very nice. A lot of things were in walking distance, like restaurants,  and stores, which made things very easy, because traffic was crazy those days. The price rate was great considering the time of year, and everything that was going in the city that day. My only issue with this hotel was that it was a lot going on when we came back on

This hotel was in a great location, right near shopping and plenty of restaurants. A pool, fitness center, bar/restaurant were all on site. I did not eat at the hotel restaurant but did enjoy a drink. The pool and hot tub were clean, and I really like  the fitness facility (they had great treadmills). The room was cozy, just what we needed. The room had a sound machine, which was great. I dislike the Keurig coffee machine in the room, I prefer a good old fashion coffee machine, but that's just my preference.  I booked through Expedia and booked a package with parking included, it was a great deal. Definitely look into this if you will be traveling by car.

Our soaps were used in the shower which made us wonder if our room was clean. My $22 salad had wilted lettuce and the $27 breakfast buffet had only one broken toaster available.  Parking was overpriced at $72 per night.

I was in town for a wedding and this was one of the hotels where they were holding rooms for wedding guests.   I picked this one because of it's location.  It's right near the Magnificent Mile, great for shopping, walking, food and entertainment.   Upon arrival, everyone was very friendly.  I especially liked that I could check in online and they let me know when my room was ready, earlier than the 3 p.m. check-in. Nice lobby, clean and open, plenty of places to sit and bar.   Room was clean and comfortable.  Had many extras, hairdryer, make-up mirror, iron, ironing board, safe in closest, coffee machine, robe, etc. I was able to check out online and grabbed a bite at their restaurant before leaving hotel.  Hotel prices but had a very good veggie omelette with toast and potatoes

Stayed here while visiting family. Beautiful hotel and great staff. Just one block off Michigan Ave, a nice 15 minute walk to Navy Pier. Nice bar and lobby with a Starbucks attached. If visiting anyone at or leaving near Northwestern Medical center this is the place to stay. Rooms are large clean and Modern. Staff is helpful and friendly. Highly recommended.

The room I was in had very little heat and it was 13 degrees out. The towels are rough. Someone stole something from the bathroom that I had left on the sink. It wasn't very expensive but still... Otherwise the hotel is in a great part of town and walking distance to where I had to go.

The Hyatt Centric Chicago Magnificent Mile is one of the finest hotels in the heart of downtown Chicago.  The location is exceptional and is within steps of the Magnificent Mile.  For those who are not familiar with downtown Chicago, take it from a veteran Chicago travel expert, the Hyatt Centric Chicago Magnificent Mile will not disappoint on any level.  Moreover, if you're a clean freak, like me, you will surely appreciate the well appointed and impeccably spotless guest rooms.  Treat yourself to an Executive Suite...But...if you'd like to keep things simple, the basic guest rooms are roomy and extremely comfortable too!

Check-in starts at 3PM. We checked in early via our phone, noting we would be there at 3:30PM.  We arrived at 3:30PM and were told our room would be ready in a few minutes.  45 minutes later...  No communication regarding the delay.  No compensation offered.  A drink ticket would have been a nice gesture.    Our room was directly across from the ER entrance and we heard ambulances every 10-15 minutes throughout the night.  There are earplugs available at the front desk.   The pool room was nice for families but do not plan a romantic trip here. The hot tub is close to the pool which makes for getting splashed in the face while you are soaking.

I had several medical exams ay Northwestern Medical Facilities. The location of the Hyatt was idea for this and several other visits.Aaron and the Manager Patrick were great but was was the entire staff. This was my second visit. I will definitely stay at the hotel on future visits.

Nice hotel - friendly helpful staff and clean.  View of downtown from our room was awesome.  We drove so parking was expensive, but not unexpected.  Check in and out was a breeze and the sights of Chicago are within walking distance.

Everyone was very accommodating and nice!  Very friendly service the whole week I was there!  Thank you for making me feel at home when I was there!  I'm definitely going to stay here if I ever go back to Chicago :)

If getting a suite with sofa bed.  Don‚Äôt.  Sofa bed exceptionally uncomfortable.  Hotel did not offer any practical solutions as we were traveling with kids.  Location depends on where you get the room. Emergency room of the hospital is just in front of the hotel.

Staff was absolutely amazing the GM should be proud. They truly demonstrate what Hyatt hospitality is all about! If you have an event Ruben and Angelica* will definitely take care of your group. I am on Keto and they catered to my dieting needs very well. Service is Above and beyond!!!

Nice hotel, very friendly and offered good service! Great location - conveniently located close to shopping and restaurants.  Also, Walking distance to many places you may want to visit - museums, art galleries, etc.

Location is great for heading out to Michigan Avenue. Valet Parking is very expensive onsite but alternative lots are within walking distance will save at least $50 to $75 for a two night stay. I would plan on venturing out for dining as well.

I am going on my 21st hotel in Chicago since Jan 3rd and decided to add the World of Hyatt to my list. The 2 nights prior to arriving to this hotel I stayed at Hyatt Regency on Wacker. Great experience so I thought I'd try Hyatt Centric. Well.... the idea was there. Unfortunately. it has left me very frustrated and overall to be a let down. The location is great. Views are mostly blocked by surrounding buildings and Northwestern Hospital is next door (be aware there will be frequent sirens) both of which didn't phase me as a night shift nurse. The rooms are also really great. Aside from the walls being paper thin and hearing your neighbors (1st night-couple fighting on valentines day, 2nd night-screaming children until about 9), I can't complain about room.   The Service on the

Great property and we would definitely stay there again, my wife really enjoyed the much needed getaway and rest. Close to shopping on the Mag Mile in Chicago made it a memorable celebration and experience

It is located directly across street from Galtor Pavillion & next to Lavin Pavillion. Only about a block or so away from Shirley Ryan. I highly reccomend it for the location when you have a full schedule of doc apts. They do have a hot tub & pool, fitness center. Lobby is located on 2nd floor. The staff was very accommodating!   My doctors needed me in for an MRI last minute apt. After speaking with the awesome staff they made it possible for me to make it to my MRI and not worry about hurrying back to checkout. It all worked out well. In fact I was so happy with my experience I booked my next stay with them. You can't beat the location when you need breaks in between apts I was able to go back an take a nap/rest instead of waiting at hospital for next apt. Had plenty of time to

I was in town for business but would definitely come back to this location for a pleasure trip. The location is great, a few blocks from shopping, walk/run trails, restaurants and transportation. Great staff too.

January in Chicago isn‚Äôt exactly high time for travelers, and the price fairly reflected that. This is a very nice hotel for a great price. I mean, we‚Äôre talking $100 or just a bit less, and I felt like I was getting 4 star services. The room is clean and comfortable. A walk in shower, and large bathroom. They also had a white noise machine in the room, which I appreciated more than anything I have EVER found in a hotel room (no joke). I use one at home and usually don‚Äôt have room to pack one on the road, so to find that noise maker in my room pretty much sold me on this hotel for every downtown stay I have in the future. Sometimes it‚Äôs the smallest of things that make the difference.

Hotel rooms were clean and had just about everything you need. Wish it had a microwave but other that good. Bathroom was large and came with good soaps and shampoo. We were on the 14th floor so noise was minimum.

It was conveniently located to the Northwestern Hospital allowing me to visit a family member daily.  It assured that I was able to spend quality time with the patient while being cared for at the Hyatt Centric.

I recently stayed at the Hyatt Centric Mag Mile for a business meeting.  What a fantastic hotel in a great location.  The staff couldn't have been more friendly if they tried.  Everyone I came into contact with was incredibly helpful and super friendly.  The hotel itself is beautiful with wonderfully decorated and comfortable rooms.  Room service was prompt, and options are plentiful.  The location of the hotel is great, with several wonderful restaurants within walking distance.  This will be my go-to hotel for Chicago trips in the future!

Business meetings, room seemed to be newly renovated but in fact it had been a few years. speaks to the level of cleanliness and maintenance the room are held to. Good outlet and charging support at the desk. the night stand could use outlet ports but was able to work around that. Good bar and Starbucks on property.

I brought my family to this hotel to stay the night after several activities with the kids and the experience was wonderful.  The room was clean and the pool was great too!  We'd definitely stay here again in the future!

We really enjoyed the Hyatt.  Our room on the 9th floor was quiet and had all the amenities we would expect.  Even a white noise machine which was a fantastic bonus we hadn't counted on but were glad to have.  The elevator situation is a little odd seeing as how you must take an elevator from the street level to the lobby (2nd floor) and then walk to a second bank of elevators just to access rooms.  Not super inconvenient, just odd.  Overall, we had a great stay.

As expected, I had a great stay with the Hyatt. The hotel is near a hotel so the ambulance siren may disturb some but the hotel does provide a white noise machine in the rooms. I was exhausted at night so slept straight through and was never disturbed by the sirens. It's also in a great location and I felt that I received value for the money I spent.

Loved the location of the hotel. We were right off the magnificent mile and close proximity to all our favorite restaurants! The staff was very friendly and the rooms were very clean! Only negative was the couch mattress.

Hotel walking distance to a lot of tourist sites. My go to hotel when staying in Chicago. Clean rooms, service was good. Great buffet! upgraded to bigger room no extra charge. world Hyatt member. very cheap hotel.

Clean hotel. Room was great. Customer service was excellent and sent text messages checking in. Sent additional towels and sheets within minutes of requesting. Check out was easy (in app). Starbucks in hotel lobby was super convenient.

I stayed here for a conference for two nights. Room was ready early on check in day. The breakfast was outstanding. Clean and comfortable room.Helpful staff. I would definitely return to this location. Easy walk to area restaurants and shops.

All the staff I interacted with were incredibly friendly and helpful, service was always prompt and professional, location was great with plenty of good dining and interesting sites nearby, and rooms were clean, comfortable, and spacious!

We stayed at the Hyatt Centric Mag Mile for my weekend birthday celebration in the city. The staff at the hotel made our stay effortless and truly special. I appreciate the thoughtful attention to detail at this great find in the heart of the Chicago‚Äôs Magnificent Mile. You can be at the center of the action of the city but feel a world away at the Hyatt Centric because the lobby is located off the street level.   The modern d√©cor and attention to detail is what really made this hotel stand apart for us. Our room pampered us with unexpected comforts including: a white noise machine to block out the city sounds at night, motion-activated floor lights that guide you to the bathroom in the dark, DryBar hair dryer, smart televisions, great-sounding wireless speaker system to listen

Looking for a quality stay for a decent price? Look no further - the staff is welcoming and accomodating, you are close by so many things and restaurants. Next to a hospital and being in a city will make for some noise but the complimentary sound machine and ear plugs can help.

The very Best in town. The price is very good and correct. Location, space, building, rooms, quiet, quality, service, people, cleaness, comfort, bed, bath, so everything really really awesome. Enjoy every moment and every single day in my stay. A beautiful place to stay and visit. Im glad to return ASAP.

Large well maintained rooms with thoughtful touches throughout and was also a great price in January. Bar was lively (and had charging points at the bar :). Good WiFi and beds also.  Didn't use the pool/gym but heard they were good. The Beatrix cafe across the road has much better coffee than the awful Starbucks in the foyer. Lots of great food and shopping options in every direction. Would stay again.

Oveall property was clean and amenities were fair. Good location and friendly hotel staff. Marking down due to poor FNB service personnel, general unattentiveness. While my stay was short, I enjoyed the polite service from the desk from check-in until check-out.

We stayed at the Hyatt Centric Magnifecent Mile, and the staff was very kind and helpful. The room was great, the view was perfect and the bed was lovely. The only downside was that the hotel does not recycle.

Hotel exceeded expectations. Highly recommend.Rooms, business center, and food excellent. Loved the Starbucks in the hotel. Bed very comfortable and excellent location for meetings at Northwestern and ShirleyRyan Ability Lab.

Didn't know what to expect. Beyond my expectations. Food was great. Convenience awesome. Clean, comfortable... great staff! Highly recommend this property. Starbucks in the street level was really convenient. Pool and exercise facilities were good enough for a city trip. Overall a relaxing and peaceful trip.

The Hyatt centric magnificent mile in Chicago is by far the best Hyatt hotel in downtown Chicago. Except for the night audit that works overnight at the hotel, her name is Kimberly she is very rude and I wish no one experience what I experience. If you are checking in, look for Debbie the front desk supervisor she will take great care of you!!

Very nice room, not overly elegant but clean and functional.  Great location.   Excellent service from everyone from checking to checkout.   Not too keen on the second floor lobby and having to change elevators every time.

I would like to extend and express our true appreciation and say thank you to all for the incredible, wonderful and excellent customer service provided by each and everyone of your staff during our stay. We were treated like family. Thank you.

The hotel staff were absolutely incredible and welcoming. The decor was top notch. The rooms were what we expected. They even upgraded us to the top floor; free of charge. We will definitely come back to stay.

The staff are exceptional. I will stay here every time I visit the Magnificent Mile. I was given great service and really enjoyed my stay here. Everything in the room worked as it should. The hotel is ideally located and secure. It is just an overall great choice.

I stayed in this hotel with my 3 daughters over the New Year's holiday.  We couldn't be happier with our choice.  The location is excellent, just a short walk to Michigan Ave.  Our room was clean and had a modern decor.  The staff was very friendly.  We did not eat in the restaurant/bar but there was always a crowd there and the atmosphere seemed very inviting.  The pool/hot tub area was crowded but thankfully my girls are old enough that not being able to get in the hot tub was not a huge disappointment.  For as reasonable as the room rates were, I was in no way expecting the level of quality and service we received!  We already want to make this an annual tradition.

This has become my go to hotel when im in Chicago for business. It's a block off Michigan ave. Which means its just enough out of the traffic and chaos of Chicago but still close enough to everything where a Uber ride to the Loop or Lincoln Park is only minutes.   The hotel its self is a pretty standard Hyatt Centric. Friendly staff, definitely leans heavily on the business travelers. Tourists seem to stay more on Michigan ave. Rooms are very clean and updated. Starbucks in the lobby, a little secret, if you dont want to wait in the line which is huge on mornings. Go right next door to Do-Right for Coffee.   The Level Two bar is one of my favorites. It has great views of the city and has a very relaxed atmosphere. Cocktails, wine and beer are typical prices for Chicago. The

Every detail in the room was exceptional, even the ice bucket design, were top notch! Motion sensing nightlights at the foot of the bedside stands were awesome. Staff were so very professional and welcoming. The buffet and late checkout package are a MUST! Daily buffet was incredible and like we were dining at a 5-star restaurant. The silverware practically sparkled! I plan to go back for another getaway.

Starbucks is in the building. It is a few blocks from everything. One block from 7-11. The room is clean and the service is excellent. It may be the most spacious hotel room I see in Chicago. I visit Chicago more than a few times a year. This hotel is my favorite!

Rate including parking: cannot complain! Literally steps from Mag Mile. Modern room, comfortable beds & bathroom with counter that actually fit toiletries for hubby, myself & teenage daughter. Friendly employees.

The location of this hotel COULD NOT be better. It was one block off the Magnificent Mile (Michigan Ave) which means hardly any traffic just outside, super easy and convenient to pull up for valet parking, AND still crazy convenient to all the sites and attractions on the Magnificent Mile (less than 400 ft from the Starbucks Reserve Roastery, in case anyone is curious!). We drove into Chicago from out of state and had no issues getting to/from the hotel. Valet parking is $70/night and you have 24 hour access to your vehicle, which is great. Staff was all very friendly and helpful, the building was clean, modern, cozy and luxurious all at once. We felt very safe (there's a night doorman and you must use a room key to get on the elevator). Bonus, there's a Starbucks in the same

1. Nobody helped us with our luggage or even offered a luggage cart when we first arrived at the hotel. 2. The food at the hotel restaurant was awful (it used to be good). 3. Room service did not bring us a table because there were only two of us. The employee who delivered the meals said this was hotel policy because they have so many rooms and argued with us. We had to insist on a table since there was no other surface in the room to put our plates, cups and glasses and be able to sit down for our meal. 4. The keycard readers in the elevators did not always work.

Everything was Great!! Nice and friendly Staff. The room was beautiful, the bed was very comfortable. The Food was delicious and it is just an overall good looking hotel. I will defiantly stay here again. And I highly recommend this hotel to others.

Great hotel, staff, and location. Was greeted and treated great by all hotel staff. Had a wonderful corner room. Was an added bonus with Starbucks located as you entered the hotel. East check in and checkout

The coffee machine in our room was filthy, so I asked the concierge if my fiance and I could get complimentary coffee. This person said, "I can't do that" and told me to go to Starbucks! Then he told me to pay $30 (per person) for the breakfast buffet. I said that's ridiculous... imo we paid for 4 nights and breakfast shld be free!

This was a Christmas 2019 trip to Chicago staying on a package booked through Expedia. We upgraded to a standard king corner room for a small fee. Well worth it as this provided lots of storage and space for the 6 night stay.   Starbucks on the ground floor was friendly and useful. You need to make your way up to the 2nd floor lobby to check in. Staff was friendly and check in simple. Check out the Windy City display on your left as you enter the lift to your room. 7th floor for us. The room was lovely, clean and spacious. A good view of a bustling Chicago out of the window. Big bathroom, powerful shower over bath and two sinks with all the amenities you may need including a powerful hair dryer, flannels, cotton buds, shower gel, shampoo, body lotion, fluffy towels and bath

The location of this hotel was great. The room was nice but I don't think I would have paid the hotel rate for it though. I am glad that Expedia had a special. We were in the largest suite but there weren't really any additional perks to reserving such a large room.

Awesome in every aspect. Location was fantastic to get to all the places in Chicago. Staff were wonderful and helpful always willing to help out. Restaurant service and food amazing. Plenty of nice places to eat nearby, very close to main strip but you seem to avoid the congestion and noise from it which is a good thing.

This Starbucks has the same great drinks and food I‚Äôve come to expect from Starbucks. The baristas are friendly, and the location is perfect when visiting Northwestern Hospital - right across the street.

This was our first stay at this location.  I liked how close it was to Michigan Avenue and located right in the middle of the magnificent mile.  It was 1 block back, so it afforded a bit more privacy and quiet.  Great restaurants right around the area as well.  We will return!

The room was comfortable and had everything we needed.  The view was beautiful and we loved the location for shopping and museum hopping. The continental breakfast buffet in the onsite restaurant was convenient and delicious.   I'll stay again.

Everything was perfect. Hotel staff was very helpful and did everything more than expected. Cant as for more than what we experienced. Welcome center also gave us a free starbucks gift cards as a welcome note. We tried that in the Roastery chicago.

My whole family came to Chicago and rented 5 rooms at the Hyatt Centrc Magnificent Mile hotel just before Christmas for 3 days/2 nights.. We had the best stay ever! Fabulous location just a block off Michigan Ave, lots of restaurants nearby. The hotel itself is spotlessly clean and modern, rooms beautiful and the mattresses are the best! Staff was very helpful and accommodating of all of our requests. The food in the lounge is great. the grandkids enjoyed the pool and adults the fitness room. We will be returning again!

We had a great stay at the Hyatt Centric.  1 block from the new Starbucks Reserve (which is fantastic!) and close to everything on Michigan Ave.  Took the train in and a quick Uber to the hotel.   Room was clean, staff incredibly friendly and welcoming.

Hyatt Centric is centrally located, just off the Msg Mile. The lounge is cozy. This Hyatt is nice because it is just off the Mag Mile, so it doesn't feel as congested, & it's quieter. There's also a ton of great restaurants & bars within a few blocks.

This hotel is exquisite! Friendly staff, very comfortable, and right in the heart of great restaurant and shopping. Even if you are not a big swimmer be sure to check out the pool, it‚Äôs stunning with lots of architectural details.

Loved the hotel and the service! We came for a weekend getaway trip due to the pandemic eating away at our mental health, and we felt super safe coming here. The front desk workers were super helpful and amazing, and everything was set up so well around the pandemic. Everything was sanitized and clean, and we barely had any contact with guests or workers.

Spent one night here pre-Covid and was very impressed. Clean spacious room up to InterContinental standards. I‚Äôm a Spire Ambassador so quite happy with the upgrade.
