Huge bathroom with powerful shower.   Breakfast downstairs was also excellent and was of high quality. Always thankful for my 4pm check outs as I had a 7pm flight to London. I will definitely stay here again.

The Intercontinental is typically a very nice hotel. However, I have to rate this location a 3 because of the awful stench that hit us upon entry. It smelled like very rotten meat or a dead body in the lobby. I‚Äôm not exaggerating. When we asked an employee about the smell, he pretended he didn‚Äôt smell anything. The smell was in the lobby, only, thank God. The rooms were nice. We had a view of Lake Michigan from our room so that was a plus. After complaining about the smell the next day, it was finally gone the following morning.

Given that I was one of arguably 10 guests in the entire hotel, I cant say I was surprised at how barren the place was. Even the main lobby restrooms were locked. In fact, minus the lobby, starbucks, and the elevators, nothing was open. While the staff were nice, I had a major problem with the couch in my room and the downstairs staff just took it as a nonchalant comment. I was there for several hearings and actually needed the suite living room for work. When my clients pointed out the dirty couch, it was too late to rectify with the staff. Color me surprised that post hoc nothing was done too. The rest of the room was excellent and the internet speeds were the fastest I've ever seen in a hotel, bar none.

The location, room, and staff were outstanding.  From check in to check out the staff was attentive, responsive and gracious. The location was central to museums, shopping, dining, and parks. We look forward to our return visit.

In these strange times, the staff was incredibly professional and friendly.   Safety was clearly a priority.    This hotel has one of the most exceptional indoor pools I have used.  The details from 1929 are so pretty.    Wholeheartedly recommend.

We always love this hotel. The pool is really beautiful and the service is great. They even graciously moved us to a different room (we wanted more windows). The bathroom needed a little TLC, but overall, the hotel and rooms are very clean. Will be staying here again!

This place never disappoints. We love staying here and being well serviced by the hotel and restaurant staff. It‚Äôs got a great location for shopping and most everywhere you would want to eat is just a short ride away.

If you follow our blog RetiredAndTravelling dot com you will fully understand why this property is OUTSTANDING. The  Outstanding Management ensured we were treated like family. Communications with the InterContinental Chicago Magnificent Mile IHG property started before we even got there. Ronald Hoogerbrugge, the Hotel Manager ensured our stay was flawless. He showed outstanding customer service attention when he gave us a tour of this wonderfully historic hotel property.  Outstanding Staff like Mikena, the front desk supervisor answered any problems with great solutions. Douglas provided excellent concierge advice & service.  Ambassador check-in with M was great. Billy curb side convinced us to valet park at hotel - very pleasant and good brand ambassador. Sylvia, a concierge

There was only one person (I believe his name is Gustavo) behind the counter in the lobby.  He was very professional and an excellent representative of IHG. Due to COVID most of the usual activity is gone for now.  However, the hotel is still my favorite in Chicago.

On a weekend trip to Chicago, we chose to stay at the IHG hotel. The location was perfect, InterContinental is right in the center of it all. The service, and the view of the iconic Tribune Tower were among my favorite parts. However, the pool is a must see; beautiful! The pool/gym/spa are was very relaxing.

This hotel made the best of a bad situation during COVID. They took great care of me and my family during our 3 night stay. The fitness center, spa and pool were all open ( and fabulous!) during our stay. Even if you aren't a swimmer you owe it to yourself to check out the amazing tile work in the pool area. Great place to relax and read or even check email! We will be back!

Excellent stay. I have already stayed at the Intercontinental Hotels before in Sydney, Australia.  The same level of professionalism, efficiency exists in all. You have exceeded my expectations. Staff was accessible at all times.I was really impressed on how personable they were despite this pandemic we are facing.

Stayed at this hotel for my sisters birthday and it was amazing! The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. I would stay at this hotel again. We had a total of 3 rooms and the hotel went out of their way to make sure we were all next to each other.

Spacious room, kind staff, and close to everything we wanted to see. We had a noisy family on our hallway, but the staff shushed them quickly. Smart pandemic policies, and good value. We'd stay there again without hesitation.

My family and I stayed for the weekend. The rooms were clean, beds very comfortable and front desk was kind. Unfortunately due to Covid Michael Jordan‚Äôs was closed. The hotel was quiet. We did not used the fitness spa or pool, but it looked amazing!

We loved our 3 day stay. The staff was wonderful. We were walking distance to great restaurants and the Magnificent Mile. We would recommend if you want a luxury feeling stay here. Be sure to take the hotel tour. The swimming pool is beautiful and the view from the lounge is just unbelievable.

The Intercontinental is a great hotel--walking into our room we were wowed!! My daughter is pretty quiet but she was so excited about being there. Great experience great staff. Loved the location of the hotel to the Navy Pier and downtown.

We have stayed at this hotel numerous times and it's always great. This last trip was during Covid 19 and even though things were strange in Chicago, the hotel did not disappoint. The staff (especially Malcolm) is exceptional - friendly, helpful and courteous.

There were three of us, so one of the beds was to fit two. When I signed up, the rooms were listed at having two Queens. When I arrived and checked in, I was asked if I wanted one King or two Queens. I chose two Queens again, but when we got to the room they were clearly Fulls. The next day I told the receptionist that we had Fulls not Queens. She insisted that they were Queens and that the hotel had only Queens and Kings, so I went back to the room and checked the mattress tag. Fulls. Next morning when I checked out I mentioned this, and she insisted that the hotel only had Fulls and Kings. The confusion at the desk was annoying, but if we hadn't been told Queens, we wouldn't have chosen Intercontinental. We didn't sleep well.  Rooms were smaller than expected (compared to

Very satisficed. Not many at the hotel. Restaurants and bars were closed. Sad but understandable. The parking is a problem since it is extremely expensive near Michigan Ave. Rates between $40.00 and $ 55.00 for a 24 hours term is next to outrageous.

Have to qualify this review by saying it was newly opened after Covid-19 shutdown so restaurants not open and no room service or maid service but management very accommodating with fresh towels and trash removal and other requests

Me and my wife are bloggers, we stay at a ton of hotels, and this hotel was by fair amazing. My son wanted to stay at a hotel because the stay at home order was getting to him, and he wanted just to relax somewhere other than our own home. So I decided to book a staycation at IC, and let me tell you it was worth it.  When we arrived during the middle of the night we were greeted by an older gentleman, very nice guy. Before I could even finish he had upgraded me and my wife‚Äôs room. Excited we rushed and went to the room it was nice didn‚Äôt have that ‚Äúold‚Äù smell most people who are doing the reviews stated it smelled wonderful. After sleeping one night in the most comfortable bed I slept in a very long time. I received an email from their Room Controller, Perez to state we had been

Made a last minute reservation the night before my husband's surgery at Northwestern. Due to coronavirus I could not accompany him to the hospital so I needed a place to stay. My regular hotel was booked but there were many rooms available here. Luckily, because of this, they allowed me to check in about 4 hours early and check out the next day about 5 hours late to accomodate my needs since I had to work around my husband's surgery scheduling. Also I received a very nice room upgrade with a view of the city. Everything about the room was excellent, huge, clean, beautiful, upscale, loved the bathroom. Comfortable bed and pillows, just perfect. The hotel felt nearly empty and the restaurants were not serving. Since the city was pretty much shut down I ordered meals on grubhub and

Hi....I booked a trip for May 12.  I went to cancel it today because of COVID.  Im a platinum member.  Sometimes you get stupidity from a place and it takes an email or two to get the hotel to understand things and the good ones "get it".  This one...despite many back and forths is still standing firm.....because i booked a rate that inclued a first night deposit, they would not refund fully despite the fact that i am cancelling because the event i was attending was cancelled because of COVID.  They offered a credit for a future trip to their hotel but i dont have one planned.  I fully intended to attend but i had no way to predict this would happen.  The IHG policy offers full refund for reservations up till April 30...I am two weeks late so they want to profit off of that.

We decided to take a staycation since spring break was cancelled due to the Covid-19 shut in and chose the hotel as they had a pool so our girls could swim. Once we arrived we were treated amazingly! We booked a regular room and since the hotel was not busy during this time they upgraded us to a ‚Äúgynormous‚Äù suite!! We felt like royalty and it really made the loss of spring break less of a bummer. The staff was wonderful!!

Great location in the middle of Michigan Avenue / Magnificent Mile. We were in the old classic tower. Needed to take a second special elevator to get to room. Very cool recommend accepting if offered. Great views. Relatively quiet - could here sirens but that was about it. Some noise from next door unless we closed closed door. Great 25 yard indoor swimming pool. Room has robe, room safe, iron & board.

Everything was perfect - Thank you! Great check in experience with Daniel, service at the bar was fantastic.Room and views are gorgeous. Concierge service is excellent, Thank you Kathy. In room dining service, delivery and food was great. A wonderful weekend and excellent translation of the InterContinental service, I also had the chance to meet with the Director of Front Office  Cintia Becera who was very welcoming! Thank you very much, looking forward to more visits when this Covid19 is over.

I think the rooms can be spruced up a bit. The rooms don‚Äôt match the name. Otherwise everything is top notch. Great guest services, they welcome and accommodate wonderfully. Prime location, close to EVERYTHING. We were there for our anniversary and they took care of us with complimentary wine and a beautiful card. A very pleasant surprise. We would love to stay there again.

We were hosting a meeting at the Intercontinental right when all of the news about Corona came out.  The staff and management of the Intercontinental were so professional and giving during this stressful time for all.

So clean and well kept with such charm ad all of the staff is wonderful... Our doorman Will was just the best, very knowledgeable knowledgeable and helpful..with wonderful suggestions for newbies to Chicago...

I was looking fir a hotel with a good pool fir an overnight withy granddaughter. The Intercontinental was rated in the top five.  Between the high rating and the competitive rate I chose the Intercontinental. I added the family package for $50 more which paid for itself . The staff was super accommodating for me and my granddaughter and she had the time of her life. I appreciate all  the extras   the hotel did for me and  my granddaughter.  For those who are grandparents you know it‚Äôs all ahe grandchildren .   I am booking a stay for May when my daughter can accompany us we are looking forward to our next adventure at the Intercontinental.

Room was very clean. Cleaning service did a good job.  I liked location the most. Right in a heart of Chicago. I got my breakfast to my room and service was perfect - warm food, everything covered.  Definitely recommend!

Excellent location, large room, quiet nights, great shower, everything you need in a hotel. Great for business travel, but I will certainly be bringing my family here on my next trip to Chicago. Best thing about this hotel is the staff, nothing was too much trouble, everything is done with a smile. Highly recommended.

Stayed on the 33rd floor in a King Executive room.  Great view of the river and city especially at night.  Very convenient location for shopping, eating and entertainment.  Valet service was prompt and courteous.  Front desk and bell service was outstanding.

Dear InterContinentalChicago,  I would like to thank your concierge team Sylvia for making sure my plan where in order for a wonderful night out in town! Thanks for having my stay a memorable stay & a shout out to valet for making sure my transportation need where met!

We were staying 3 nights with teenagers and had never booked a suite before.  We stayed in one of the amazing suites and it was perfect.  It was like having a spacious living area completely separate from the sleeping area.  Best part, there were 2 bathrooms! I cannot say enough about this hotel and staff.  I do not have a single complaint.

The location is perfect; the Starbucks attached to the hotel is great for interviews. The hotel staff is extraordinarily professional, from the welcoming check-in to the willingness to answer questions to the check-out and the doorman who helps with bags. I really do not consider any other hotel chain.

The Hotel was in a great location with plenty of great shopping ,restaurants and just plain areas to walk to! The staff was very accommodating, service was excellent, rooms were very comfortable, well kept building with many great features! The  attended convenient parking was a nice feature!

We had the pleasure of seeing Dinka our hostess and Yugen our server every morning of our stay. Everything we asked for was provided with prompt service and a smile. Besides the breakfast food being amazing the attention to detail and service is definitely what kept us coming back. Thank you Yugen and Dinka for making our Chicago stay even that more enjoyable.

I‚Äôve stayed at many properties in Chicago and the Intercontinental is my favorite. I like the overall ambience; staff are friendly and helpful; rooms light, comfortable and good size; great location. I enjoy Michael Jordan‚Äôs bar and restaurant. Overall, it‚Äôs my hotel of choice for Chicago.

Spent four nights here on a business trip and was massively disappointed. Rude, unhelpful staff, old fashioned and dirty rooms, average breakfast. The hotel clearly hasn't been updated since the 80s.  To make matters worse, my colleague found a cochroache in his room. This is totally revolting and unacceptable. See photo

Have stayed at many nice hotels in Chicago, but put the Intercontinental at the top of the list. The location on the Magnificent Mile is perfect, close to many excellent restaurants, shopping and the major sites. Staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are very clean. The pool is very nice. Fitness center could use some help. The bed in the room was one of the most comfortable I‚Äôve ever slept in. Overall a great stay. Highly recommend.

Nice older/historic hotel.  The location was perfect.  Check in was a problem but only because we didn't know each person had to be listed on the account to check in and the office manager made the reservations.  Had to call her to get clearance.  (Won't forget that again).  The rooms are nice and clean but on the small side with is normal for an older building.  Biggest complaint is that there is about a 4" x 6" space available in the mini fridge for guest use and the rest is stocked with grossly overpriced drinks.

We stayed here for all star weekend and the hotel was amazing...room service was pricey but it was well worth it. It was also valentine‚Äôs weekend so we had dinner in Michael Jordans restaurant and everything was delicious. Room was very clean and spacious. The location was even better if you like to shop. Everything is walking distance.

The only good thing this hotel has going for them is the location.... other than that rooms were very small, dated and musty for the Intercontinental Brand. I‚Äôm an IHG Plat member and have been to many Intercon hotels around the world... the bran has been starting to go downhill...Parking was also very high. Gym and pool are dated. There are so many nice and updated hotels in the area that I will not be staying at the intercontinental in Chicago again.

Excellent hospitality. Clean and fresh. Rooms were small but very adequate.  Lots of hot water in a great tub shower. In the middle of downtown on the miracle mile. Walking is so easy. I must say the weather was warm for Chicago February. I‚Äôll be back thanks hotel staff

We have stayed at many different hotels on the Magnificent Mile and our stay at the InterContinental was a memorable one. If you‚Äôre looking for a large pool where the kiddos can swim, this is the place to be. The ornate details in this classic pool are unique and beautiful. The pool is 4 foot deep on the shallow end and goes to 10 feet. This is important to know if you have less experienced swimmers.   The room was nice as well. We stayed in the Executive Tower, which I hear is more up to date with respect to furnishings. The shower is one of the best I‚Äôve had in a hotel. Plenty of hot water and a nice shower head for complete coverage.   The parking is easy to get in and out and the employees were all a pleasure to interact with.   We‚Äôll be staying here again and will try out

I stayed at this hotel for business. They had to move my rooms three times when I checked in because of the smell of weed and cigarette smoke. I had extremely noisy neighbors, and I called the front desk several times for them to help me, but they never returned my call or followed up. They offered to clear out the mini bar so I could use it to store medication, but they never did, even after calling down 5 different times. This was one of the worst hotel experiences I‚Äôve had. I travel 265 days out of the year and I stay at many hotels. I give this rating a huge thumbs down.

Well located property with excellent service and lunch restaurant. Shy away from breakfast: it was ok, with dishes off in flavor( all had same oily taste). Beyond that very nice rooms and easy access to Michigan Avenue.

The price is not bad and the property is very nice. Staff is excellent and accommodating as well. It's really nice having the ENOlogy wine bar and Micheal Jordan's Steakhouse right in the hotel. Otherwise, the location is excellent. I've been coming here for years and it's one of my favorite places to stay...

The front desk staff was friendly, professional, and accommodating. The room was spacious and had great views. It was a great one night staycation in the city. If there was one downside, it was the price of parking. We ended up parking in a garage next door for a third of the price.

Great place to stay. The location was excellent and staff were very nice. Excellent gym. Transportation to and from the hotel from O‚ÄôHare was easy as well. Magnificent mile shopping was close by along with multiple great restaurants.

Fabulous setting. Easy to reach all areas and ability to do most events without vehicle. Definitely would stay here again. Was fine doing a review until I was required to submit 200 characters to be able to continue

We were there for my birthday and the hotel was beautiful, it was more than I expected. Great place to stay and the employees were very friendly always. My husband wants to go back to Chicago soon!!!!

This was our first stay at the Intercontinental. The front desk staff was efficient and accommodating, allowing us early check in when we arrived ahead of time (they also permitted late check out for our friends staying there). The room was comfortable. My kids really enjoyed the pool even though the water was cool; and the family movie poolside on Saturday night was a fun bonus. The fitness facilities are very nice with plenty of equipment and space. Would definitely recommend.

Old aged Hotel with with very poor insulated room N#3106. I was feeling the wind and cold from outside trough the windows. I complained they offered me to change room but packing all my stuff for only 1 night no thanks! Instead they offered 31 usd room service charges thanks for that but it will not make me feel better about the overall experience.  Additionally the price of the parking is ridiculously high. 75 usd / night which is 15-20 usd higher than same hotel range in Chicago Dowtown.  Last but not least this room is located not far away from firefighters.   Low value for the price

From the moment we arrived we felt at home. Will greeted us with a smile grabbed our luggage helped us check in. The bellman told us about the room‚Äôs features and places to visit near the hotel. Lunch was great at Michael Jordan‚Äôs. The Room was very comfortable. The exercise facility was fabulous and the pool was so cool. We had wonderful weekend looking forward to returning

Excellent service from a valet parking to check-in and thoughout my stay! Staff was polite, efficient and responsive. Had a challenge with a FedEx shipment which was resolved quickly. I will be back to this hotel.

The hospitality from Housekeeping to front desk was over the top.  Had a great stay in Chicago due to this hotel, the views were great, the room was clean and the service was over the top.  Thank you Intercontinental Chicago

We have visited this hotel in January the last two years and had a great experience both times.  The rooms are nice, the service is great, and you can't beat the location.  We will definitely stay at this property again.  Highly recommend!

Rented 2 rooms - went with a friend and our kids to spend a night in the city and use the pool.  Both at night and the next morning our kids were scooping bugs/cockroaches out of the pool.  When I brought one of the critters to the front desk the woman was disgusted and did nothing about it.

Stayed here for a work event and could not be happier with the accommodations. From the room itself to the conference rooms we used for our event, it was easy to navigate, clean and the staff was super helpful. Will definitely be on my list to revisit next time I'm in Chicago.

The stay was great.  The staff was very responsive, and offered me a new room when I commented on the loudness of the air handling system in my room--at 3:00am!  The bed was very comfortable, and the TV was HUGE!

We have stayed twice as a staycation- New Year‚Äôs Eve & later in January because we enjoy the hotel, location, service, and amenities. As well as the staff being very proactive to see if anything was needed, they also reacted when we needed assistance. Especially on New Year‚Äôs Eve when it is crazy busy we appreciated the attention and help.

The hotel is vast, but that does not take away from the service. Upon check-in, I had a slight issue with my room, and it was handled within minutes. They called me, sent me an email and sent someone up, and no joke, 5 minutes later I had a new room. I highly recommend this hotel.

Great location, AWESOME STAFF (thanks to Vince, Hussein and the other bellmen) and perfect rooms!  Enjoy the Art Deco 12th floor pool and the perfect local! You can get to all the best Chi-town locations from this awesome hotel!

Had a great visit to Chicago and the service at the hotel was excellent.  All the staff were very friendly and helpful.  I found that the hotel reached out in numerous different ways to make sure my stay was satisfactory.  Really enjoyed my time at this hotel.

I was in Chicago for the week due to work presentations for a new client as well as making my rounds w/ other clients.  The IHG Chicago was incredible.  They upgraded me to a super comfortable suite and made my whole work week very pleasant and smooth.  The staff was very pleasant and helpful w/ anything i needed (eg getting around town, sending out FedEx packages, etc.).  In addition, the location to shopping and food is also a huge plus.

We were a family of 5 staying in Chicago over Christmas for a family wedding. Everything about this hotel was impressive from the attentive, polite staff to the fantastic breakfast to the wonderful pool. Best of all though was the room. If you get a chance book the two bed suite on the 40th floor, 360 degree views of the City and loads of space. Not to be missed!

My wife and I had a wonderful time at the InterContinental. The rooms a spacious and up-to-date. Everything was very clean. They also have a Starbucks connected to the lobby. Valet service was $75 a day, which is a bit pricey, but the closest public garage was a couple blocks away.

Hotel is very clean and modern. Staff is exceptional. I also really like having Starbucks in the lobby.  The only negative was not the hotel's fault. The constant fire and police sirens were problematic to say the least. Welcome to Chicago, I guess.

We were in Chicago for a business trip. Hector checked us in and provided us with great service. He upgraded our room which was most appreciated. The room was great with a nice view of the city. The bed was very comfortable and we enjoyed the pool also.

My family and I recently stayed here to celebrate our daughter‚Äôs first birthday. During our stay here, we were treated like royalty. The staff was always friendly, polite, and very accommodating especially for our little baby, who can cause a bit of a mess sometimes as babies do. And the dining staff for breakfast was absolutely amazing. The hostess Dinka even noticed when our daughter dropped her pacifier, came over, picked it up, and cleaned it without us even asking. They, also, provided us with snacks to take with for our baby.  Thank you, Dinka and all of the dining staff, for being so hospitable and making our stay an excellent one. We cannot wait to visit again!

Intercontinental Chicago is a beautiful and convenient place to stay.  Terrific for business and pleasure! Well appointed rooms with a terrific restaurant onsite,  Starbucks just off the lobby was a tremendous bonus!  Loved the fitness center...  And the staff was incredible.  I highly recommend...

Accommodations perfect, location excellent, and very helpful, friendly, professional staff. Restaurant and bar superb, as was the wine bar. Rooms have all of the creature comforts needed for a business trip ( USB ports, etc)

This hotel was excellent! The staff was courteous and professional. The rooms was very clean. This hotel was a great value for Michigan Ave in Chicago. I would recommend this facility. It‚Äôs in the heart of downtown.

We held our daughter's wedding reception in the Intercontinental Grand Ballroom in January, 2020. Approximately 288 guests. We also had over 80 hotel rooms in the room block for the weekend. Our guests were very complimentary on the entire weekend. The Michigan Avenue location was convenient and perfect for out of town guests who wanted to site see. Tara Hubbard did a fabulous job from our first meeting to discuss a potential wedding venue, then the contract details, tasting and menu selection, final walk through, to the actual event date. I can't praise her enough! If you are considering a wedding in downtown Chicago and want it run right, give them a call!

My time at this hotel was magnificent! I spent my time celebrating with friends. The location was great. Close to great dining and entertainment. The room was beautiful. The bed was comfortable. The staff was pleasant and took care of all my needs.

So this review is way late and I will update with new pictures when I go in a few weeks but this is by far one of the best hotel stays I've had in my travels. The hotel is beautiful (although it has gone through an extensive renovation. New pics coming in my update). I stayed in a cityview suite for my birthday and the staff and service were exceptional. The location is close to the northern part of the Mag mile with easy access to all of the high end shops and restaurants in the area. I don't usually stay at the same hotel twice but it spoiled me so! Can't wait for my stay in a couple of weeks

Spouse and I stayed two nights.  Decor beautiful. Room, nice.  Staff were quite friendly. Room service food very good.  Dog friendly. Great park nearby for dogs. House phone in room horrible. 1980‚Äôs technology. Didn‚Äôt work properly. Toilet paper was horrific.  Reminded me of something you would find in low budget hotel.  Considered dropping a star rating over it, but wouldn‚Äôt be fair to hotel. However, issue needs addressed by management.  Overall, recommend.

Have stayed at Four Seasons Chicago as a staycation occasionally over the years, and so made it out go to place for our anniversary.  They treated us like All Stars from start to finish.  The place looked great, and the location is perfect for some Gold Coast shopping and eating (including their relatively new restaurant - which was great).  But more than anything, the service and attention to detail wins us over every time.

I spent the weekend at the newly renovated Four Seasons Hotel in Chicago and I have to say, it's my new favorite home away from home in Chicago!    The renovation is gorgeous from the beautiful lobby and lounging areas with plenty of space to social distance to the spacious rooms and suites which are beautifully appointed.  My view from my lake-view room was gorgeous at every turn, from morning arrival to the twinkling night lights of Chicago to the most gorgeous sunrise across the horizon, it was magical!  Service was the usual spectacular 5* service one gets at a Four Season and Chicago has down perfectly.  I needed museum tickets, they were in my email in 2 minutes.  Rooms service for breakfast was not only delicious but fast.  Everyone was super lovely, helpful and friendly.

Business trip my toddler tagged along, informed the staff he‚Äôd be accompanying me and they went above and beyond. The views ...amazing! The food was great, room service was quick. Valet parking was awesome my car was always ready for me the concierge was very helpful.

The newly re-opened Four Seasons Chicago hotel is absolutely amazing!  From the moment you get off the elevator on the lobby level to the time you get in your guest room, the entire property is in immaculate condition.  Our room was extremely clean and we felt safe while we were there.  The hotel has staff checking temps upon arrival to ensure both staff and guests are healthy before entering the hotel.  The guest room product is second to none.  Also, the wings are the restaurant, which take 72-hours to prepare, are worth a trip alone.  If you're in the Chicago area and are in need of a life-changing experience, order those wings!  And have a few of their amazing cocktails and stay the night.  You will not regret it.  Hands down my favorite hotel in Chicago.

This hotel is beautiful! The service was terrific! The location is the best!  From check in, the room was beautiful, drinks in the lounge and snacks were delicious. The public space with all of the art, amazing furniture- wow! I did not want to leave.   They really take special care of the guests during these covid times. They have friendly greeter at the door that takes your temperature with an amazing touch less face scan that takes your temperature. They provided a wonderful checkin amenity of face masks, sanitizers and cleaners in the guest room. I appreciated the high level of care and how serious they take to ensure confidence.  I did not want to leave 2 nights were not enough!

My wife and I were guests of the Chicago Four Seasons this past weekend.  Our whole experience was excellent.  From arrival and check-in, to the room (what a view), to in-room dining, to cocktails in the beautiful lobby, we felt very pampered. The staff were attentive and personable and really took great care of our needs.  If you have not been here since their new remodel, book your reservation today!  You will be glad you did.   Matt & Cindy Peterson Saugatuck, MI.

Had such an awesome experience staying here! Staff is wonderful and on top of things whenever you need anything. Located in a great spot as well, close to everything. Definitely made my first time in Chicago an awesome time!

Our stay was amazing! The staff was very kind, helpful and accommodated to all of our needs and more. One of the best hotels I‚Äôve ever stayed at, very clean, aesthetically pleasing and the location was great. Will be returning!

Unbelievable experience on all fronts - from checking in to dining at Adorn, I was blown away at the quality of service. The staff took all the necessary steps to ensure we felt safe and comfortable with the current state of the pandemic. The room was spotless and the views of the city were breathtaking. Can't wait to return!

First Class service by all interactions, both in person and over the phone. All team members exemplify the definition of Hospitality and I can now see why they are a Forbes 5Star property. I apologize I do not recall all names, but major shout out to Jillian the Concierge who obviously enjoys her job and seeing others happy.  We will definitely be back!!

In uncertain times, it is such a luxury to be able to travel. If you are going to be away, the best place to go is somewhere that feels like home...where the people are so welcoming, it feels like you have known them forever. A place where, when you walk through the front door, a feeling of luxury, comfort and excellence embraces you. That is the Four Seasons Chicago.¬†  I am not a professional reviewer. I‚Äôm just a woman with a job who wants to support the hard working folks inside hospitality. Of all the luxury hotel options in this city, the Four Seasons Hotel Chicago is the best and I‚Äôll show you why.  #1 - the staff. Best team in the business. Though this is their job, you never think that because the service they deliver is so natural and authentic. They are knowledgeable

This Hotel really has five stars! In our travel around Chicago, we wanted to spend time in the property , It was my first time in Four Season and its rooms clean, excellent location and the best service.

Wishing all of the team the best in these difficult times. Let‚Äôs work together to beat this. Clearly we do not have much leadership and guidance from those that profess to know everything!  Stay safe all! We look forward to our next excellent cocktail in your property once we finally get through this.

Overlooking the Great Lake it is primely locates for all the great things Chicago has to offer, recommend this hotel opt for a higher floor to enjoy the panoramic views of the lake and the city. Enjoy

Perfect location. Walk to best restaurants. View of water. First Class Wilber, Monica and Rachel made me feel that i was the only person in the Hotel. I have stayed in Chicago before, but i would be lucky to never stay at any other place!

I usually stay at the Four Seasons when in Chicago.  Last week I tried another highly rated hotel and wish I'd stayed at the Four Season!  To me the Four Seasons is the benchmark of service and continually offers a quality experience.  The other hotel did so much on par with the Four Seasons but their restaurant experience for breakfast was disappointing both mornings.  Why take chances when traveling, especially these days?

My husband and I stayed here one night for a little R&R. We have stayed at other Four Seasons properties and have always been impressed. Typically we stay at the Peninsula when in the city but decided to give this property a try. We were upgraded to a lakefront suite, which was a nice surprise. The staff were all friendly and welcoming upon check-in. The room was small but tastefully designed. Everything was going well until we realized that there was absolutely no way we were going to get any sleep at night. Apparently something to do with the hydraulics of the building, its tall height and its windy lakefront location come together and cause incessant creaking/crackling sounds all night. There was no sleep to be had. We thought it was strange that turndown service had left

We have never had the opportunity to stay in a high end hotel in Chicago and the Four Seasons did not disappoint.  From arriving at the curb in a cab the bellman was friendly and very good at his job.  The front desk check in was efficient and we were very excited about an upgraded room to a Lake Michigan view.   We were shown around the spa pool area by a very helpful woman who helped us with slippers and robes while showing us how the lockers worked.  The pool area was not too busy but it was a Sunday night also.  The hot tub was nice and hot, even the pool was not very  chilly.   Breakfast was delightful the next morning and it was nice to relax before heading out to shop on Michigan Ave.   We definitely were spoiled and will be back again. We had a nice relaxing weekend

We have stayed in Chicago many times, staying at many different hotels. This Four Seasons is my favorite. The comfort, special treatment , perks more than make up for the higher price. There are times I have booked a hotel to save money that has ended up being a nightmare, even in the higher priced chains. Four Seasons has offered my consistent stress free stays. I highly advise a try. It is conveniently located just of the magnificent mile across from Bloomiingdales and near Watertower.

I stayed at the Four Seasons during NBA All-Star Weekend. The first night of my 5-night stay was sleepless, as noises from plumbing, guests upstairs, and constant creaks from the wind kept me awake all night. Thankfully I had a friend staying at a neighboring hotel and was able to sleep there for my next 4 nights. After night 3, earplugs were left on the nightstand with a note saying that the wind was the root of the problem for the noise. Sorry, I'm not staying at the Four Seasons to wear earplugs in order to sleep.  The restaurant and bar were closed due to renovations, and the pop-up restaurant was in a bland conference room. Again, not something I expect from the Four Seasons.

The lobby is undergoing significant changes to be brighter and more contemporary.  It‚Äôll be fun to see it when the rest of the lobby, the restaurant and bar renovations are complete.  The friendly and professional service remains unchanged and unparalleled.  From the doormen to housekeeping staff, no hotel in Chicago treats guests better or offers a better stay.  Don‚Äôt stay away during the construction.

This hotel didn‚Äôt feel like the Four Seasons.   My son kept calling it the One Season :). It‚Äôs under construction and there is no bar or restaurant.   But that wasn‚Äôt the worst of it all.   Our bathroom shower design left a large puddle of water on the floor after every shower and the plumbing is just old (not much water pressure either).  We complained three times but nothing changed.   The hotel is just old, the building creaks at night (due to wind outside, but still).     Seriously, the stay was really no nicer than a any mid tier hotel.  Based on this experience I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôd stay at a Four Seasons in general.   BTW, the people working there are very nice and the doormen outside were fantastic, friendly and helpful.   But overall not worth the price with other options

We have come many times with our children...they absolutely love it! The staff is fantastic and makes the experience. Between the pool, milkshakes in the room, and the local sites to see it is always a memorable experience!

Our kids first trip to Chicago could not have been better! We booked the Family Fun in the City package and it was fantastic! Make sure you schedule your visit from the Ice Cream man when you book your room because the time slots do fill up. Thank you to all the staff who helped make traveling with our children as memorable as possible! They loved all of the goodies at check-in, the snacks and extras that were waiting for them when we would arrive back after a long day of exploring the city. A special thanks to the concierge team who sent up another stuffed "Sammy" after our original Sammy went for a swim in a toilet while attending a show!  The pool is amazing and we had it all to ourselves for an hour or so on a Friday afternoon. My kiddos love the Home Alone movies and it was

Disappointed to the learn the hotel restaurant and bar were out of commission. I should have been told in advance. I would not have stayed at the Four Seasons if I knew the restaurant was unavailable. Also, when I booked a spa appointment, I had to go through the front desk because the spa was closed for a month and I was booked with an incorrect treatment.

I am currently at the 4S in Chicago and it is undergoing renovation. While the lobby restaurant and bar are being renovated, the service is still excellent as are the food and drinks. The rooms are wonderful. The location on the Magnificent Mile is outstanding.

A really great experience! The people were kind, the room was spacious, the view was beautiful.. right on the Magnificient Mile. It's just one of these hotels you can't stop recommending to your family and your friends visiting the city.

This is my 6th trip to chicago.This was my first stay at four seasons and somehow it didn't live up to its expectations  i think for me the disappointment was the pool ( the main reason i stayed here was for the pool). When i went to swim i saw FOURTEEN kids in the pool at 8pm. the water was mirky, they were consuming food in the poor and after one length , my hands caught some hair and some "Thing" else that i couldn't identify. the adults were drinking from glass containers and there was broken glass at one end of the pool edge. I reported this to the spa manager who informed me that it would be taken care of after the pool closed. after that i couldn't actually bring myself to go the pool anymore. i am sorry to say i wont be staying here anymore .

I want to give this hotel 5 stars but the pool situation with the kids is out of control. I picked this hotel because of the pool and it was over ran with children. They have an adults only time but it‚Äôs from like 9pm to 10pm. If I‚Äôm in downtown Chicago that‚Äôs the last place I‚Äôll be at 9pm. I highly recommend they find a solution or make two adults only times. 1pm-2pm and 9pm-10pm.   The room had an amazing view and the staff was very friendly. Valet parking is expensive so be prepared. The complimentary coffee, got chocolate was outstanding and it‚Äôs connected to a shopping plaza so that‚Äôs nice. Great location as well.

The hotel has a prime location with breathtaking views. The staff is attentive and purposeful. The rooms  are very well maintained and all the services offered by the hotel are world class. I have stayed in most of the 5 star hotels in Chicago and the Four Seasons is by far the best!

Stayed for my daughters annual birthday celebration. This year she is nine. The pool is wonderful. The location is perfect (neighbors of american girl). 900 north shopping and hotel issued discounts to stores makes shopping all the more enjoyable.

The management & staff of FS Chicago exceed our expectations every time. No challenges are too great for the FS team. Our family members , young and old,  consider it our home away from home during the Holidays.

This was our second time staying at the Four Seasons Chicago. We travel to Chicago regularly and we switch back and forth between 4 top hotels depending on availability and price. This time we chose the Four Seasons because our previous stay was memorable, it was disappointing that when we made our reservation we were no informed that the lobby and restaurant are under renovation. It did make our stay less enjoyable, breakfast is only available via Room Service, the food was good but not what we are used to have at the Restaurant. There is a temporary cafe in the lobby area that offers coffee and light bites. Aster Hall in the 900 Michigan Avenue Mall is a great option, you just take the elevator to the 6th floor. Last time the Ice Cream Man made a visit to our room, this time

This is a nice quality hotel with a great location. Four Seasons is always dependable for great service and comfortable rooms. We had a beautiful view of Lake Michigan from our room. The restaurant at the property is solid. We had breakfast here each morning and a couple of lunches. Fantastic service a good food.

We stayed here during a layover on our way to our honeymoon and were upgraded to the Executive Suite. Like most Four Seasons, the room was perfectly maintained and comfortable. I wish we were able to stay for more than one night! The pool and spa were great as well (despite some loud children splashing around), and the breakfast buffet was delicious with a large assortment of options. We will definitely stay here the next time we're in town!

Had the opportunity to stay here one night in December of 2019.  The room was fantastic and I really enjoyed the lake view upgrade.  The pool was great as it had a dedicated lane to swim laps and a welcoming hot tub to soak in after a work out.  The only downside right now is that the hotel does not have an on-site restaurant or bar as it is undergoing renovations.  This was not posted when I made my non-cancellable reservation however the hotel did call prior to my visit to let me know.

The staff at Four Seasons Chicago was attentive, courteous and caring.  From entering the hotel to check-in and check out.  The room was spacious with a great city view and very comfortable.  Large bathroom with double sinks, large tub and shower.  Very clean and comfortable, as usual with Four Seasons.  Had a great friends weekend.

Great staff, great arrival and departure service, over all what you want from 5* lux pro-service on all levels. Will be back for sure during my next travel to Chicago. Note: if you travel with your dog this is the place to stay - the service on this front was worth every dollar.

We stayed at the Four Seasons for a few nights while in Chicago on vacation.   The hotel is fairly well situated. While we were in Chicago, we visited Willis Tower, Navy Pier, Millennium Park, and the River Walk. None of them are really within walking distance of the hotel, but they're all about a five minute Uber away.  We booked two rooms, which were right next to each other and were mirror images. While the hotel lobby is around about the 7th floor, the rooms start somewhere near the 30th floor, so there really are no low-floor rooms. We had rooms on or around the 40th or so floor, facing back towards the city (rather than the lake). While I expect the view on the other side of the building is better, our 'city view' was nothing to sneeze at. Both rooms were very nicely

Great from start to finish.  Staff was great with kids.  Schedule the ice cream man to visit your family if you can.  The pool was great for the whole family during our stay.  Would recommend this property to anyone.

The location of the four seasons hotel is absolutely ideal. The staff is incredibly accommodating and the service is beyond outstanding.  The views of Michigan Avenue, the John Hancock  and the lake make this a truly iconic property.

You don‚Äôt realize what you‚Äôre missing in a hotel stay until you visit the Four Seasons.  They anticipated every need I had and needs I didn‚Äôt even know I had - like leaving me a really bookmark for my book on my nightstand.  The staff were extremely friendly and go out their way to help out.  We were traveling on business for my husband and received a complimentary upgrade to a beautiful view of Lake Michigan.  The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I‚Äôve ever slept in!  The fitness room is on the smaller size, working out in the morning I was restricted to only cardio.  There were personal trainers taking up the weights section.  Thank you Four Seasons for providing excellent service and being so friendly, we look forward to future stays!

First of all, this is a good hotel. I was also upgraded to a suite on the 43 floor and that was stunning. However, overall the hotel feels dated and tired and it a huge disappointment.   It is also annoying to have to get one set of elevators to the 7th floor to get the lobby, and then take a different set to the rooms.   This is an expensive hotel and it is simply not worth the money ...

Just finishing up our 4 night stay. Overall service levels that one expects from a 4 Seasons are lackjng. No anticipation of the guests needs. Very overpriced for quality provided. Outdated facility that is not up to 5 star standards. 1) Greeting and Checkin-Good. Bags brought up to room quickly and check in fine. 2) Room had a beautiful Lake View but small standard size...not current 5 star standards. Bathroom for wheelchair users an afterthought. Knobs for water on front wall of shower...not handy for wheelchair user on a bench.  Room dimensions small for manevering around. Very loud HVAC---like a low quality hotel. 3) Bar very nice with good service. Comfortable to relax. Cheese plate, wings and cocktails above average. 4)Menu-uninspiring....not current..old fashion

Perfectly located for shopping and great walks to the lake or down Michigan Avenue. Overall the staff is quite nice and welcoming but the hotel has only one restaurant with a very limited menu if you want to eat healthy foods.  In dining menu is even more limited and prices are very expensive once you add the tax and room service charge. I had to pay $38 for a glass of very bad Cabernet.!! My room was standard and ok but no frills.  I had a massage at the spa, where the reception staff was very kind and helpful but the 50mns massage at $220 was a joke. The masseuse used oils and when I asked about the offered scrub, she said she always does it afterwards?? She only did a small part of my back. And the hot stones? Two stones to massage you with... disappointed.  The worst was at

In the current day of chrome and glitz, the Four Seasons Hotel stands asa  grand dame of fine living. The ambience of the hotel is supported by the decor with its dark wood and traditional furnishings and enhanced by the attentive and friendly staff both provide an memorable experience. I am relaxed at the Four Seasons Hotel. My partner and I would not think of staying at another property.

We truly enjoyed our stay at Four Seasons Chicago.  Everyone was amazing, from receptionist at check-in who upgraded our room to suite, to bellboys, concierge, and all other staff that we interacted with.  Dinner at Allium was exceptionally good.  Location is very convenient, right across from Water Tower and above 900 Shops, yet it feel very private.  We would highly recommend this hotel and will be back.

We stay here annually for our 'staycation'. The hotel is in a convenient location and guest rooms are very comfortable. My kids (7 and 5) are always welcomed with a trip to the 'treasure chest' and have a welcome amenity on the beds in our room. This year we had cookies and milk awaiting at our check-in as well. The kids also love the pool and could spend the day there, especially in the winter. Overall it's a great place to stay in Chicago.

It was a couple weekend at the hotel with shows and a parade to see. The location of this hotel right off the Mag Mile was perfect. A great room and wonderful service in a beautiful hotel made our weekend a fantastic one.

I always stay at the Four Seasons when available and this was my first stay at the Chicago Four Seasons and it met all of my expectations.  The location was excellent as it was walking distance to two of my three meetings and there are so many great restaurants within walking distance as well.  I had a beautiful lake view suite and as always, everything worked, housekeeping was wonderful, furniture was all in good shape and comfortable.

Nice hotel with a great location a couple blocks north of the Water Tower.  Our high-floor 1BR suite had spectacular views north and east over the lake.  However, parts of the room felt in need of a touch up / renovation (some peeling wallpaper, nicks etc.)  The staff generally provided the usual excellent Four Seasons service, though seating at brunch was limited and service lacking (needing to hunt down the waiter, utensils and foods running out at the buffet, etc).    Overall a nice experience but not enough that I would again pay a premium to the other excellent 5* hotels that are within a few blocks.

Zero complaints. The staff is great throughout, they made my children and I feel very special. The spa, amenities, and atmosphere were a haven from the busy but great city of Chicago. Allium, the restaurant in the hotel, delivered every time with great food and service, especially the cocktails.

We had a lovely room - full suite with two bathrooms.  The technology in the room trails the Peninsula.  Staff are friendly, but again, just one step behind.  We spent more that 100 nights at Four Seasons in 2019 - Hualalai and Surf Club.  Both of those have staffs that are a bit more on top of things.  Dining is another area this property could use a boost.

We are frequent guests here and it never disappoints.   Love going to Allium for pre-dinner cocktails.  Service is attentive but not intrusive.   Kevin enjoys the gym and sauna.  I love that he‚Äôs happy being here.  We will be back soon.

Excellent service and amenities!  Stayed here for a long anniversary weekend earlier this month.  This hotel will definitely be on our list for the next time we travel to the wondy city.   Spa experience is top notch.

I have been fortunate in my life to stay at many of the finest hotels. The Chicago Four Seasons ranks with the best. It is not glitzy, just comfortably elegant. The room was exceptionally large by city standards and well designed for comfort and business. Housekeeping seemed to go a step beyond. They make their guests feel appreciated, all in an understated way.

Excellent service and a first class property.  Everything was perfect from the valet when I arrived to the checkout process when I left.  My room was clean and spacious and I had a great view!  I'll definitely stay there again.

Very good hotel, large size room & bathroom located in the heart of the city, downtown. Stayed on 45th floor, view was excellent from there. All major shopping and dining destinations with in 5 minutes walking distance. Didn‚Äôt have food there. Staff was courteous enough.

We have stayed at this hotel in the past, and did not have as great of an experience this time. We were promised an upgrade upon check-in, waited an additional few hours for the upgrade, only to be taken to the same room we had booked. The room was not as clean as we expected- the comforter had stains on it and the heat was stuck at 66 degrees. Of course it took us a day to realize the thermostat wasn't working, so we spent quite a bit of time in the cold before having the staff address the problem. Overall, the stay was just average, and wasn't the Four Seasons quality we typically enjoy and expect.

I stayed there for 3 nights and there was not one thing that would need improvement.  This hotel is amazing! The location, staff, cleanliness.... Food was good. The city view is amazing and you just can't go wrong.  It is close to everything you would like to see in Chicago.  I did not want to leave!!!

We had exceptional service. Restaurant always willing to accommodate us as well as the staff.  Hotel is centrally located in the heart of the city. Walking distance to great restaurants.This hotel is our number one pick every time!

Been staying here for years.  The rooms have recently been upgraded.  The executive suite looked fantastic and was very functional.  Desk is gone and replaced with a table and chairs.  Service as usual was top notch. Room service was excellent.  Nice pool and gym.  Parking, though, is steep--70 dollars a night.

I booked a 4 day sightseeing trip with my 12 year old niece and the Four Seasons made the trip even more memorable for her by giving her cute little gifts each day and by the concierge giving us such great recommendations on where to go and what to see.   The room was perfect. Very spacious with a Great Lake view. Room service and housekeeping were top notch. Excellent turn down service every evening.   Special thanks to the night manager, Raul Ibarra, who showed great kindness and professionalism when I had a dispute with my credit card company. It was not the Four Season‚Äôs fault but he stepped up to make it right and I really appreciated it.

Always have a superb experience at this hotel. From the bellhop staff to the housekeeping to the front desk, I am made to feel like royalty.  I try to make this the hotel I stay at when I'm in Chicago for business or pleasure.

Awesome service!  Greeting personally at desk.  Room service On Time and hot! Great gym and pool area.  Great location in Chicago connected to inside shopping mall. Restaurant food very good though could use greater variety of entrees.

Four Seasons Chicago a peak experience. The accommodations and hospitality unsurpassed! The lobby bar really lovely and the menu was great. Sunday brunch so elegant. The service on point and the staff so generous helpful. The accommodation s so comfortable. I can‚Äôt wait to return to the Windy City and the Four Season‚Äôs will be my destination of choice.

My wife and I were at the hotel recently for a wedding of a close friend. One word - Outstanding! Everything from arrival to departure was perfect. Best place to experience a wedding that you get to enjoy. We have our youngest daughter getting married next year and this gave us some wonderful ideas.

Love this hotel, it was quite an experience.  We went for our anniversary as a stay-cation and to relax at the spa.  The location is great. Everything you could possibly need is right there.  The pool, hot tub, and saunas are great.  Hotel staff is friendly and accommodating.  Great for business travel or couples get-a-way, or even a family/friends vacation.

The Four Seasons is secluded yet assessable to everything you want to do in Chicago.  The staff was courteous and friendly.  We loved the  entire experience.  The hotel room was totally equipped with anything one could need.  The restaurant for breakfast was delicious and offered many great choices. The people were friendly and helpful.

Best value at the luxury end. Have stayed at all the top hotels and the Four Seasons is more fairly priced. Breakfast is pricey but there are lots of good options in the neighborhood. Concierge was super helpful.

My first and only stay (until now) at this Four Seasons was a number of decades ago, probably before the internet's debut.  A horrific experience with a horrific front desk staffer at both check-in and check-out, plus the hotel's non-response to my written complaint (this was back when guest surveys were completed on paper and mailed), kept me away from the Four Seasons in the ensuing years, during which time I would stay most frequently at the Ritz Carlton (which was then a Four Seasons hotel as well), the Langham (in Mies van der Rohe's IBM Building), and the Hotel Burnham (now the Staypineapple) in the historic Reliance Building in the Loop.  I was enticed back to the Four Seasons for this trip by a great rate offered by my Chicago-based professional association.  I'm happy

We love to come to Chicago for special birthdays or occasions. Our favorite hotel by far is the Four Seasons. The staff, the food, everything is first rate. The sleeping accommodations are amazing! Every experience is executed with such care.

Fantastic location, clean, well maintained, okay it could do with a brightening up job but the helpful staff certainly made up for it.  The concierge ladies couldn't do enough for us and were there the next day to check everything had gone to plan, normally you use the concierge desk and never see the same people again but these girls remembered everything they had done for us and made sure we were happy.  Great room fab view, check in desk very professional and pleasant, doormen great, I love a doorman with personality and these guys definitely had that.

The location of the hotel is so convenient.  The staff is just super good. I can't say the best as it was my first time in Chicago.  Any way  from the super doorman to the restaurant the whole staff I have been in contact with..they are all kind, quick, nice..smiling.. bravo.  Regarding the hotel itself  there is nothing magic apart the magic view I had from my room.  The deco of the lobby is 80's , old fashion.  My suite was large ..but neutral...sad.  Bathroom are so so overaged BUT SUPER WELL MAINTENAIDED.  I am really impressed by the so good condition of the bathroom as it is looking so hold. Everything is super clean and perfect condition.  It is a perfect CORPORATE hotel.  I hope the new decorations and restoration  of the hotel will bring more magic..

Had another wonderful long weekend away at Four Seasons  Chicago! Stayed with four other couples and everyone absolutely loved the accommodations, location, hotel amenities and staff. It‚Äôs a special place and we look forward to going back soon!

This staff obviously doesn‚Äôt under stand the luxury hotel market. Has never stayed at this four seasons before but have in many other cities without problems. It was basically like service at a courtyard Marriott. You can do lots better by staying somewhere else.

Great service. Specially the concierge service; she went the extra mile to make sure our plans were exactly what we wanted.  Also, the rooms were nice and clean, and the front desk service was as good as you would expect from any Four Seasons hotel.   Great job overall!  Highly recommended!

The hotel is old an needs renovation. Some rooms are renovated ( they said ) but its just re decorated ! We are four seasons Regulars but this one was different. I asked the first day if possible i would like to talk to the front desk manager or assistant of manager and i was told they will for sure call me. we stayed for 3 nights and nobody contacted me. The suits does not look like pictures you see in website. not at all!! It was some kind of disappointments compares to all four seasons hotels we have been. Arron at  Breakfast  was  very very professional . They have 2 Arrons . I am talking about the Blond Arron. He was amazing. i think he deserves to be the manager. He could handle everything correct, fast, was friendly very professional. Great .Thank you Blond Arron.

Nice hotel and location.  The bed was comfortable.  I was staying for 2 night for work and wanted to do some exercise.  The front desk informed me I needed to make an appointment to use the gym and they charge for the use of the gym. :-(

My room was great, staff nice and friendly. Upon checking in I asked how much is valet? The guest attendant  said $76 with in and out privileges. Even told me most people use an app called SpotHero if there just parking. But since I was going to be going in and out I just chose to valet. Upon trying to take my car out I was informed by the valet,  I‚Äôm not entitled to in and out privileges because I didn‚Äôt pay with the hotel. I wish the hotel would make this more clear upon checking in. Beware

Stayed for one night and everthing was fine. Asked for a calm room and got one. Check-in was swift and staff was friendly. In the light of Covid-19, the hotel takes hygiene very seriously. Cleaned and sealed rooms, cleaning swipes in the room and the tv remote was wrapped in plastic. Would stay here again.

We stayed 2 nights and I can‚Äôt say enough about how great the staff treated us. The hotel is clean and newly redone. Highly recommend this hotel!  We had a bunch of camping stuff that we were able to store without having to lug it up to our rooms. Our rooms were clean and very comfortable.

Everything I needed for an quick emergency trip to visit a family member.  Hotel appeared to make all the required pandemic precautions.  Hotel bar remained open which was nice.  Most importantly it was in a safe and convenient location to get everywhere I needed to be on foot.  Will most definitely return.

If you have concerns about your health, don‚Äôt stay at this hotel. The hotel staff doesn‚Äôt wear masks and doesn‚Äôt care if other patrons have face coverings either.  Rooms are basic. Location is good, however.  What a joke.

From the minute we pulled into the drive, we were treated like VIP‚Äôs.  The valet parking staff were courteous and professional.  Ed the bellman and the others were fun and engaging.  You had the sense that they enjoyed their job and wanted to make sure their guests felt comfortable and at home. The front desk staff were polite and efficient.  We encountered Monse and Denise during our stay and they were both a pleasure to deal with.  I can not say enough good things about Russell the concierge on duty the weekend we were there.  He was quite simply put, AMAZING.  He answered many questions prior to our arrival and then greeted us with a friendly smile that made us all feel like we knew him for years.  I am not sure if I have ever had such a positive hotel experience in Chicago

First time traveling to Chicago and could not have chosen better hotel! I loved the stay at Hotel Chicago, everyone was stupendous with helping us accommodate especially Russell. He helped us throughout our whole trip regarding places to eat and what attractions to go to!!! I definitely will be booking here on our next trip!

While checking in, Lakisha not only gave me 110% guest service but she treated me as I was a VIP. People, that's what I call amazing guest service. When checking in, make sure you ask for her she'll treat you as your a VIP...

Had a few problems with my room and while the front desk was very apologetic, they couldn‚Äôt move me - they could only offer points. Two days later I left my key in my room and went to get a new one. Trevor was working and he asked how my stay was and I told him fine but then mentioned the problems. Without hesitation or request, he offered a solution and moved me to a fantastic new room with a king bed and river view. He didn‚Äôt have to. Technically the hotel had already ‚Äúsolved‚Äù the problem but Trevor didn‚Äôt see it that way. The bar is also totally worth a visit. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Especially Kat. She recommended a wine to my partner that he really enjoyed and made me a top notch rye old fashioned. Executive lounge was small but adequate with attentive and kind

I have stayed twice in this hotel Feb 1st - Feb 2nd and Feb 7th - Feb 8th. Both stays are excellent! The beds are very comfortable. The room is so beautiful and luxurious. Also, the room is really soundproof which can make me sleep so deep at night. Also, breakfast are really delicious. Furthermore, the hotel has a great location. I feel this is one of the best hotels in Chicago, I definitely would like to stay again in this hotel next time. 10 out of 10 for the rating!   Bocong Zheng Mar. 9th, 2020

The Good: - Fantastic location right near the river on State Street. - Easy walk to shopping and theaters on State Street - Unbelievable government rate for a Chicago Hotel. Far below the official Per Diem rate.   - Super friendly valet people that park your car. - Was upgraded to a huge suite with two full bath rooms and great river view. - Front desk people were all very helpful and friendly. - Concierge lounge just off the lobby was big and beautiful - Lounge was open on the weekend for breakfast and to get water and soda. - Breakfast in the lounge was one of the best lounge breakfast we have ever had. - Elevators were fast - Floor to ceiling windows in the room and living area.  Maybe could improve - Furniture in the room seemed banged up and dated - Light near the bed was

This hotel was awesome. The staff was super friendly and helpful. Breakfast was constantly good throughout my stay. My room was nicely cleaned and restocked with towels everyday. The bellman, especially Rich, was super helpful during my stay by assistant with my luggages and ride services. It‚Äôs in a really good location. The view of the river is beautiful. Anyone staying here would enjoy their visit

Visiting the city to celebrate my wife‚Äôs birthday and Hotel Chicago never disappoints!  Sharlene and staff are always fantastic.  Room impeccable, great location.   Will return time and again. See you next time! Thank you.

Love love love Hotel Chicago.  We travel to the city several times a year and have made this our home base.  From the attention to serving their guests, prime location, and quality accommodations- can‚Äôt beat it!! And a big special thanks to Sharlene for always taking care of us.  We‚Äôll see you soon Thanks!!!

Located immediately next to great bars and restaurants.  Directly located on the river with iconic views.  Awesome breakfast at Yolk, cool bar/bowling, and fun bar ping pong joints are literally steps away.    Staff are attentive and great to work with.  Front Desk assc Lakisha is awesome!

We booked this hotel as a Marriott Gold Member.  They usually do a really good job.  Price was good but maybe too good as valet parking was near $80 and not much other parking around.  The rooms were above average for Chicago rooms.  I was bummed that as a Gold Member I never get an upgrade...so on the 14th floor we did not see much of the river.  I did appreciate the 2 pm late check out!

The hotel staff was so friendly and helpful. The bar is definitely worth visiting for drinks and food, and definitely try to stop by Katana. Our entire experience was really amazing. We will most certainly be back for another visit.

We recently stayed in a junior suite at Hotel Chicago for a mini family getaway. Though the hotel was busy with guests in a full lobby, hotel staffers Wayne and Ed went above and beyond to ensure we were warmly greeted upon arrival and took care of our belongings to get them to our room. Our suite was beautiful and spacious with plenty of room to relax, two tv's, and a fully stocked mini bar (they even made sure to add a few special treats to our room to make our first family getaway even more special). The bathroom was huge with so much natural light! My husband particularly enjoyed a drink in the lobby bar and said that Tim (the bartender) makes the best Old Fashioned he's ever had. Room service was great. We also enjoyed a delicious hot breakfast in their concierge lounge

Stayed in this hotel to see a concert at House of Blues. The room was upgraded for us since we were Marriott members. Joanna checked us in and took care of us for two days. She was the best we‚Äôve had in any other hotel in years. I will always come back here. The room was wonderful. Very clean and retro. Lots of room and big bathroom. We had room service which was outstanding for breakfast but most of all, Joanna helped us with everything from navigating the city to find what we needed to parking. She had more personality and patience than any associate I‚Äôve ever dealt with and I‚Äôve been from Illinois to New York to New England and back to Chicago just in December and January.  Can‚Äôt wait to come back!

My second stay here.  My wife stays frequently.  Rooms are nice and clean and the environment is clean and attended to.  Breakfast is good and the area surrounding the hotel is nice despite current construction.  Easy to get to places to see; just call an Uber.  There are gaps in where/when you can get a variety of good food to eat within the hotel.- the bar option seems limited and there is nothing after 11:00 PM.  An early evening snack/ happy hour foods would be a welcome addition.  The staff here are very good - pleasant and attentive.  I was particularly impressed by Jermaine of the house keeping services   Jermaine went out of his way to be friendly and helpful and my stay was made all the more pleasant for his being there,.  His supervisor should take note of the extra

Location is great, and the service is always wonderful, but the cancelled service in the lounge is disappointing.  After coming back to the hotel from work it was nice to relax and have  a lite bite in there.  Breakfast is still being served in the morning and I hope they reevaluate bringing back evening service.

2nd time at the Hotel Chicago and both times it was a very good experience.  Staff was great and rooms modern and clean.  Location is excellent with a short walk to some great restaurants and Millennium Park.

I have been a few times to thos hotel, for business and with my daughter for leisure. It is very central, as in good location for chicago downtown. Service is very good, personal and I always like when concierge gives me a smile and welcomes me back. Nice spacious rooms. Clean and good pillows, which I like. Great food downstairs in lobby bar. Very happy customer

This is the third time we‚Äôve stayed at this hotel, each time it is an excellent experience. Staff is wonderful, the lobby bar is perfect, you can grab brunch at Yolk, the beds are amazingly comfortable and the location is perfect!!

The room was upscale, clean, and relaxing.  The bathroom was large.  The walls were thick so you couldn't hear the neighbors. The hotel is in a great location.  Walking distance to so much! The staff was helpful and friendly.

Fantastic location, next to House of Blues and Marina Towers!!! Close to Mag Mile, and Theaters. Not much for fine dining, but you‚Äôre in the heart of the city walking distance to tons of great restaurants. They do have a ‚ÄúYolk‚Äù restaurant attached, which is always good. Taxis seem always available. Very modern spacious room, cool vibes. Great value but had to pay for internet if not a member. Staff very friendly and helpful.

I stayed at this property during a snow storm and found this place to be really comfortable. The staff went above and beyond in the short time I was there. I had a slight issue with my room which was out of anyone control and I was in contact with Russell From Hotel Chicago and he went above and beyond to make sure it was addressed and I was happy with the service I received. He will be the reason I come back to this place next month for a work travel stay.

Great hotel and service! The valet Murphy was so helpful getting our car parked and the front desk attendant was great too. This is the second time staying at this hotel. It has a bar and an attached restaurant for breakfast in the morning. Close to everything!

1/16/20 stay -- Other than the location, a nice greeting while checking in, and the cocktail I had at the bar, this hotel was a big disappointment. I'm a Marriott Lifetime Titanium Elite (disclaimer) and I don't complain a lot but I'll list a few problems 1)  King Suite (room 1237?) was drab and the climate control in the room was suffering 2) there was no bottled water in the room 2) no glasses in the bathroom 3) It was 18 degrees outside so I thought I'd buy a bottle of wine at the bar and take a bath. The master bathtub was inoperable so I called engineering.  They asked if I'd like to use a straight jaw Channellock pliers to operate the tub (seriously, photo attached) 4) the room wasn't up to cleanliness standards 5) there are more but when I walked to the front desk to ask

I've been staying here for less than 4 hours and the following things have happened:   1. I tried to take the "only elevator that goes to the Lower Level" where the fitness center is. The elevator was broken but there was no sign indicating this. So I took the stairs. When you take the stairs, you have to trip over random drop cloths and broken furniture that's haphazardly placed in the walkway.   2. An employee just unlocked my room with a key while I'm sitting here on the bed and walked in. She noticed me, said, "oh, sorry!" and then left. I have no clue what that was about, but I will remember to put the stopper on the door now. Thank goodness I had clothes on.

Every year just before NYE, the hubs and I will spend the weekend in the city and this year we chose Hotel Chicago. From the minute we pulled up to the door, the "Curbside Maitre 'D" (Mr. Murphy!) was genuinely welcoming and that warm hospitality was carried all throughout the weekend by every staff member. The beds are comfortable and the rooms are spacious for what we're used to in the city. The location is very safe and just on the rim of all the "buzzing" places. The hotel bar is warm and inviting, nicely lit. We had a discrepancy on our bill after our stay and it was taken care of professionally and immediately. The hotel's level of customer service is above and beyond and that's what makes this place fantastic! We look forward to staying there again next year!

From the moment we got there Wayne was always helping us from storing our bags and making sure our room was ready to helping us with directions. The staff in general is very welcoming. I would recommend this hotel for both the staff and location!

This hotel is very close to most tourist attractions downtown and restaurants. The parking is very expensive, however that is a fact everywhere in Chicago. I loved the room, it was tidy and modern. The breakfast in the hotel‚Äôs restaurant is fantastic but not included.

This is my second trip to Chicago on an unpleasant errand that has me working all hours in a hotel room and, for variety, lounge.  It's a different hotel than last time, and thank God I found it.  The difference is night and day.  The room isn't huge; the amenities aren't overwhelming.  The honor bar is... well, it's like all such; I invested in a trip to Jewel-Osco instead.  Nothing against the selection, of course.  The club lounge, however, has been a life-saver.  Wonderful big breakfast in the morning; delightful hot snacks and crudit√©s in the afternoon -- and stewards eager to go out of their way to help with any little request.  Every single person who works there (and I've met them all this week) has gone out of their way to make sure I'm well taken care of.  I could go

I was hesitant to stay here as I had read mixed reviews but those turned out to be all inaccurate or from very picky travelers. Note I have the highest status at many chains and fly business class for work and personal. This hotel isn‚Äôt the Conrad but it isn‚Äôt as bad as some reviews say. The service at the front desk has been phenomenal the past 3 times I have stayed here. Each time, they have been caring and try to accommodate requests.  I am platinum for Marriott so that helps but with Platinum, you will get 1.  Club lounge access (proper club with a full free breakfast served DAILY - the lounge is always open for breakfast even on weekends (7 am to 10:30am). Breakfast is buffet with eggs, two types of sausages, French toast, breakfast potatoes, bread muffins, pastries, fresh

Hotel is at a very convenient location and the staff is awesome. Very friendly and hard working folks.
