The two front desk people in particular were Catherine and Trevor and then the guy at the bar (can‚Äôt recall the name) was courteous and helpful. All in all, being a picky traveler we had a very good time. Keep it up üëè

This is a nice hotel to stay in downtown Chicago. The hotel lobby is modern, the rooms are a bit small but comfortable. The bed was good, nice mattress and there is free coffee/tea. Unfortunately the bathroom is old, with a bathtub instead of walk in shower and a very small sink with no place to put your toiletries. The staff at the hotel are helpful and friendly. We loved the fact that many nice places/restaurants/museums/shopping were all walking distance. Beware parking is $ 72 a day. Same price as one night hotel stay!

We stayed for a night on Dec 22 2019 (one room for my husband, me and baby; other room for my mom). Both AC in two rooms were not working.  Rooms were warm and it was terrible because we were staying with a baby. My mom didnt bother to do the complain but we called front desk at 4am and they sent out a technician to our room. Our baby woke up because of the early morning visit from the technician. The technician was friendly but he didn't solve the issue of our AC. The room was warm so we need to open a window in winter time. This was terrible for a 4 star Marriott hotel. I talked to the front desk before my check out about this issue, she promised me that Manager will email me but I didn't hear back from the Manager.

A very nice hotel in a great location.  Staff was friendly.  The lobby and bar area are lackluster but there is a lot to do around the area.  The rooms are dark and the windows are tiny but location fantastic.    I'd stay here again simply for the people and location.

Great place to go to the theatre district, eat, shop, and hop the train to the airport. We had a miscommunication with one our party and had 2 rooms but when explained what happened to Catherine we got to get rid of one of our rooms. She was great to get us just we needed. I need to give a shout out to Wayne and the greeters he works with. They get the job done well and are fun to talk to. They know where to go in the area.  I enjoyed the member‚Äôs lounge where it was a quiet breakfast and a place to go so the family could nap.

Very pleased in every way at the 2 day stay for my Wife's 50th birthday.  Our concierge Russell Zwolinski was THE BEST!  He went out of his way on his own to set up the room in advance and impressed my Wife and I incredibly.  The room was very clean and comfortable and the staff in general were extremely friendly and with excellent service.  I highly recommend staying here and I know we will be coming back.  Great location too with 2 attached restaurants that I highly recommend.  Katana and Yolk.  Both excellent!  Other major restaurants well within 2-3 min walking distance.

Got a great rate at about 100 a night. Was worth it for that price. Would not say it deserves Marriott category five. Service at front desk was slow and the room was okay. Would go back for the right price.

This is a ideal location in downtown Chicago and I enjoyed my stay at this property.  Everyone I encountered was very cordial and helpful, which made the stay even better.  I would like to recognize Jermaine Harris and Carlisle Myers for the excellent work they provided on the floors and for the great conversation.  These individuals are great ambassadors for the hotel and I again want to thank them for their assistance.  The lobby bar is also a nice place to grab a drink and be sure to try the deviled eggs.

Stayed for a work related event. This was my first time in the city and the very welcoming and professional receptionist Jaz took her time to let me know about the "can't miss" sites to visit while in the city. I'm very grateful for her recommendations. I had a wonderful time and will definitely stay at the same hotel next time I'm in town.

The location is perfect but the service and linked management isn‚Äôt reliable. The room service wasn‚Äôt done on one day until 4pm and so we were not able to access the room. The management offered us a water and additional Marriott Bonvoy points which I never received!

Stayed in the Penthouse Suite for 3 nights while visiting Chicago for a girls weekend. The hotel was great with accommodating all our requests of 18 different people.  The Sales Team: Theresa, Hallie, and Jennifer were great with all our constant changes and requests.  The hotel is centrally located and has a nice modern flair.  The Penthouse Suite worked out great for our group of 18 to meet after a busy day just to relax and hang out.  Thanks Again!

This well overdue relaxation weekend trip kicked off with a great check in experience! Jasmine, thank you for the warm hospitality, professionalism, and recommendations! Hands down the Best hotel stay I‚Äôve had in quite a while!! I travel a lot for work, so it was great to stay at a hotel that felt like home because of its cleanliness, friendly staff, and ambiance! I cannot wait to return!!

I visit here often for work mainly because of the location. The staff here always remembers me and makes me feel welcomed. The bar staff is great and always fun to talk to and they make great cocktails. The door guys are funny and are quick to get me a cab. Desk staff are a pleasure as well! I will always stay here when I visit Chicago.

From the smiling and joyful doormen to the front desk everyone is so willing to please. Liliana even went to find us dishes to eat the amazing deep dish the front desk recommended. I know where to stay next time I am in town!!

Right in the heart of down town with everything at walking distance Nice Riverwalk ,restaurants and shopping at the magnificent mile  Friendly staff and big clean rooms with comfortable pillows and bed Good value for money

I requested a room with a tub. Was told by the front desk that I was given a Deluxe King. When I saw the bathroom, I almost laughed. I had never seen a 3 foot tub before. Fortunately my stay was very short.

I stayed here for 4 days in Oct 2019. I was immediately impressed with the doormen who met my taxi. Wayne and Richard were extremely friendly and inviting and remembered my name for the entire stay. To say I arrived exhausted would be an understatement. I was so tired that I was slurring my speech, but Jaz at the front desk couldn't have been more gracious, patient, and helpful. Rooms were large and clean. There was no noise internally from the hotel, but sirens could be heard from outside pretty much around the clock (I guess that's Chicago?). The hotel is directly connected to the restaurant Yolk, which was nice. The hotel is in a complex with a few bars and restaurants and a bowling alley, and shopping was within walking distance. I had a nice chat with Trevor the manager

Great location! Great room! Wonderful staff! After long days of shopping and eating fabulous food, we would end our evening in the lobby bar area! Great staff and ambiance! Can‚Äôt wait till our next stay in Chicago!

I stayed at this property for an association annual meeting and I was there for almost two weeks. Being in show management, I have stayed at several hotels but my stay here was the best that I have ever had in Chicago! The front desk staff is phenomenal. They are friendly and welcoming. During check-in, I found out that the gentleman that checked me in (I cannot remember his name) had previously lived in the same county in Maryland where I live right now so we had a lot to talk about. How awesome is that? The bellmen are some of the nicest people. When I returned to the hotel late at night, the bellman/doorman Richard always greeted me with a smile and by name. My view of the city was wonderful and the view at night will leave you in awe. My room was clean, simple yet modern.

Money at the front desk staff was so welcoming. She put us in a large, beautiful room with a nice view of the river. The concierge Russell was so helpful in finding activities and restaurants nearby. After asking for directions to a restaurant they walked us part way there to help us find it and then the next day asked how our meal was.   Our room was a spacious upgrade but it could have used some updating which is why I took off a star. However, the very kind and thoughtful staff made up for the room's dated decor. The lobby was beautiful with a nice fireplace for chilly Chicago days.   The location is in walking distance of some kid favs like Ghirardelli and Sugar Factory.   The concierge lounge, Club Maxwell, is open 24 hours to grab a water or soda which is a nice perk.

I was there for a conference with my baby and husband. I truly had an amazing time at Hotel Chicago. Staff were very professional and always ready to help you out. Great thanks to Victor at Club Maxwell. He made our trip :-) Thank you Victor and God Bless you!

I am travel for business and have a high standard when I have travel for hotels for personal stays. My husband and I booked here because of being of it a Marriott boutique property, we were not disappointed at all!  The hotel was clean, the staff were super friendly and accommodating. We got in early and they got us in a room right way even though they were sold out the night before. Our room had a awesome view of the lake and the famous ‚ÄúCorn Cob‚Äù buildings.  The hotel is right in the heart of the city action, walking distance to everything. I will stay here again and would recommend it to you!

Ed was great. Made our stay even better. Hotel had everything we needed and was In a great location. The rest of the staff was helpful as well and went out of their way for us multiple times. Thanks hotel Chicago.

The team at Hotel Chicago go ABOVE and BEYOND to make sure you have a great stay. I've not yet encountered a more helpful or friendlier team in my travels. Russell (concierge) is the best of the best and always makes sure I have an amazing experience in Chicago, from booking tours and making reservations to checking in with me throughout my stay to make sure there wasn't more he could do. JD at the front desk was also the kindest and sweetest person and made sure my recent stay for the Chicago Marathon was extraordinary. I will never stay anywhere else when in Chicago! It is also in a great location with big, comfortable, clean, and quiet rooms and close to all public transit and restaurants. Love this place!

This hotel has a perfect location for downtown Chicago. It is close to everything, yet it is a step back or above everything. The views through the floor to ceiling windows are impressive. The higher, the better. The upgrade we got was awesome. Service is very welcoming. The property is very chic and well designed. It gives you a feeling of understated hip. You can't go wrong here.  If you have a car you want to park here, be prepared to unload $72 a night.

We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. Great central location to everything in the downtown area.  The room was recently renovated, spacious and clean. All of the staff in the main lobby, cleaning and at the bar were friendly and helpful. JD at the front desk was particularly lovely.  Russell at the concierge desk was very helpful in finding restaurants and must see places to go.  Would stay here again when we are in Chicago. Highly recommend it.

I have stayed at this property many, many times over the past 5 years.  The location of the property is great.   Richard always greets me when I come and go and is always helpful and friendly to everyone.

From the moment that I stepped foot in the hotel, JD at the Front Desk greeted me with a smile and was very helpful! She is extremely professional and strives to ensure that your stay will be beyond your greatest expectations! I travel a lot for business, but every time I come to this hotel it brings a smile to my face! Thank you JD for always makimg my stay so wonderful!!

My kids and I are in Chicago for the marathon this weekend. We had a last minute room change request and on this super busy weekend Alicia was able to accommodate our request. It made a huge difference in the quality of our stay. Thank you!!

Great location, big and sophisticated rooms and an amazing team that delivers incredible and friendly service!  Very convenient lounge, high-energy bar and a location in the heart of Chicago.  What's not to love?

We chose this Marriott property for its location for our family vacation. We asked Karen, the Concierge, for advice for local restaurants and the best architectural boat tour on the Chicago River, Her advice was impeccable!  Thanks to Karen, we enjoyed a couple of wonderful days in Chicago! The front desk staff, Jaz and Kat, also give terrific customer service! Give them all a raise!  Paul  Bosley

Russell was absolutely amazing! He's concierge agent and he went above and beyond for us: he gave us incredible and in-depth insight on all of the spots and restaurants to check out and gave us a ton of coupons and discounts to keep things affordable. Also, the fact that we stayed here over 2 years ago and he still remembered us is a testament to how amazing he is! Also, can't forget ED, he's one of the bellmen and he remembered us as well! He helped us surprise our best friend for her birthday! The people and service you receive at this hotel is second to none and I will definitely be back!

This hotel is conveniently located right off of the river. It‚Äôs also right next to the House of Blues and several restaurants. Service is good And you can walk to restaurant venues without paying for transportation. The service is also very good. I love the fact that the location is central to downtown.

Came here for a weekend getaway with my friends. This was my first time in Chicago and I wanted to do some sightseeing and explore cuisines and nightlife. Russell the concierge went above and beyond to inform us about everything there is to do in the city and more! (THANK YOU RUSSELL!! üòÉ). He provided us with vouchers for Chicago‚Äôs main attractions and local restaurants, truly made us feel at home. If anybody ever needs assistance or information about the city and places to check out, Russell is your guy!

From checking in to checking out, my experience at Hotel Chicago has been nothing but positive. Even when entering the hotel, you‚Äôre greeted by friendly and welcoming staff that are willing to help and assist you with the check in process.   Rooms are spacious and clean. The hallways are kinda dim and dark which can be challenging when finding your room.  I stayed here twice this year for conferences and the staff on the 4th floor were super nice and prompt when serving, cleaning, and assisting us with anything that we needed.   The hotel has a gym in the basement with a few machines as well as a market.  Overall, the best thing about this hotel is the location! You can have somewhat of a view of the river (the obstructed parking garage will get in your way unfortunately). I

The staff (Jaz) and the property were amazing. Great place to have a corporate event. Placed right in the center of the city with access to EVERYTHING! The rooms were nice and service was excellent. It's easy to access excellent restaurants, bars and nightlife from the hotel. GREAT PLACE!

Fantastic customer service and accommodations.  Cat made sure I got the room I requested and was a pleasure to work with. She is a true representation of the Marriott brand and the customer service one expects when staying at these hotels. The new rooms make this a true autograph hotel, and I will definitely stay here on my future trips to Chicago.

We stayed a week ago for 2 nights for our wedding anniversary. We got a free upgrade and champagne and chocolates when we came back! People were so nice! Room was great! Close to things in Chicago! Will def come back and stay.

We stayed here over the weekend.  The hotel is clean and beautiful.  The pillows are amazing!  My only complaint is that the room food and drink prices are outrageous!  I understand paying a convenience fee, but it really was ridiculous.  Also, I think the parking fee is unreasonable, but I suppose that‚Äôs Chicago!

I was in Chicago a couple of weekends ago to do some family shopping and cannot praise the Hotel Chicago and their staff enough. We arrived Friday morning and Randy in the lobby was extremely helpful giving us great shopping recommendations in the city. The lounge we were able to use in the morning was awesome and gave us good variety, and the necessary carbs to spend some money shopping in Chicago. The front drive was exceptionally clean!!!

Hotel Chicago in my mind is that Deacon of Hospitality. I‚Äôm had nothing short of a great experience from the time I pulled in and was greeted so welcoming by Wayne in the valet I know the team was solid here. Wayne was knowledgeable and friendly but not over bearing.   Wayne announce me to the front desk and I was swept off my feet. JD, Money, and Irvin was the team that assisted me and they went above and beyond to make sure my stay was what I needed and more. I told them about an incident at a prior hotel and they treated me like the royal family. Even before knowing what had occurred it was evident they all wear a smile with their uniform and take pride in their work. I travel 3 weeks a month for work and this team has raised the standard for me. If you own or manage a hotel

I have made a habit of choosing the Hotel Chicago from the many options available due to the great employees that work there when I visit Chicago.  I receive warm welcomes from each and every person when I arrive from the valet gentleman, the concierge & front desk staff.  Lakisha & JD in particular were very friendly & warm after my long day of travel.  As an ambassador, it is the little things that make a difference during my frequent nights away from home & Lakisha went out of her way to make sure I had a room that I was most comfortable in.  These high character employees continue to strengthen the Marriott brand & I hope they are recognized for their exemplary performance.

I really enjoyed my stay. Room size was nice and bar had great food and service. During my check out I spoke with a Ryan and he was extremely helpful. I can‚Äôt to visit again and experience all the partners Ryan spoke of.

My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Chicago for our first trip to Chicago. We had two MAJOR issues with our stay. Fortunately, both arose on the last night of our three-night stay.  First, the slippery tub needs to be addressed. As many other reviews have noted, the shower is very small, making it difficult to move around. More importantly, the tub is VERY slippery. There is no mat and it seemed like there once were anti-slip strips/stickers but had been removed or completely worn down. My husband slipped and fell out of the shower. Fortunately, he is in his early 30s and is an athlete so he knew the proper way to fall. We told the manager at check-out and although she did apologize, she also did not seem to think it was a big deal. I looked online at prior reviews and there

I traveled 7 hours to come here and got the worst service ever from the front desk rep name Jason. He was very rude to the point I decided to check in at the hotel across the street. After leaving I called him to get corporate number and he replied ‚ÄúGoogle it‚Äù I definitely would not recommend this hotel. With them prices I should have got great customer service. What a night.

Clean, great location and comfortable rooms. Beds are so soft and I had a lovely night sleep!  Very limited contact with staff and the hotel is quiet at the moment so easy to socially distance within the hotel.   Thank you for a lovely stay.

I have stayed here on several occasions and each time it‚Äôs a hit and a miss, never quite making the mark.  I stay here because my employers booked it and not through personal choice. Each time I have been here there has been issues with wake up calls either for myself or for one of my colleagues. This ranges from not getting a call at all or to the wake up call being 15-20 minutes late. I‚Äôm sure the generic management response will give COVID as a reason to this unprofessional service however it has been this way for the last few years.  The reception staff on the desk can vary in how welcoming or blatantly rude they are. I find it rather shocking in a country such as America that is apparently so service driven that from some of the employees at this hotel they can behave in

In general the hotel is dated. Ceiling Shower Head not working as it should due to limescale  In room safe doesn‚Äôt work Shower floor is disgusting I coffee pod it‚Äôs what‚Äôs left in your room no cream just dairy powder The cleaning is also unifficient and make sure your room door is properly closed as for twice was left open The receptionist on duty on the night of 20/8 was really a charm not providing any further information than saying no I‚Äôm sorry   Not good at all

Was here for business, however in the current situation it was sad not to see all the normal staff at the hotel, especially the amazing doorman. Room was very adequate apart from the iron spitting out dirt on my shirt. Had the problem of only 2 pillows on the bed, this isn't normal and normally have 4 very large ones.  Overall a good stay.

the front desk person was very polite and courteous. The room was a let down. Very small bed was uncomfortable, a king bed but only 2 tiny flat pillows, the room smelled like someone had been smoking bad weed, a starbucks cup was in the refrigerator, the room was not well appointed at all, very tire small and smelled awful.    Would not recommend and would not stay again even if paid to stay.

Once we arrived checking in was efficient and easy. We stayed in the Superior Double Room. The room was spacious and very clean. My favorite feature in the room was the ceiling shower head. The hotel followed Covid-19 protocols with guest wearing mask, providing hand sanitizer, adhering to physical distancing, and allowing limited guest to use the elevator at once . Jason, the manager, professionalism and  attentiveness was superb! He wanted us to have the best experience at the Millennium Knickerbocker! This was an amazing location to relax and explore the great city of Chicago!

There wasn‚Äôt a microwave in the room or in the lobby. The biggest problem was the room was not fully cleaning. We found a dirty sock underneath the chairs and we found underwear underneath our bedding.

Before the stay even commenced, I had three employees tell me three different things. One said I could check in early with no fee, another said I have to pay for a FULL night, the last one said they cannot do an early check in at all. I don‚Äôt expect to be treated as if I‚Äôm special, but it became confusing when I arrived at 4am to an employee telling me I have to pay for a full night when I received a different answer previously. The stay over all went well once we went out and did not have to interact with the employees, but from first impressions it felt like there was no communication or care about giving guest the correct information. As said previously, the hotel is just fine. The staff can be hit or miss.

My husband and I stayed here on our trip around Canada and the US, I loved Chicago especially the river running thru the middle, even on the coldest wettest days there, I just wanted to go out and explore. The hotel (although they didn't advertise it) catered for gluten free, in fact you pretty much ask for what you want.  They made great omelettes although if you asked they did scrambled or poached eggs too.  There is a little food store on site, with a microwave so you can heat shop bought food, a cafe etc.  Some floors had little areas you could sit in for a break from your room, it was clean and tidy and the doorman and bag handlers were very helpful (just make sure you let the bag man carry your bag he stresses out if you don't) although he was very helpful and once in our

After leaving I called him to get corporate number and he replied ‚ÄúGoogle it‚Äù I definitely would not recommend this hotel. With them prices I should have got great customer service. What a night.

Room was very adequate apart from the iron spitting out dirt on my shirt. Had the problem of only 2 pillows on the bed, this isn't normal and normally have 4 very large ones.  Overall a good stay.

Spent 3 nights here and thought it just perfect. Friendly staff and good service. The rooms where clean and were kept immaculate with the daily service. The bar area had a good atmosphere with good seating. Highly recommended to anyone going to Chicago.

Pleasantly surprised by this hotel. While it is older and doesn't have every amenity that others do, it was a great value that delivered exactly what was needed. Very little interaction with hotel staff, but the hotel is clean, well maintained and has a location that can't be beat. Shocked by how nice the bathroom/shower combo was. Great set-up. Would definitely stay here again.

The hotel is old bottom line; it needs major updates in rooms,  general areas and could be cleaner.  Our first room was a King and extremely small and very loud fan.  I did ask to switch rooms and the second room was much more spacious. The staff is very nice and accommodating and great location.

This hotel was exactly as described in its profile. It is well located and the staff were very kind. It has a very traditional big old hotel feel. It was quiet and comfortable. I did wish there was a store or coffee shop in it, but the staff at the door were able to easily direct me to somewhere nearby.

The hotel atmosphere was amazing. Right when you walk in the lobby is very classy, with their tea brunch thing going on everyday. Rooms are spacious, location of the hotel is right in the middle of action. Loved everything about my stay including the friendly staff. üëå

I stayed here for a few nights last week, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The hotel is in a brilliant location,, 4 minute walk away from a mall and surrounded by small stores to go grab a snack and drink. Room was a nice size with a mini fridge and ironing facilities. Room was very clean and so was the hotel lobby when I arrived! Staff were all brilliant at the hotel, especially David who works outside! Was very helpful with directions and was always happy to have a chat!   Will definitely be back!

I am staying at the Knickerbocker for a business trip. This is my first trip without my 2-month old baby. I am pumping breast milk and asked for a mini fridge in my room to store the milk. Upon check-in, the hotel radioed for a fridge to be brought to my room. Although the initial fridge that was brought to my room was defective, the hotel did replace it, and I appreciated the service and friendliness of the employee who brought it.   This negative review is because the guest services agent told me a flat out lie, and I do not appreciate being lied to. I also asked if I could have a microwave brought to my room in order to sterilize my pump parts and bottles, as my baby has an underdeveloped immune system and requires regular sterilization of bottles. The agent said that was not

Stayed here for just one night, check in was an easy process. Very beautiful when you walk in, love the old feel and was beautifully decorated for Christmas. Hotel is very convenient if you want to walk around the city. Very close to the John Hancock building, and backs up to the Louis Vuitton store. I had a king bed room, the room was a little small but most city hotels are, my family had a two queen bed room and it was much more spacious. My only complaint about my stay would be the sheets, they were very thin and paper like and even made crunchy sounds. All in all a good stay though.

Brilliant hotel and excellent location for everything you will need while your on vacation in a fantastic city,from our arrival to our departure the hotel staff were only too willing and helpful with all our needs.we would thoroughly recommend it.

Stayed the night as part of a company holiday trip.  Beautiful accommodations.  I know they want to make money with their in room snacks but they are so ridiculously priced. Overall would keep it in my options for staying at again.

We booked a room here for a long weekend. Our flight was getting in late so I called the hotel to let them know. They said not to worry they hold it til 2am. Our flight was delayed further so I called again to let them know again was told not to worry they will hold our room.   We arrived before 2am after a long flight to be told they didn't have any rooms available.  I prepaid for the room and they were putting us in another hotel for the night. I was so upset and tired we just went with it and was told we were going to be compensated.   The hotel they put us up in was even better but the hassle was not worth it.  I knocked a star off for this as I believe this could have been handled better.  The actual hotel is a historic site. The lobby and common areas are dated and need a

First of all  I never leave reviews. However, after contacting the manager and not receiving a call back I think it is important to alert others The hotel was busy with one woman working the front desk. She acted like it was an inconvenience to help us. I can't completely blame her as she must have been overwhelmed. Our room was tiny and smelled. Well, we found out later it likely smelled because the refrigerator wasn't working. Unfortunately, we found that out after I used it for putting my milk from pumping in there which resulted in dumping out 25 oz. of breast milk. Also, the doorman watched me struggle, carrying two bags to open the door (both when he arrived and when we returned)... patrons of the hotel ended up opening the door for me both times. Bartender was not

I was alone with my four-year-old, who woke up at 2:00 a.m., screaming with an earache. I had forgotten meds, and I was SO stressed that she would wake up other guests. So I bundled her up and took her downstairs, b/c we had to get to Walgreens. I promptly burst into tears when this lovely bellman, Nurrie, asked how he could help. He offered to get me a taxi (but for some reason I walked, in December in Chicago, with a 4-year-old - not my best move - but we made it there and back). Then she refused to take the meds, so we decided to pack it in at 3:30 a.m. (I live in Indianapolis, 3-hour drive). Nurrie was instrumental in helping me get my bags, reminding me of everything I could forget in my frazzled state, and got the valet to get my car even though I couldn't find my ticket

Stayed for 4 nights on a visit from Florida.  Excellent location just off Michigan Ave.  We were able to walk just about everywhere we wanted to go.  Hotel staff was friendly and accommodating.  Craig, one of the bellmen, gave us great food recommendations.  Our room was 2 doubles.  Beds were amazingly comfortable.  Bathroom was large and well appointed.  Mini bar was well stocked.  I had breakfast one morning in the Nix restaurant.  I just wanted a bagel and cream cheese which they did and it was delicious.  Lovely lobby area and a nice bar with comfortable tables as well as bar stools.  Got a great rate, we will be back!

Recently stayed 5 nights in a ‚Äúcorner King‚Äù room.  We have stayed at the Knickerbocker many times before, going back many years.  It is a good business-class hotel.  They still do a good job.  BUT.  It turns out they are one of those hotels that will put unsuspecting guests in an ‚Äúaccessible‚Äù room without telling them, even though they know full well a ‚Äúregular‚Äù (normal?) room was expected.  I did spot a suspicious-looking toilet immediately upon entering the room with the bellman, but thought nothing of it.  It was way off in a large bathroom, possibly a normal toilet, and the rest of the room looked normal‚Äîat least in that first 60 seconds while we dealt with the bellman.  WRONG.  I‚Äôm 6‚Äô1‚Äù, and I have difficulty working with those high toilets.  My wife was very unhappy.  Her

We arrived early but were allowed to check in. The rooms are a bit small but very comfortable.the lobby was decorated very beautifully for the holidays. We spent a few hours at the martini bar. Our drinks were fabulous as was our attendant. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. Our biggest regret was we couldn‚Äôt stay longer. We will be back for sure.

Flew in for thanksgiving and do touristy things. Couldn‚Äôt have asked for a more comfortable stay at the Millenium! The bed was so comfy and the pillows soft! Just what I needed after a busy day walking around Chicago!  Very clean room with plenty of space! Also no noise from outside which was good!  Staff were friendly and helpful!  Would definitely return when visiting Chicago again!

Just spend the weekend in Chicago and being members of the Millennium Knickerbocker Chicago we were totally unpset withe the service and rudeness of the Staff. We had a show to atttend three miles from the Hotel so stopped by to check in at 3pm which is check in time and was told we could not check in because the rooms were not ready. I told them we dont need the rooms just wanted to check in so we could return later in the evening. Was informed we could not do that. Ok so we wasted 45 min on this trip,, returned later in the evening  to check in and was told we could not have the two rooms with double bed as they were out of them which is what we booked. Next was I told them we have a stay and park which was told we didnt have . After getting all the info back to them was told

Our room was great. Comfortable, clean, and relaxing. Great bed, shower, and sitting area. We enjoyed the staff, especially Craig the concierge. He was always kind and helpful. The hotel is located in the Golden Mile of Chicago shopping and activity. We were able to walk to various points of interest and enjoy the architecture of Chicago. Highly recommend this hotel.

We had a quick overnight at this hotel.  The room was very comfortable and nice, although a little warm (thermostat really didn‚Äôt do much to change the room temperature). You can‚Äôt beat the location, but parking ended up a little difficult to find.  I wish we would have had more time to explore the hotel and the surrounding area.

Did a pre paid room and decided to upgrade.  Big mistake!  The hotel said $20 a night but fails to convey that they will now double charge you for tax, service and facility fees on the double room ; which you already paid on the pre paid room!

Paid on Cancelon, then asked to pay another $15 per night on top of that fee. Room is dated and small, not really all that great. Booked due to online pictures but I saw nothing that spectacular about the hotel nor the "facilities" I didn't use or find any that were of use. Location is nice but you can get that anywhere. Really not worth the price. Parking is also high if you needed it, we used a parking garage elsewhere. Room quality about the same as a Motel 6.

My daughter booked this for a mother-daughter weekend trip and we throughly enjoyed this wonderful hotel and it‚Äôs location. The location is perfect to all the best stores in Chicago, and we were able to walk and shop to our hearts delight! Our double room was spacious and comfortable and the bathroom was clean and updated. The bar area offered comfortable and cozy seating with great service and the small restaurant was convenient to grab a quick breakfast before shopping. Will definitely return to this hotel!

I stayed here for two nights this past weekend. I highly recommend this hotel for it‚Äôs convenience, comfort, economy and fantastic location! It is also upscale and elegant! I‚Äôd also like to recognize a special housekeeping employee, Scipien Samba, for her friendly service and detailed attention when cleaning my room and for finding my lost jewelry bag and leaving it for me on the bed with a note! I greatly appreciate her honesty and integrity, and I look forward to staying here when I‚Äôm in Chicago!

Great hotel at a fantastic price! Close to everything with great service. Room is decent size for 2 people with a king bed. Bathroom is good size (toilet hangs on the wall?) Bar on the ground floor as well with projector on the wall broadcasting football games.

The hotel is centrally located just off the magnificent mile so shopping very close by and nice eating joints. Rooms are a bit shabby and tired with very limited personal supplies. Breakfasts are done fresh although arrive to the table cold.

We stayed here because of the location but found that the hotel's greatest asset is its staff.  In particular, we apprciated the friendly and kind assistance provided by Craig, the bellman, who helped store our bags and gave helpful suggestions about our stay in Chicago.  We really enjoyed talking with him.

The room was tiny but nice and clean.  The service was great. The room was hot and we could not turn on the AC.  The location  was perfect.  The staff was nice.  We had a great breakfast.  I would not stay there in the summer . ( no ac )

Check in process was tedious. Hotel was just okay. Room was definitely tired. Would rate 3.5 stars if not for incident with valet. Upon check out, a bystander pointed out a large gouge in the wall of my passenger side front tire that caused it to split. The tire was still inflated but was damaged severe enough that it shouldn‚Äôt be driven on. Upon bringing it to the attention of valet, they immediately said it must‚Äôve already been like that. The assistant manager came out and talked to valet. After about 10 minutes, he told me that the damage was noted on the valet inspection when I turned in my car the previous night. When asked why I wasn‚Äôt notified, he became defensive. Any hotel with a $70 valet should have staff trained enough that if a vehicle is turned in with damage,

I stayed at this hotel because it was the venue for a forum I was attending. The forum was conducted on the 14th floor with one hall for the meeting, another for breaks and the corridor in between for registration and table top shows. I give the hotel very good marks on hosting this event.  I didn‚Äôt arrive as early as I expected due to flight delay. Still, I made it before the hotel‚Äôs official check in time. I appreciated the fact that they found a room for me at that time. Beyond that, the actual check in was far from satisfactory. I will forget it with the hope that this was an isolated happening. The hotel should be able to do better.  The room assigned to me was small but the bed was comfortable. The bathroom, again small, had good amenities including rain shower. Water

The rooms were lovely, quiet, clean and had great beds. Located close to the Red line train (easy connection to the Blue line for access to/from O'Hare and bus services to all likely tourist attractions, this is a wonderfully located hotel in a beautiful area. There are most well known stores within easy walking distance as well as access to loads of restaurants, Divvy bikes and the waterside paths.  Ask about the hotel's history and ask to see the Ballroom.

We held a women‚Äôs conference here for 5 days and were very pleased with our choice of hotel. The staff is AMAZING! Our group sales contact, Tiffany, was a joy to work with and the bellhops were terrific. Special shoutout to Nurrie and Craig who were extremely helpful. Although housekeeping staff were very friendly we recommend a bit more attention to details. We had a large suite and it was not fully stocked with supplies upon check in. We did have a few issues with the plumbing in our suite but the engineering staff was quick to fix the issues (thanks engineer Mike) and it in no way affected our stay. This is a historic hotel, so keep that in mind; rooms have been renovated but they are not contemporary in size or decor. Location is amazing; close to the lake and Michigan Ave.

I had contacted hotel prior to going and requested a nice room as we had a double celebration whilst there.  What seemed like a positive reply was received.  On arrival we were allocated a room.  Whilst it was functional it was small and tired.  There was no literature in room about hotel facilities including tv or Wi-Fi. No information had been given at all at check in not even what floor the room was on.   In feed back to Expedia I stated these facts and betel replied that they were ‚Äòmediating direct‚Äô with me.  That was a lie no communication took place at all.   The hotel is in a great location for all amenities and the waterfront. It was disappointing that it was let down.

I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in August and loved how close it is to Michigan Ave for restaurants and shopping.    It's just a short walk to Rush Street and River North.   The rooms are spacious, the beds are very comfortable, and it's a short walk to the Signature Room for drinks.   Don't miss a chance to see the view from the Signature Room!

My stay was good until my room door was left open. I reported it to the manager. I was told I would receive a call at the end of the day to let me know the outcome of the investigation. I did not receive the call, as promised. When I called the next day for a status update, the same General Manager was very rude, unprofessional and did not seem to be concerned with my complaint. He went so far as to ask me ‚Äúwhy I was calling back and what was it that I wanted?‚Äù He even told me that ‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt getting anything from him,‚Äù even though I had not asked for anything other than a status update. When I told him that I was going to write a review and report it to Corp. his response was ‚Äúwrite whatever you want.‚Äù I‚Äôm appalled at the unprofessional and rude behavior exhibited by a Manager.

Hotel in the northern part of the city centre of Chicago, metro station 10 minutes walking, several bus stops nearby. Rooms quite big and comfortable. Elevators more or less from the last century. Ideally for a city stay for a couple of days.

I arrived at the Millennium Knickerbocker Hotel 08/23/2019 and checked out 08/27/2019. The hotel was like any other 4‚≠êÔ∏è hotel. It did have a very comfy bed...cool pictures of Chicago scenes in the room and the fridge was VERY well stocked.   I did love the rain shower and the water was very hot to the point that it could get painful, but I love that! So the room experience was good.   What I fell in love with was the history of the hotel! Al and Ralph Capone ran a bar and Speakeasy on the 14th floor! Super cool!!! There was also a secret staircase so if the police arrived, people could escape lol. Love the history! Also I did have a Southside Cocktail at the bar just to have the full experience!   All in all I would absolutely stay at the hotel again. There‚Äôs a black bartender

This may have been a good hotel in its day, but too many departments are failing for it to considered as a good hotel. Reception was very busy on arrival with one member of staff overwhelmed. Another arrived, but she had a keyboard to attend to, then a conversation with her working colleague, then a phone call, then the keyboard, then another conversation with the working colleague, then her favourite (the keyboard), then ‚Äúnext‚Äù the first acknowledgement that there were paying guests waiting. She couldn‚Äôt be bothered to pass on information about the WiFi, gym, restaurants, bars or anything. All we got was a key. We then struggled passed the concierge staff with 3 suitcases and 2 rucksacks, but the were enjoying pleasant company with each other. The room was nice though one phone

The welcome wasn't so warm and friendly as expecting in this class of hotel. We don't  receive a hearty welcome when we arrived on Friday evening; for example at the reception when we arrived, for the breakfast morrning at the desk when we are waiting a long time for a voucher,  in the dining-room and for the check-out.

The hotel was really great! I came for a psychology conference and really got to enjoy my stay in Chicago, with the hotel playing a large role. The rooms were recently renovated  (with amazing bathrooms!), whereas the rest of the hotel remains fairly old-timey (in a good way). Ely at the front desk and Alejandro were phenomenal! Alejandro took a number of the guests on a tour where he showed us secret passageways through the hotel! He was super knowledgeable, friendly, and genuine! The hotel is in a safe area to my knowledge with a small convenience store less than a block away. It is fairly close to the train station, too! If you like anything historical or nice hotels, stay here!

I traveled 7 hours to come here and got the worst service ever from the front desk rep name Jason. He was very rude to the point I decided to check in at the hotel across the street. After leaving I called him to get corporate number and he replied ‚ÄúGoogle it‚Äù I definitely would not recommend this hotel. With them prices I should have got great customer service. What a night.

Clean, great location and comfortable rooms. Beds are so soft and I had a lovely night sleep!  Very limited contact with staff and the hotel is quiet at the moment so easy to socially distance within the hotel.   Thank you for a lovely stay.

Ceiling Shower Head not working as it should due to limescale  In room safe doesn‚Äôt work Shower floor is disgusting I coffee pod it‚Äôs what‚Äôs left in your room no cream just dairy powder The cleaning is also unifficient and make sure your room door is properly closed as for twice was left open The receptionist on duty on the night of 20/8 was really a charm not providing any further information than saying no I‚Äôm sorry   Not good at all

Was here for business, however in the current situation it was sad not to see all the normal staff at the hotel, especially the amazing doorman. Room was very adequate apart from the iron spitting out dirt on my shirt. Had the problem of only 2 pillows on the bed, this isn't normal and normally have 4 very large ones.  Overall a good stay.

This hotel has a great location. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. The service from the reception staff was polite, but minimal. No info about the hotel was given at check in, no asking if everything was ok as we checked out. The tea and coffee was not replenished each day, neither were the bathroom products. It was a good base for us to explore the city, but we were not bowled over by it.

We arrived in Chicago about 8.30 pm and were really excited for the first leg of our holiday. The doormen took 1 case from the car and left us to move the cases. The receptionists did not greet us with the attitudes we expect from a 4 star hotel and were not forthcoming with any information about the hotel. We were left to our own devices to get to the room. As the title says the room/suite is amazing which is good as it cost quite a lot. There was no complimentary water in the room which is expected normally. We went back down to reception to enquire about breakfast and was told the restaurant was shut. We then asked for a map and the receptionist circled an area of 3/4 blocks and said you are here somewhere. She struggled to pinpoint where we actually were and could not give

Centrally located near the Magnificent Mile. Shops and restaurants aplenty. Hotel is vintage but not shabby. Sound insulation is the only con as you can hear everything crystal clear from closing doors, to people using the bathroom. Outside street noise can also be quite loud if you're a light sleeper.

As a business traveller this hotel is one of the worst hotels I have ever came across. The noise is constant from housekeeping and engineer even drilling next door ! Lastly receptionist is beyond rude !  Other staff like bellman are charming ,this hotel really needs to address these issues hence my post as complaining made no difference

The hotel location next to Hancock tower and just off Michigan Avenue is great for most tourist and business travelers alike. The bed was very comfortable, but the standard room is cramped. There is 2-3 feet around the bed on all three sides and the desk chair bumps against the bed when you sit down to work. Free wifi is slow (we did not pay the $10 upgrade charge to faster speeds).  The hotel charges a mandatory $15 facility fee per day per room. This is not included in the price listed on booking sites including the hotels own. The facility fee covers business center and gym. The gym is a small room on 2nd floor with no windows with a few running tracks and bar bells. Not worth the $15. I have traveled to 40+ countries and this is first time I have seen a such fee for a

We stayed at the Knickerbocker for one night.  Check out wasn‚Äôt till noon so we had time to eat breakfast and do the 360 Chicago Observation Deck before checking out.  Location is great.  We walked everywhere.  Went to Millennium Park, Maggiano‚Äôs for dinner, Mag Mile.  The hotel was clean, comfortable and centrally located.  Staff very friendly.  Would highly recommend a stay there.

The knickerbocker was a complete disappointment. I booked 7 nights for a family vacation. Upon checking in we were informed that there was NO Pool. (Although it is listed as one of the amenities. Complete false advertisement and the front desk was not slightly surprised as ‚Äúit happens frequently‚Äù ‚ÄúNot all of the pictures online is of this property, we get that a lot!‚Äù Giving the benefit of the doubt we looked at the room. It was completely outdated and smelled of mold. We proceeded back to the front desk and asked if we could get a refund and check out to go find a new hotel. Keep in mind the full 7 nights were charged in FULL the day prior to arrival (although on line it stated it would not be charged until check in.) The front desk manager agreed to a full refund, and

Needed a good night's sleep after a big day in the Windy City.  We got it at the Knickerbocker.  The room was updated, bed comfortable, and bathroom clean.  Priceline provided a reasonable cost for what we were looking for.  Would stay there again.

We have just returned from Chicago and had the pleasure of staying in this hotel. The hotel is in a great location and is within walking distance of museums, shopping, restaurants, the beach and other touristy interests. All of the hotel staff were amazing and could not have been more helpful. We were very lucky to have our room upgraded as we were celebrating our 2nd wedding anniversary. The hotel staff even provided a bottle of bubbly and chocolate covered strawberries which were gorgeous and completely unexpected. We would definitely return to this hotel without hesitation and hope to do so next year!! Do not hesitate...book this hotel!! You will not regret it!!

When I booked the Knickerbocker I was not expecting a valet parking fee of $69 per night! I can forgive this as parking is expensive in general in downtown Chicago. A small problem we had was, the hotel restaurant was closed when we got back around 10.30pm one night and the staff said they could not heat up our 1-year-old's pre-cooked meal. The room was very comfy and the space was satisfactory considering the location of the hotel. The restaurant staff (when it's actually open) are extremely friendly and wonderful to talk to. A good hotel, but the extra expenses can add up and you'd end up paying a hundred or so more dollars than you signed up for.

The bed was so big and the shower was THE BEST. We had a standard king room. I wish valet or parking was included in the stay but it was $69 which ends up being cheaper than some overnight parking in Chicago. Overall, the price was great and the rooms were so nice we will continue to stay here in the future. We had an issue where we warned valet that we would be leaving at 4 am and they said we could still valet. They told us they were bringing our car around and then 20 minutes later they asked us if we were asking for our car. we waited 40 minutes for our car because the concierge said valet was working when they had not even begun to work yet. not the valet's fault but don't lie to your customer's front desk.

I am currently spending my second night at this hotel.  Came her for a wedding.  Checked in Friday, no soap.  Called front desk. No way to call housekeeping.  Took many, many rings before someone answered.  This was true most of the times I called.  Someone came up with one bar of soap. Was I supposed to take it back and forth from sink to shower? Called about charge to my Visa.  Put on hold.  After about 7 minutes, I called from my cell.  5 minutes later, cell was answered, while I was still on hold on the hotel phone.  Front desk understaffed.  Trip advisor checks that there is a concierge.  Not true.  No concierge.  Next am I went to make coffee.  No cup.  Told Candice , manager, Got me a coffee.  Room not made up by 1 pm.  When it was made up.  No towels. No soap. No coffee

One of the nicer hotel experiences I have ever had.  Great, attentive staff.  After a rather horrible travel experience to Chicago they were terrifically accommodating (and calming) upon arrival.  Very clean rooms.  Can't beat the location.  Great bar in the lobby.

This was our 3rd stay at the hotel, and while we started out a bit rocky (issue with our reservation), the hotel manager, Clarice, was more than welcoming and helpful to assist.  As I was searching for our reservation confirmation, Clarice worked diligently to rectify the issue on her end and all ended perfectly well.  We no longer felt anxious and concerned about our hotel stay and enjoyed a wonderful week's stay in Chicago.  Additionally, the breakfasts and servers were top notch, as were the bar folks.  We will definitely stay at the Knickerbocker when we plan our next Chicago visit!

An hotel with old fashioned charm and in a good location, but it is very badly in need of a refurb.   The reception and lobby area needs new carpeting and a general upgrade. It has a very run down feel.  The bed was comfortable and clean but the room was more than a little shabby; bathroom floor tiles cracked, scuffed walls and badly frayed carpet which was just this side of being a trip hazard. If I‚Äôd been staying longer I would have asked for a different room.  The food in Nix was fine but an incredibly slow service. I sat for 15 minutes after being given the breakfast menu before anyone took an order.  Overall I was very disappointed with my stay.

My wife and I, along with our two kids came to stay at the Hotel Monaco in downtown Chicago recently. The hotel is perfectly situation along the Chicago River, an easy walk to the Navy Pier, and so many other downtown attractions. The room was spectacular with the little sitting windows. Our kids would wake up each morning and hang out in those nooks! The customer service, from the people at the front desk, to the General Manager Adam Gurgiolo were superior. We could not have asked for nicer people to interact with at this hotel. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Chicago if they are looking for outstanding customer service, a luxury property and views to die for!!

Booked 3 nights, because I needed a break from my work.  We weren‚Äôt sure what to expect due to the pandemic.  We were greeted by Gretchen, who couldn‚Äôt have been any nicer.  Maybe the nicest person on planet earth. She gave us a run down of the hotel and what to expect in the city.  Our room was very very clean!  As a hotel Rooms Director,  trust me I can find things that‚Äôs wrong in a hotel room. The place was beyond spotless!!! Back to Gretchen, while my husband park the car down the street we chatted and she greeted/acknowledge every  guests that come and go through the front door.    Fast forward to the next few days. We would come and go 5 times a day through the lobby and majority of times we said hello first and when we didn‚Äôt we got no acknowledgement. It is true,  your

Alexandra was a queen: check in top notch. She was understanding of my personal struggles upon check in. She gave me the top floor, complimentary toiletry gifts, and the comfort and hospitality was top notch. This hotel should be 5 stars just for her service.  I will certainly return in the near future. Thank you all for making this a memorable stay. I have yet to receive better service.

The idea of perfect customer service is Abdul Albow at the front desk. Extremely professional and helpful! Great job guys! Room was extremely clean. Anything that we needed Abdul took care of it. Check in was extremely fast with no hiccups. I parked at a garage right down the street for the weekend that was within walking distance and reasonable prices.

I was a little nervous about traveling during the pandemic, but Gretchen Mitz made it all worthwhile. Not only was she warm, friendly, and welcoming..but had answers to ever question asked. PLEASE......make sure she is rewarded in some form. She truly goes above and beyond the call of duty. Thank you Gretchen for making my stay....MEMORABLE.

My friends and I planned a dinner and show in the city. We chose to stay at hotel Monaco. We could not have been more pleased. When we arrived they had a complementary wine hour in the lobby. While enjoying some wine, I noticed the hotel offered a bicycle if needed and dog bowls for your pet to grab a drink. The staff was so welcoming and accommodating. We were able to stay in a beautiful room with a view of the river. We were a few blocks away from the theater with great restaurants near by for dinner. After the show we headed back to the hotel for a drink at the  hotel bar. The bar tenderer was very personable and great to talk with. We had a great night. The Monaco staff and ambience makes this hotel a place I would love to visit again soon!

I have been to Chicago many times, but this visit sincerely was beyond belief! Gretchen greeted me and immediately I knew this would be my best visit to Chicago!   I have stayed at about every hotel in this city, but never have I received a welcome like this.Not only me, but others in the lobby were all about Gretchen we wll! She is an outstanding ambassador for Chicago and the entire Kimpton chain. I truly appreciate her and her outstanding customer service.

This hotel enjoys a great location and it is nearby the Magnificent Mile and the Millennium Park. The reception staff is great and super helpful! They made me feel welcome and assisted me with my hotel needs. I would definitely recommend this quaint and classy hotel. I just hope they get me into higher floor next time around!

Stayed overnight at the Kimpton Hotel Monaco Chicago on March 7th. I was in town with a childhood friend who had never been to Chicago. Gwen at the front desk made sure that his first trip to Chi-Town was memorable. We stayed on the 11th floor with a river view and a window seat big enough to sleep on. The room was very clean and spacious. The doorman and bellhop were very friendly and courteous. I‚Äôm definitely looking forward to bringing the Mrs. back for her birthday in a few weeks.

Stayed at the Hotel Monaco for Leap Day weekend.  Location was perfect, walking distance to Miracle Mile, Navy Peer and  Millennium Park.  Hotel has a nice little bar with drinks my date loved, very foo-foo.  Should be able to book on Priceline for $80-$150/night.

I stayed at the Hotel Monaco for 2 nights as part of my birthday/wedding anniversary weekend. I had indicated my check in time and the occasion for my visit. Check-in was smooth and as soon as I opened the room I was definitely wowed (if that's even a word)!   Very artsy decor in the room, comfortable bed and lots of instagrammable locations in the room and bathroom. Throughout my stay, I occasionally received text messages from the hotel asking how things were going. This was a nice touch.  In terms of improvements, here are some recommendations I have- - Don't just provide complimentary tea and coffee downstairs for customers. Add some fruit or a few cookies. This will add an extra touch to the hospitality.  - Provide a non-alcholic beverage option during the complimentary

Centrally located in the Loop. Walking distance to great restaurants and shopping. Terrific coffee and tea served in the lobby to start your day and wine hour starting at 5 to end the day-a perfect combination.

The staff made the stay so special!  They were friendly and so happy to serve their guests. Staff went above and beyond...when I realized I had forgotten my coat in my car that the valet had parked the day before, they went to get it for me and had it to me within minutes. Ate at the restaurant once and it was great. Location is super close to theaters, restaurants and shopping. Room is spacious and decorated beautifully. I could occasionally hear street noise (honking) and floor noises from next room but couldn‚Äôt hear TV or conversations. For the most part, very quiet. Definitely a great value. Highly recommend!

This was our second time staying at Kimpton Hotel Monaco in Chicago and it has yet to disappoint! The staff is always so professional and friendly. Although we didn‚Äôt travel with a pet, I was very impressed with how dog-friendly they were. They even had a water and treat bowl out in the lobby for all of their four-legged guests. We stayed in a king deluxe room with the river view (totally worth the extra money). My FAVORITE part about this hotel is the little nook you get in your window in your room. Since we had a river view room, I was able to lounge in that nook and just watch the city (great way to end the night). Other than our awesome nook, the room was clean and very modern. I also utilized their fitness center, which has weights, ellipticals, treadmills, and a PELOTON!

We have stayed at many hotels in Chicago and none have been this clean and with great staff! We were greeted right outside our Uber and everyone from him to the front desk, to the person who brought our luggage to our room were exceptional!   We came for my daughters 21st birthday and received an upgrade with a great view and window seat. Nothing beats the window seat!  This is the only hotel we will be staying at from now on!!!!! Great location to everything!  Thank you!

Were in Chicago for three days.  The location is in the theater district and within walking distance of the Art Institute can't be beat.  The staff was extremely helpful and friendly and steered us to some excellent places to eat and to enjoy live music and drinks.

I had the pleasure of staying at the Kimpton Hotel Monaco Chicago for a night while in the city with my nephew, and we enjoyed a beautiful one-bedroom suite.  The room was clean, very well maintained, and had plenty of space--the comfy seating along the windows was even a nice touch.  Hotel staff was super friendly and casual (in a good way).  Location in the Loop was excellent--close by just about everything, including the train lines.  I'll definitely be back to stay here again.

I really liked the hotel. great rooms, great decor, staff is friendly. great  restaurent downstairs adjacent to the Hotel for breakfast. Same thing for the restaurent, great decor,  staff is nice and helpful. My only negative, I was walking from about a mile where I had dinner with customers. Passed in front of it  a few times looking for the Kimpton hotel. It doesn't say Kimpton hotel at the front. weird!!I guess they just joined ..not sure.

We absolutely loved staying here! Not only it‚Äôs conveniently located in the heart of downtown, but the staff is friendly, and the rates are reasonable. The eclectic decor is fabulous!! The fact that it‚Äôs dog friendly is only the icing on the cake. This will be our go to place whenever we visit Chicago! Can‚Äôt recommend it enough!

We came to Chicago to explore the city center, and what an amazing experience we had at this property!  The entrance was humble, in comparison to some of the other properties in the area, and the lobby was cozy and inviting.  Alexandra and Eric checked us in. Each was engaging and delightful. Our room was upgraded to a Corner King 1BR suite on the sixth floor, and we couldn't have asked for a better room.  The only thing lacking was a bathtub.  The view was spectacular, looking out onto the Chicago river, and I immediately found myself relaxing on the window seats, (which were at several of the windows), taking in the sights.  Fruit, sparkling wine, and water were placed in our room while we attended the wine hour, a nice surprise.  The carpeting and color of the hallways and

Wow! Is all I can say. This hotel was amazing in every way. I cannot wait to plan another trip back to Chicago and stay at the Kimpton. From check-in to check-out we were treated special. I mentioned to the young gentleman checking us in that this is a late birthday celebration and he immediately asked what wine I preferred and brought a bottle up! The swanky decorations in our room and throughout the hotel were a major added bonus to the stay. Fresh fruit infused water available at all times of day and coffee and wide selection of tea in the mornings. Due to our time constraints and itinerary we didn‚Äôt get to participate in the nightly happy hour with wine they have every evening. I even called the front desk to ask if they had a better blow dryer and one was delivered to my

The Monaco Chicago used to have a wonderful upscale bohemian ambiance. The lobby was exceptional, different seating options, art, bar where guests could work... it was welcoming, and a great place to meet and greet, or enjoy the social hour. The rooms were similarly decorated... Recently, the hotel has been redecorated.. they have lost the feel of the Kimpton Monaco.. the lobby is basic, more similar to chain hotels, and the rooms have lost character and furniture such as  the modern couches and reading chairs, not to mention the animal print robes, blankets for window seats.. those small touches that made it such an exceptional place.  The service at the hotel continues to be excellent, and the location is great,... just sad to see it lose so much of what made it a destination

We typically spend a weekend in Chicago during the holidays to take in the lights, shop downtown, visit the Kindlemarket and maybe see a show.  It had been probably 20 years since we last stayed at the Monaco, and we were pleasantly surprised.  Newly remodeled, it was extremely comfortable and inviting.  Staff was wonderful, and we both loved the fact that we did not have to check out until noon.

One of the friendliest hotel staffs in Chicago!  Excellent location, amazing service and dog friendly like all of the Kimpton properties.  LOVE this place, especially for the people who work here!  Close to everything, 1/2 block from Michigan Avenue.

I don‚Äôt write many reviews but feel obligated to share a wonderful experience. I honestly cannot think of a complaint. Perfect central location, very clean, quiet. Walking distance to theaters, the bean, navy pier and magnificent mile. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Though I did not partake the complimentary wine happy hour was a nice option. I had my children with me and they loved the window sitting areas. They pulled the curtains and had their own private ‚Äúnests‚Äù with WiFi and an amazing view of the river and trump tower. They even slept in the windows several nights (sounds odd but they‚Äôre about 6‚Äôx3‚Äô with a nice mattress pad and pillows). Not sure when or if I‚Äôll be back to Chicago but if I do I will definitely stay here.

Our 3rd stay at Hotel Monaco!...my daughter and I come to Chicago every other year...magic the first time and magic this time...early check-in and room ready...LOVE the new room decor...view of the river...the ‚ÄúL‚Äù and Sears Tower...lovely!!!...spotless room!...comfy bed and fabulous bath!...beverage service every morning in the lobby...My very best to Antonio...and to the entire staff at Fisk and Co. with a shout out to Samantha, Amir and Paul....thank you all for making us feel at home while in Chicago...see you again in 2021! Happy Thanksgiving ü¶É

Every time I stay at a Kimpton I enjoy myself immensely.  This was no exception.  The hotel was beautiful, cozy, and happy.  The location was great, too!  Just one turn off from the window.  Opt for a river view!  It was great sitting in the window frame looking out over the city.  The only unfortunate part is that the Trump Hotel is in sight.

Had to stay an extra night in Chicago due to the weather and moved from another hotel to this one due to overbooking.  The Kimpton was one I was not familiar with but the one bedroom suite I had was very spacious, clean and was conveniently located.

I stayed at the Hotel Monaco in connection with a business meeting held at the hotel.  Check in was a breeze.  The lobby is really nice with a lot of sitting places.  My room and bathroom were very nice.  The one drawback is no coffee maker in the room.  You can get tea and coffee just off the lobby even in your bath robe.  Breakfast is served at the Fisk & Co. restaurant in the hotel with limited, but adequate choices.  The meeting room was very quiet and set up to our satisfaction.  We had a very good lunch served by buffet in our meeting space.  The attendant was  attuned to our needs.  The Monaco is just across the bridge from Michigan Avenue's miracle mile.

This was my first visit at the Hotel Monaco, and it is by far my new favorite hotel in Chicago! First, the team there is outstanding! Front desk Alexandra, Samantha, Eric, Gwen and Ronald-awesome! Bellmen, Dion and Conner so great, and Laura and Lorraine kept our room beautiful!!  Second, the Fisk-restaurant delicious! Great staff lead by Amanda and Payton our server. Third-the Hotel is BEAUTIFUL!! Loved the Art Deco feeling-but modern!! Last-LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!! We walked everywhere with ease! Convenient to just about everywhere we went! We will be back!! Awesome team and hotel!!

I stayed here for a meeting and what a great place. Conveniently located to all downtown shopping and eating. Everyday morning tea and coffee and evening wine. The rooms are spacious and quirky. The beds are comfortable. I‚Äôd definitely stay here again

We had an awesome experience and the customer service level is beyond expectations. Caroline at check in & out was awesome.. she had a cab prepared for us although we didnt need it. Great conversations. The front desk was awesome and the housekeeper who cleaned our room Saturday night was great! Although we didnt interact in person, we interacted through notes!. The restaurant had great food and the staff was super friendly and attentive.

We stayed three nights at the hotel. The staff was at your beckoned call. Antonio, Joshua & Sonya took great care to make sure all our needs were provided, The wine & hors d'oeuvres in the afternoon provided a nice time to relax after a day of adventure. The hotel is centrally located making it easy to walk around, catch "Hop on-Hop off" bus and the boat tour. Also close easy walk along the river trail. I would recommend this hotel for cleanness, service and location.

I only stayed at the Monaco for a night, but would definitely stay here again.   The king room I stayed in, which I think is one of their base rooms, was gorgeous, modern, and clean. The furnishings were some of the most beautiful I have seen in a hotel.   It was a decent size room, but the window was super small. Not sure if all the base rooms are like that, but it wasn‚Äôt a deal breaker for us, especially for one night. Also, try and get a higher floor. We were on 4, and could hear a lot going on down on the street below.   This place is walkable to everything, would definitely stay here again.

Had a great night at the Kimpton.  I‚Äôd like to thank, Dion and Alexandra at the front.  They were very friendly and made both check in and check out a breeze.  I‚Äôd also like to thank the staff for the excellent recommendations for breakfast, lunch and dinner.  The location is perfectly located for the best of the Riverwalk and Big Bus tours.  The attached restaurant was very good as well.

We used credit card points to book this hotel over Labor Day weekend and chose a Suite style 2 room layout.  Wow, were we pleased.  The room was on a corner, with awesome views of the Chicago river and city hustle and bustle.  The rooms window ledges were so wide and long that my 6' 4" son and 5' 9" daughter both napped or just stretched out to read during day and evening time in the room.  Dad got pats on back from kids and wife that I reserved the "best room ever."  That never happens, cause I tend to go more budget.....but splurging on this room was worth it.  I also enjoyed the free cruiser bike rental and rode miles up and down the lakeshore drive bike paths.  Fun!

First time in Chicago ! The team at the Monaco made us feel like at home! Everyone is so caring and nice they all had great  recommendations of were to go and what to do. specially the bellman Antonio he is a gem! He has been with the hotel for over 20 years...so pleasant to talk to he always has a smile in his face. Everyone in the Front office team is amazing! Abdul the Front office manager is great ! Kudos to the housekeeping  team the rooms apart from being beautiful they are spotless clean!

A beautiful boutique hotel, in a superb downtown location.  Coffee in the lobby is the best. I would have given it 5 stars, but upon returning home, found we had been charged for a bottle of wine from the fridge.  We took our own wine and beer. I called hotel and they had the charge reversed.

I love the Kimpton Hotels and chose to stay at the Monaco in Chicago last fall. Although it is right in the center of everything downtown, it is very quiet. The room is typical Kimpton Monaco with two plush beds, a lovely reading chair, small bathroom (due to this being a refurbished hotel). Bonus was the window seat which gave me an excellent view of the Trump Towers and the Christian Science Reading Room.   The hotel is only two blocks away from the wharf to catch the architecture boat tour. They have a bike you can borrow if you want to bike along the river.  The service is of course five stars. I used the concierge service to book my tour and to find a restaurant for dinner. As I was on business, I stayed only one night, but I was able to leave my bags at the front desk so I

Quaint hotel in an awesome location. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and our room was great. Spacious with comfortable beds. Despite overlooking a decently busy street, noise was not an issue.

Stayed here for business and a fantastic hotel.  Great staff, very helpful, rooms very comfortable, good choice of breakfasts and right in the heart of shopping and restaurants.   No request was too much and even though they don‚Äôt have a business centre they helped with any request I had swiftly and helpfully.

This hotel exceeded my expectations. I was on the 8th floor, which looked remodeled. The hallway was so unusual and pretty. My room was large and beautifully decorated with blue and yellow. The bathroom was large and had a lovely marble sink, tub with overhead hand held showers, and stylish chrome grab bars.  The free coffee in the lobby was a nice touch. Fitness room was a good size. I liked the alternative 80s and 90s music in the elevator and lobby!

The rooms are so unique, window seats, large bathroom. We came to chicago for a little getaway for a friends bday and there was plenty of room for all 4 of us. The staff are incredible, Jonathan, Ron and Gabe helped make our friends birthday so special. They are amazing. Thank you guys so much. Also the bartender in the am was very helpful with giving things to do, and her drink making skills.... mmm

I Loved the room. You can tell this hotel has been recently updated and upgraded. Comfortable window seats were a great place to relax and enjoy the city views.  Nightly wine night provided a unexpected and enjoyed start to the evening.

Great staff and  location.  There is construction going.on outside but I did not hear any noise from it. I had a great upgraded corner room.  The exercise room was good.  The bar area and wine reception are a reason to stay here alone

The wifi would not stay connected during our entire stay, which was very frustrating, but overshadowed by the poor service and lack of follow up by the hotel staff regarding the issue.  Per their guidance, on our first day I contacted the support number and they were able to verify that they were having issues with the WAP and/or repeater in our area of the hotel (top floor) but would get it fixed.  As the issue was not being resolved, I contacted the front desk one to two times per day during our 4 days there.  They apologized, offered free cocktails, asked us to move rooms (on our final day), but never actually followed up on anything, proactively contacted me, or drove it to resolution.  There was no ownership of the problem, just me asking over and over if it was fixed.

Ron, who I believe manages the front desk, checked us in and we were delighted to find that we had been upgraded to an amazing room with awesome window seats and views of the river. This hotel is in a great location in downtown Chicago and the staff are the best. The hotel is newly renovated in a perfectly boutique fashion. Excellent food and cocktails, very comfortable bed, awesome bathrooms. Stay here!

Chicago was our first stop on our American holiday and we couldn't have stayed in a better hotel. We arrived quite tired after a long flight. The doorman and reception desk were friendly and helpful. The room wasn't particularly large but was well planned with sufficient storage, amenities, USB plugs and most importantly a good sized bathroom. The location is central which means you can walk to many of the sights, take the L further afield or short taxi rides which weren't expensive. Walking distance to Andy's Jazz Caf√© and around the corner from the Witt - hotel with a lounge on the 23rd floor - not the highest view point in Chicago - but a pleasant place to have a drink. The restaurant at the hotel had decent food and good choice of seafood and getting breakfast was easy. They

My husband and I booked this hotel for a last minute weekend trip to Chicago. We knew relatively little about the hotel when we booked it but we liked the location and price.   We were blown away by our experience! The staff were so incredibly polite and accommodating and the rooms were just beautiful. We had a lot of things planned in the short time we were there and it was so relaxing to come back to our room at the end of each night to unwind. I especially appreciated the pump bottles of shampoo, conditioner, and body wash - there was more than enough to take care of my thick hair for the weekend!   We would absolutely stay here again on our next trip to the city.

Accompanied my wife who was on a business trip to Chicago.  We have stayed here before and always is a pleasure.  Their complimentary wine hour is a bit hit with the guests.  The person pouring the wine is always generous with his pours.  Some light finger foods are also served.

Spent three nights at the Kimpton Monaco over Labor Day weekend. From check in to check out, service was superb. Antonio and the other members of the valet team were consistent, friendly, and considerate.  Interactions with the front desk team were also very pleasant and they were able to help with every request I had. The servers and bartender at the hotel restaurant, Fisk and Co., had the same warm and service oriented attitude.  Absolutely loved the riverview room I had.
