It was fantastic seeing all the architecture and photographs of well-known stars and celebrities of yesteryear.  The dining experience in the restaurants on premises was phenomenal, and the staff was very kind.

These dudes went above and beyond for sure. My wife and I stayed here after a bad car accident and these two were incredibly compassionate and courteous. Give these guys a raise for sure! Will return just bc of how pleasant they made our first unexpected stay.

This historic, iconic Chicago hotel remains stunningly beautiful, with its unique charm kept intact.  Love all the photos of the stars who played the Empire Room adorning the hallways. Hotel staff makes you feel special.  The location is great and it's very affordable.

This hotel was downtown Chicago placed in a nice area surrounded by shopping centers and what seemed to be a metro station for transportation. The hotel has a few restaurants inside and a Starbucks for your morning coffee. The rooms were very clean, comfortable and spacious. Overall enjoyable stay.

This hotel looks like a hotel that would treat guests properly, be clean, and reasonable. It is not.   The reception desk is one level up from street level.  We were yelled by a hotel employee for starting up the escalator with our luggage.  Apparently, we had to use an elevator instead.   We tried to check in at 11:30 AM and the desk agent promptly informed us that there was a $25 early check-in charge before noon. (We are Hilton Honors members) We asked to check our bags---they send us back downstairs to do so.  There is no bell serverice where you need it--and the front desk could not care less.  The lobby looks nice, but the rest of the hotel is garbage.  The room had water damage that was pootly covered by paint.   We shipped a package to ourselves at the hotel.  The front

Beautiful hotel in the Loop area of Chicago and close to many attractions. The room was spacious and very clean. The hotel is huge and requires a staff complement to support that number of guests. We found that attention to details was lacking and responses to our requests were delayed. The elevators were not operating properly and guests became frustrated with the amount of time spent waiting that we would jump on any elevator up or down to just get in. Finally, there was no final bill under the door. Instead, we had to go to the check-out desk and had no time to review the billing errors since we wasted so much time waiting for the elevator and then had to proceed to the airport.

Staff was amazing.  Beds are very small (double)  bathroom definitely needed some updating.   The burger place was closed every time we tried to go. Location great.  Starbucks on-site.  Lots of stores close by.

The Palmer House - Chicago  There are three different parts of this experience of the Palmer House hotel in Chicago to share.¬† I initially booked this stay online for a weekend with my kids.¬† I chose a higher-end hotel because I was traveling with my kids and they like things like the pool and the spacious rooms.¬† I picked their standard room because it was during a weekend of nice weather which meant we would not be in the room a whole bunch.  Room 1  We checked into the Palmer House after an excessively long line and wait in the hotel lobby.¬† It took us about an hour to wait in the long snakey line set up just to check-in.¬† After we got to our room we had noticed right away black mold on the wall above the doorway and black mold in the bathroom.¬† I have a kid with asthma and

I`ve stayed at The Palmer House many times.I did appreciate the upgrade to a King room. Usually I have a good experience at this hotel. I did not like that I had paid for a Stay and Park package only to see that I was charged $85 for parking. Had I not caught this I would have been stuck. I asked before arriving if I should just pull up to Valet in front of hotel. They said yes. Upon arriving I confirmed with valet it was stay and park. They acknowledged it was. So strange that I was really supposed to self park across the street for this package after all. Also I dont like people asking for tips ahead of time. Bag drop did that. I also did not like Hilton Grand Vacations chasing me to the elevator to throw sales pitch.

Went for a stay vacation at the Palmer House for 1 week Hotel is running on its 100 year old history Lack of security - anyone can walk into the hotel and go up to the rooms Overpriced even by Chicago standards Dogs are allowed and may keep you awake at night with their barking They did me

We are on 3rd day of stay at Palmer House. 2/3 days we have not had housekeeping services. None. I even called front desk - they said they would "notify housekeeping" - and nothing.  Asked if they could at least empty trash and bring towels. Nope. I certainly expect more from a Hilton.

We met our daughters and their families for a long weekend in Chicago.  We chose this Hilton property for its location, and the restaurant Potters located within.  We have stayed before and loved the Pub for a meal with kids.  We saw the pool was closed and were disappointed with that, but then got checked in and found Potters was closed for the weekend.  WTH.  So disappointed.  Instead went with 8 of us to Lockwood, the fancier restaurant the first night.  Crazy expensive.  Ok food.  Slow service.  Waiter forgot to take drink orders.  We only saw him once or twice our entire meal.  He did make sure to tack on 20% gratuity.  The rooms are soooooooo small.  Not sure what kind we had last time, but they were not this cramped and claustrophobic.  Also disappointing.  Still

If you love grand, historical buildings and want a superb location for arts and culture in the Loop, I don't know how you could do better. To be sure, the rooms are a little on the old side but they have cool mirrors and other touches.  Walking through the glorious lobby a couple times a day can take you back to the glamour days of the 30's and 40's. Symphony is a block away, Millennium Park and the Art Institute are 2 blocks.  I felt completely comfortable as an older, single woman.  Wish the drinks in the lobby weren't so pricey.

Palmer May have been a good hotel in the past but not is overpriced fo what the offer.  Definitely need some cleaning, remodeling and renovation!  Elevator very slow and for the most part didn‚Äôt stop at our floor.  The first room they gave us smelled so like bleach we had to change rooms.  Second room had old carpet broken mirror , clogged tub.... i can go on. There are pics of our room attached to this review. No room service in the evening ( guess they had it just few hrs a day)  Definitely will not stay at this hotel again.

The lobby was stunning! Found the hotel room small and could feel that it is pretty old. Though renovated well, the size just doesn‚Äôt do justice.   The staff was courteous. I liked the veg burger I ordered from in-room dining.

The hotel's lobby, ballroom, and restaurants are beautiful and worth coming in and of themselves. But just for a drink or some food. Like a lot of great old hotels in big American cities, the rooms just aren't designed for modern sensibilities or standards. They're quite small, especially the bathrooms where it feels quite like taking a shower in a closet. The windows aren't double-paned, as far as I can tell, meaning on cold winter nights you really have to crank the heat to stay comfortable. If your room is designed to be able to adjoin another room, you'll be able to see light from the other room in the dark and hear everything your neighbors are saying. The upside, if any, is at least the rooms aren't all that expensive. Expected more, though.

Palmer House is historic and iconic. Stunning lobby.   Visit for the lobby.  Hang out in the lobby.  Tiny rooms in this classic hotel.   Tiny beds in tiny rooms.   Decent WiFi, ok linens.   Good location and easy walking distance for art institute and cbic heatre

I have stayed here many times, and this was another excellent stay. The lobby/bar area is beautiful. The location is right in the middle of downtown with plenty of restaurants within walking distance.

Upon arrival to the hotel we were checked in promptly and offered complimentary bottles of water but when we got to our room there was old room service on a tray in the hallway we dropped our bags and made a member of reception staff aware of the tray. The next day entering the hallway the tray was still there and when we spoke to a member of staff and explained it had now started to smell she suggested "move it to the other end of the corridor yourself."  Also during our stay our toilet broke and after reporting the problem, again, there was a delay in it being resolved which resulted in me having to have my hand in the top of the toilet. We were also told while the issue was happening with the toilet that we would have to use the ones at the gym 10 floors down.  As many other

We stayed at Palmer House for 2 nights in January 2020.   From the moment the doorman greeted us to help with luggage to the housekeeping gentleman who smiled and asked us how our day was going, this staff are among the kindest, smiling staff we have ever encountered.  It really made such a difference at a time when out stay there was nerve racking!    We stayed in a King accessible room, which was different from our original reservation as a King Executive Suite (Our only hiccup, which I just wasn't in the head space to argue about).  It was a very spacious room, especially the bathroom and it suited our needs, since we were really only there to sleep!   I have able to make some last minute changes on my presentation and display, without it really being inconvenient.   The

Downside: Make sure you bring your own coffee and tea facility as there is none in the room Upside: Friendly staff, value for money, good location, food in restaurants are good quality and delicious!!

I expect to see Gable and Lombard descending the steps into the bar at any moment.  Beautiful hotel and customer service is exceptional.  It‚Äôs not a new hotel but beautifully maintained historic hotel. Room service is speedy and food is hot.

We live in the Chicago area and I work just down the street. We chose to stay here because of a half marathon starting from Soldier Field not far from the hotel. We asked in advance about a late check-out to be able to shower after the race, and were told it would be $25, which is fine. This morning the front desk clarified $25 per additional hour. The other surprise was no coffee maker in the room- what hotel  in this day and age doesn't have coffee in the room???!!! Room service brought a maker up, though it doesn't work well. This was our first time staying here and will be the last. We will not be coming back, will not refer any guests and I will not refer out of town colleagues. The breakfast staff is incredible- they deserve 5 stars. Hotel management, you have a lot of

As a HHonors Gold member, I really expect better from a Hilton property. Wallpaper in the room was falling off in multiple places in the room. Would prefer a shower only rather than shower/tub combo, but that's personal preference. Hair blower was one of the cheapest I have ever used. VERY THIN WALLS. Lobby was gorgeous. Service twice at breakfast and once at Potters was absolutely horrendous. One server at Potters didn't know the menu and was not helpful. Had to wait about 7 minutes to get greeted and over 12 minutes after that for him to return to take an order. Asked about hot sauce and had to walk around the restaurant to find the right one at a different table. Another meal we had at Potters was great and Manny was AMAZING, although the food was kind of a let down. Overall

I had high hopes for this hotel. My stay was a disaster.   The executive level room itself was not worth the extra cost, the room was dated - wallpaper coming off the walls, a chipped bathroom mirror, a 2 to 3 inch gap under a poorly fitting bathroom door, pulled up and torn carpet edges. The layout of the room was very strange and there was a hallway that led to nowhere at the side of the room.   We were awoken during to loud construction in the hotel next to and above our room. Housekeeping also had a cell phone ringer which went off loudly a number of times. Prior to my arrival, I had asked if a refrigerator came with my room or not and I was told it was usually $40 but they would comp it for me. When I arrived, I was told that my room would always have come with a fridge at

The hotel is on a perfect location it's its walking distance to everywhere on downtown chicago.the staff are very professional with great attitude.the hotel is beautiful the room clean and comfortable

We went on our first vacation of the year and Palmer House was the best choice. We stayed from January 18th until January 21st, Edward and Keely in guest services were very helpful. Concierge Nicholas and Robert gave us all the point of interest. The hotel is located in the loop. State St shopping, millennium park, Wills Tower all are writhing 5-10 mins of walking distance. There‚Äôs a ton of restaurants. The hotel itself has many dining and take out options. We stayed at the executive level the best part Being the executive floor has their own elevators and needs your room key to access.

Great location and hotel. Stayed for 3 nights and couldn‚Äôt ask for a better location. Within walking distance to everything, a block or 2 to Macy‚Äôs, target, cvs, museums, the river, restaurants!!! Rooms are small but really clean and well equipped. Starbucks on site. The bar has the most amazing ceiling, literally a work of art!! Give the flat top grill  a go, less than 2 minutes walk delicious food and great value.

The Palmer House is a wonderful example of excellence.  The service in the Potter's Chicago Burger Bar the night we stayed was very shaky, but the the rest of the staff was excellent.  I highly recommend Palmer House!

Went for 50 something girls weekend which included theater tickets. Loved everything about the hotel, including its location in the theater district.  Every staff member was pleasant and anticipated our needs. Front desk got us pleasantly upgraded. Our rooms were huge and adjoining. Hotel bar was beautiful and fun. Breakfast left us feeling completely satisfied.  This iconic beauty has to be experienced. Go here, you‚Äôll be delighted.

Poked on the Executive level (paid extra) only to find out the Executive level service was barely nonexistent. Three crappy luke warm appetizers and cold breakfast buffet. Staff was helpful and did refund some points to my account. But, from what was a prior experience to this recent experience turned me off. Room was clean, but paint was peeling off the bathroom door. In-room phone broken and TV reception was poor. It wasn‚Äôt until next morning the TV menu worked. Too many other options in Chicago. Don‚Äôt plan on making this hotel an option next visit

We have never stayed in a city hotel that is as beautiful and in such a good location as this hotel. The service is at a very high level, and with c and mass the requirements are met quickly and with quality.  Breakfast is good but only monotonous.  The lobby is lovely and has a beautiful cafe.

We arrived in town on a Sat night. With a reservation that had been made for months. The entire hotel was shut  down. We felt like they had had plenty of time to notify us. It was easy enough to change but thank goodness I was a savvy traveler.

Definitely recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a clean, comfortable, friendly place. The staff was wonderful. We arrived early to Chicago & they were able to accommodate us in a room. We had an amazing city view. You can walk 10-15 min to Navy pier, millennium park and Magnificent mile or uber for a few bucks. The city cancelled St Pats parade & festivities due to Covid-19 but the hotel hosted a small party downstairs that kept us entertained & our son with games without leaving the hotel. I would stay here again.

Even in the concierge rooms, needed repairs are openly visible: dresser doors that won't stay shut, mars and scratches on furniture, etc.  Even the shower curtain and its rod are dated; it has been quite awhile since I had taken a shower in a crowded tub without a curtain rod that bowed out for additional space.  Still, the location and amenities of the Sheraton are hard to beat and the staff are pleasant, helpful, and knowledgeable.

The room was nice. The view was amazing. Parking was high but that‚Äôs Chicago.  Checking in was such a breeze and everyone was so nice and helpful. I wish kore restaurants were in walking distance of the hotel but just doordashed my food for the night.

You‚Äôve probably seen the hidden camera investigative reports that revealed that housekeeping often just rinses and wipes down glassware in hotel rooms. I had kind of forgotten and put that out of my mind. However, it came flooding back when I found a coffee mug in my room with a few drops of coffee stains inside and smeared lip prints on the edge. I left it sitting out hoping it would be replaced with a clean one. I came back after my room being cleaned and found the exact same mug on the shelf with the same spots and same smeared lip prints. ICK! In these days of coronavirus, this is unacceptable!  Always wash your hotel glassware yourself people! Hotel was otherwise ok.

Great Hotel, Great Location, Very professional and Guest friendly. Was here for all star weekend and despite the crowds and numerous activities going on The Sheraton Grand was on point. everything you need is in the hotel and within walking distance, there is a whole foods, a movie theater and numerous restaurants  a block or less away. i really enjoyed my stay here and with the Magnificent mile and other attractions within walking distance this is the idea location. Jeffery from the front desk was amazing as well at check in Shout Out to Jeffrey.

Beautiful hotel! Came here for the Cubs Convention. It is really nice in here! The ballroom conference rooms are super big. In a great location with so much around in the heart of Chicago. I had a great time!

We had a great stay at the Sheraton Grand for St Patrick's Day 2019 -- the hotel is not only located right on the river, but overlooking right where they turn the river green. We had a front row view!  The hotel has a huge lobby - great for meeting up with your group. They had a quick hotel bar and also were located near to a few other restaurants/bars.  Quick walk over the river to the Loop and located at the start of Magnificent Miles - tons of shopping.    The rooms were clean and quiet.  We definitely would stay at this property again.

I stayed here for a business conference but doubt I would ever stay here on my own dime. Beds were very comfortable and had a great location with great views of the city. However, internet is extra $15 per day, microwave/fridge must be requested (although website says they are included), I had trouble getting ahold of anyone to order room service, no one ever cleaned my hotel room and there were dishes from a number of rooms on my floor that just sat in hall way ALL day. They only got removed when I called and asked later in day. Front desk staff were very nice but concierge refused to answer my question until after he spent a couple minutes condescending me.

My family and I were here for a martial arts tournament. This hotel is a great venue, especially for such a large tournament. The competition area that was set up for the tournament had ample space. The main lobby of the hotel was a great place to relax while waiting for my son to compete. Guest rooms are nice, clean, and quiet. Staff is friendly. Great location right on the river.

Being big Chicago sports fans we visit the city every Christmas to get our fix - thankfully I'm not reviewing the sports teams because they went 1-3 on our visit this time! I am reviewing the hotel though and that's a good thing! We had another excellent stay. Every member of staff we dealt with was very polite and helpful (special mention to the ladies in Starbucks), and several remembered us from our previous visits without even being prompted. One of the managers (David Heffernan) went out of his way to say hello and ask us if there was anything we needed when he spotted us in the lobby and another came out to wish us a safe trip home after we checked out! We must give a special shout out to Michael and John (Tiritilli) on the door too. Once again they took great care of us

Good - beautiful, clean & nice views. Older set up ( no usb plugs ) small washrooms. Our room had a weird angle had to really tilt the tv. Close to a lot of things the bean, good restaurants etc. Nice indoor pool but what a job to find it. Bad - no fridge. Just there ‚Äútouch it‚Äù ( motion sensors ) and pay fridge and snack center. Small Pringle‚Äôs $8!!! Not cool in 2020 to have this - esp with kids.  Rushed - 7 hr drive wanted to use valet ( told to self park ) need help with luggage ( get a sigh and ‚Äúok‚Äù ) checked in with app - told not working had to line up. No instructions where was what.  Broken - our kids DVD player. When it made its way to our room. 1 hr to talk with the luggage people, manager on duty ( Andrew was very helpful ) and then security. To be fair they did refund

I‚Äôve stayed in a lot of hotels and have of course had the periodic issue here and there, but my stay at the Sheraton Grand in Chicago had so many issues, it was hard to keep track. An absolute nightmare! Even after completing the post-stay survey the hotel sent and listing the multitude of issues and problems during my stay, I received a stock response from a front desk supervisor. I value feedback from others on Trip Advisor and hopefully my feedback is helpful.

It was my first visit to the cold and Windy City of Chicago for a business trip. The hotel probably deserves 4 stars, but it was the overall experience, prompt customer service and the nice gym and pool that earned them the extra star.   Checkin was a breeze. The staff extremely helpful with an early check in and very courteous compared to US standards (not to compare to Asia obviously). The hotel is well maintained, rooms were clean and equipped with nice Starbucks coffee, complimentary bottle of water and nice comfortable bed. However, the room was slightly small and bathroom toiletries could have been a bit better. As I mentioned earlier, the gym and pool area were nice and it is always great to get some exercise in when on business travel. The location is awesome and in

The highs: - beautiful facility on the river - food at Shula's is excellent - friendly helpful staff The lows: - the hot water is non-existent - get ready for a lukewarm (at best) shower - old bones - they supposedly refurbished the rooms, but instead they simply painted, put in new carpet and possibly a new bed.  The bathrooms are old and the furniture is old (but that's ok). - concierge lounge - nice room, absolutely terrible selection of food.  The eggs for some reason taste like they have saw dust in them, no bacon or sausage - cold cuts, fruit - melon, no berries or the like, I guess they have a pretty good bread selection (which I don't eat).  But clearly the worst run concierge I have experienced in a long time. - fitness facility - small and cramped for a hotel this

The hotel is in an ideal spot. Right by the water and so close to parks, restaurants and so much to do. It was a tiny room where everything in it cost extra though. Overall I would stay again as the ideal location helps make up for the room.

Really enjoyed staying at the Sheraton on business. It was an easy walk to the Mag mile and other things. I had a beautiful view from the river! The lobby was pretty dead with the main bar closed, but overall a good stay. I'll see myself back here next year I think!

We celebrated New Year Eve with fire works by hotel. Large loft , dinnig lounge and breakfast jn basement area. Nice decor and excellent view of skyline. Rooms are large and spacious.  Breakfast is not included in charges for Room.  You have to order from Menu. Children look forward for lots of varities in foods and got disppointed. We get one Drinking Water Bottle as coutsey service.  No courtsy hot coffee and water cooler in lounge.

Rooms are a bit dated. Aircon very noisy. Place is a bit soulless. Main bar was shut. Very large halls and areas that lack character. The fitness suite is average. The location is good. That‚Äôs about it.

I was very surprised by the great service at this huge convention type hotel. Everyone was friendly even though it was super busy for New Year‚Äôs. The housekeeping staff were also very happy and seemed to enjoy their work.  I did mobile check in but later went downstairs to speak with the Bonvoy desk attendant about late checkout and bonus points. He welcomed me as titanium elite and confirmed our 4PM checkout and recommended RPM Steak as I asked for dinner recommendations. Even though this is a huge hotel, service was efficient and the concierge was particularly helpful with walking directions to Michigan Ave.  We stayed here for one night (Dec 31) in a river front facing room (2911). I requested an upgrade online and the higher floor views were amazing. The midnight fireworks

Stayed here for a national conference. Nice rooms with great location to Michigan Ave etc. located along the River with easy access. Clean rooms. Staff was very attentive. Walking distance to most anything you would want to do.

The Hotel is quite good. Location great, but watch your bill at all times. They seem to charge you for drinks you don‚Äôt have because there system of knowing who is buying the drinks is very poor. Also they will put money on hold on your credit card every day for a room charge even if you have paid the room in advance. So you may over spend on your card thinking you have money there and them be charged by your bank while waiting for the money to be refunded by the Hotel. Which they shouldn‚Äôt of touched in the first place.

I like the hotel. But the aircon blows onto the bed which is annoying and they put money on your credit card on hold so you can not spend that money, even if you have paid for the room upfront. This makes no sense when you have paid for the room and they are still taking money for the room. They need to have a better way of knowing who has paid and who hasn‚Äôt. Being such a big company very bad management. Also they charge you for drink that you didn‚Äôt have, so suggest checking your bill not putting key into checkout box near reception.

This was a very pleasant surprise,  was ease to get to and was in a perfect location to the Navy pier and all the restaurants and shopping!  Family loved it !  Clean and great services!  Right in the river, good views.  Staff was very helpful!!!!

Loved the views and location of the hotel. The hotel was well staffed for NYE and kept their composure despite the antics of some guests. Response to the marriott app chat was quick and efficient. Parking was very expensive and we were not fans of the mini bar with pressure sensors automatically charging guests. Will still stay again.

We stayed here one night with family. Rooms are clean and updated, though I was surprised there weren't more USB ports for charging. Great city and river views from our room. Uber pick up is easy. We had a problem at check in- I asked about club lounge access and was told our Bonvoy status wasn't eligible at this hotel. After we reviewed our reservation that clearly listed lounge access, we returned downstairs and were told a mistake was made and we got the situation corrected. Breakfast area in club lounge was way too small, as it is in most hotels, so get there early. All employees were friendly and helpful.

We arrived at 1.45pm and didn‚Äôt get into our room until 4.25pm.  We booked a family room, however the additional bed wasn‚Äôt made up and when we called for it to be made up, we are still waiting....we have been waiting for over an hour, with young children at close to 11pm at night.

As soon as we got there, the guys helped us get unloaded.  Then we waited a little bit to get checked in.  As soon as I heard the lady speaking, I KNEW she was sick.  She had a sore throat, and couldn't talk that well.  I really didn't want her to check us in, because I didn't want to risk the chance of either my husband or I getting sick. Which my husband is terminally ill with lung cancer,  and if he gets sick, and developes a fever, he can die.  Well, we BOTH got sick.  Thankfully he didn't get as sick as I did.  When I called the hotel management to tell them what had happened, she knew who checked us in, and said, yes she had a sore throught, and couldn't talk, but she wasn't sick.  Would you like to talk to her?  What's the point?  She would've argued she wasn't sick.  But

I stay here annually now for a weekend trip to Chicago with my girlfriend and another young couple, while I don‚Äôt explore the intricacies of some hotel frequenters (there are longer lists of services available at nicer hotels like this one), I can speak for the comfort and high quality of the stay. Great price for the location in my humble opinion! Short walk to the Loop, near the water, and right on the river too. Whole Foods is next door to fuel up for a long day, and Uber/Lyft pickup outside the Sheraton is smooth and organized.

We really enjoyed our time at the Sheraton. We upgraded to a river view room facing the city. The staff was very helpful. Magnificent Mile was easy to walk to. Parking garage below the hotel was so easy to get to, in, and out of. The only issue we had was the phone would ring once or twice until midnight. I unplugged it at that time.

Hotel was clean and pleasant and the staff were friendly. Rooms were generous size, and beds were very comfortable. Disappointed that wifi wasn't free here, though this was the only thing we were disappointed with.

I have stayed at this property several times over the years and it use to be my hotel of choice--ever since the Marriott merger, this property has been going completely down hill.  When attempting to change my reservation I was told by several different employees 3 different variations of their "new cancellation policies."  No one seemed to be able to give me a straight answer to my questions and the managers refused to provide me with a refund after attempting to cancel my reservation within 72 hours of my stay.  The employees clearly need training on the new policies and should be able to speak to them with conviction.  SPG members should be clearly notified of the changes in policy after the merger to Marriott, and the important nuances between "Bonvoy" and SPG rewards.  I

This very large hotel has very comfortable rooms and lovely common spaces with a pool and exercise gym and a great restaurant as well as several coffee and lunch venues in the hotel. Well situated. Have stayed here many time.

This is a grand old dame, but dated. The nickel and dime you for everthing. The catered food is not up to what you would expect and the staff is surley. They act like they don't want to be here. I was there for a conference and really wish I booked some where else.

I enjoyed my stay the Sheraton Grand Chicago. I was told that would get a guest room on a high floor (29th) that had been renovated because of my Marriott Bonvoy Gold Elite status. I was underwhelmed by the room; however the river view was exceptional. The property is clean, the bar is very good, and the staff at the LB Caf√© is friendly and efficient.  This was my first visit to Chicago, and I will certainly come back when it‚Äôs warmer/.

I was in town for a work reception and decided to stay at this hotel due to its amenities and location in downtown. Perks of this hotel included,  1) Whole Foods a 5 minute walk away 2) Easy and quick check in (I did arrive at 1am) 3) I got upgraded due to my Bonvoy status to the club lounge and definitely found it worth it. The place has amazing views of the Chicago River and downtown. They have free water bottles throughout the day and breakfast included eggs, toast, cereal and fresh fruit.   My only real downside was the gym, which had 2 Peloton bikes but neither of them were connected so I wasn‚Äôt able to use them. Other equipment was great though.

The hotel staff were very helpful, valet parking was excellent.  The room had a river view which was great.  The weather was unusually cold for the time of year so we didn't do much outdoors. Would stay here again.

Convenient location along the river and riverwalk in a mix of attractive older buildings and very contemporary steel and glass towers.  My room viewed the city, and not Lake Michigan, including the Trump Hotel and Tower with its large capital letters reading TRUMP on the side facing the river.  The meeting spaces were adequate and the overall facilities were good.  My room was of a nice size but it did have some background noise from traffic crossing the metal decking of the lift bridge below.   The bathroom should be updated.  The tub floor looked gray and the face of several of the bath tiles was peeling.  Apparently club level rooms have been updated. The hotel is showing a bit of age and dated by its architecture.

I was here for marathon weekend and it was very crowded. Check-in was fine and room was nice. Very good location near many things in Chicago. Breakfast buffet,  although a little pricey, was good. The concierge lounge at this property was very good and all the people working there were friendly and helpful.

Great location, great rooms, great staff. Corner room offering view of river and navy pier. Check in was under staffed and took too long. Able to exit hotel onto river walk. Negative was the cost of parking onsite. Way too expensive!!

Wow - I loved this hotel! It's massive, and I attended as part of a large conference, which made it very convenient. It was comfortable and clean. They upgraded my room (as a Gold Bonvoy member) to a MASSIVE suite, which made me feel like a rock-star. I really can't think of any negatives to this place.  Some highlights:  1. Location - right on the Riverwalk, a 5 minute walk to downtown. 2. Great fitness centre - roomy with lots of machines and weights. 3. Luxurious lobby. 4. Clean, modern rooms, comfortable beds, and modern bathrooms. 5. Netflix on all the TVs!  This will be my preferred hotel when I come to Chicago in the future. Thank you!

This review is specifically for the caf√© in the hotel. I came here for a conference and that means that the line for coffee and to-go breakfast was always long, but not to worry! The wonderful ladies working at the caf√© are a well oiled machine that give great service with a positive attitude and a smile. They made my long days in the exhibitior hall start in a bright note!

I stayed here for a 3 day conference. The room was very spacious and I had a view of the river which was pretty awesome. I love the location of this hotel. It's centrally located and easy to get to all the well know attractions in Chicago.The only small gripe I had about my room was it was right by the elevator. I can here the elevator go up and down in the middle of the night. Other than that, this hotel is great!

Our family was treated great during our weekend stay. We used the pool and health club. Both were clean and in good condition. The rooms may be slightly dated, however, for the price, it was a great value and we‚Äôd definitely return.

I have stayed at this hotel 3 times now, and I really like it centrality. Walking distance to the miracle mile, easy access to River South and River North area. Can catch the hop on hop off bus tour right out front of the hotel. Excellent choice. Very cool to also watch the Chicago Marathon as the runners pass right by this hotel.

This hotel is located right on the river in the middle of downtown.  Very easy walk to Navy Pier and any of the architecture water tours you'd want to take in Chicago.  My room had a great view of the river and city.  The rooms could be updated a little, but weren't too bad.  The gym had a lot of great equipment including a Pelaton bike that I was a bit intimidated to setup and try.

I stayed here for a conference and it was a great stay from the ease of check in to the spacious room. I had a view of the river and it looked great! The only issues I had was my room was right by the elevator so I can here it go up and down and the check out like was super long. I think scheduling could have been anticipated when you are aware of a large check out process due to groups. Other than that, I love the located of the property as it is centrally located and walking distance to most of the attraction of Chicago.

Beautiful hotel with excellent facilities. It was American Thyroid assc convention and this was the venue.  Problem started upon check in when the ‚Äúsystem‚Äù noted our booking was cnacelled.  After haggling, i was given a room.  The booking included wifi and breakfast but the dining area was not informed so the ‚Äúsystem‚Äù again failed. So our tour leader had to complain again.  Upon check out, thentour leader asked to settle my bill and spelled out my name BUT  the ‚Äúsystem ‚Äú cant locate my name. When i messaged her my room number then the ‚Äúsystem‚Äù suddenly had me on the list. The girl in the counter cant answer why it happend.  Overall the stay the bed and facilities are excellent. The management should look at their computer gitches because the team cant explain the fiasco except

There is always the temptation to look beyond those "older" hotels that are exceptionally well located and try newer properties.  I debated this property versus something newer and opted for the better location.  The hotel, which must be well over 30 years old was fresh and comfortable. There is the odd design element that shows its age (bathrooms). However, we had a spacious room with a view of the river that was functional and comfortable. This is probably a small thing but some hotels can feel pokey based on the size of the corridors. The Sheraton Grand has wide and spacious corridors. making the hotel (which is large) feel more like a boutique hotel.  We found the staff excellent - very friendly and efficient.   Overall an excellent stay.

Located in downtown. Great place to stay. Rooms are nice, big. I had a river view room and it looked fantastic. Amenities were as per the standard. Concierge service was fantastic and helped me booking and great advice as well. Check in and out was smooth

Love this hotel. Well located for my office and the rooms are well appointed and newly renovated. Bed was comfortable and shower was great - strong pressure and hot hot water. Gym was great too. Nice equipment including peloton bike and lots of pieces. Bar was busy every evening and worth having a drink at.

First time visiting Chicago.  Our convention group was booked at the Sheraton Grand.  Happy we were as the location and hotel are excellent. Right on the riverfront so morning exercise walks were great.  Hotel itself it very spacious and comfortable.  We had a corner room which was huge with great views.  Elevators were fastest I have ever experienced at a hotel.  Beds extremely comfortable and staff was great.  Really enjoyed our stay.  Only caveat is the only morning coffee is the Starbucks in the hotel.  I‚Äôm not a Starbuck fan and it is expensive as well.  I wish there was a coffee shop or Dunkin near by. Otherwise excellent all around.

We stayed here for 4 days. The location was fabulous. We like to explore on our feet and this hotel could not be better located. This is a walker or public transit riders dream. The lobby is lovely and the staff could not have been more welcoming. We were greeted by water often when waiting at the concierge for recommendations or help. At check in the staff was welcoming and had some good recommendations. The room on the other hand was small and dark. We got the upgraded view at check in as a surprise bonus but, it doesn‚Äôt change the fact that the rooms are disappointing. Clean and neat though.

The hotel is beautifully appointed and has a great view of the river! Plus you are close to lots of sites and attractions, the only downside is the elevators need more of them waited almost 20 minutes to head downstairs :(

This was our 1st time staying at the Sheraton Grand Chicago. The location along the river was terrific. My husband‚Äôs conference was being held there which made it so convenient. We dined at Shulas steakhouse which was delicious. I also had the buffet breakfast every morning at LB Bistro which started my days off perfectly before I headed to the museums. The room had a perfect view of the Chicago river especially at night when all the buildings sparkled like stars. The room was average in size. It could have used a loveseat instead of one chair. We didn‚Äôt get the renovated room that I hoped for but the view made up for it.

Stayed here for 10 nights and really couldn't find anything to fault the place on. Nice staff at desk, room was immaculate and recently refurbished. Nice terrace bit by the river. Very pleasantly surprised given the hotel isn't a new hotel. Highly recommend.

Stayed at this hotel 2 weekends ago. Everything was great expect for the fact my credit card was charged and I was never sent a bill. Tried calling and was told they couldn't find my bill. Emailed and was never gotten back to. Absolutely unacceptable.

A big hotel with a dedicated staff that truly wants to make your stay a great one.  Have to call out Melissa at the desk, Matt at the bar in Shula‚Äôs and Paula at concierge.  The Chicago marathon was starting at the time we were to depart and Paula made certain we had a ride set up (at a great price) with someone who knew how to get around the race route. She even checked in during the trip to make certain all was going well! First class!

Location good. Club room not worth extra cost. Most basic we have ever experienced. Never been in a club  room where a glass of wine is $12plus tax and tip. We should have had a newly renovated room on high floor. Our room was not newly renovated and to use the club room meant we had to go down transfer to another lift to go to the club room. After complaining we were moved to a higher floor.

Stayed for one night and had a great stay. Arrived early and the receptionist realised I‚Äôd travelled a long way and kindly let me check in early so I could rest. Room was clean and spacious with great views of Chicago. The rooms are old and probably could do with an upgrade and lick of paint but that didn‚Äôt at all diminish that it was a great stay. The location is right next to the Chicago River and a easy walk to all the main areas of Chicago. Definitely would recommend staying here.

Enjoyed a two-night stay for a conference. Nothing to complain about and nothing to rave about. I really liked the location - I had a view of the Chicago River and Lake Michigan from my room. Nice exit onto the river walk from the bottom level. The only meal I ate onsite was at a banquet and the food exceeded my expectations. Easy to check-in and out. Right next to Navy Pier. And since I didn't have to pay (company dime), I have no idea if the value was worth it or not. Everything was as it should be in the room. Overall this review likely didn't help you - but hey good luck finding the right hotel in Chicago. Got plenty of options!

Disappointed in Shula Steak House. The music was loud and uncomfortable for a restaurant at 6pm. Had to leave before ordering because of the volume. No other restaurant available in the hotel. Sure, I could have ordered in however not a fan of eating in hotel room.

Great hotel great location right on the Chicago River. We upgraded to a suite which is well worth doing also had a club room so breakfast was included. The rooms overlooking the river have spectacular views of all the buildings lit up at night. The room has every thing you would need for a comfortable stay. it is only a short walk from Michigan Avenue and a 10 minute walk from Navy pier. The staff on reseption were very helpful

We stayed here one night while in Chicago. I got a very good price and was overall very happy. The hotel is in the center of Chicago on the river. It is in a nice area and you can walk to most places. Just be aware that the parking price is astronomical. It was $60 to SELF PARK overnight. It was in a secure garage but.... I think that is a bit too much. You can park within a block for $25. The room seemed very clean until I went to use my towel and there were brown and black marks all over it. They looked fresh and not stained. GROSS. Other than that, it is a very nice hotel.

Not impressed. Hotel has a very nice grand entrance. All elevators didn‚Äôt seem to be working/running. Rooms very basic. Toiletries limited to cheap shampoo,conditioner and moisturizer. A/c had SERVICE illuminated even after me reporting it. Failed to service room had to request in the evening. Door men extremely helpful and friendly. Lack of charging stations in lobby/lounge area. Needs updating.

The room I satyed in had a nice river view, but during my stay the construction noise from the opposite river side disturbed me, especially on Saturday morning. The doors to the corridor are everythen else than nois proof and due to some reunion events over the weekend it was very noisy, even in the late evening. The carpets in the rooms are worn out and no longer fashionable: They should be replaced by wooden panels. On the posive side, staff was very helpful and friendly.

The room I stayed at had a partial lake view which was nice.   I was told that it was a recently refreshed room but it still seemed tired to me.   The staff was helpful but the reception desk staff could have been more professional.   They seemed all too casual in their behavior.     The only choice on Sunday for dining was the bar and they had a very limited menu of only cold bites.     It was very conveniently located with many steak houses in walking distance but not a lot of diversity.     The members lounge had limited amenities and services.   Overall a nice hotel but nothing extraordinary.

Stayed here for a weekend get together with old friends, at a decent group rate. Wonderful location with pleasant, if rather  overpriced, bar and steak restaurant ("Shula's). The lobby is huge with plenty of seating. My room was large and comfortable but no microwave or fridge. It was on a high floor; elevator service was slow. I was sorry not to have a view of the river. The electronic key on the Marriott app didn't always work, so I got a real key from the front desk. All in all, a satisfactory experience.

I recently went here for a conference and was very pleased with the hotel, the room and all amenities! Nice bed, bathtub, and tv! The staff were pleasant and very helpful. Great access to the city and local food!

I came here this past weekend and the hotel is on a great location. Everything is in walking distance. You can't come to Chicago and not walk on the River Walk. The Navy Pier is so close and UBER access is great from this location.

Sheraton Grand is located in within easy walk of Navy Pier, Mag. Mile, several good restaurants and entertainment  . It sits right on the riverwalk with access to outdoor seating and dining. Beautiful view of Navy Pier and the lake from my room on 33rd floor.  Although the hotel was quite busy, there was no wait for the elevator, or for luggage services, when  I stored my luggage, as my room wasn't ready. They did have a room for me by 2:00 ( I was super warly( and I was notified by text.. Nice room, large, comfy bed.

Had a club level room with a great view of the river, river walk and all the buildings across the river, was fun to watch all the people down below. The room had nice style but was not big. The hotel was crowded and checkin was slow even for high level club members. Parking was very expensive. Uber was the way to get around. The club for breakfast and snack in the late afternoon was out of control on a holiday weekend.. Breakfast had a line down the hall to get in. The afternoon was easier, the help was great and especially RENE, who was Puerto Rican, he made each visit special. So friendly and helpful, be sure to visit with this great guy! You will always have a friend in Chicago. The maids were very friendly also.  All in all the hotel is a nice place to spend a few days in

The hotel was situated within walking distance of many great food options.The service provided at check in was prompt and painless especially after a missed flight. Inside the rooms, the decor was modern and clean. Could not really fault it for a 4 star hotel. Would definitely recommend.

My husband surprised me for our anniversary by booking a great room, with flowers and chocolates to be delivered to our room (in which he also called the number for the hotel to verify as well). When we arrived we did not get either. We were told that the Sheraton online Booking and telephone service are not their company. SERIOUSLY??!! My husband explained that he called the number listed on the website and he was still told by the recption desk that it isnt associates with them. We will NEVER stay here again.

High priced comfort inn. The hotel is nicely done, some of the staff were rude. The beds were awful and the pillows were so flat I had to fold them up to get any support, called guest services to get firmer pillows, when they were delivered I thought a mistake was made, my husband chased the guy down, those were the firm pillows, looked and felt the same as the crapy ones. The little cafe downstairs serves Starbucks coffee, that was the highlight of this hotel

The hotel was nice and the service was fair. The rooms are dated, could use a good renovation. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. I would try another hotel next time, not very worth it for the price.

The location is terrific..near Michigan Avenue and right on the river. All staff super nice and responsive to requests for services. Only things I didn‚Äôt like were the food options were not great for vegetarians...the charging of anything in the mini bar or on top of counter gets moved (we weren‚Äôt charged it‚Äôs just annoying to think if we move something we could be and because of this there was no usable fridge in the room) and the rooms were a bit small and old for the price. Love that it‚Äôs dog friendly!

Booked a room with river view.  The room smelled musty and wasn‚Äôt cleaned well.  The window was extremely dirty so defeated the purpose of having a river view.  We were moved to a room two doors down and that one was a little worse.  The phone didn‚Äôt work and the bathroom was dirty.  We were finally able to move to one of the renovated rooms which I guess there are some of those and it was a little better with new bedding and some furniture.  The lamp didn‚Äôt work by the bed but we could see out the window.    Just not what we expected for the price and for a Sheraton.  Scratching this one off the list.

Took forever to check-in.  Twice, AFTER dinner, we were told our room wasn‚Äôt ready.  Then for the next two nights-they NEVER cleaned our room.  Both nights upon return from our meetings we were told oops, sorry, it‚Äôs too late to get someone here, we‚Äôll send clean towels.  What?  Where was management?  How is this acceptable for a Sheraton? Would not recommend!

Stayed here 10/9 -11.  Very polite front desk staff explained how things run during covid.  I was recognized as an Accor member and am ex platinum.  We were given a 24th floor king room with a nice view of the Hancock building.  Room was very clean with an exceptionally comfortable king bed.  Separate glass enclosed shower and a nice bathroom with shampoo, soap bottles etc.  One robe and two towels were provided with no additional housekeeping for the two night stay.  Extra towels were brought up on request.  In room Keurig coffee maker was appreciated.   The is a nice outdoor seating casual restaurant less than a block away that is open 7 days a week. Location is convienet to walk to most popular dining, shopping etc.   We would definitely stay at this location again.

We spent a few nights at the lovely Sofitel in late July while visiting family in the area.  They did an amazing job of instituting in-depth safety procedures without making guests feel uncomfortable or unwelcome--in my experience, this can be a hard mark to hit.  We loved the convenient location and comfortable rooms.  During our stay, we enjoyed both their dining room and bar and noted the spaced out seating to allow distancing and the thorough cleaning of tables after guests departed.  It was a truly delightful stay and I congratulate the gracious staff for both their hospitality and their attention to safety.

The hotel is pretty nice but it is overshadowed by the high price of parking. The parking is $50 a night, which is very pricey for most budgets. If You plan on coming to Chicago and need to park a car, choose a hotel that offers better parking options.

Road trip to Chicago during a crazy time in our world. The Sofitel is a beautiful hotel at a reasonable price in a wonderful location. It is a block away from Chicago's Miracle Mile and John Hancock Building. The hotel was clean, room spotless, and large. It was nice and modern. Staff was very nice and accommodating for any request in this difficult time. Highly recommend this hotel!

After a long confinement to take care of my parents, we came to this large and beautiful hotel, we were very well received especially by Stefano who helped us so much to make this stay magnificent, we slept in a spacious room with lots of technological equipment, beautiful functional bathroom, incredible breakfast

In this trip my friends and me visited Chicago, we really enjoyed it to do, We travel around US and Latin America. We decided to stay in this hotel, i read other opinion and i thought that it will be a good idea.  The hotel could be a little bit expensive but has good amenities, nice view, it has good location and nice resaurant. When we visited Chicago was before thecovid's 19 pandemic.

I couldn‚Äôt be more delighted than with the service we received upon our first stay at this property. The staff were friendly and accommodating. The hotel was clean and well prepped for the unique needs of a traveler during this pandemic. Hotel breakfast was delicious and I wished I would have tried it out first day there, as then I would have ordered it every day. Make sure to have a staff member show you you all of the lights and motorized shade function in the suites as they can be tricky and can seem like they are malfunctioning. You just need a quick tutorial and you‚Äôll be all set. I look forward to future visits to this property.

Sofitel Chicago is definitely a must try when you are in the area. With great service, beautiful clean rooms, top notch  bedding, and most importantly delicious food and cocktails.  The location is close to many restaurants and attractions.

Sofitel Chicago, without question, certainly has the best housekeeping department in the city.  Whether one is travelling for business or leisure.  Stephano, who is combined Engineering and Housekeeping Director, is the most organized and highly efficient manager that a guest could ever imagine.  As a world traveler, I have not never seen anyone with a versatility who runs a department with attention to every detail, his interest is only what is the guests wish.  Stephano‚Äôs ability to handle any situation at the hotel aside from the incredible housekeeping arena ‚Äúmakes this hotel‚Äù.  Stephano is known as ‚ÄúMR FIX IT‚Äù at the hotel.  After nearly three months of staying at the property, his knowledge and professionalism is beyond one‚Äôs highest expectation.  His success, I believe,

This was our first stay during COVID and we were impressed by the cleanliness of the room and kindness of the staff. Sanitizer and masks were available, and room service was only upon request. Water bottles were provided in the lobby, and while the restaurant was busy even for to-go orders, it was delicious!

This was my first time staying a hotel post-COVID, so I was a little apprehensive about it. However, immediately upon walking in to the Sofitel I was impressed with the measures they'd taken, from glass partitions at the check-in desk to sanitizing wipe dispensers. The common areas are also beautiful, with a luxe look deserving of the price and hotel class. The woman who checked me in was very welcoming, as were the other staff I encountered during my stay.   My room looked great at first glance as well, with upscale finishes and a comfortable bed. But as I started to get settled and take a closer look around, some alarm bells began to go off in my head. I noticed black hairs on almost every surface of the room. From the desk to the bathtub, there was hair everywhere. I'm a

I travel a lot and rely on  TripAdvisor, so I will try to provide the info that I look for in a review,  Judging a hotel during COVID is difficult as these are strange times and things are in flux.  That said, we stayed for 5 days (booked through Accor website).  The Accor program only gives you credit when you book directly through them which is pretty unusual and a little stupid, so while I have stayed in many Sofitels and Fairmonts, it doesn't  show on my account.  Check-in was a bit of a cluster. Had emailed the week before to confirm (as the hotel that I had originally booked- the Langham- cancelled and delayed opening until July). Gave my arrival time and requested a high floor.  Called the day before to again confirm and was told we were all set.  Arrived on time (3PM)

This week, I stayed at Sofitel Chicago Magnificent Mile, and we experienced excellent customer service. I would like to commend Kyle Jackson, Director of Rooms, for his excellent customer service and attention to detail. My stay was during the week of June 12-17, 2020, immediately after the hotel's re-opening due to the COVID-19 pandemic. During these especially difficult times, Kyle came through like a champ! Due to the pandemic, we had to order food to-go from local restaurants. Therefore, we needed a microwave oven, refrigerator, cutlery and plates and needed plates and cutlery. We presented our requests to Kyle, and he promptly arranged to have everything delivered to our room. Each time we needed towels or the trash taken out, or the room cleaned, Kyle again responded

Sofitel has wonderful employees, and we are sorry for their loss of wages recently. Chicago‚Äôs inability to manage its police force, finances and criminals means we aren‚Äôt coming. Hopefully, the city of Chicago can become safe and enjoyable again someday.

The location and decoration are very good, very safe to get around even at night time, also convenient for dining and shopping. Service is excellent! One of the newest hotels in downtown Chicago. Breakfast is not bad

Great views of the Chicago sky scrapers and in all the action of shopping districts.  This place was unprecedented...  I thought the staff were friendly and efficient and the room was overall comfortable.

I have never written a review before. Stayed here recently with my family. I left my watch on the bed and when we returned to the room it was gone. Not wishing to rush to any judgment, I immediately contacted hotel staff and asked for the issue to be investigated. It transpired that house cleaning picked it up and put in with the industrial laundry. Mistakes happen, albeit the particular maid was grumpy because our 13 month old was napping so she couldn‚Äôt get into the room earlier. Anyway, the hotel assured me they would ‚Äúdo they right thing‚Äù. They haven‚Äôt. Their insurers have offered a derisory amount and to buy the exact replacement will cost me 2k more. What my major issue us that the hotel have ignored all emails and allowed the situation drag on. I wasn‚Äôt even offered as

I stayed at this hotel for the night of i got married. we arrived late at night and Andrey was checking us in. he recognize my nationality from my name which is Kazakhstan and after telling that we just got married in that night he upgraded our room to a suit  and congratulated us in our language. after arrived to our room we were surprised by the room and its great view.after some minutes Andrey  surprised us again with pastry and congratulation card which was delivered by the room service. this was made our wedding night unforgettable and we will not hesitate to suggest your hotel to all of my friends and family. Thank you Andrey and sofitel team for this amazing stay.

great food but you might want to print out your reservation first their credit card system cheated me out of a night showers are pretty slim the liquer was expensive ... its a chinse affair i spent it on new years eve ... dining was great perhaps if you use a credit card have your information on you, i was excited to be in Oprah world

The Sofitel is a beautiful hotel in a great neighborhood. Our room was modern and comfortable. We had a suite which mead a nice size. There were slippers and robes which was a nice touch. The hotel is very clean. The front desk staff were very friendly. The location is excellent. Lots of restaurants and shopping close by. I will definitely stay here again.

Frequent traveler to Chicago for business and pleasure.  Sofitel never disappoints.  Excellent place for business travel as location is close to everything, including Chicago Loop business, which is a short Uber/Lyft or 20 min walk.  Restaurant and bar area are chic and staff outstanding throughout this hotel.

Located in the northern part of downtown, the area feels a bit more relaxed than hotels on Michigan Ave (2 blocks away) or in the loop.   The area has great restaurants, nice shopping, and it's walking distance to many things.  We walked to / from the Art Institute and  Field Museum.   Well appointed room and bathroom.

We enjoyed a brief stay at the Sofitel. It is well-sited for many of Chicago's attractions with many in easy walking distance. The bedoom is spacious. There are pkenty of restaurants and bars nearby as are the shops on the Magnificent Mile and the John Hancock building.

I cannot say enough wonderful things about the staff.  Charcoal in was a breeze.  Our car was loaded with boxes, a nightstand, bags, and miscellaneous items.  The bellhops surrounded our car and unloaded everything onto carts, then proceeded to get all if it to our room.  Then we had another load of 15 more boxes which were shipped to a friend in Chicago.  That night we picked up those boxes and the bellhops did it again.  The next morning they loaded several loads onto our car.  The rooms were incredibly comfortable.  The location is in the Gold Coast area, so lots surrounding hotel.  We are very grateful to the staff.

This modern, sleek hotel is located just off Michigan Avenue in an area with great restaurants and shops. The welcome was very warm, with excellent, professional staff who wanted to ensure that we would enjoy our stay. The benefits of the AMEX program were clearly explained and we received an upgrade. The room was spacious with beautiful views of the neighborhood and the bathroom was well laid out, with a separate tub and shower (and nice Lanvin products). The bar has a great atmosphere and excellent staff serving fine cocktails and small dishes. Finally, breakfast is served in the airy and bright restaurant and the croissants in particular are not to be missed. We would definitely stay here again.

Spent a night here on our anniversary. It was great. The staff, the room, the location, the amenities and the restaurants were terrific! We had dinner in the cocktail lounge-delightful! And, breakast the next morning in the restaurant. Yummy and relaxing!

The check in with Carlos was fast,efficient and Incredibly friendly. He also upgraded our room without asking and all his recommendations for restaurants were spot on. The room was well-appointed and very clean. The whole experience was topped off by free champagne and appetizers in the lobby. We will definitely stay here again the next time we are in Chicago.

Loved this hotel! Perfect perfect location! Close to so many great restaurants and bars! Clean room, comfortable bed, bathroom and accessories were wonderful. We were on the 28th floor with great views!  Front desk were quick, efficient, and ever so friendly! Will definitely stay again! Thanks for the great stay!

We had a very nice stay at Sofitel. The room was very nice and spacious. Service and attention was A+. Great location within the Magnificent Mile. Close to restaurants, shops, etc. I could definitively stay again.

I travel a lot to Chicago for work - this is by far one of my favorite hotels. It's easy walking distance to the river, Navy Pier, Mag Mile, and my office.  The environment is fresh and bright, the service was wonderful and the place is just beautiful.

The following are notes from my experience staying in a Prestige Suite:  Closet was small for a suite. Half the closet space of most american standard hotel rooms...in a suite. This is a french closet door, which was very old and worn and kept getting unaligned.  Wifi did not work. The engineer that came by was kind and professional, but 3rd party internet provider had to be called and they could not fix problem as the router was in another hotel guest room.  The Prestige suite has a ridiculously small walk in shower. Smaller than the one at a basic gym locker room. It only fits one adult person and doesn't have enough room for that person to stretch...in a suite that seemed to have been updated with attention to (most) details.  Note: High floors not guaranteed with Prestige

Quite sophisticated hotel in Chicago downtown, in a very good position to walk through the Magnificient Mile as well as the main attractions in the city center. It is a modern style hotel, clean and in order, basically it is worth the cost.

The Sofitel was magnificent indeed.   Perfect location, centrally located to Magnificent Mile as well as the Loop, with many fantastic dining options nearby.   The room was fabulous with the signature feathertop bed and designer toiletries, a lovely size. (Ask for a corner room)  There was an option for housekeeping not to come and clean the room, and you could get $10 back.   Complimentary tea & coffee making facilities for the guests downtown available 24hrs.   We stayed at another hotel on Mag Mile, but would definitely return to the Sofitel in the future.   Highly recommended!

Our stay was in a Superior king on the 18th floor (free upgrade because our room wasn‚Äôt ready when we arrived), and the views were gorgeous. The room was very well appointed and had one of the most comfortable beds I‚Äôve ever slept on (although there was no top sheet, just a duvet). The rain head shower was glorious but there were some dirty aspects of it (see photos). The chaise had a large stain so we just avoided sitting on it. The thing that really disappointed us was the $20 ‚Äúamenity fee‚Äù that we were charged upon checkout for using the mini fridge in the room (needed to store leftover dinner). I‚Äôve never been charged a fee for using a mini fridge at any hotel I‚Äôve ever stayed in. Overall, the location was terrific and the staff was very courteous. It was that amenity fee

My husband and I will definitely visit this posh, beautiful hotel again. From the moment we stepped into the gorgeous lobby, we were impressed. As we approached the reception desk, we were greeted by Eric‚Äôs warm, friendly and professional demeanor. He made a great first impression of this property. Our room was spotless, modern and very well appointed with robes, slippers, Keurig machine and a super comfy bed! Bathroom is spacious and classy! Mike, our doorman, was also very friendly and helpful which just added to our positive feelings for this hotel. We highly recommend staying here!

As conference co-chair for the second year in a row, we were alarmed when we learned of new management at the Sofitel. With stellar experiences in prior years on every level, accommodations, catering and personnel, we thought we would be starting at Square 1. Not so, the new team elevated our prior experience to even greater heights. Our pre-conference meeting was attended by an army of Sofitel staff with GM Matt at the helm, dedicated to serving every aspect of our experience. They were knowledgeable, professional, accommodating and treated everyone involved at the conference with tremendous grace and respect. We‚Äôre coming back again for our sixth year and back to the Sofitel L.A. for our mid-year meeting. Thank you to everyone on the Sofitel Chicago team. You knocked it out of

Absolutely very good hotel not only because of location (5 minutes from Michigan Ave) but also because of service, stuff and standard. Room are very good equipped and clean. Excellent bathroom. Very quiet.

The hotel is modern.  Located in the city center.  The rooms are very comfortable and spacious with everything you need for a comfortable stay.  The staff is well trained.  There is one, but significant drawback, standard breakfasts at a very high price.  A two minute walk from the hotel you can eat much tastier and half the price.

You will never do better than SOFITEL for travel accomodations!!! The fine personnel there treat you as a GUEST , that you truly are!  From the Bell Captain on through until Check Out, the treatment is always friendly, professional, efficient,  and very welcoming!

Hotel staff was friendly and helpful.  Needed to change rooms had other minor issues which were handled very well.  Rooms were what you would expect from a hotel of this caliber.  Location is prime and can't be beat.

This hotel is in a great location, just off Michigan Avenue. We booked a Prestige Suite and requested a high floor. It had great views & offered plenty of room for our family of 4.  It was clean, modern and a wonderful location at a fraction of the price of the other 5 star properties nearby.   If you want Magnificent Mile adjacent for a great value, book here.

Stayed two nights at the Sofitel Magnificent Mile for a conference. The check-in and check- out experiences were very smooth and so easy. I arrived early and was going to just check my luggage, but they secured a room for me to check in early. The room I stayed in was very luxurious and clean, comfortable beyond belief. Great hotel, great location, great staff!

What an amazing stay at the Sofitel Chicago. From the moment we checked in we felt special. The bed oh so comfortable, the small amenities supplied, and my wife loved the Hermes shampoo, condition, lotion, soap, and bath gel. Every person we came across was very friendly and helpful. Great location, great staff, and great room.

Nothing about this Sofitel experience was less than top-notch.  The property is well-appointed, and the room (a king) was very spacious.  The amenities were excellent, from the gym to those provided in the bathroom.  The staff were quite friendly, and there is no shortage of great restaurants, shops, and bars nearby (but without making the area loud and party-central).

We booked 4 rooms all on 8th flooring Dec 27 one night stay   Three rooms were ready at 3:30 the 4th two hours later   We out five of the six grandkids in one room I took off the pillow on the longe to give to the kids to lay on.  Here is where I discovered a sick disgusting sight    Food all over never cleaned. This was true on all rooms.  All the said was they gave me my room fee back which is 20.00 For one room   So check your rooms they probably are not cleaned. Or maybe now they might be after I showed the desk pictures

We had started out at another nearby hotel but was so disappointed we moved to the Sofitel, where we had stayed for our wedding night 10+ years ago; our stay was as perfect now as it was then.  Our junior suite was fantastic:  incredibly comfortable bed, spacious and luxe bathroom, lovely sitting area with large screen tv, perfectly quiet at night. Added bonuses included free coffee bar (excellent coffee) in the lobby, a fun bar and a very cool lobby decoration.  The location just off Michigan Ave is ideal, close to everything but out of the fray.  As always, it's the service that really distinguished the Sofitel; from the minute of checking in to leaving 4 days later, all the staff were professional, focused on our enjoyment and nice!  Can't say enough good things about our

kept having problems with the commode not working properly they were fast in answering with maintenance   but very inconvenient going down 20 floors to use the restroom. also they need to air purify the rooms they have pets in so as not to to bother next person in room with allergies no spa on location  server in bar was rude and they do not give back all your change from drinks!! just not a 5 star stay

What a great experience. The overall service was amazing. The concierge Morgan went way beyond to make this trip perfect! I would not hesitate to stay here again. Our favorite place yet in Chicago. Don‚Äôt forget to try the restaurant

A weekend stay, christmas shopping. Very convenient -a 3 minute walk to the Magnificent mile, where you can walk right into the Watertower mall. The motel has a very modern vibe throughout. The room was clean and roomy, the mattress was comfortable and the pillows didn't flatten. The bathroom was large and had a good ventilation system, The shower had easy controls. We stayed on the 7th floor right across fromthe elevator but never heard the noise from them.

Loved this hotel , beautiful , different holiday decor , friendly , helpful staff , clean , nice rooms , perfect for a girls trip !! Great location , easy , safe walk to the Magnificent Mile ! Perfect choice !

Nice, friendly, professional, comfy beds and just all around classy hotel.  Of course, Tripadvisor is just ridiculous and one has to write at least 200 characters, therefore, the Sofitel is nice, friendly, professional with comfy beds.  Classy hotel.

I recently had a fantastic experience with Allan at the front desk. He was so helpful in accommodating my stay I can‚Äôt say enough! The 5 star service made the stay more than worth it. I recommend this hotel to everyone. Can‚Äôt beat it.

High luxury hotel! Attended a wedding there...it was really amazing with all those sparkling chandelieres and fabulous service. The restaurant had a large choice of dishes for breakfast, especially continental style. The bed in the room so comfortable with pampering sheets and duvets... Highly recommended!

Right downtown by Navy Pier and Magnificent mile.  a great locaion to get anywhere in Chicago.  Staff was very friendly and rooms were comfortable and clean.  Evferything wsa great and I would definitely stay here agaim.

Everything good - Nothing negative    Great location (right downtown)  Friendly staff!   Most comfortable bed üòÄ and super nice bathroom with nice vanity - room to spread your things out  - good security too!

Last month, I was tasked with meeting with representatives of high profile companies in Chicago. I booked three rooms at the Sofitel for my team and I. Our meeting went very well and a few of the members of upper management from the companies that we met with chose to join us for a drink at the hotel bar. I would soon learn that this was a mistake. I was throughly embarrassed as our choice of hotel became the butt of the jokes for the rest of the evening. The lobby and common areas were filthy. One of the members commented that they were insulted that we had taken them to the ‚Äúmost glorified motel in Chicago.‚Äù Luckily, I didn‚Äôt lose our partnership however I‚Äôve learned to be much more careful in selecting my hotels!

I had a group that stayed at this hotel and they have nothing but good words to say. From check-in to check-out the stay was smooth. They appreciate how accommodating the staff were. And A+ for the breakfast. They loved it. Will definitely refer clients here again.

Coming in I was excited to stay at the Sofitel but left very disappointed. I had a cool shower on three of my four nights stay. I called the front desk the first night, after 2nd night approached the front desk and they said they would take care of it while I was out, 3rd night called the front desk again - maintenance knocked on my door after I was in bed! He was very nice and worked to correct the problem but I had to get dressed and told him it didn't matter as I was leaving early the next morning.  I really thought I would see at least an adjustment in my room charge but that did not happen when I checked out.  I hate to pile it on (and much of the staff was very, very nice) however the staff at the restaurant made sure I knew they closed at 3, when I stopped in at 2:30 for

We stayed at the Sofitel this summer. Check was easy as was check out. Our room was perfect. I‚Äôve stayed at the Sofitel hotel in Paris so I am familiar with the brand, it did not disappoint here in the states.   We also ate at one of the restaurants on site, everything was delicious. The location is prime as well. You will not be disappointed  Would I stay here again? Yes I would and would absolutely recommend it!!

We recently stayed on a leisure trip to Chicago to see a friend of ours that is currently in the production of The Niceties.  Morgan, the Concierge at the Sofitel, helped us so much and always had a smile on her face.  From simple directions, to a sensational recommendation of the Purple Pig, we felt very well taken care of and will definitely stay at the Sofitel and call on her expertise again in the future!

This is a terrific place to stay. Convenient location but off the frenzy of Michigan Avenue.  My room was clean and comfortable and had a terrific chaise on which to sit and work. The bathroom was large with a nice tiled shower and a large tub. Staff was helpful and a newspaper was provided in the morning. Would definitely stay here again.

What was a great place to eat a Sunday Brunch now is terrible. I mean just awful. Go to Tempo Restaurant down the block.  Sorry to say these words but this is how I feel Maybe they weren‚Äôt making money on the old menu but now they will be getting only hotel quest there now

This was our first stay at the Sofitel Chicago and it was simply wonderful!   From the gracious & friendly check in to the efficient and speedy check out, our stay was memorable.   The hotel decor is modern and very appealing.   Our room was spacious, comfortable and so quiet.  The location was great as Michigan Avenue was close.   This is a place we wish to return to and is highly recommended.

As much as I like this French chain and their Hotels. Chicago was a failure on every level! Employees just drop the ball left and right. Once you complain, the manager is correcting or trying to correct by some comps just to run into the next situation of failures to start all over again! Biggest disaster is the Front Desk and Bell Staff. Wonder how they got the rating they are riding on. That said, the rooms are nice,....but that's about it!

Stayed for 5 nights... room was a really good size and loved the free WiFi. Close to Michigan Ave. breakfasts were good. Staff really friendly and polite. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Loved the Mac n cheese on room service. Home cooked,

Prior to our trip, I emailed the concierge and received a prompt reply from Osbaldo.I knew immediately that we had chosen the right hotel.
