Osbaldo was very informative when it came to finding transportation other than a cab. He checked the opening times for Lincoln Park Zoo as we were going on Columbus Day. Lincoln Park Zoo is a must. It's free and less than a 10 minute cab ride away. On arrival from the UK and feeling tired (we are six hours in front of Chicago) we were greeted as if we were old friends by Eric and Elydia. They made Check-In fun and were informative of the services that were offered. Tea and coffee is complimentary and is available every morning in the lobby. Our room was on the 23rd floor and was immaculate and a very good size.  We had a huge bed and a chaise

After staying at a disappointing hotel booked for my conference last year, we vowed to find a hotel in magnificent mile that gave us the best Chicago experience, and the Sofitel definitely delivered. From the warm welcome by the staff to the absolutely incredible views, to the turndown service and meals at both cda and le bar, there wasn‚Äôt a single aspect of our stay that wasn‚Äôt executed perfectly.   I have never stayed at this particular chain before, but my experience was on par with stays at five star hotels. From now on, Sofitel is going to be at the top of my list when staying in Chicago or any new city.

Great location with superb service and accommodations all with a distinctly European influence and ambiance. All this in a good way you. You won‚Äôt regret staying at this upscale property. Whether walking or using mass transit this is where you will want to be.

Stayed here whilst attending the GBTA conference in August. Lovely hotel, friendly staff, great location. Not a massive fan of the breakfast. Rooms were really nice and big, very well equipped especially for someone who is travelling on business. Would stay here again!

The hotel is among the pricy ones, but you do get a lot in return - so we can highly recommend the place!   On the positive side: - location could not be better, two blocks away from the Magnificent Mile and a 5 min stroll from the metro station Chicago  - very friendly staff - good breakfast - comfy and clean rooms with a very ‚Äûnew‚Äú feel to it (not even scratches on the walls)  Potential for improvement: - the gym could use a refurbishment and does not have any daylight - during our stay, only two out of four elevators were operating, leaving guests with quite some waiting times when trying to go up or down  We would definitely come back!

We recently stayed at the Sofitel for our anniversary.  Upon check in we were warmly greeted by the staff.  We found our room and got settled in.  Sadly we found undergarments in the closet that did not belong to us and we had to have them removed before we could settle in completely.  The room was nice we had 2 beds and an adequate view.  The cable was out more than we could count on the rainy days we were there which made it challenging.  Thankful one of us had a book to entertain us.  We enjoyed the closeness of the hotel and spent what time we could away.

I stayed in this property ten times in the last 8 years.  All the stays were very good.    Unfortunately, my last stay was not at all as good as the pat stays at Sofitel Chicago.  Too many issues during my stay which really ruined my 3 nights at the property.  Food quality has dropped and housekeeping has rooms for improvement.    I conveyed my concerns to management, but it was too late, as our last night was really terrible and ended our vacation on a bad note.  I hope the hotel's management could take back this property to its better days.

The Sofitel is in a great location for walking Michigan Ave, great restaurants and shopping nearby. It's close to the north end of the strip, so perfect for walking all the way down the Magnificent Mile. Our room was clean and bright, with a big bathroom. Service was excellent, valets helpful, check-in was quick. In warmer weather, there's a nice area to sit outside and have a drink. We tried excellent restaurants within walking distance...Fig & Olive and Bistronomic. The famous Gibsons Steakhouse is also within walking distance.

I stayed two nights at the Sofitel Magnificent Mile for a conference. My check-in and check- out experiences were smooth and easy. I got there early and was going to just check my luggage, but the front desk person secured a room for me to check in early. The room I stayed in was clean, comfortable and luxurious. Great hotel, great location, great staff!

With a strikingly modern building located close to the Magnificent Mile in midst of a nice neighborhood, this hotel should have all it takes for a top rating. And indeed the rooms and bathroom leave little to be desired, both aesthetically and functionally. However, service is erratic, to say the least. Next to Vernon, the competent, personable concierge, I encountered both a female assistant manager as well as a doorman who definitely do not do the hotel proud. And no apologies forthcoming!

Very well located, fancy lobby and comfy room. The problem is the breakfast: the service was a mess, complet lack of management, over 20 minutes just to get your order. But even worse is the fact that whem I booked the room the breakfest was included, although NOBODY at the hotel was able to tell me what could I ordered without aditional charges. It¬¥s not about the money but if something is included should be Crystal clear at the menu what to order in this case. Summarizing, take your breakfast elsewhere and enjoy the hotel. By the way, the housekeeping is very well done.

Fantastic hotel and great facilities, an absolute gem. The selection for breakfast was excellent. Room service was also very tasty. All staff seem to be happy to work here and always smiling.  Thank you for the great hospitality.

Great location  Great Room  Great Service  Great Drinks  Rooms are stunning I was on the 25th floor in a corner room with a view of the city, bed is very comfortable, desk services were outstanding!!!!  I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this hotel and look forward to my next visit

Our stay at the Sofitel was wonderful. Beautiful hotel, clean comfortable rooms and a great location. Easily walk to most of the highlights Chicago has to offer. Staff is courteous and friendly. Le Bar is classy and great for sitting by the window and people watching. The views from the room are spectacular. Wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to go back.

The room was gorgeous.  A bit of inconsistency upon check in.  We were told one thing, our friends told something completely different and we came on the same Travelzoo promotion.  Service in the breakfast area bordered on ridiculous.  Food was tasty but overly priced.  I would come back again however.

amazing stay with lovely staff in reception , hk are super nice and the food is amazing woooooow , ill recomend this hotel to my people . thank you all the staff for making me happy during my whole stay

My coworker and I are nurses currently assigned at McCormick Place on the Covid-19 unit. After a long shift we decided to stay downtown and not drive back to the suburbs. We called ahead to check in. Asked if we can get a room on a higher floor with a view, I did mention we're nurses.  Upon walking into our room we were pleasantly surprised that they upgraded us to a gorgeous suite on the 31st floor. Very clean, huge, 2 bathroom suite with a view. Great service and friendly staff.

The room was big and clean with a great view of the lake and the Navy Pier.  Raquel the clerk at the front desk was very friendly and courteous and gave us exceptional service. We will definitely go back.  Thank you üòä

The room was huge and has a beautiful city and river view. I loved the very complete gym which even had smoothies to have after the workout and flavored waters. (I was there pre-covid). The bar on main level had very yummy drinks and the bartender was nice.

The hotel itself and staff are good but they are barely enforcing COVID safety protocols.  I'm local and needed a place to stay while my apartment was getting repaired (flood) and I was so pleased when this hotel had affordable rates for this extended weekend. I guess I'm getting what I paid for, because barely any guests are wearing masks.  I am only leaving my room to get food twice a day, and each time, there are large groups directly in front of reception without masks, and other groups scattered in the lobby and walking around, not eating/drinking, but completely maskless. They say only 2 per elevator, but they still have the elevators set to pick up from multiple floors. At one point a 6th person was trying to enter the elevator and I had to get out. I have even asked a

My husband and I stayed at the Swiss to give the kids something to do. They had an amazing time. I was impressed with the front desk representative Lanette Silas. She was hilarious the kids loved her and she made sure to give us great tourist attractions for our stay.

Location is excellent: 5min walk to the Millennium park, 5min walk to Architecture river cruise tour, 15min walk to 360 Chicago observation desk. There are plenty of restaurants nearby. Also there are restaurants in the hotel. Rooms: I highly recommend you to choose river-view room: it really takes your attention. You‚Äôll see skyscrapers, river and city life - it‚Äôs really cool. Bed and willows are very comfortable, bathroom is big: there is shower cabin and bath both. Wi-fi works excellent. Some information: Breakfast is not included - you should pay $50 per person. There is ‚Äúfast‚Äù parking zone in front of the main door - you can stop there for taking your luggage from the car and that‚Äôs it.

The staff is welcoming! If Nicole is not already employee of the year she needs to be ASAP. We are greeted with bright eyes and smiles underneath masks. The room has a beautiful view, desk to get work done, and a lounging area. Swiss√¥tel for the win!

Had a great stay. Olivia Miller checked us in and was amazing. She helped us upgrade to a suite that had amazing views of the lake and river. Huge bathtub. So much room. We ordered food and had lots of room to eat. Bought tickets in advance for the field museum and art institute. Very few people inside. Everyone wore masks. Felt very safe. We are a family of 6 we got a suite with adjoining room. It was lovely. Would stay again. Thanks again to Olivia made our stay great instead of just two small hotel rooms

Our awesome experience began at check in with the exceptional customer service provided by Quiance. He really made us fell welcomed and from here our expectations were exceeded. The suite and two queen bed rooms were beautiful.  The beauty and elegance of the rooms were only exceeded by the screams of excitement of my 16 year old and her three companions as they entered their suite! The rooms were impeccable and the staff were courteous and efficient.

This is a really nice hotel. The rooms are very clean and the attendant Maria and the runner Mari helped us out with our iron. They also gave me feed back on my makeup which I appreciated. Thanks for the great service ladies. Now the parking structure is a whole different talk show! It was 60.00 overnight and the structure is a nightmare. But other than that everything was great.

This is our new favorite hotel around the Riverwalk. After a horrible experience at the LondonHouse, we are so glad that we made alternative arrangements at the Swissotel. The staff couldn't have been more welcoming and the rooms were lovely with stunning views of the river. Highly recommended!!!!

Our hotel at the Swissotel Chicago was great! The lobby was beautiful, with friendly staff and social distancing rules in place. The view of the river from my room was also stunning! Great fitness center with a wide range of machines and cool view of the city. Great location downtown, easy to site-see and get around. Would recommend!

We noticed garbage on the floor and dust bunnies and cobwebs on the ceiling. This is in the Premier Corner Room, with a view. It is unfortunate that we have to write a review to bring this to light but after notifying the front-desk we were kept waiting on the manager. We were told that the manager would see us, but we were kept waiting. We were told a final cleaning was done before check-in, but look at the photos. They prove otherwise. It is unfortunate that such an expensive room, during the COVID-19 pandemic, where environments need to be clean and sanitized, weren't.

This was the second hotel that we stayed my friends and me in Chicago, we decided this hotel for the architecture, luxury rooms, good location. we really loved this place, you have everything nearby.   We recommend it 100%.

Enjoyed my brief stay at the Swissotel.  Great location if you want access to the river walk, lakefront and Michigan Avenue.    Rooms are very large and comfortable.  Did not try the onsite restaurant but it looked nice.  Would definitely stay here again.

Very last minute, I had to book a full room block and a suite for my wedding weekend during Covid and the amazing team at the Swissotel made it all happen within a few days! They helped me through everything and even put together a Rehearsal Dinner before my wedding that fit my budget and was in the best event space with incredible views (the food was great too!). The events and booking team were on top of everything and were an absolute PLEASURE to work with. When my new husband and I came back to our suite there was a beautiful desert spread waiting for us. I cannot thank them enough for everything they did. The suite I stayed in was simply incredible and very clean. The hotel staff was so kind, helpful, and efficient. I honestly cannot wait to stay here again. I would

I booked a room here through Hotwire for the 4th of July weekend. I was excited because I've always seen the outside of the hotel, pointed out in architectural tours. However, I had a disappointing stay.  I don't know why it's considered a 4-star hotel. I didn't see anything special about it.  I stayed there as Chicago started reopening. The hotel didn't reinforce the use of masks in public spaces. I saw countless people walking up and down the lobby without a mask without being bothered at all.  Check-in was easy and I was told that there was no room service, which I actually appreciated. On the other hand, they'd give me a $10/day credit.  I got cleaning supplies from a nearby CVS. The room wasn't as clean as I'd expect during a pandemic. There was hair in the bathroom, and

We got to our room yesterday and there was an empty soap wrapper  in the  middle of the floor, rings on the sink in the bathroom, and the  toilet seat was dirty. The room   had been barely cleaned. You would think that at a time like this the hotel  would at least do the bare minimum to keep things cleaner seeing that COVID is still around. They're obviously not taking extra precautions to ensure the safety of their guests by keeping the rooms clean.  If Lori didn't block everything off we definitely would have gone somewhere else.

Booked a double queen with a city view room. Was able to see all the way to Soldier Field and the Field Museum. Great view of the sailboats on the lake also. Good location right by the Riverwalk and Millennium Park. We also walked to Navy Pier and Water Tower Place. Room was a good size with a large bathroom that had separate shower and tub. Also had a desk, huge television, easy chair and ottoman. Came with a coffee maker and mini fridge. No microwave.  Hotel staff very professional. One of the quietest hotels I have ever stayed at. Never heard any noise in the hallway or another room. Because of Covid they only clean every 3rd day but the room was spotless when we got it and also per policy now the room is unoccupied for 48 hours prior to your visit. I would highly recommend

I came to Chicago at end of end of July/beg of Aug 2020.  I stayed in two different hotels‚Äî Cambria for 3 nights and then Suissotel for a week.    My experience at Suissotel was great!  The service is incredibly responsive. In particular I have to comment Craig, from the ‚Äúfront office‚Äù (I wish I had gotten his last name), who was incredibly accommodating. The housekeeping staff seemed professional and left my room fresh and clean (when I stayed, the policy was to clean every third day, so as to reduce COVID risk).    Excellent location.  I walked to Grant Park, the Art Instiute, kayaking and the lake, and conveniences like Whole Foods (not to mention a short jaunt to sip some wine by the river).   The bathtub was long, the water pressure in shower was great, fridge was super

We had a FANTASTIC stay in one of the corner suites and would highly recommend. The views of the river and Lake Michigan were amazing and the special treats we ordered from room service were spectacular! A great, romantic, staycation here in Chicago - just the thing for a special treat in these Covid times.

I have used this property multiple times for work and personal trips. I have never been disappointed, the property is clean and spacious. It's in a great location, you can walk most places and you feel safe!  The meetings and conventions staff were so helpful and flexible, by far one of the best service hotels I have worked with! The go above and beyond not only for the event staff, but for my attendees too. The food is outstanding, not your average banquet food, my team was really impressed.    The front desk staff were friendly and welcoming. The sleeping rooms were good size, clean and updated. Each room has a good view of either the river, lake or the park. I don't have any complaints, I would recommend this property to everyone whether its a personal or work trip!

The hotel room was clean and the view is spectacular. It is conveniently located so that you can walk most places and leave your car parked. The price for guest parking is outrageous and getting into and out of the lot is ridiculous. The worst part of our stay was walking through the drinking and smoking on both nights that we were there. On Saturday night, we had to maneuver through groups of people all over in the front of the hotel. I would think that the hotel could have security presence so that guests could get into the front doors without wading through the ‚Äúparty.‚Äù When we were leaving the hotel at about 8:30 the next morning, the garbage from the night before had not even been cleaned up. Liquor bottles and food wrappers were all over the ground. There was even a pile

We go to Chicago twice a year for a long weekend.  We just returned from that weekend. Here is what we found at the hotel.  There was no maid service unless you called for it.  Thats not bad but when you called they didn't always show up.  The parking garage cost $60 a day and the electronic entry and exit system never did work correctly.  Three of the four times we need to get into the garage, they had to send someone out to the gate and overide the system.  Three of the four times we were to leave the garage, the gate would not work and people we lined up in the garage waiting for someone to come let us out.  You are so far underground that the phones won't work, so one person had to go to the elevators and go upstairs and get the person.  The reception staff were rude at best

This hotel is so good for a getaway from stress! I stayed 2 days and they met my needs answered all my questions this was my view and it totally relaxed my whole system!  Highly recommended the area has a lot to offer from food to tour hot places!

Raquel is a great person who does speak Spanish in the hotel, she helped me and my father to check-out on June 28th and also on July 4th and was there to handle any problems/issues. The view on the 18th floor and room 1820 had a great view, and also the 11th floor and room 1116 had the view as well

I travel quite frequently for work and stayed countless nights at different hotels from all around the world. My stay at The Swissotel was an unforgettable experience. This was my first time to The Swissotel in Chicago. The atmosphere was inviting the rooms including the great views of the Chicago skyline as well as the river walk was breath taking. What really got me was the service I received there. Especially from this one individual who worked at front desk. If I remember correctly the name of this employee was Harper. I was having a bad from my flight getting delayed for 4 hrs to my luggage getting lost at the airport. So When I arrived at the hotel I wasn‚Äôt in the best of Moods but that all soon changed when I met Harper. Her inviting smile Along with her Mannerisms were

From the amazing interior to the spectacular views from the room this hotel is the only one i will stay at while in Chicago.... Lanette,Q,and will at the front desk are so knowledgeable and make you feel like family when staying here....  Customer service was exceptional... Special Thanks to Lanette for making my stay above and beyond the expected.

Some of my family stayed here while they were visiting from out of state, and they had a wonderful stay.  The staff were professional and courteous, and checked in my family swiftly and with no problems.  The rooms were spacious and the beds were quite comfortable, and room service was prompt and accurate.  The location is great, right in downtown Chicago near the Loop and several amenities (restaurants, museums, shopping, etc.).  Some rooms offer a beautiful view of the lake, while others offer a great city view.

Let me start by saying that I was so looking forward to our stay at the Swissotel Chicago - for a very special occasion. And it was off to a great start when the bell man greeted us and escorted us to the front desk. But that was the end of our pleasant experience with Swissotel, even though I had called in advance to let them know this was a special occasion. We were greeted at the front desk¬†by a cold and unwelcoming individual named Nicole Thompson. She was horribly rude and unfriendly. When I inquired about the bill because¬†I was surprised it was more than anticipated from my online reservation, she seemed bothered with my questions and made me feel like I was being problematic, instead of just trying to get clarification. We left the front desk feeling very unwelcome and it

Arrived about an hour or so before check in & I felt as if we were forced into an upgrade otherwise we‚Äôd get a room with full beds (even though I was booked a king) I also felt like I was deceived by the upgrade I was told we‚Äôd be upgrading to face navy pier however we were not So we had to room change. But when we arrived to the new room it was dirty. Bathroom was not cleaned and previous guest had left things behind. Which made me question the cleanliness of the whole room. Also I was not told of urban fee or what was included so did not get to utilize any of the inclusions with it. When I Contacted the property w my concerns and I was told I‚Äôd be receiving a call back however I never received a call back. 100% disappointing. would not recommend

Very comfortable king size bed. TV was large with a lot of channels. You can pay extra to rent movies still in theaters. Great view. The river view is magnificent and even if you have a city view it‚Äôs very nice. Great location. Very clean which is important.   They do charge extra for a microwave which I think is standard in most hotels but apparently not in a luxury hotel. I guess that‚Äôs really my only gripe so have to say I enjoyed my stay.

Decided to stay downtown for my wife's birthday. Found a great rate at Swissotel. Every staff member we encountered was so friendly and helpful. When checking in the front desk attendant attempted to upsell us on a better room, she was very polite,  but we were on a budget, and declined. I thought that would put us in a room facing a brick wall, however we had the most wonderful view of Navy Pier. The bed was amazing, the bathroom was spotless. It would have been a perfect stay, had it not been for the couple next door that fought for at least 2 hours. My wife ended up calling the front desk so that we could finally get some peace. Checkout was super easy, we just dropped the keys in the dropbox. Definitely willing to give Swissotel another shot.

ShanLa H . And Jordan helped me at the front desk even after shift change they were willing and ready to assist me.   Along with Ms Garrett ( who diligently provides the same services after hours ).  Seriously you made my stay very warm and comfortable and plan on staying here exclusively when in Chicago üåû

Whenever I am in Chicago, I always try to stay at the Swissotel downtown. I have stayed there on 6 occasions and have never had a bad experience. The staff is always professional and accommodating and the dining and lounges are second to none. I will definately stay there again!

Reservations through Groupon discounts worked flawlessly for check-in and we acquired rooms on the 25th and 28th floors. The desk staff were great both at check-in and throughout our stay whenever we had a question.   The rooms were clean and spacious with nice bathrooms. There wasn‚Äôt a place for us to play cards or another game in the hotel, so we eked out some room on a table, a couple stools and the bed in one of the rooms.   The location is phenomenal as it is directly above the fantastic Riverwalk and two blocks from the DuSable Harbor where a lot of nice yachts are moored. Behind it is Lake Shore East Park while three blocks away are the start of Maggie Daley Park (great for children) and Millennium Park where Cloud Gate (The Bean) is located. The biggest issue is figuring

Great location, comfortable room, nice view but expensive. Room rate per night could be more competitive, but the issue lies more on the restaurant and bar that are totally overpriced, which is a shame when you travel for business (with less time/opportunities to "escape" the hotel).

This is our go-to hotel when staying in Chicago.  I'm rarely disappointed.  This last trip was one of those unfortunate rare times.  All-in-all everything was good.  The only issue was finding a dirty sock from a previous guest under the drapes in the room.  Knowing that this is not a common experience here, I am willing to forgive, but it's why I couldn't rate this as a 5 for this trip.

The Swissotel on Wacker Dr in Chicago is a fantastic hotel.  The staff is friendly and professional. The rooms are great, we had a wonderful view from our room.  I will stay again and again.  The rooms are clean, the shampoo and lotion are the best.

Updated modern feel. Very clean. Beautiful view from the fitness center on the 43rd floor facing Navy Pier. Would definitely stay here again! The service was great, love the pool table in the lobby bar area.

Huge thanks for the entire Conference and Banquet staff.  I'd specifically like to point out James Jenkins.  He was absolutely exceptional.  I can't forget CJ and the rest of the staff.   Every staff member in the conference area was always willing to bend over back to help us out.  You don't find that often when an entire team works together so well.

After recently completing a corporate program at the property I wanted to specifically call out the banquet staff for the incredible job they do.  From James to CJ, they responded to all of our needs without hesitation.  We look forward to coming back next year.

I stayed at the Swissotel for the first time during the weekend of Aug 9th to the 12th for my birthday weekend, and I have to say I was very impressed. The room itself, was amazing. The hubby and I stayed in the lifestyle suite and it was awesome. The room was nice and big. Loved the 2 bathrooms, and the big tub. One of the best parts of the suite were the views from our room. We could see millennium park from one window, and a river view from another. The views were amazing. My only con is that when we would come in late, it seemed to be a lot of foot traffic on the outside of the hotel, from other guests friends who didn't stay there, and not a lot of security. Other than that, we had a pretty amazing stay, and would definitely stay here again. The location, the proximity to a

I stayed at Swissotel for work this past week. My room was clean and comfortable; I slept really well each night despite being very close to the elevator. We had meetings every day and the conference rooms were very cold in most cases. If traveling here for meetings, I‚Äôd recommend dressing in layers so you can stay warm throughout the day. Meeting rooms were spread out across several floors and at first it was confusing to navigate but by the last day we had figured out where everything was and when it was best to use the escalators vs. the elevators and vice versa. On the topic of elevators - that would probably be my only complaint. The elevators work by programming in your desired floor and then you are assigned an elevator. Unfortunately a few times we pressed the floor we

The view of the river and pier from the hotel was nice. The staff was friendly and attentive.The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The water from the shower spilled out onto the floor. The hotel fees and price of parking were outrageous!

James Jenkins was AMAZING.  There were times that our group really depended on him for changes and he came through with prompt exacusions of asked for items.  Highly recommend this facility with James team excellent performance.

This is a shout out to Virginia from the hotel staff at the Swissotel in Chicago. I left a pair of Bose wireless headphone in the gym (great gym by the way). Fully expecting them to be gone forever I decide to call the lost and found department to see. To my surprise they where recovered. Thank you Virginia!!   If you find yourself in Chicago for business or pleasure I recommend staying at the Swissotel.

Superb attention to detail and spectacular views. Definitely worth the up charge to get a room with a river view  on  a top floor.  Service was phenomenal. I will be returning next time I'm in Chicago and will be checking for your locations during travel.

Nice hotel. Great location. Had a suite  with connecting room for co workers. Bad idea!!! Suite‚Äôs all wrap around the elevator which never stops and has a horrible rattle!!!!   They turn off the elevator form 10-7. Supposedly. Horrible!!!!!They did not clean our room until I called and requested after the third day!! Very disappointed.

I really enjoyed staying at this hotel while attending a conference that was being held there. The hotel was beautiful and the customer service was very good. The conference facilities were very nice. The room was clean and comfortable. I also loved the aroma of the Purovel toiletries in the room. The location was amazing with beautiful views of the city, lake, pier and river. It‚Äôs easy to walk around and explore the city from this location, or catch a bus or boat tour.

The staff at the Swissotel on Wacker Drive in Chicago are highly trained hospitality professionals.  Our room was awesome, the beds are comfortable, very clean environment.  Bathtub and separate shower.55 inch TV.  2-3 blocks from Michigan Ave and the Riverwalk. 10 min walking distance from State St.

I was in need of a lunch last minute for a client meeting at their Arosa room.  He was a tremendous helper and even arranged delivery to the room for me! He‚Äôs helped me in years past too and always goes above and beyond! Thanks Michael!

We stayed here one night for the dental convention at McCormick Place.  We had a nice experience.  Great location.  Our 18th floor room had excellent views, nice size, comfortable bed, large TV.  Quick check in, easy check out.  Great price.  No complaints here!  Overall very satisfied.

Here for Dental Midwinter conference.  We were greeted with the very friendly Dinah.   After day one of our meeting we enjoyed cocktails made by Donny... not only were his drinks amazing, he had such a great personality.  Can‚Äôt wait to come back for happy hour.

I was in town for a conference and enjoyed my stay at the Swissotel. Front desk staff were very nice and I was able to check in early. My room had great views of Lake Michigan and my room was much larger than I expected for Chicago. I also enjoyed the creative fruit water in the lobby. Only complaint was that the elevator situation was a mess. Constantly had to wait for an elevator only to find it completely full. Then, if you were in a full elevator it still stopped at every floor. Fun.

They ruined our celebration for our 6 year old child by giving us the wrong information regarding their pool. The day we booked it they said they have a pool, the day of our visit they said they haven‚Äôt had one in 2 years. When we asked for compensation staff said ‚Äú there is nothing we can do‚Äù and gave us the wrong email address to contact reservation or Managment complaining about what happened. On top of it, we felt blamed by them making statements like how couldn‚Äôt we have known and asking for proof that staff gave us the wrong information. No ownership, not accommodating, defensive. We will not be going there again even though we have been their customers for 10 years now.

Thermostat was broken, bathtub was dirty, had an issue with the tv only getting one channel.  Called the front desk and they could not have possibly cared less.  I would have expected that from a 2 star hotel, but at this level, service is the name of the game and they don‚Äôt even try.   Stay at a Marriott or a Hilton - your money will be better spent.

We had a great time. The lake view room was spectacular. The room was clean with a large washroom and big screen TV. The rooms were quiet. The fitness room had more cardio and weight machines than any other hotel I've visited, lots of dumbbells too, and offered Granny Smith applies and lemon and cucumber water. Very nice! It was clean and well kept. The staff were great. In particular our hostess Ruth gave us all the information we needed, recommended a great restaurant and ensured we found our way around town. Outstanding and attentive service with a smile! You can always find a good hotel, but I would come back just for the great service.

Hotel on the river in the center of downtown. Close to many attractions in Chicago. Clean, very nice service. Beautiful views from the rooms of the City and Navy Pier. A large gym and two restaurants.

This is the 5th downtown Chicago Hotel we have done a 2-night stay at, in the past 2 years. All others had annoying issues of one sort or the other; but Swissotel's service, accommodations, location, and comfort; has been the best so far!  Highly recommend a "River View" suite.

We just stayed 2 nights at Swissotel for my husband's college reunion trip. It is a beautiful building, inside and out. Great location, great service, great view. We loved everything about it and would definitely stay again.

I love the Swissotel!  The people are always very friendly and the accommodations are wonderful! The rooms are spacious, comfortable and the views from almost every room are wonderful!  I have been a guest at this hotel multiple times and have never had a bad experience!

Great hotel that is in a prime location with beautiful views. Parking is ridiculously expensive. The charge for parking was approx. 2/3 of the price of the room which is outrageous. Try the hot chocolate, it is amazing

In 2018 we found the Swissotel Chicago Santa Suite by happenstance.  We were staying at another hotel and visited the Santa Suite with our one year old granddaughter.  It was amazing!  We had such a great time, we had to book rooms at Swissotel Chicago for 2019.  We were not disappointed.  We booked an Elf Suite with an adjoining room that accommodated our family of six very comfortably.  Walking into the suite, my granddaughter (now two) was awestruck!  She ran into the room, hugged the reindeer decoration and jumped on the bed.  Her reaction was everything I had hoped it would be!  The decorations, coupled with the beautiful city scape, was a sight to behold!,  Later that evening, we went up to the 41st Floor Santa Suite.  There is no better way to see Santa Claus than this.

I visited the bar during a recent conference.  My experience was terrific thank you for your top notch service Mr. Demetrie Jones you and your staff are a wonderful example of elite customer service continue the excellent work.

Staff is always friendly and excellent. The corner rooms offer amazing views.  Great upkeep of the facility and my rooms are always very clean.  Close walk to Navy Pier.   The Palm restaurant is attached to the hotel which is convenient.

We frequently fly into Chicago for trips. I have stayed in multiple hotels all across downtown and West Loop. This hotel by far has been the best in cleanliness, hospitality and amazing views. They even have a green eco friendly house cleaning where you can receive $10 day credit. It is the perfect location by the downtown river and navy pier. Sharifa, at the front desk went above and beyond finding me a toothbrush when I arrived, saving me a snowy trip out to CVS. We will definitely come back and stay here.

Victoria and Terik were absolutely incredible!!! From the check in Victoria was so sweet and got us into an amazing room with a rad view. She answered all of our questions and was a so professional! We loved it here that we decided to stay another night! Terik handled the seamless transition and helped ensure everything was the way we wanted!  These two amazing young individuals are what every hotel hospitality should dream to be! Very polite and professional but most importantly happy!  Definitely be coming back here!

Nicole T gave the BEST front desk service. Super friendly and considerate! Went out of her way to accommodate me during my stay. Hotel is very nice and gym is great. Food it amazing. Highly recommend!!!!

We wanted a hotel downtown within walking distance of Millenium Park (since we arrived from Indiana via the South Shore Line) and got a good deal through Hotwire, which placed us in the Swissotel.  We were impressed from the get-go.  We were able to check in early, the room was clean and spacious, and staff was very friendly.  My daughter was disappointed that there is no longer a pool on the premises, but the fitness area that replaced it is very large with nice, up-to-date equipment.  The views from both the fitness area and the guest rooms were great.  My daughter ended up leaving an item in our room after check-out.  We contacted the hotel and the item was sent to us via UPS very efficiently, within just a few days.  Overall great experience and would definitely stay here

My trip to Chicago was for the purpose of uniting with my fianc√©. She reside from Star the State of Louisiana. And I reside in the State of Ohio. It was at the Swissotel Hotel that I proposed to her at The Palm Resturant. The staff helped my out the great moment together. The Hotel Staff including Nicole, Solomon we‚Äôre great in providing excellent 5-Star Service for me and my soon to be wife. I just want to say to anyone who is looking for a reasonable hotel to stay at. You need to stay at the Swissotel you will not regret it. Dr. Sean A. Crowley, Sr.

Right off the bat, any hotel that charges a "mandatory" resort fee, not a tax, gets dropped down 2 stars in my book.  When the excuse for the fee is "justified", in the condescending manner that Manager "Craig" did when questioned about it, adds insult to injury. This property calls its resort fee and "Urban Experience" fee, which I guess is supposed to be a slice of Chicago living, but charging for shoe shines, local and long distance calls, laundry,  a Smoothie during night owl hours, coffee and tea in the lobby is a farcical rip-off...but according to "Craig" it is coming to other hotels in Chicago (which I guess makes it right)....why not just raise your price to cover your costs instead of these specious fees - especially for someone like me that actually lives in Chicago

Weekend getaway to Chicago and the wife has always wanted to try the Swissotel. Location is about 4 blocks east of Michigan Ave. We were placed in the premier Lakeview comer suite on the 29th floor (2904) that offered stunning views of the city, river, the lake, and Navy Pier. The small hallway from the door to the room itself is a nice touch and adds to the privacy feeling. The bathroom offers great views even when you‚Äôre doing your business on the toilet. The bed was great. Sweet spot between firm and soft. Slept like babies.   The fitness center on the 43rd floor is great. Very clean, well lit and offered awesome views as well. Had a lot of equipment and was much larger than your typical hotel gym.   Harper at the front desk was great. Very friendly, very warm, and clearly

We got a great last minute rate for a beautiful large room, with two beds and an incredible view of Navy pier and the lake. Staff was wonderful, especially Victoria who helped to check us in. We were slightly disappointed that the pool was removed, but it has been replaced with a beautiful fitness center. Highly recommend this very solid hotel.

My husband had to go to a conference at a neighboring hotel in Chicago in November and asked if I'd like to join him for a short trip.  I tried to book a night at the other hotel that he was staying at (where the conference was) and they wanted to charge us almost double for another night, so we told them we'd look elsewhere.  The Swissotel came up on Google Maps as being pretty much right next to it, so I booked us a room there.  I was NOT disappointed!  The lobby was beautiful and the staff was very friendly and helpful.. they even showed us how the elevator system worked (which was the first time I'd seen anything like the system they use.)  Our room was clean and comfortable with a great view.  The parking garage between the two hotels gave us an opportunity to discover

Swissotel Chicago is tucked away, but don't miss it! Convenient, lovely, and friendly! Accommodations were convenient, staff was friendly and helpful, and there was an air of excitement and belonging--truly a great representation of Midwest hospitality and big-city vibe!

Swissotel is located in a great location; we walked most places we wanted to go (Aquarium, Field Museum, Symphony, etc.). The view was great even without upgrading to lake or river view room (recommend the south side rooms). The room was very clean and spacious and the bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept on in a hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

Last year we had our Holiday Party at this place. I directed our staff to book this place as we worked closer, and actually we were involved partly in the design of the hotel and the Wacker Drive in front of it. We booked over 50 rooms i believe. We stayed there for the party, but unfortunately i had to leave at 5:00 am next morning for a business trip to Washington DC. I was fortunate though to be awarded a gift card from our holiday party committee for a single night stay at the hotel, so i could enjoy the views. It expires at the end of January. I went online to see if the hotel is booked up and has no room for the holiday, and found out that there are plenty of rooms available through TripAdvisor, Booking etc. Even 25% discounts are offered for the day.  Unfortunately, the

I was treated as if I didn't belong at this hotel, when I'd actually had 3 nights reserved at the hotel. The staff acted as if they didn't want to service me, and treated me like a lowerclass citizen. For the reaminder of my stay, I avoided the staff and any needed assistance. I was staying there for a conference or I would've found another place to stay. I can't believe I was treated like I was here.

We recently stayed at Talbott for our wedding. We initially had a wedding block set up, but COVID changed everything. However, Talbott was extremely accommodating and understanding from beginning to end. The level of communication and response time was great and helped lower the stress level while planning our wedding. My wife used the McRae Room to get ready with her bridesmaids and everything was perfect for them. Highly recommend the Talbott for your wedding block or stay!!

This hotel is located in the heart of Chicago and the location is really good. Room is fairly good too. However, during pandemic, the hotel doesn't allow you to enjoy all the amenities you might expect. So just reconsider your visit.

We recently stayed at the wonderful Talbott Hotel and though it is not the same missing Perry and all the employees who always went above and beyond for us, the minimum staff there were very accomodating, friendly and whatever we needed was available in a short time. (Even a microwave delivered to the room!) The location also can not be beat as it is close to wonderful restaurants and shopping in the Gold Coast.  I much prefer this location to the busy streets south by the river. They did a great job maintaining distance and followed all covid precautions.  Thank you and we can not wait to return and see you ALL again soon!

Good value for money. Location was perfect! The staff were kind and handled a situation I had prior to check-out without any hesitation or questioning. The hotel room was average, no bells or whistles but comfortable--particularly the bed. I will return for a later stay.

We thoroughly enjoyed another trip to Chicago and our stay at the Talbott was again top notch. Dwayne is like an old friend so fun to talk to and truly cares about his guests helping out however he can.

This is the perfect choice for your stay in Chicago. The central location is convenient to the best restaurants, shopping and lake front. We found our room to be very comfortable and tastefully appointed. Everything was clean and we felt very safe. I would especially like to thank the manager Chris for making our stay so enjoyable. His hospitality and local recommendations made our weekend!

This was a beautiful, clean, and safe property with super helpful and friendly staff.  i loved how they had tight COVID precautions.  i never felt unsafe here.  It was also in a very convenient location.  I will return!

Restaurant, valet, and minibar currently closed due to covid 19. But room was well cleaned on arrival, hotel is in central downtown location with great restaurants and shops within minutes of hotel. Minibar items are available for purchase in the lobby and hotel is very quiet. Have zero complaints about hotel

An oasis of calm amid the Downtown Chicago buzz. A perfect location for visiting the city with top notch customer service. Thankyou Chris for all your great info and personal assistance . This was our second stay at the Talbott and it‚Äôs the extra mile customer service along with great value that keeps us coming back .

We really enjoyed our stay at the Talbott Hotel! We were thrilled to discover they‚Äôre pet friendly and we brought our dog, Millie, along for the trip. The accommodations were excellent. We were greeted with a welcome kit including masks and hand sanitizers for each of us. The hotel was very clean and all staff were taking the appropriate precautions. Everyone was very friendly and they were able to accommodate our request for early check-in and late check-out. Parking was close by. If you live in driving distance to Chicago I would definitely recommend driving in and bringing your pup! The Talbott is so close to many dog friendly shops and restaurants including Nico‚Äôs, Tavern on Rush, and Lou Malnati‚Äôs! Even the Shoreline Sight seeing tour welcomed Millie. We will definitely

I arrived to Chicago last Thursday. I had booked my reservation via expedia. When I go to my reservation, I had noticed it was cancelled. I called the Talbott and was advised that, they never cancel third party reservations, but that someone from their company cancelled my reservation and there are no notes stating why, so it is most likely a mistake on their part.   With that being said, I ask, So.. what happens now, I made this reservation weeks in advance. Their response was, well the hotel was completely booked and they cannot accommodate us. This was my first time in Chicago its late a night and I am basically told to figure it out, as if it was my fault.   I will never again attempt to book with this hotel. Their customer service and addressing customer concerns is

Pros:  Location-on the Gold Coast near Water Tower and Oak Street Price- found a great AAA deal Responsive Staff  Cons: Nothing about this is a Hyatt. Had no curling iron, mouthwash, coffee maker, and other basics available to guests. It‚Äôs actually noisier here than staying in Streeterville with ambulances. No desk to do work or set your laptop on.  This isn‚Äôt all about covid either. Expect though to have no access to an onsite restaurant. The fitness center is sign up only for 45 minutes at a time. No valet parking so you‚Äôre going to need to find a place yourself. And no room service- so similar to other places we requested our daily supplies, changed our own sheets, threw out linens and collected our garbage daily.  What I think is wrong is we are charged a nightly ‚Äúurban

I have booked The Talbott hotel after doing many reviews and comparisons. The room I booked was a 2 queen beds as and it was massive, I am sure it is very difficult to find such size in mid-Chicago. The location is central with many things to do nearby, within 10-15 mins walking. The lift is a bit slow but no big deal. Will definitely consider staying there again if in central Chicago

Great, central location meaning you can walk to so many places of interest if you choose to. The Hotel is quaint with a convenient restaurant and lounge on the ground floor where reception is also found although initially it is difficult to find. We found all 3 employees who manned the help desk went the extra mile.

We‚Äôve stayed at other hotels for twice the price around the same area and found this one to outshine them all. Where old world charm meets modern design aesthetics! Very clean rooms and bathrooms. Will stay here for our future business trips. Staff was very helpful and accommodating. The hotel is only a block couple of blocks west of shops of North Michigan Avenue and walkable to excellent restaurants in the area! Very pleased! Thank you

Everything was perfect. However, the room size was a little too small for me to be comfortable. The check-in was very proper and communication was passed down the proper channels because I had a unique problem when checking in.

Great boutique hotel, can walk to Michigan Avenue.  Wonderful staff everywhere.  The bar/restaurant was excellent. The bartenders Mark and D so nice.  The best little burgers at happy hour. My room was small bot cozy. Will definitely go back!

Nice hotel, located well. Know that the junior suites are near elevators, and the studio suites are over the back which has beeping trucks in the pre-dawn hours. Apart from that, the hotel is clean and handsome, and has character. The rooms are quiet if you get the right location.

Very Good Stay, Very Big Rooms, Clean, however, we had 2 rooms and the TV in our Daughters room did not work. 2nd problem was not really the hotels fault, but impacted our stay.  We had a Man and Woman next door that were very loud, and you could hear them well down the hallway, if you get my meaning.

We have stayed here a couple of times and will be back for sure.  The location is walking distance to most downtown favorites.  The hotel is clean, the staff is nice & it is very affordable. You can‚Äôt beat the quality/price/location!

The staff at the Talbot Hotel was friendly and attentive. The food and ambiance in the bar was top notch. The room was clean, nicely appointed and had an excellent TV. I‚Äôll be back! The location is within easy walking distance to many of the highlights Chicago.

Great visit to Chicago and The Talbott was fabulous ! The stay was very comfortable ...walking distance to great food and shopping on Michigan Ave!   The staff was so kind hospitable.  Will definitely be back ‚ù§Ô∏è

My friend and I had a wonderful experience at the Talbott hotel from the moment we stepped inside. We were greeted by Dwayne, who has the best hospitality we could've asked for. He helped us to our room and immediately saw that we wanted a better view. Dwayne called to the front desk and was able to get our room changed with a much better view! Finally, before Dwayne left he gave us several spots to try in Chicago that were delicious fun and affordable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

We were here with a large group for a competition.  The hotel did an excellent job accommodating us and is beautiful with a great atmosphere.  The staff went way above and beyond to take care of anything we needed which made life so nice and we could focus on the kids and their competition.  Special shout out to DeWayne and Charles at the front door who were FABULOUS as well as Angie in housekeeping.  She was happy to track down anything we needed.  Highly recommend this hotel.

Our children were in town for a color guard competition and the entire staff was amazing all weekend long.   Charles, Dwayne and Angie were very supportive of our groups needs and they welcomed us like we were family.   The people working there are the true gem to this hotel!   They were very accommodating to our large group of 30+.    I have future visits planned to the Chicago area and this will now be my go to place!   Job well done!  From the bottom of our hearts thank you staff for making this a memorable experience!

Traveling with a large group for color guard competition and had a great experience! Dwayne, Charles, and Angie were all amazing! All hotel staff were very nice and helpful. 35+ people in our group and no complaints!

Totally unexpected, Such a beautiful room and hotel for a last minute booking. The pricing was also very affordable. Even came with two complimentary bottles of wine. Amazing; needed, and booking again soon.

Priceline chose this place for us and honestly I wish I wouldve gone with my original choice. The price was only a couple dollars cheaper than the hotels that had pools and jacuzzis and water,coffee and tea that we didn't have to pay for. Valet was 70$ for one night..jeez... the bed was incredibly uncomfortable. There was no option for late check out.  It just was very basic and for 10/20 $ more we couldve stayed in a better place.  The bathroom was nice, that's about it.

I was very impressed with the cleanliness, comfort, and customer service at the Talbott! The check in experience was wonderful and I even got a complimentary drink voucher. My room was beautiful, light and airy, and the bed was comfortable which is very important to me. The bathroom was gorgeous and immaculate. I‚Äôve stayed at many hotels downtown Chicago and this is my new favorite! I will definitely be staying again and I can‚Äôt wait!

Always try to stay in a different area of Chicago so thought we would try a bit further north than Magnificent Mike. Loved the neighborhood with local restaurants and great architecture like the Driehaus Museum. The staff was excellent, gracious and very helpful and very good, well-informed concierges.  And the restaurant had excellent food.  Only negative was longer waits for elevators but it is an older building so we just built in a few extra minutes.  Room wise, the studio king was huge with nicely upholstered sofa. Anyone with noise intolerance may want to ask for 8th floor or higher by phone directly to the hotel in advance since there is new condo bldg next door with huge HVAC exhausts up to 7th floor.  This is really a great value for the money!

It is NOT ACCEPTABLE to charge fees with NO DISCLOSURE.  I got a $17 charge plus taxes for an "URBAN AMENITIES FEE" total of almost $20 for one night stay.  It should be included in the total price and not slid in on the back end when it's too late.  When I questioned the person behind the desk and told her I was not made aware, the answer was lame.  "it's automatic and just included as a standard"

This boutique style hotel is situated in the gold coast area with many options to shop and eat in the area. The hotel is awesome, clean, with friendly staff and nice bar to unwind. There is also a gym.

Everything was amazing about our stay at the Talbott Hotel.  The door men was beyond helpful, telling us the cheap places to park our car (instead of valet at the hotel), local restaurants and a place to go for groceries within walking distance.    For a boutique hotel, the room was double the size that was expected.  We just had a normal double queen room, but there was so much extra room, and a seating area.  Everything was clean, the bathroom was also nice sized, and they had large bottles of shampoo, conditioner, shower gel and lotion.  It was nice not to have to try to squeeze out a few drops of shampoo of a small travel size bottle, just to wash my long hair, and since there were three girls in the room, we didn't have to ask for more.  Plus that, the conditioner was quite

Great location.  Rooms are nice.  Cozy little bar/restaurant.  If you don't like the feel or a big, convention type hotel, this is for you.   Dwayne at the the front door is very helpful and friendly.  Check in was quick, and friendly.

All of the staff makes an effort to be very welcoming and helpful. The concierge left a welcome note for our son, a nice touch that was unnecessary but appreciated. The stay had multiple moments like that.   This is a great location, good access to various modes of transportation and walkable access a wide range of food styles and price points.   This is an older building that has been updated and well appointed without losing the historic feel. The elephant in the room, so to speak, is the elevators. Nice and cozy. But plan for extra travel time during prime check-in/out time.

We appreciated the upgrade to a larger room, and the bowl of fruit which welcomed us.  We were in town for a special event.  The event organizers had made arrangements with the hotel to be the recommended place to stay for delegates. The front staff were always welcoming and friendly.  The bar staff less so.  We had problems with the shower plumbing, but since we did not complain, nothing was done about it.   The hotel is well located with respect to shopping.

First off it is in a BEAUTIFUL neighborhood, we were greeted at the door by 2 doormen, they helped with our luggage, as soon as we walked in the door the concierge was right at the door and said ‚Äúit‚Äôs the birthday princess we have been waiting for you all morning!‚Äù My mom and I looked at each other and couldn‚Äôt believe what an awesome welcome. When I booked the hotel in the notes I wrote that we were celebrating my daughters 9th birthday and this is going to be her first time in Chicago and we were going to the American girl store. A few days after booking the hotel they wrote an email asking her name because they would like to have a personal birthday card for her and an amenities. When I read it I thought how amazing! I believe the concierges name was Roanna (spelling ?) her

This is a very nice hotel. It is in the heart of downtown Chicago. It is an older hotel that has been remodeled very nicely! You will be greeted as soon as you pull up. The check in process was seamless. Concierge was helpful. if you drive be prepared a hefty price to park($65 a day). Definitely an upscale hotel!

Great boutique hotel in the Gold Coast area. Many stores, banks, and restaurants nearby. Something for everyone. I have stayed here before and will again. Rooms and bathrooms  are spacious and exceptionally clean,

The Talbott is a boutique hotel that has been restored, yet still has the 1920's feel and vibe.  The rooms are upscale, comfortable, spacious.  The staff were beyond nice and accomodating.  It is in the heart of downtown, walking distance to just about everything!  Great bar and restaurant.  We would definitely stay there again!  The Concierge was very knowledgeable and informative.  Also, a shout out to Perry, who handled our luggage and MANY other things.  He is the man to go to if you want info. on Chicago!  He could not have been more courteous, genuinely caring and helpful.

Great service. Great room. Phenomenal location. We over-payed because we stayed here for Valentines Day, and that same weekend Chicago was hosting the NBA All-Star game. So rates were through the roof. But, that being said, the stay was well worth it and I will definitely be coming back and would prefer to only ever stay here for my return trips to Chicago.

We had a wonderful long weekend in the Windy City.  The hotel‚Äôs location was perfect for our shopping trips and we had numerous restaurants within walking distance,  the breakfast served at the hotel was delicious.  The entire staff was helpful and courteous.  The housekeeping staff was excellent, especially Rosemary Miller. She went out of her way to help make our stay comfortable. We will be back!

The hotel was awesome. The room was spacious and clean.  The location was convenient to Michigan Avenue shopping and restaurants.  The staff was friendly and the housekeeping staff - Rosemary Miller - was exceptional. Breakfast was delicious each morning. This will be our place to stay in Chicago for the future.

Stayed here during All Star Weekend visiting friends and family. Ms. Rose Miller was exceptionally pleasant and provided excellent service. The room was very clean after. Will definitely stay here again!!

Comfortable Bed and extremely large Room with  a 70 inch television ... .  The Staff was remarkably polite and helpful,  from housekeeping to the Concierge to the Bartender.....  If you are traveling to Chicago and plan on visiting  Rush street or the Mag Mile  this is a great choice .

Clean, pleasant room.  Cozy restaurant.  Housekeeping super nice. Could have used more chairs in suite.  Very convenient location: close to entertainment, restaurants, and shopping.   Windows blocked noise from street.

Wonderful 5 night stay!  Staff was excellent, room was not overly huge but very clean and modern. Fully stocked fridge was a treat! Restaurant was great and open until late!  Right around the corner from Michigan Ave ;) Would definitely stay here again!!

This hotel greatly exceeded our expectations. We booked last minute through hotels tonight app and it will now be our regular place to stay. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed our stay! I believe my husband called back to get details on the bedding and comforter because it was amazing!

Rooms are compact but comfortable.  All you need for a stay in the city! Quiet Street  Great Sleep  Great Shower. Wonderful Staff- especially the Concierge and Bar Manager.  Went above and beyond for me. Very convenient to Michigan Ave and within a nice long walk to Millennium Park and great Museums

The location was literally in the perfect area to suit my needs. Shops and restaurants everywhere. The room was clean and comfortable. I was able to check in early with no hesitation. I've never stayed at a hotel that offered a complimentary drink for a stay and the food was delicious. I have already recommended the hotel to people as well as 20 East.

outstanding trip for momma and me.  Great location just off the Mile, and a wonderful quaint little neighborhood.  Staff was courteous and our room was big and comfortable.  Food and ambiance at 20E was excellent.

We visited Chicago to return our daughter to school for the semester and lucked into this gem of a hotel. The staff was fantastic, always friendly and welcoming. The check-in process was quick and smooth and the accommodations were second to none - comfy beds and a really spacious room. This quaint hotel is within a quick walk to Water Tower Place so it‚Äôd be a fantastic choice for shoppers looking to browse the Magnificent Mile. I heartily recommend this establishment and we will certainly be returning!

Super friendly stuff, perfect and super clean rooms and the hotel is located at one of the best spots in Chicago.You can reach shopping miles by walk and also a lot of restaurants are near by. Next time i will definetly stay again at the Talbott hotel.

My room was an absolute dream - the room was spacious and quiet with beautiful views of Chicago. Emily at the front desk was incredibly welcoming and Gene was very helpful in answering my questions and giving recommendations. The hotel is in such a prime location, with great shopping and restaurants nearby - and Michigan Avenue is just steps away! I will definitely be staying at the Talbott again the next time I'm in Chicago.

My wife and I stayed at The Talbott last March and we were impressed enough that we stayed there again this past weekend. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay because of: 1) the incredible friendliness and helpfulness of all employees at the hotel; 2) the cleanliness of our room and its comfort; and, 3) the very reasonable rate, especially for a fantastic location in Chicago.

Staff was awesome. Everyone at the Hotel is super friendly and willing to help if needed. Great location to everything Chicago has to offer. Overnight rooms are very large and comfortable . Food and Beverage at 20E was exceptional.

Concierge was amazing made my daughters birthday extra special. Placed chocolate covered strawberries In room while we were being tourists. An amazing surprise...... Would definitely recommend this to friends and family

We came in to see a show at the Ruth Page theatre. I picked the Talbot because of the online pictures, location, and price. We had a fantastic weekend stay there. Besides the staff being so nice and friendly, it is a beautiful building, the room was very comfortable with a great bed. We both woke up and almost at the same time said how great we slept. Go there, you'll be happy!

This place was great!!! The staff was so friendly, and helpful I felt like I was staying at the Four Seasons Hotel. The Lobby lounge was wonderful with a great menu and wine list. The hotel and rooms were clean and fully stocked with all we needed. The hotel lends itself to old-world charm, in its fixtures and furnishings. Our Concierge Gene was FANTASTIC really nice and very helpful. He got us last minute tickets to a show and we were so appreciative. I forget the name of the door man, he was tall and mature with the best smile and helpful attitude. Thank you all!!! We will be back!!!

The room was clean and well stocked, hallways are well lit, and the elevators were quick. The restaurant and bar area was cozy and there are plenty of lounge areas in the lobby. Third visit and all trips have been consistently great.

Had a great stay at The Talbott for the weekend. Nice suite. Great little bar and wonderful breakfast. Conveniently located. The hotel lobby and the rooms were very clean and quiet with a friendly and competent staff.

I recently did a staycation in Chicago just to get away for the evening. I found The Talbott hotel via my hot wire deal. After reading some reviews and checking out some pictures I was excited to stay here. Upon arrival the doorman, Dwayne, greeted us with the biggest smile and hello! We walked right to the check in counter and was met by Joshua who went ABOVE AND BEYOND. Not only was he so kind, but we also got a room upgrade AND 2 complimentary drink tickets to their lobby bar. How amazing! I was so impressed and I had not even seen the room yet in person lol. The room itself was spacious, the view wasn‚Äôt anything since we were ok between building, but that didn‚Äôt bother me. The bathroom was nice and the shower was HUGE. About 4 people could fit in there, no joke. My favorite

The hotel location is great for downtown Chicago, but you will have an "urban facility fee" of $15 a night added to your bill, not shown in the Hotels.com price. A Snickers Bar fro the snack draw was $5.

Our stay at The Talbott was incredible. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. They make your stay worth your while. Loved it!! Will definitely stay here again when we visit Chicago in the future.

Came back to the Talbott with fond memories from past visits. Unfortunately several changes will make me reconsider coming back. Not sure if they are having financial difficulties-but nickel and diming the customer is NOT creating returning visitors. Vallet Parking-$70.00,  No coffee machine in room- have to go to the lobby to get your morning Joe, no free mini toiletries. I absolutely can bring my own if I would have known.  You will find larger bottles of shampoo, lotions, soap for $15.00 per bottle.  And finally- think twice if you want that after dinner cocktail-One beer and one short white Russian will cost you 20.00 plus tip!! Ouch!  Now all this being said- the staff was just as nice as they were the last time we were here. Both the night and day bellman are true

My family has been going to The Talbott Hotel for the last 15 years.  Our main reason for staying there is the service and hospitality Given to us by Gene Murray.  Gene anticipates our every need and recommends new restaurants he thinks we would enjoy and he always nails it. Now that are kids married they also choose to stay at the Talbott because of Gene.  The Talbott Hotel is very fortunate to have Gene working for them for so long!   KG

Gene Murray was absolutely wonderful!!!  He went above and beyond to make our stay at the Talbott the most memorable experience for my family and me.  We came in for wedding dress shopping and bridesmaid dresses and this trip will never be forgotten thanks to Gene and all of his accommodations he made for us!!   I always look forward staying at the Talbott because we get to see Gene!

Everytime we come to Chicago we pick the Talbott for their fabulous concierge Gene. He always goes above and beyond to make our visits special and memorable. We had another wonderful weekend and he had awesome recommendations for us.

Hotel was Clean. Charles the Doorman was kind and caring. Sweet Man. Check in was easy and people were nice. Rooms were clean. Beds very comfortable. Bathrooms clean and good smelling shampoo and conditioner and cream. We really enjoyed our stay.

Stayed here for a few days. The room was very comfortable and clean. The hotel staff were also nice and helpful. There is quick room service and complementary cup of coffee in the morning. Would stay here again.

My stay at the Talbott Hotel in Chicago was fabulous because of Perry he took wonderful care of us in every way. Great customer service and room service etc he's one of a kind and hard to find. Myself and our family will be returning there in the near future

I like this hotel so much. Traditional and creative design. Morning coffee is free,delicious.  Around here,downtown is very nice. I suggest you to go walk around with Digital Camera. There are some shops that you can eat breakfast at early morning(like Starbacks,Yolk.)

My wife and I have stayed at The Talbot on our last 6 trips to Chicago. With many options, we continue to return this very special hotel. All of the staff is exceptional. We highly recommend the Talbot.

I recently stayed at the Talbott due to being a Hyatt member.  I was immediately unhappy with the room set up due to no desk for work.  The chairs were crush velvet and old reciprocals in the room.   The bathroom was gorgeous and updated.  No coffee pot in the rooms, no coffee in the hotel till after 6:30 a.m.  I like to have coffee in my room in the morning or the opportunity to order coffee from room service.  I was told by the front desk that room service didn't serve till am.   I was told I could walk to Starbucks down the street.  NOT accommodating at all!  Was informed later that I could have requested coffee and a pot, although that wasn't offered to me when I called at 5 am.  I WILL NOT be returning to the Talbott!

The Talbott has the best staff I‚Äôve encountered anywhere!  Dwayne, Charles, concierge, front desk, housekeeping, and manager are so helpful, accommodating, and they genuinely want to make your stay as comfortable as possible.  This visit was a girls weekend.  Our stay was fabulous as usual and I keep returning to this hotel due to the welcoming caring staff, plus excellent location!

Very Hotel. Not thrilled with the remodeling of the rooms. Climate control in the room was very inconsistent. Great location. It is very close to many restaurants, shops, etc. The service was very good. However, the noise from hallways and other rooms can be easily heard.

I used to live in Chicago, so love that when I get to visit for work, I found such a great spot! The hotel is absolutely lovely, the bed incredibly comfortable, the rooms beautiful, the staff wonderful, and the food delicious!

We stayed for a few days over the Holidays.  It is the perfect spot and in the center of everything- shopping, restaurants, and much more.  I have stayed at many Chicago hotels and I will only stay here from now on!

The Talbott Hotel is the place to stay while visiting Chicago! It‚Äôs in the center of everything, shopping üõç, great food ü•ò and all the beauty Chicago has to offer! Very clean üßΩ and accommodating! I will definitely stay here again!

My partner and I were looking forward to visiting Chicago in December 2019 after booking the flight almost a year before in January. All I can say is from the first day to the last, our stay was nothing short of perfect. The location of the hotel is fantastic. A 2 minute walk to Michigan Avenue where all of the shops are with plenty of bars, restaurants and tourist attractions too close by too. Upon arrival we were treated to an upgrade to a Junior Suite. The room was spacious and the king bed was so comfortable. The food in the restaurant was delicious and the bartender Mark was a pleasure to talk to and knew his way around a cocktail. A special mention goes out to two of the doormen. Perry and Patrick were so helpful and couldn‚Äôt do enough for us. They helped with
